reviews.review: Trip cost 1 Dirham. We road the traditional boat across the Dubai Creek to visit one of the Souks. It is very cheap and a good way of travel. Be ready to hop off quickly as it comes into the pontoon. We travelled with a stroller and we managed to squeeze up. I think there is a maximum number of passengers allowed, as I saw some asked to hop off, so it is safe.
Serene. The evening dhow cruise was relaxing with a sumptuous buffet spread with a gentle breeze and the views of the dubai heritage building was simply breathtaking
Nice view but not clean water. The water was not very clean, and the place could be better at night. You may not like the area when it is too humid.

Very interesting area. We stayed at the Radisson Blu at the creek and had many hours of enjoyment watching the boats (including the dinner boats) cruise the river. You can spend a lot of time at the creek, but make sure it is a cool day.

We enjoyed our walk along side Dubai Creek.. This was our final stop on one of our 3 excursions in Dubai, and Abu Dhabi. We had just visited the Sheikh Saeed Al-Maktoum House, and walked the short distance from there to Dubai Creek. I enjoyed this walk much more than the Sheikh's house. You have a great view of the buildings on the other side of the shore and it is a quiet walk. There is no automobile traffic, just other people walking, and at the time we were there, very few of them. This was a great end to a hectic day of touring.

AMAZING place in night. One of my favorite places in Deira Dubai you can visit traditional shops near by you have to pay only 1 due to cross the river also you can enjoy while dining in the boatsuch a nice place and most attractive

Not great for tourists. If you need a water taxi go, if you want to sightsee or go shopping don’t go. It’s that simple. The haggling in this area was a bit uncomfortable. If you have high blood pressure or a short temper don’t go.
kindda cool. It's a nice area behind JBR beach and it makes for a good romantic midnight stroll. There is supposed to be some shops but i didn't see any.
A bit of old Dubai. Good area, both sides of the Creek, to wander, explore and watch the world go by. The short trip across the Creek was well worth the very small charge

Wooden Dhow boat ride. We were by Dubai Creek in Al Fahidi the old part of Dubai. We rode the dhow boat for a couple of dirham to the other side to the gold souk. It was a good cultural experience. The boats crowded with workers were continually coming in from the other side. It did take a while before we were able to get a boat to the other side.

Interesting Dhow cruise experience. Great Dhow cruise experience for either couples or families
one can select the type of boat and most evening cruise is a package deal with buffet dinner and a local dance

Gold fingers!. Get to the gold market and get a boat onto the creek. Will take about 40 mins and is pretty cheap for 2 people. A romantic journey for 2 up the creek without a paddle as it's not needed!
Dhow Cruise Dinner. We had a round about of the Creek while enjoying dinner in Dhow Cruise. The city was developed extremely well and have skylines too.
Superb creek. This is a great creek. One need to go in this creek. Well accommodated and go on smoothly. Even people afraid of water can easily go.
beatiful city dubai. A beautiful city is Dubai with excellent broad road with all lighting in high rise buildings. A great discipline among the citizens.
The Abra ride on Dubai Creek. This is a fun and economical mode of transport across the creek to the various markets/souks. You can go by metro, but the Abra is more fun!
The Dhow cruise. The Dhow cruise is a good experience, although if you have done the European cruises, this one will be a big let-down. Not many views around to enjoy. The food is always very bland.

If you come to Dubai you gotta go here. There are lots of shops and restaurants in the area and it has a great view of beautiful landscapes of Dubai.
You must ride the boat at night to appreciate the night view of Dubai.
Lovely walk. This is a great place to walk both night and day , great views of the buildings , plenty of good pics to be had , nice places to eat
Good historic area. Lovely historic area of the city, near to the gold souk and the spice souk. Worth a visit if you have time to soak up the atmosphere and want to look for a bargain.

Take an Abra to cross the river. We visited both sides of the river, visited the soucks and als used the simple boad called Abra to cross the river. We also tookt a young kid with us, but that was no problem. Takes only about 10 minutes, but efficient and Enjoyable!

Really Beautiful and ((Money Saving)). Could you imagine that you can see every where of this nice place and use the BOATS that called ABRA in Dubai! But how it's possible?You can find Abra stations near creek and take them to go and see some places such as Historical Places... its most cheaper than Taxi... ;)Just find your location in map and then calculate how much it will be better for you to save time and money ...

Family bonding. The park us locatef along the Dubai creek and it us green throughout. We spent one of the Eid Holidays here, had barbecue and a quality time with the family. We will definitely visiting this place again and again.

Lovely palce to "hang out". Dubai Creek is beautiful, peaceful, but with many outstanding skyline of buildings around it. At night you can cruise the Creek and see more highlights under the lights. Some cruises.offer dinner (so, so food), but the views are marvelous.
Half day sightseeing tour. Interesting and intriqueing. The tour group spent over an hour crossing by water taxi to the Dubai Creek and touring
Great . Was fantastic - great views of Dubai and enjoyable meal with good beer. Met by a guy named ritz or riz ... My glass was never empty. 5 star customer service! Cheers

charm of old dubai. The creek is a nice way to contrast old and new dubai. The water is beautiful and relaxing. You can find the spice markets on one side but beware you will be hassled by the shop merchants all the way through. For just one dirham you can take an abra boat ride across to the other side of the dock and see the gold market and meena bazaar.It is a lot cheaper than the marina and Jumeirah area so its well worth doing your shopping here.

Love the Creek. The Creek is a really good part of Dubai. Removed from the madness of the Mall area it is quieter and older. The river has a life to it and if you want to relax this is a better area to do it in. Dining boats on the river are tourist traps and best avoided.

Wonderful views. Take a trip up the creek in a boat What wonderful of Dubai skyline Plenty to see that's for sure Amazing at the dock side seeing different boats and all the cargo on the quayside Defiantly worth a visit while in Dubai , don't forget to go to the spice sook and of course the gold sook both should be on your to do list

Authentic old dubai. We enjoyed the old historical context of the creek and the fact it is a working port with the fancy yachts and workings vessel together,is also unbelievably clean. A river cruise is a must as is a trip on a water taxi. The food at the creek side restaurants is not to be missed as it is very high quality and very cheap compared to the rest of Dubai. The only downside we experienced was when we went to the old market and were so badly hassled that it put us off going to the other markets which was a shame. We bought a week long tour bus and inclusive attraction tickets that were well worth the money to make getting about nice and easy so we went a couple of times and along with the metro had no problems getting about as the roads are too congested to make taxis worth the while or price,

Surprisingly good. We had stumbled onto the creek. And took a boat tour on a whim. By coincidence, the sun set half way through our boat ride. The lights coming on along the creek was invigorating. Comforted by a breeze for the first time during our stay, Seeing Old Dubai and New side by side was definitely worth it.

Over the Creek. Took the Abra boat fir 1Dh to the Old Souk. This water taxi is a quick means of transport for both locals and visitors. Travelling to and from the Creek was as easy as taking a bus from the hotel. Everything runs into each other...Dubai is geared up to welcome visitors in all parts of its daily life.
Brilliant area to visit. Great place to visit. Loads to see - souks, water taxi, restaurants, coffee shops. Better in the cooler weather and don't forget the nearby Dubai Museum!

Excellent. This tour on the creek comes in the package if you purchase a 48 hour pass for the hop on hop off Big Bus tour. Very informative and certainly something to experience with views of the boats that the local traders use ( the name eludes me ).
Good Boat trip in the Creek. We had a trip in a boat, with open buffet. The duration was 2 hours, food was good. Nice experience to try, recommended with good weather.

Really nice but not worth the cruise so much. We took the cruise with the Big Boat tour but if it wasn't paid with the ticket it wouldn't worth it to pay and take it. It just takes up and down the Creek nothing much.

Best place to know Old Dubai. Dubai Creek is the main part of a creek which divides Dubai in two parts. Bur Dubai and Deira are connected via abra, water taxi. Best to visit during winter. You can enjoy seagulls coming along. There are some museums to visit along the creek. It is a nice place for walk during winter.

Dhow not so much!. If you are wondering if you should experience a Dhow (usually included in the hop on hop off bus)...don't bother! There is no commentary so you have no idea what you are looking at - and the trip is really only a boat trip up the creek and back again - about 45mins....could have used that time for many other explorings in Dubai.
2 hours of my life lost. Dubai Creek cruise on Jumeirah Dhow. Food was bland and tasteless. No commentary. No dancing. Passed Parliament buildings otherwise nothing to see

Old Dubai from the water. We had a boat trip on the creek as part of a bus sightseeing tour. Only took 1 hour up and down the creek but enables you to see Old Town Dubai from a different perspective. Definitely worth a look
Nice boat trip. You can see the whole creek from a really nice boat, and see beautiful skyscrapers from a viewpoint that you won't have otherwise

Similar to Gateway of india Boat ride :(. This isnt a creeek. it is muddy water in which some shabby boats run taking tourists alongwith them for an evening ride.. The lighting around is good to watch.. However, the ride by itself is boring... After 15 mins you dunno what to do... The dinner served on the cruise is also average... Can skip it...
Interesting . Interesting, but nothing special. Good view of some of the many boats focked along the creekside. Maybe worth a try if you are near

One of the Finest indoor Ski experince. Its one of the fines Ski Experience in Mall of the emirates....
Best rides for kids and adults....
Its fun being there with co-operative & alert staff....

Less of a creek and more of a river.. I was honestly surprised to find out that this waterway was called a creek. Three is nothing special to be said about the creek, but it does serve as a main waterway between one side of town and the other. If you have thee time a round trip ferry ride is always nice.
Tiresome but ok. Its good but only if u r in lower deck with AC. Open upper deck is very warm more so by the heat of burner warming the dinner to be served. So, its very uncomfortable. Rest is so so.
Boring . This is a bit of a tourist trap. Basically you get on a wooden boat crammed between sweaty workers and some tourists and look at nothing spectacular. We did not really enjoy it.

Worth a look.. Just been to dubai creek.Its worth a look as much of dubai is modern and this is the original part of dubai.We got a taxi from our hotel to the spice souk.Just across the road is an abra station.It is 1 diram to cross but have change,if you give a note you wont be given change.The dubak museum is on the other side and worth a look.It reminded me of old Hong Kong harbour.
Nice View. You can enjoy the view and go for shopping, cruise or walk/jog along the water. You can enjoy the view and cool breeze along the water.

Food not good. Nothing special about this trip.....waste of money..just to have dinner on decorated boat is waste of money...food quality not good....make sure you choose the best and big size boats...

Cultural must. Dubai creek is stepping back in time. Boat trip is a must. Lots of shopping in the souks, but be carful of their prices. Bartering is expected. Do not go in the middle of the day if it is hot. No place to get out of the heat.

It's a creek but that's about it - nothing inspiring at all. Dubai Creek is a creek and nothing more.There is an opportunity to take a small boat across the creek if you so desire and to be honest I really don't see what the interest in this creek is. There's no pleasant tree lined and walkways, no sidewalk cafes or bars and the question please nothing special about it at all.I went during the day and I heard that the sun sets across the creek at not look very good but I didn't go at Sunset I cannot comment on that.To be honest there are many other things I would much rather do than waste my time going to see this creek
Worth a look. It's worth a look if the weather is not too hot or at night to enjoy a more intimate aspect of Dubai away from the large malls. Be prepared for some hard bargaining with the local shops
A trip along the water . Paid one of the ferrymen about £12 to take us up the creek for a wander - only 2 of us. Great cheap way to see another side of Dubai before visiting the souks. Recommend
One of its kind experince. Must try and spare good times with your loved ones , enjoy environment , breathtaking views and cool place
Nice view. There's a cheap taxi to the other side with nice views, especially at night. There will be people trying to give you a guided tour, but in my opinion normal taxi is enough.

Choose your way to enjoy~ walking, jogging, taking cruise, dinning. Dubai creek is a multi-functional place!Walking alone the river bank at night, you can enjoy the breeze and seeing the crowded on park. If you have more time, take the water taxi to go to other places. It's near the traditional market, then you can go there to buy some souvenir and get surrounded by the buildings. There are many cruise which serves the dinner, either you can choose it, or there are many good restaurant along the river bank, then you can have really nice food there.
Nice creek. Nice creek !!! pay 1 DH to cross to other side of old Dubai and walk through !!Just to see how the old Dubai was !!

Interesting place. Walking through Old Dubai and then taking the water taxi across Dubai Creek and visiting famous gold and spice market shopping should be part of your plan. Creek has history of Dubai in it. Walking tour is preferred here.

Great area to see what Dubai used to be like. This is one of the few places in Dubai where you can get more of a sense for what the city used to be like. Looking at all the ships still in use transporting a range of goods gives you a real perspective on the history of the city. The various attractions around the area give you a good idea of what the houses and other buildings used to be like.
Felt like an authentic experience. Enjoyed the hustle and bustle of the Creek. We took the water taxi and wondered around the market. Loved the sights and smells

Scenic and calming !. This place is so beautiful. The boat ride is a must and also on budget. I was here quite late in the evening and it was so calming and scenic. You can even find a lot of souks around here and shop as well but my top recommendation would be to enjoy authentic Arabic food which you can find on either sides of the river. I particularly enjoyed the falafel

Nice Ride. Not many are aware that you can save so much and see so many riding the water bus. Cheap fare, no traffic, and sights especially tourists would appreciate (mine did). If you are wanting a tour, it can be accessible from seeing the Al Fahidi Heritage Village, Dubai Museum, moving on towards the textile souq, ride the boat into the spice souq, and to the gold souq.

Nice way to cross the creek. We left the gold souk and caught the Abra across the creek. For 1 dirham it is well worth it! Our little guy (7yrs) was free. It takes only a few minutes to cross - 5 minutes max but you get to see some cool sites. I enjoyed it.
2nd time......... to the area, this time we arrived by the Dubai marina ferry, which in our opion is a must do to get a full apreciation on of Dubai.

Dolphins . I saw a dolphins very lovable and very cute I want to come back again with my family it's a very nice show you will really enjoy it and it's very cheap to book tickets we recommend to all who will visit dubai

Find out the real Dubai. Every tourist when visiting Dubai focus their time and attention to the new part of the city and at time don't even bother to visit the Creek.The Creek is where it all started. As Dubai wealth started with merchant trading in and out of Dubai the Creek was the original core of the city.It is a unique experience to appreciate how real and simple life was before the expansion.There are several boat restaurants where you can enjoy a nice dinner. Around the Creek there is what is left of the tower built to protect the city from invaders with a great museum. Several souks are spread on both side of the river.i would recommend a nice walk around there, eat some original Arabic food and learn about the history of this place. A must is a ride from Dubai to Deira with one of their local boat. A great experience for just 1£
Walking tour and water taxi ride. We really enjoyed walking through Old Dubai and then took the water taxi across Dubai Creek to walk to the spice and gold markets. Very beautiful and interesting.

The only fresh air I had in Dubai. On impulse my friend and I rented one of the smaller boats for an hour cruise around the creek. It was evening and hot but quite nice on the boat. Our "tour guide" had entertaining stories and facts. It was good

lovely evening tea. visited with friends living in Dubai. Went in the evening when cooler and had tea sitting by the creek with views of the city at night was magical. There is a mini old city village which I think is free you can also visit.
It is good place. Nice and good place in Dubai, you will find many Floating Restaurant, specially if you like Indian food.

Boat dinner. Sit below in the air con man it's hot dinner was average on the boat no option to purchSe beer after dinner was a show an a long wait untill you could get off the boat the creek was a long way frm the hotel we stayed at an traffic was bad allow a lot of time to get there is staying not in that area

Dhow dinner cruise - Dubai creek. So interesting to see old Dubai, we had a lovely dinner while seeing the lights and old city of dubai from our dhow, theres so much dhow cruises around with competitive price n offer. I saw one dhow that play reaalllyy loud music that I can hear from distant away in our dhow, I personally wouldnt enjoy that and luckily our Dhow doesnt play music which is nice so we can talk n enjoy our dinner while sightseeing, I enjoy the food as well in our Dhow. The dhow dinner cruise is actually one of the highlight of my Dubai trip

Must do the dolphin show and Barbeque in good weather . Kids and adults I took to the dolphin show were very impressed at Dubai Creek so it was a big hit ... They have a few other shows too of exotic birds. There's a very exciting science museum also inside for little ones which is in a covered zone.In good weather one can spend the full day at the Creek Park with barbecue and outdoor games / play area for family.

What a night!. We visited the gold and spice soul and fell upon the creek by accident. Again another wow factor,it was buzzing with people. We had a beautiful ride up the creek on an old type wooden boat. This took about an hour and managed to see a most wonderful sunset into the bargain. Give it a try, you'll love it

Dubai Creek. Good place for outing for a day, surrounded nearby with Dubai Museum, Hindu temples, etc. One can go for a short ride (sharing with others) just for AED 1 and same for return, the one way ride usually last for 10 minutes, but of course gives lot of satisfaction. Very well maintained waters.

its a waterway, not an attraction. Not sure why this is rated as an attraction. Perhaps it is the cultural value of the dhows docking and loading near the entrance. I suppose this is done much the same way as a century ago.
My wonderful experience. It was fun time there when ride boot with diner and some entertainment ... But u must go in winter so the weather will b ok
Very busy waterway. This is a very busy waterway which connects to the Persian Gulf. Both local abras and larger vessels containing cargo and people traverse this waterway.
worth a visit. this is a place one should visit in the night. Just sit close water in any restaurant and have hukkah and enjoy the beauty of Dubai.
Okay. Clear view of the water which was extremely nice. But there was a little traffic which kind of ruined it.

Prefer the smaller dhows. This cruise activity is really worth doing (much more than the marina in my opinion), especially if you go for the smaller boats. They will make you feel better the mix of ethnic groups and activity, far from aseptised malls and shops.

Nice dinner at the boat. We try this boat restaurant because our friend recommend this place. Pay 125AED per person. You get a all you can eat dinner at the boat and also the have arabian dancing show on board as well. Good value of money. You can see old and new dubai from the boat. The boat will take you in 2 hours trip.

A restful stroll. Sitting in one of the many cafes along the Creek gives time to view the many water taxis ferrying passengers to and fro across the creek. Strolling down the embankment we can visit places of historic interest (air conditioned) and meet the locals. Expats from many nations service the restaurants and Emirati are present in the inviting guest houses.

A very busy transport hub.. They call it a creek we'd call it a massive river.
The dubai creek is constantly busy with tourist board, taxi's and merchandise ships.
The ships surprised me as they were not what I'd been used to in terms of cargo transportation.
A cruise along the Dubai creek is laid back and enjoyable. Give it a go.
Dubai Creek Dhow Cruise. Our tour company, Rayna Tours, arranged a Dhow Cruise on the Dubai Creek. Cruise consisted of buffet dinner and live entertainment for approximately 2-3 hours.
Unique place. Dubai Creek is a fabulous area where people need to pay a visit and the place can fresh the mind plus enhance creativity of the visitors ' brain . A place must visit !!
Hot but worth a visit. we visited the Creek and took a boat down the river, it is fantastic and cheap but more importantly worth a visit to see a true and authentic part of Dubai.

Nice View and pleasant place... Nice place to chill out and spend time for solo or couples or friends or family. There are many nice views. Cruise, boats, ships and you could have a fine dine on the cruise.
Blend of Old and new. A real blend of the old and new. You have the traditional Abras ferrying you across, and on the banks, some beautiful yachts tied up.

Interesting. The best way to see the creek in my opinion would be to take the abra (water taxi) across, you can even negotiate a deal with the abra drivers and take one on private basis for an hour or so an really see the creek! Its nice to see and enjoy this side of Dubai.
Must visit. Dubai Creek and abras are a must visit place while visiting dubai. Its the heritage landmark of dubai.
Worth a visit. Good transport and very reasonably price of 1dirhams which wot,s out at about 20p. Quick and efficient

Ancient World in a Modern Setting. Dubai Creek where Arab Dhow meets Luxury Liner, Walk along the banks of the creek and view the myriad of items waiting to be loaded, everything from toilet rolls to towels and radios to refrigerators. All items hand loaded onto the dhow. Continue along the creek and look at the cruise ships, multi decked like floating hotels each being loaded by modern machinery. Again watch the dhows slowly wend their way down the creek avoiding the abra's shuffling back and forth loaded with passengers. then see the liners slowly slipping from their moorings. Each in their own way traveling to to exotic destinations both ancient and modern. An interesting walk down an innocent creek conjuring up thoughts of travels to unknown destinations,

A walk of reminiscent . A quick get away for a sight trip in the evening. Just take the green line going to baniyas square metro station and you are in for adventure. A couple of old souks are just around the corner and you can enjoy a brisk walk on the sealane. You could cross on the other side using the abra for only 50 fils and don't forget to bring your camera cause a lot of good snap shots are awaiting you.

Best part of our city tour. It was a very pleasant change from sitting in the bus. Most interesting to see how an ancient form of transport is still highly relevant today. Also saw the commercial boats and their cargoes. Loved it.

Dubai creek tour with RTA boat. to explore the burdubai and al ras creek boat ride is the best option.You can use the RTA water taxi, which is very cheap, 4 AED for a return trip person. After crossing the creeK, one can go to, al ras area, spice market and gold souq.

Cable car closed. Went to Dubai creek park today... the cable car has been closed gor 2 YEARS... nowhere online did i see this information!!!. The park itself is quiet, green, with nice views of the yacth club across the creek. Should have bern busy with families on the holidays... but very quiet

too hot to enjoy fully with a walk.. Interesting to visit. have been here a few times. At this time of year appears to have more than its share of bothersome workers (trying to sell everything from water to water taxi) so simply enjoying a stroll was tough. The souks are what you'd expect with vendors insisting on trying to bargain whether you talk to them or not. Not a great place to sight see. Later in the evening there are many dhow cruises to choose from. The view is nice with these boats and many other types of water travel.

Port and waterway on East side of Dubai. . Shows another side of Dubai in Deira Creek area of Dubai. The waterway is bursting with traffic on the waterway and across the waterway, from one side to the other. A cheaper side of Dubai around the Souk and old town.

Nice place . We went there for a cruise with family on jumeriah side. This is much better than creek. After a tiring day of shopping and travel this is so relaxing . Great food, great view and very good experience. Worth it
We took uber and didn't take a transfers and it was cheaper for us with a luxurious experience in Lexus
Old Attraction still attractive!. They have restaurants and cafes where you can enjoy the view and calmness of the creek. An old attraction nevertheless an attractive one.
Old meets new. Well worth a visit. A brilliant opportunity to see old dubai and new dubai. The abras are a must for anyone visiting dubai. Take some water with you !

Dhow cruise in the day. Though there are plenty of dinner cruises in the Dubai Creek, I didn't had enough time to spend an evening out there. Hence, I planned for a day cruise instead. There are only handful of operators in the day and only refreshments are provided during day. The cruise will take you for an hour sail through the creek and will the old charming city which is now dwarfed by the skyscrapers. The boats are two storied with an air-condition cabin and an open air deck. The boat ride itself was enjoyable and I would recommend it for an afternoon break.

Dhow cruise dinner. This was the best outing that we had during our stay. The arrangement and the ambience of this was very good. The creek was so beautiful at night. The staff also very good. We were treated to some very nice juice upon arrival. The food was excellent. The tanura show and other shows were also very nice. On the whole, it was worth our money and more. I would strongly recommend everyone to take this tour without fail.

Abra - cadabra!. We wanted to take an abra over to the gold souk. A really nice experience. Old wooden boats, sitting with locals and a nice breeze. We (accidentally) went at sunset - a beautiful experience.
Nice location to stay. The creek has a lot of cruises which offers a good view of the Dubai skyline and a delicious arabic dinner.

A bit of old Dubai. Had a short time here, looking around the souks, did the spice market, and then took a dhow boat very cheap across the river to the gold souk. Everyone sells the same stuff, so all trying to get you into their shops etc. But nice to have a look.

Abra Cadabra on Khor. We went on a water taxi (abra) ride on Dubai Khor (Creek) from one part of the city to another (traditionally the creek has been viewed as splitting Dubai into two section - Deira & Bur). The end of the creek has a waterbird & wildlife sanctuary. The abra is a pretty basic, old form of watercraft but it got us across the creek reasonably quickly so we could spend plenty of time visiting the street & arcade vendors alongside the creek.

Good entertainment, you may try once. Good-*********Few cuises like Radisson's are good rest all are sub standard.they decorate mostly all cruises with lightstandoora performance was goodit shows the city area from creek side viewthey will sail you to some distance and drop you back after an hour or twoservice is okay.\they have toilets but not so great.be careful with kids and hold them properly while in cruise especialy if you are sitting in top as their is no special security and chances of falling is high.Its a stable cruise thoughyou can click picsenjoy sailingBad-********We did not enjoyed the experienceFood was utterly badif you are inside the AC area its better but lot of noisce and cant take proper pic due to waterly windows because of humidityIf you sit on top open air its better view but still feels humid and hot.
nice view. It's a nice view. One tip is to rent the cruise from the port. It costs 50 AED and from the agency it's aprox. 300 AED.

Overcrowded. Dubai creek is located far from the city and overcrowded.
It takes 1.5 hrs from city to reach during peak hours which is tiring and takes away the interest altogether.
Not a sight to visit, dhow cruise boats overcrowd this place.
Advise to avoid

Dinner cruise on the creek. We enjoyed an evening on board Bateaux Dubai with a group of friends. Lovely atmosphere, food and service were of good quality. A pity there was not some occasional verbal comment about the buildings etc to look out for and although the pianist was good our previous experience on board a similar excursion some years ago had a couple of lovely singers who made the cruise unforgettable. This was sadly missing on this occasion.

Lovely to relax. We visited in Jan 2015 the climate was cool .Dubai Creek is a nice place to hang around. There are some authentic Arabic restaurants around.Can enjoy a Dhow cruise with dinner and entertainment. Clean so can relax in the evening

Ride the water taxi!. Never been on a water taxi before, until Dubai! Great ride, cheap,and was interesting to see Dubai from the water. The staff was informative and helped get from ne place to the other.
relaxing. in the mid town of Dubai you can find a jewel .the creek is fantastic for relaxing in the night .you can pay 170 drh and use this facility .

Great place to bring back your mood.. Interesting place for exploring as well as for shopping. This area is packed with small shops and cafetarias. There is a temple and mosque nearby and is always active and colourful. Best place to experience and know about the old dubai. Activities : Shopping, Abra/RTA Boat ride and Chillout at the creekside

Open top red Bus tour. One of the attractions we saw and heard about on the tour together with the boat ride we enjoyed on the creek, also included on open top bus tour.Good viewing of the attraction and interesting knowledge of the Creek.

Another venue on the list since there are some older areas to visit. Good shopping areas local, boat trips and very good views. Full of activity and general hubbub.I grew accustomed to the heat and you can always retreat into an air conditioned shop.

Boats galore. A 45 minute boat ride around the creek in a very solid timber craft for $10 with 4 of us on board was fun. The old styled huge timber cargo boats that abound in the area are fascinating, and there are so many of them. this was a short adventure that we really enjoyed and i highly recommend the experience.

Dubai creek. nice place to visit in the evening beautiful park chair lift children city and lot of fun
easy to get train taxi and public transport bus and for children dolphin show
Relaxing scenic tour. It was a very beautiful place to visit! We toured the creek by boat and the scenery was amazing with breathtaking views.

Cruise at night X . We visited the creek and travelled on a restaurant cruise X entertainment was beautiful with a gentleman playing soft piano and the food was exquisite X bateaux Dubai has got to be the best of what's on offer X superb!!!
Prettier by night. We did a cruise along the creek, which was OK, a few photo opportunities but the appeal of the creek is at night. Gorgeous photos then
Lovely. Had fun with the family.Tried out indian dance.Food was lovely.Music fantastic.The dance performance was really nice.

Very interesting area.. Easy to get to by train. The architecture is fascinating and the buildings are located along the Dubai Creek to make it a little more cooler. All buildings are made to look like they are made from mud and sticks. The day we went was a public holiday and everything was shut. Check before hand.Be aware of the market place close by that sells everything. You have to run the gauntlet or the market holders are all over you! It's a shame because you can't even look at the products on sale. Take a hat to protect you head from the hot sun.

Boat ride that takes you to Spice Market and Gold Souk. Mini non fancy boats are used to transport people to the other side of the local river. On the other side, shopping area begins with road side shops. First you will pass tones of shops that sells many variety of spices. It is surprised to see how many variety's are sold... The spice smell in the street is just so nice and soothing for the hot sunny days.... Pass the spice market to get to the Gold Souk wherein you can see huge ornaments made of gold and diamonds. The Gold price is displayed on the street itself at many spots. Most of the Gold items are priced piece rate. If they go by weight then they do add making charges. So I won't say gold is cheap here but it is a different experience watching shop full of gold ornaments. One annoying part is, there are many vendor agents trying to grab you to their shops that sells duplicate handbags, goggles, perfumes of branded items. But still this is one good place to visit at least once when you are in Dubai....
Great shops. Anything you can think of you will probably find it at the shops by the creek or get on a boat and enjoy the scenery
Crossing and return. A quick and amazingly cheap way of experiencing old Dubai and getting to the souk markets and laneways. The service was quick and clean and the piloting smooth and coimfortable.

Wonder bus. A yellow wonder bus travels on road and goes in the water to become a boat and takes you across the tour of Dubai. An excellent adventure for one hour and be explored. A good thril for kids too. One can buy tkts online at attractive prices

Shopping area and dhow ride. We spent some time walking in that area ( gold market is there, and the spices market too) and for the night we chose a dhow ride. The boat was fine, the view nice, but the food and the program was not at all fine. Pay attention which boat you are taking.

Bur Dubai and Abra boat ride, most authentic of the Dubai outings. This was a fun outing, but in the summer you want to wait until it cools off. You can do an enclosed A/c boat, but you really want to try a traditional Abra. The creek is a port for goods from Iraq and other places, namely Iran, but the UN is pressuring the UAE to crack down on trade with Iran so my guess is that this will be turned into a tourist and yacht area eventually. See it while it is still here, the old wooden cargo ships are amazing and it is fun to wander the streets and bargain for saffron and textiles afterwards.

Experience . You must take a taxi boat over the Dubai creek just for the experience of it, we also took a boat cruise it lets you see the area but would have liked some commentary to explain the area.

Very warm in August . Took a taxi to the Gold Souk for a look around then walked down to the Creek where we paid for an hour's trip on an Abra, just the two of us. Swelteringly hot (47degrees) but worth seeing.

nice dhow ride. I would suggest doing a dhow ride across he creek after sunset to get the best views of lighted buildings on both sides of the creek. we did exactly this. although the access to pier on burdubai side is from across few crowded markets, the search is worth it. one boat takes about 12 to 16 people comfortably, we hired one full boat though we were only 10 of us. the ride lasts for about an hour and is medium paced and comfortable. this is a much more affordable way to enjoy the creek rather than paying for dinner cruise

So much to see. This is where old meets new. Dhows from Iran and other neighbouring countries offload their cargo, mostly by hand at Dubai Creek as they have for hundreds of years. Be sure to take one of the small ferries across the creek. Gold souk and spice souk are nearby as is the old city.

Nice view for dubai water side . I was staying at park hayyat hotel with fantastic creek view weather in the early morning or in the sunset or you may enjoy a cruise in the creek for dinner experience.

Outstanding experience!. We jumped on a taxi Dhow with the locals, this was a great experience. You pay on the boat 1 Dhs each and pass it down the boat to the driver - it takes you across the river. You have to be quick they can only allow so many passengers and you've got nothing to hold on to and the water's not far from your feet. We did it on a Worship day so there were lots of locals out, the river was heaving with Dhows.
Late night walk . We had been there almost mid night but it was like a Day multinational people walking around very good coffee cafes worth visiting at night

Trip across the creek in a small boat. My wife and i crossed the creek to see the fabrics and we couldn't believe how cheap the ride was ! We weren't too impressed with the fabrics though but we enjoyed the sights and the ride. It is a must do experience for anyone coming to dubai.
Try something new. Our dinner cruise along the creek was something of a treat for a cousin who is experiencing Dubai in the first few months of being there. The Ras-ta-noura show was a surprise.
Loved it. Loved the whole area and the creek itself. We wandered along the foreshores on both sides and tried different forms of water transport to appreciate the views and history

Dinner Cruise on the Creek. The cruise route took us past the sights on both sides of Dubai Creek (14 Km of natural saltwater inlet) – This has played a major part in the regions commerce, the creek divides the old city into two parts – Bur Dubai & Deira. – I didn’t enjoy the dinner – but that’s just my opinion but others enjoyed both the dinner and the sights. I loved the night lights and you get the sense of what the area was like with historic old neighbourhoods, wooden boats, open air markets etc..
Nice place. Nice to walk a long in the afternoon plenty of eateries and cafes to eat at this is a man made creek small and large boats.
Dow Cruise. We took a Dow (boat) for an evening cruise with dinner around the creek. Pleasant evening and met some like minded travellers :-)
Creek visit. This is a beautiful place with so many facilities. Especially nice on a hot day. Lovely cafes and eateries.
Dubai Creek. Went there on the dinner cruise, great views at night and also went on a smaller boat in the daytime which gave us a different perspective and great views of all the buildings.

back to the old times. it was such a good experience crossing the creek by using a small boat from Bur Dubai to Deira Side. aside from you save your time with the traffic you can enjoy watching different old dhows from the creek that in someway giving you a story on the places that they've been too. you will also see the merchant chatting on top of those old boats smiling to us showing how contented they are on their simple life's. reaching the other side of the creek from afar you can smell different kinds of spices coming from the spice souq or market. your visit in Dubai will not be complete without crossing this beautiful Dubai creek.

Man made with lots to see. This creek, though man made has lots of activities from just walking along the edge to dinner boat cruises. The cruise I went on was not very good, but it didn't take away from the great views at night.
Dubai Creek. We did this trip ourselves via the mono rail and tram from the Atlantis Palm Hotel. Good to seeing some of had beautiful sights too.

My favorite aera in Dubai. Enough said. If you are a tourist in Dubai, I def recommend to visit Creek area. Give yourself the freedom to roam around but make sure to dine somewhere in Creek, as they have fabulous restaurants and bars. The view is mostly perfect everywhere. Enjoy :)

Love the creek. We stayed the creek at the Sheraton - it was really lovely there. Would highly recommend this area to others. It is full of traditional and modern boats and has a really lovely atmosphere.

OK. It was evening when we went there that is why i didnt see more of the views, we went there to see a bird show which I paid online and I have to still pay for the entrance for the creek park, so I suggest you come in the morning for you to enjoy the park.
Authentic Dubai. If you want to see what Dubai is, beyond the skyscrapers and malls, Dubai Creek is the place to visit.
Good . It's a good experience to See Dubai through the fairy ( alabrs) but I recommend by winter time when u can enjo more the the tour

Not very UAE. We saved our trip to the creek until later in the evening because of the heat. The little boats go over and back continuously so there was no problem crossing over (takes 5 minutes tops). When we got to the gold souk it was really busy and boisterous and we ended up leaving earlier than planned because of the hassle. Also, it wasn't very Arabic there - with the fouls we went into seemingly more dominated by people of an Indian origin. Not that this was an issue - more just a little surprising. We found nowhere nice to eat on either side of the creek but we were very hot and probably a bit impatient to get back into some AC.

It is ok. This is like a flea market. Spice soul is a place for people to try to sell cheap souvenirs. Gold Souk is crazy. Prices are high but people trying to sell knock off purses etc,. constantly people asking you to buy things. Was not enjoyable

love walking along the creek on a breezy eve. Love the creekside. There is a great market (yes, they will annoy you asking you to buy) but just smile and say no and they will leave you alone. dont be rude - this is not morocco. A breezy evening walking by the creek is just my idea of a great holiday.

It is amazing but not of an interest to me. It is a very nice place specially in the night where you can view the Dubai creek lit by the lights of restaurants/shops/coffee shops and the walkways light posts, etc. It is a romantic place. It is very nice also for people who likes to sail and have their dinner during a cruise, but it is not so interested to me because I don't like riding the see but it is much more interested to me to sit in a restaurant/coffee shop overlooking the creek.

Try abra, feel the night sensation.. Do not miss the sensation of riding abra in the creek. Just spend 1 AED you can accross from Old Souq bur dubai to Gold souq Deira within minutes. Enjoy the evening time at its best in the creek with urban life.

When authentic is the real luxury. been in Dubai Creek many times. All the visitors expect me to bring them to Dubai Mall or similar places. Virtually no place has the allure of the Creek. Al Bastaki a.......the river.....just an enchanted place where the clock stopped and having dinner on the river remains one of the best moments ever spent in Dubai. Surely no skyscrapers, no Hermes corners and Laduree but still worth to spend a day there or even more.

Magical. We rode the cruise from the Raddisson hotel , it was a 150 year old cruise ship and we had a really really nice time enjoying the ride and live arabic music and food which was great . I enjoyed the dessert very much particularly .The ride itself was nice , would wanna come back again
Magnificant. A great place to visit and the restaurants are excellent with a great choice available.A great way to spend the day

Abra to cross the creek. My wife and I took an Abra (small rustic boat) to cross the creek one afternoon. The ride was quick but unforgettable. We experienced how many people from dubai cross the creek in a daily basis. he ride was pleasant, with great views and we considered it very cheap, 1 dirham each... you can't beat that

Beautiful by day, mesmerizing at night!. A dhow cruise down Dubai creek gives you a different view of the city and the many one-of-a- kind buildings. It is humbling to think that people were able to create a man made waterway and such splendor in a desert.
Old meets New. Strolling along Dubai Creek is amazing. You can see old Dhows being loaded and unloaded, fancy yachts, hustle and bustle of life. It really is old meets new, east meets west. I love it
Good experience. Great experience but the service can be better. Entertainment was great but the delay in getting seats was not so good
Evening boat trip. The creek itself for me was not anything special.We did a boat trip from the creek, it was brilliant.The trip had food and drink, and a great commentary.Worth doing

Ignore the show cruises, make your own using the water taxis. The view at night from the water taxis is amazing, particularly of the brightly lit dhow cruises. Like steam trains, they look better from the outside! And for 1 dirham per crossing, you can do this a few times to get good photographs.
Love this area. The creek is lovely, lots of fishing boats. I have been on a boat to the shopping area. I would recommend a trip down the creek, its very cheap.

Fancy meeting a Sikh guy who owns the cruise ship. At €16 each from a groupon voucher it's ok. We didn't receive a warm welcome like others did but that's probably because the cruise team were grabbing ppl of the street to get on board. The cruise includes entertainment and buffet style meal. Indian curries, veg options and a range of starters made it worth while. It's a slow cruise from end of the marina to the other and back again. Sit on the top deck, although it's humid and no air con upstairs the view is amazing in the evening. Entertainment was supposed to be a magic show but not quite wat we got. Get your mehndi done on board for 20dh. We set of at 8.30pm back by 10.30pm.
It was great!. The hotels in Dubai Creek are magnificent also quiet and calm, it is a really lovely place and the view of all the buildings and water is excellent.
Good. It was free withe the big bus it take one hour............ good view and staff are good........... next time with dinner
Bateaux Dubia. Beautiful evening, the views were amazing and the whole evening was extremely enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this trip.
Worth taking water taxi. Ok thing to do and see Souks and shopping area across the old City. Nice item to cross off bucket list....however...not a must.

Authentic. You should visit the Dubai Creek are and use the traditional little boats to cross it to get a nice authentic experience of the city. There are bazaars near this area that you can visit if you want to buy some presents to your friends etc.
Lots to see. Quite a lot to see in this area. The Creek itself is interesting. The souk's are nice, but be prepared to barter hard.

Nice Trip out. its great to go to the souks and then get the Abra (water taxi) across the creek its very cheap, hang on tho they do get busy.You can also pay a water taxi to take you for a trip on the creek for an hour just a couple or friends.
Nice place . Dubai creek is nice place to visit . It's good for the person who like to be quit and wants to feel some freez lonely . Good place to see .
Perfect for a late night walk. Really enjoyed going here a couple of times in the evening. Nice restaurants and great vieuws over the Creek.
beutiful at night. we had dinner on the dhow cruise and the entertainment was good, view by night amazing, however its better to prebook the cruise, the cruise is worth the while

dinner in water. creek is beautiful water lake in Dubai. The nearby area have various adventure, rides for kids and other things to enjoy. also on creek in boat you can enjoy dinner which is just so awesome.

make a cruise in the creek. it is very nice at least once to have a cruise in the creek. traditional ships go up and down the cree offering buffet and dance. better at night since all city is full of lights. very safe.

Visit the old gold souks and creek tour. We visited this area to visit the souks but there is so much more to do. Try and get on a creek tour with your own personal driver. We only paid about the equivalent of £5 for an hour tour of the creek. Great place with lots to do.

Dubai Creek. Dubai Creek It's the party of old Dubai. This reminds me the dock area is Mumbai. One can see the Old Dubai while on ride. Also can visit the Meena Bazaar, Spice Market and lot other market. Well connected to Dubai Metro too. Lot of option for eating.

In a middle of somewhere. I understand the place because it's like the center of trade.it tells the old trade story of Dubai and how its operating nowadays...it's nice for walking but I don't feel it was secured enough...I ride with an abra to transfer in the other side of the place..water is no longer visible

Villa Resident at Dubai Creek. Having recently visited the Dubai Creek Golf and Yacht Club again it recaptured some wonderful memories. Having lived in the Villas surrounding the Golf Course for 4 years I must say that I do miss this magnificent environment and facility. Everything from fine dining at a host of restaurants and cafes through to great bars for a quiet drink after that challenging game of golf. A must visit location to visit whenever you are in Dubai.

My favorite place in Dubai. Amazing place, feels like real Dubai! Don't miss crossing the creek with the boat as well as the hindu temple in Bur Dubai side. Definitely one of my favorite places in town. Walk along the creek and visit the Heritage village at the end of it.

Why Dubai?. We stopped in Dubai enroute to Turkey. It was the most uninteresting place I've ever been. I can't understand why people travel to Dubai. We stayed at the Sheraton on the Creek. Nice hotel, near old Dubai, easy walk along the creek. Many many boats being loaded up with fridges and washing machines, clothes driers and dishwashers. Carried on board by men from parts of Asia. It was a bit shameful really. Market was dull compared to the souks of Morocco and the Grand Bazaar of Istanbul. I don't get it! Why Dubai?
Wonderful place. This place view and boats are nice. You can reach the place eaisly . There are number of boats that you can select one for short ride
Dubai Creek. Opening to the sea - Persian Gulf - many places to visit - boat rides are available and part of the fee for the bus tour
Nice but Not Nice. Having a trip up and down the Creek is nice to see buildings, loading as well as the wealthy but the polution of this waterway is unpleasant with the accompanying unpleasant smells

Quick creek trip. We took what is called an Abrar from meena bazaar to the other side as that is where the gold souk is. It was 1 Dirham and a really nice trip across the creek. It is a very interesting historical and cultural area bundled into the hustle and bustle of modern day to day trading. And as with everything Dubai super safe and convenient - it was very hot but there was plenty of shade and places to eat.
Good experience. Its a simple area where u can enjoy sheesha and dinner. Small restaurants. Was a different view of Dubai. Narrow shopping areas. Bargain for a good price.
Traditional Dubai. We took the boat around Dubai Creek & thoroughly enjoyed the scenery, we got a lovely feel for the Old Dubai.

Shindaga to Festival City. I just love the creek, but not when the outside air temperature is 45C like it is now. From Shindaga to Festival City there's a lot to see. The new/old Heritage area is fun to walk around, if a bit 'manufactured', then there's the old souk area in Bur Dubai with an interesting mix of tourist tat and old trading companies, including the bizarrely named 'Semtex Trading'. On this side of the creek you can walk down the length of the old souq, then continue alongside the creek past the Rulers Court with its helipads, to the area called Bastakiya or Al Fahidi. This is really the only true 'old' area left in Dubai, with a few restaurants, coffee shops, art galleries and narrow streets. The Dubai Museum is not far from here. The area beyond Bastakia on Al Seef road is being modernised/beautified (in the name of tourism) and will be a bit like the Madinat in Jumeirah. I liked it like it was with grass areas and room to walk. The Abras (water taxis) that cross the creek are incredibly cheap and easy to use, somebody will always point you in the right direction. You can also privately hire an abra for a longer trip along the creek, cruise past the tall Bank building with it's mirrored frontage and take a photo of your abra's reflection.The creek still has Dhow traffic on the Deira side but it is all scheduled to be moved to by the Deira Palm, which I think will be sad as the creek has been home to trading dhows for hundreds of years. On a good day, late in the afternoon looking down the creek from the Bur Dubai side Baniyas/Old Souk abra stop, if you wear the right rose-coloured spectacles, you can almost imagine you were in Venice, well I can and I love Venice even more than here. Finally Festival City, beyond the Business Bay Bridge is being enlarged and will soon have an even better selection of restaurants and shops, but if you want a 'real' drink here then go to the Belgian Beer Bar in the Crowne Plaza.

Good experience. I visited that area by the heritage village for a dinner with my gf and friends. It is an amazing simple area where u can enjoy shisha and dinner. Suggest to have some more luxury cafes and restaurants by that area.

Interesting cultural insight into Dubai.. Definitely an old meets new type experience that links modern Dubai to its cultural history with Dubai Creek being very much a traditional centre for commerce. Definitely a worthwhile experience to gain an insight in to Dubai.
A shopping spree for souvenier. Old souq is the place for you to find a souvenirs. Make sure you bargain the price as the shop there always offer a good deal if you're good at bargain.

City of Contrasts. Dubai is a city of contrasts. A visit to the Creek area is a must for those who like history or are interested in seeing both sides of Dubai. Watching the workers load TV's, washing machines and fridges by hand onto old blue barges is amazing.

Average Attraction with Average Food. Last time I went on a Dhow Cruise was back in 2000. I thoroughly enjoyed it then. The Dhows were clean and tidy with good quality food. This time we were not impressed. Food was average and the Dhow was old. The entertainment was ok with. Magic show and some traditional dances. I don't think I would go on a Dhow Cruise again.
Historical place. The old Dubai. The prices to cross the creek are super low! Conect the Gold Souk to the Textile Souk.

Not much to do . We were a little underwhelmed with this place. It was on the things to do on trip advisor so we went. However, we were unsure of the purpose of the visit. It's very run down and not 'typical dubai'. We went on a boat trip, but again it wasn't clear what it was for. It stopped at random places and then eventually they told us to get off- about 30 mins from where we started.

The souk market . My daughters family live in Dubai, her cousin, arranged to meet us after our shopping! The gold souk market is old Dubai, it is very much a thriving and vibrant market be prepared to be hassled though! at the souk market as many of them know that you are tourist! and will hassle you to come and take a look & buy! From their shop A warning though don't go any where with any one asking you to do this! Be safe! Take care! We walk back on the Main Street to wait for my daughter friends cousin it was late at this point! He arrived and we got into his car happy to just sit down somewhere with a bottle of water at hand! Be prepared to take a lot of water with you! your going to need it & we arranged to meet up soon! We had a second visit to the souk market & haggle at the market! Afterwards in the evening! we took a river boat across the creek! The ride across the creek river was bumpy and scary, we crossed over to the other side to return to our hotel. At night time old Dubai takes on a different look beautiful bright lights
Beautiful view with the coconut. It is wonderful to sit there and drink coconut. They will drill it for you and you drink it directly with a straw. LOVELY

A Must do on a hot day. We took a full hour boat trip on a immense hot july day. The trip gives a nice view of the 'other Dubai'. Experiencing this from a cool and windy boat is a good alternative for an airconditioned taxi

Charming In the Winter. All along the creek is a beautiful place to walk in the evening during the winter and spring. You get the feeling of Old Dubai and somewhere very real. Make sure and get a coffee, cross the creek in a Dhow (for a dirham) and if you have time book in a visit to the SMCCU (Sheik Mohamed Centre for Cultural Understanding)
Best place to wonder on legs with loved one.. I like the creek area on both side of backwaters,its very ideal to take a walk with loved one in this unknown country.at night it looks very glistning.
Good place to visit. This place is well worth the heat and effort to visit. Many pestering traders but weel worth it, its fun and gives an idea of old school Dubai

Don't take the RTA from 22 to 21 return. Wanted to get from Sheraton creek to gold market, so asked girl at counter what to doShe talked us into a return ticket 2 AED for card each pls 2AED each way, so Talked us into a return to ticket each 4 passengers, Get to gold market and go to come back and no boat, no boat,There is no boat. So approached the same girl when we got back and she just Asked us to contact RTA , it was her error, why could she to make it better,It was very hot and a hopeless system, as one of our members was not well because of the heat, it needs to be clearer if the boats do do a return as why were we made to buy a return when there was not one.

Great way to spend 1 Dirham! . Catch the local boats across the creek for a fun and cheap activity that the whole family will enjoy. It costs 1 Dirham per person each way. Lovely way to see Dubai from a different perspective.
What a mass. It's an amazing place to visit, but you'd better be ready for traffic jams, taking long to find a park slot and get to a crowded but charming place. Lot's of restaurants and shops.
lovely. a good ravishing experience depending upon the nature of activity you like.. a dinner on the cruise is what you always with your wife.. we loved it
Worth a trip. My daughter's favourite experience was an abra trip on the creek. It was the cheapest thing we did! You can also go for a meal on a dhow in the evening.

ok. Nothing much to do here other than getting a few pictures clicked with a nice backdrop of towering buildings and a nice water flowing below. try and come in the evenings to beat the heat. Can give it a miss if you are not a selfie fan.
Worth a visit but don't expect much. Interesting if you want to see the gold soul or spice soul but not a lot around. The Abrasa re good value

Hot hot hot!!. Do not come here in the summer! I went at a friend's request.. The creek side was deserted and most shops were empty... It was too hot to breathe, even! But it is a beautiful place and I can see why it would be a really nice place to go when the weather improves!
Pleasant. Took a trip across the river as part of the hop on/off bus tour. On a very hot day a top way to see the old & the new & somewhat cooler than walking around, especially during ramadam
Not much to do.. Walk along the "creek" and watch what is going on. Really not that pretty an area. No real attraction. Not very interesting.

A nice stretch of water within the city. It used to be on the outskirts old Dubai and part of the fisheries trade. Now it is slowly taken over by more buildings and becomes part of greater Dubai. Still a nice surrounding without the hectic of inner-city Dubai.

Complimentary Cruise on a Dhow at the end of a Big Bus day tour.. A brilliant end to a hot day. The cool breeze and view of the city with the old area from the water was excellent. We couldn't think of a better way to finish an excellent day.

Very nice experience on the boat. It was very nice to board the boat and travel all along the Dubai creek. Night view of the city is too beautiful. We loved Indian food served on it. It was very tasty with so many varieties. After food there was traditional Arabic dance by male dancer which was also very good. Must go with family when you are in Dubai.
Take the Abra across for $1. The Abra is a real local experience. Go down to the dock, ignore the touts, and take the boat across the river to the spice souk.
Creek. Creek rides ay 1 AED! approx 20p! Crossing the city is easy, hop on hop off, pay the captain! A good experiance!

A personal visit. I visited this place with my family and I really enjoy the visit and my children s as well.you can visit this place with your family. The crystal clear water to swim.I really enjoyed it
Unique Experience. Took a small boat to cross the river and you can really feel and experience both worlds between Deira ( old ) & Bur Dubai ( New )
Dubai museum and a pleasant boat trip. I'm staying on the Deira side of the creek and spent a nice afternoon evening nipping across the creek to visit the Dubai visit and appreciating the views.

Old Dubai and a boat cruise at the Creek. A place to visit in the evening, walk on the stretch of the creek, take a boat cruise (lil expensive) or just sit relishing shawarma watching lovely cruise that pass by.People who can't afford the cruise can opt for 'Abra' ride for 1 dhs each way. Abra is basically used by people to go from one side of the creek to the other side. I always enjoy being in and around waterso for me it was a god experience. There is nothing much to see...

Nice ride during none-summer season.. You may hire the old wooden boats with a usual Asian experienced driver for as little as 20 Euro to take an hour tour into the Dubai Creek going by the old port with the large wooden shipping boats and some of the most modern buildings on the other side of the Creek.
I love dubai and always have !!!. Walking distance from dubai creek is Juice world this is the old part of dubai which is always buzzing and busy as always

Fantastic. The visit to dubai creek is done in the evening coupled with a dinner in the yacht . it is wonderful experience to move around in the creek in the yacht and see dances and beautiful lights and building along the creek. However food served in the yacht is lousy
Relaxing ride.. Dubai Creek is really larger than a creek. It's interesting to see the different boats and barges along the way. It's a bit more industrial then what I was imagining.

Boat cruise on Dubai creek.. Great experience very romantic and great views and entertainment with the piano playing and the theme was amazing.I only give credit where due but this was amazing and for such small portions I was so shocked I was actually full after, perfect dining and great staff.Make sure you go on the correct boat it's mainly glass and looks elegant not tacky.
Average. Was a little disappointed with the cruise along the creek, the views were great but the night life was very low key. Much more for the older generation.

Nothing to see. Really quite disappointing in that there is nothing really to see! The food was ok, nothing to shout about. The drinks were very expensive and the toilets ABSOLUTELY stank! The boat takes you up the old port of Dubai which quite frankly is very underwhelming. I would recommend putting your money into something more exciting.

Old Dubai. Dubai Creek really showcases the old Dubai and is a must see as a tourist. It's way different than newer neighbourhoods like Downtown Dubai and Dubai Marina. You'll also find the famous souks in this area.

Old Dubai it is!!. We took the Abra water taxi just to experience it, just loved it. You get the feel of old Dubai, true essence of a localite. Great view in evening. Its a must to explore this side of Dubai too. Wonderful experience.
Good Hotel with Quality service and very comfortable. Very comfortable rooms and amenities. Staff very friendly and the food is excellent. The bed are extremely comfortable.

Take the city tour drive and stop by this place. We took the city bus tour and get off at the creek. The place is very beautiful and you can't believe this was built from the desert. The infrastructure work is also incredible. The place is full of small cafes and shops. We did also took a boat ride around the bay which we do also recommend as you will have the chance to see the incredible buildings from a different perspective.
Great character experience. Booked Dubai Private for a tour- around the city, across Dubai creek to the souks. Great to get a running commentary and see all the spots.

Preferred this part of town than the skyscrapers. This section of Dubai is buzzing with people from all walks of life unlike Jumeirah beach which is full of western tourists. Food was much better price as well than the other areas.

Interesting to walk around. Walking through this area and the gold souks was very interesting but better on a cooler day. We did it when the temperature was nearly 50 degrees and it was hard work. Choose a cooler day !!
Nice for a evening ride. Did a private boat ride along with friends. Great views, nice place. Do it a pleasant, windy evening. The water adds to the atmosphere.

Great place to see the old Dubai. The creek area is the best way to see how Dubai once was. You can from there explore Bastakiya, the Iranian spice market, gold souk, see the trading dhows and take an Abra ride across the creek. God forbid the Emirates ever removes these features from the landscape. It would destroy the last soul of the place
Perfect for night. Beautiful view in the night but as well in the day time, Here Bur Dubai separate Deira by Creek Chanel. Love it
dubai creek tour. we booked a dubai creek tour by ship. the food was just ok and not really good. we had a belly dancer men on ship. the music was to loud. the price was ok too.

A place i called Milan (Italy) in Dubai. It is wonderful scene when you have to take a walk or ride a small boat (Abra) that takes you from Bur Dubai to Diera or vice versa.

Lovely in places. This is a very bustling part of town in complete contrast to the very high end designer elite shopping to be found in the upmarket malls. Here in the docks is where all the workers, boats etc can be seen manually handling the tons and tons of goods. It is very dirty and there aren't any toilets to be found anywhere. Walk a bit further along and you'll be in the heart of the market traders and shopping where bartering takes pride of place. Try the trip across the river in a dhow or small boat. This is a short trip for about 15 minutes and only costs 1 dhiram per person. There are no life vests or any real safety features so be careful with small children. I doubt if they have any insurance either. Still it's worth the experience. You can always get a taxi back to where you need to be. This is also where you'll find Nassar Square where you'll find all the electronics and gadgets you'll ever need. It hot here so make sure to take sun cream, hat, and drink plenty of water.

Great Fun. We caught the little Abra water taxi c cross the Creek to the Gold and Spice Souk and it was a lot of fun. The ferry is very old and traditional and a great way to see the Creek area. I cost 1 Dirham each....that's New Zealand 40 cents. No complaints.

A Nighttime place. Nice at night, with lights on the boats and the souks nearby if you want to shop. But if you are tight on time there are other places in Dubai. But it is free and different to Downtown.
Cruise on the creek. A nice way to spend a few hours. Enjoy the opulence of the City, the State, the sky line is impressive

Dinner Cruise was okay. Took a ride on one of the many boats located on the creek and we attended a dinner cruise, a bit overrated if you ask me! The buffet was mediocre, and there wasn't a ton of amazing views from the boat. The entertainment they provided made it more fun though! (An Egyptian dancer and magic show). If you have a few hours to kill, take a boat ride on the creek!

Great way to see Old Dubai. Great way to see Old Dubai and get an understanding of the ways the city worked many years ago. It is the quickest way to get from one side of the city to the other and it also provide a nice, albeit warm, breeze from the sweltering heat.
nice place to visit. choose the right time of visit according to the weather and you will enjoy the experience , there is a lot of activities there too and its good for tourists

Separates Old to New Dubai. Dubai has developed like anything and has many upcoming attraction. Creek area is old Dubai I believe; but everything is modern, scenic and if you wish to stay you can stay in this area for Creek view. Easily accessible by bus and metro rail.

DINNER DHOW CRUISE CREEK. Dubai is more beautiful and attractive in the evening and in the night. Dhow Cruise Creek is an outstanding experience of spending the holiday and to make it gracious. Traditional dhows and dinner cruises. We were thankful to eat in the airconditioned lower decks, but we did spend a sweaty 30 minutes on the upper deck enjoying the city lights and river traffic.
Good place to buy local stuff. Good place to walk in the evening but not better than JBR. Nice local stuff for reasonable and good price compared to other market.

evening beauty place. an excellant creek side dividing deira and burdubai creeksidea lot of old and new buildings on that sidegood to go for cruise trips and have some mouth watering food and see the serenity of the creeksalso traditional type of dhow servises r seen therea good amount of goods are transported to oman,iran and the neighbouring countries through this creek

Wonderful, old Dubai. If you want to see the old, authentic hub of pre-oil Dubai, visit here! You can nip from one side of the creek to the other on an abra (AED 1 for a 5 minute journey) and visit souks (spice and gold on one side and textile, plus museums and heritage buildings, on the Bur Dubai side). You can also take an abra cruise around the creek - abra drivers will ask you if you want to go across or round, round being the cruise which takes about 45 minutes and you will probably get a boat to yourself. The souks are all very close to the creek so there isn't far to walk in the searing heat. You can also see the beautiful wooden dhow boats, upon which you can take an evening dinner cruise along the creek. Don't expect air conditioning in the old souks! Just soak up the atmosphere! I didn't see any toilets but there are free toilets in the museums, heritage buildings and the Al Ghubaiba bus station on the Bur Dubai side of the creek.

Lovely creek views. Our hotel was right on the creek and it is a nice part of town. With the older parts of town and you can enjoy a cheap ride on the boat ferry across. It is very hot so it's hard to walk too far. There are some nice cafes on one side of the creek but not much in terms of eating on the other side (airport side). Well worth the visit.

A must see. The creek is the old heart of the city - with Deira on one side and Dubai on the other. Crossed by abra for best views and atmosphere. There is also a tunnel and several bridges. Lots of impressive buildings along the creek

Lovely boat ride. We took the metro and then crossed the creek by one of the local abra water taxis which was a lovely experience. Used the same on the way back from the spice/gold souks. It's very relaxing to watch people go about their business in the creek area ...
Always a great place. The must do in Dubai. 1AED to cross the creek! But make sure you hang on !! ( not sure Elf n Safety would like it!!)

An Authentic View. Dubai Creek gives you the authentic view of Dubai. Take a water Ubra (boat) across the waterways to get the old feel and take in this area which provide that history feel. You want that in each place you visit in the world, and this is an area where you will find that in Dubai.

The only thing in Dubai having some history. Dubai is a modern city. Everything is modern what whatt not modern belongs to 50 years ago.100 years ago it was a village.So finding something to give the city a sense of heritage is not easy in Dubai. the wooden dough scene in Dubai creek is the only thing that can tell you how was life in Dubai in the past (Past means 100 year ago, don't go any further back or you will end up in bare sands.Dubai municipality was smart enough to keep the wooden boats still coming so preserve this scene.Another attraction is Abra, a group sea taxi taking people (up to 20 people normally) from one side of the creek to the other side doe one Dirham (close to 27 cents). It takes two minutes or less to cross the creek.It was a dead end but recently is is joined with the artificial business bay and from there through a canal under construction (as of July 2016) will be reconnected back to the Persian Gulf.

Great place for an after dinner walk.. We went to the marina after dinner and had a lovely walk.The surroundings are stunning.Dubai is an amazing place but the marina is gorgeous at night with all the lights from the buildings .

Lively and colourful . What a fantastic but busy day. This old region of Dubai cannot be missed. We visited it all, from the Heritage Village, the Grand Mosque, the Dubai Museum & old Water Tower, the original old trading wharves and a Dhow cruise down the creek across to the old Gold and Spice Souks or markets, and final the Deira region. The Dinner Cruise. We went to the Dubai Creek for a dinner cruise. The cruise lasted for almost two hours. The beauty of Dubai with the lights is spell binding. The Dubai Creek was dazzling as the sun set and the whole city lit up.

Must go places in Dubai . Creek park Dubai is one of the very eky attractive locations inside the vibrant and Lively city of Dubai. It is a Must go place for anyone who is visiting Dubai for first time, Dubai creek is situated right in the heart of Dubai separating new and old dubai. it has got many attractions like Creek Park, fine dinning restaurants, water front, walk way, Dhow Cruise dinner and rides....and beautiful merger of modern and historic Dubai.

unique experience. stunning views. It is a must visit place if you come to DubaiThere are many restaurants ,Lakeview and Boardwalk as international, Legends as Steakhouse, Casa De Tapas as Spanish cuisine, and Cello bar, There is also QDs bar and loungethe service, staff and ambiance are really amazingviews from all cosines are stunning and breath takingThe food is one of the bestI love this place and highly recommend it for friends and visitors

Take the Short Boat Ride. This review is quite late. I crossed the Dubai Creek aboard a short boat ride. It was fun experience especially when done at night where you can see the glittering lights of nearby buildings.

Lifeline of Dubai. Creek is the natural waterway inside the desert land connected to Sea .Sea water flows in the creek.The resourceful & farsighted,imaginative Govt. Of Dubai,use this waterway for economic benefits. commerce and development of tourism,water sports etc .Apart from trade ,trabsportation of goods & people ,Fishing also another source of income of the people.Both banks of the creek have concrete embankment.Main shopping ,business centers have come up on both sides.Beautiful tall commercial buildings housing Offices , business centres ,Commercial banks beautify the area .Excellent gardens,parks like, Creek park beautify the creek banks .Gold souk,spice markets are on one side of the creek.Luxurious boats ply in the evening where dinner is served and Arabic music ,dance is performed to the delight of the travellers/revellers.Thus a simple waterway is instrumental in enhancing the wealth,commerce ,entertainment , economic prosperity and overall economy and well-being of people & Govt of Dubai.They have conquered nature., business

Worth taking a cruise on a working Dubai Creek. The history of Dubai is intricately linked to history of Dubai Creek. Fishing and pearling industries relied on Dubai creek in 19th and 20th century. However, after Japanese invented the art of cultured pearls in the 1930s the pearling industry in Dubai died. Fishing to some extent still goes on. Dubai Creek is just over 10 km in length but there are plans to extend this. As the original creek had deep and shallow parts, which meant only certain ships could enter or anchor in the creek, dredging was carried out 50-60 years ago to allow much more continuous traffic of good. This trade lead to the development of Dubai. The Creek is lined with a large number of modern buildings of a variety of material and design. The wooden boat trip with a commentary goes a long way to explain the value of the creek as well as describing the various buildings. Worth spending an hour or so especially in the afternoon.

A night Dhow Cruise is beautiful. This was one of the highlights of our trip.... the dhow cruise can be booked in advanced and you are usually picked up from your hotel and returned. Usual start time is 7.30pm and comes with a buffet dinner. Don't hold your breath - the food is okay but the views of the Dubai Marina and the skyline was awsome.

Annoying locals. Arrived here with such high expectations of the Old Dubai area. Other than using an abra to cross the creek, there's really nothing to get excited about. Walking through the souk is an exercise in patience with locals continually calling out to you and shoving pashminas and other goods in your face.
