The creek itself is pretty at night when the douw cruises are lit up but the creek is so far from central Dubai city that the cost of getting there was hardly worth it.

The streets of Dubai. You can get a glimpse of the early developing days of Dubai when walking across these streets and getting a small boat ride. The streets are really beautiful and crowded and the smell of these Arabic perfumes fill the streets along with the raw smell of the water beside the streets. May not appeal to everyone but really a visit worth place.

Plenty to do here. This is the old bustling part of Dubai and must be fitted into your plans. There is a souk - we did not have time to see it but we are going to base our next trip in this area. Well worth going on a boat ride for good views and also a commentary including some of the history of the creek.

Lovely place to spend evenings. This is a lovely place to spend evenings sitting watching decorated cruises pass by. Good for evening walks as well. adjacent to Meena bazaar and walkable distance from Al Fahidi metro station (exit 3).
Refreshing . Nice experience crossing via water taxi. Cheaper than any other transport to cross d river btwn d old dubai souk n modern dubai village

An explosion of the culture of Dubai.. This is the place where the beauty of the EMIRATE of DUBAI fuses with the cutting edge technology..This place changes colors like a chameleon.!!!In the daylight , it reflects the sophistication of the leading city of 21st century.However, as the sun sets , the creek brings out its true colours and brims the atmosphere with ARAB culture in every sense, be it the lights , the music, the dresses , the boats or the super expensive yachts.One of the best ways to experience the creek fully , would be to dine in the DHOW CRUISE , which brings together FINE FOOD with SIGHTSEEING .
beautiful cruise, delicious food. A perfect cruise for family and couples, sights to see, locals to see, and tasty food served for all tastebuds.

Need of lick of paint. Stayed for 3 nights and all things considered was a good choice. As it was a short stopover decided not to stay out at the beach but at the creek, last time I stayed in town was 1997, a long time ago. The hotel when built was stand out and had Gordon Ramsey restaurant, now gone. Staff were excellent, but the hotel is now catering for the cheaper end of the market, well that's the impression I have. All that us required is to just a very small refurb, paint and upholstery and it would get five stars from me.

Great selection . The creek was wonderful, we visited at different times we went for breakfast, stayed till lunch and returned on other days just for dinner. There is a wide range of restaurants to choose from and the boat trips are fun, if you want some will even let you have a go at driving. Supervised of course. The boat restaurants are best experienced at night in all their illuminated glory. Fun, fun , fun.
Amazing Views. If you want to have a view on old Dubai, and enjoy views of Diera and Bur Dubai; Dubai Creek cruse the best trip ever.

Want something special?. If you're in Dubai or live here and have friends visiting here's a great thing to do... Go to the abbra (small boat) terminal on the Diera side of the creek. Haggle with one of the many drivers for a private hire of his abbra. Ask him to take you and your loved one or group of friends for an hour up to the floating bridge and return. Do this in the evening; it's cooler and the lights are really spectacular! As a romanic thing for a couple what could be better? Cruising up the creek beneath the lights of the high rise city sitting on the front of your own private boat? Ultra romantic and different. Expect to pay around AED 160-200.
Something different. A lot to see and do. We also took a boat ride with supper on a Dhow boat. This is worth seeing on your visit to Dubai.

A beautiful gate-away in Dubai . What a beautiful water way in Dubai, you can take a boat for a ride to see the skyline of some of Dubai towers and the old souq and also to experience how they used to cross the banks of the creek before building the bridges. Some big boats offer dinner.. But I enjoy the small ones and it is called "Abra"

Dubai Creek and old Bur Dubai. Enjoy the Dubai Creek by strolling down the Dubai Creek towards the creek entrance (Shindagha). I enjoy the late afternoon (around 1-2 hours prior to sunset) on the Creek on Bur Dubai side (NOT Deira side!!), combine it with a visit of Dubai Museum ad end up at Shindagha Hertiage Village and finish it up with a dinner at one of the countless restaurants and enjoy watching the boats coming and going.
Bit of old culture. I am glad I have seen this part of Dubai. Away from glitzy and shiny buildings. Good area to look for cheaper gold and souvenirs. Try to stay on main streets - just as precaution.
Interesting place . The Big Bus offers a dhow cruise along the creek. Interesting to see all the different types of boats docked along the creek. It's worth seeing.

good way to spend an hour. went touristing around the Gold Souk, then decided to hire an abra ( water taxi) for an hour to travel along the creek. good way to see things. our driver was very friendly and quite informative.it cost us about £25 for the hour, which isn't bad.
Wonderful evening. I spent my last night in Dubai having an evening dinner cruise at Dubai Creek and it was an unforgettable experience.

Not so typical yet oddly satisfying . The view is quite nice in the evening. Booked for 2 in an evening dinner in a dhow cruise with buffet. Well technically its not a buffet since the food is limited to like nibbles. But i guess its ok since i got it cheap. As for the scenery, half of it is construction then half is the city. Thats what i saw.
Lovely place to visit and go on a boat . We went on a evening boat ride it was beautiful and had dancers the children loved it however one of them really scared my son aswell
outdated but beautiful need to improve. heart of the city. Creek need many changes and rework behind required to shaikh mohammed. Not must go place it's near City Center Shopping mall

Abra (Boat). This was a good experience from one side of the river to another. Our friend took us on the Abra (wooden boat). Very cheap to use. Be careful getting on as there is no handles to hold on to, just a wooden seat in the middle to sit on, but definitely a fun experience.

Nice evening Meal. Came here on the advice from a fried and was very impressed. Had a nice meal in a nice little restaurant on the side and watched the world go by and a few boats,, it was Ramadan so it was a little quite, but was very nice

Interesting . I enjoyed going here but suggest you use the locals transport as so much cheaper as the other water taxi's cost a fortune. It is full of locals so watch which direction they go. Night time is beautiful.

Well worth a visit. Get the Abara acoss the creek with the locals, or rent one for and hour and go right up the creek to see the contrast of Old and new.
lots of little tourist shops in a Souk area, and a very good Museum about the History of Dubai, ( entry DHM 3 ), Restaurants are also there.
Dhow Cruise. Its ok. Not advisable to people who had previous experience travelling on a cruise ship or a boat...food is ordinary........
Excellent . Excellent place to go for dhow cruise excellent atmosphere beautiful place must visit in dubai excellent
Must do whilst in Dubai. We did an evening boat trip and it was really fascinating to learn just how important this waterway is to the residents of Dubai

Typical part of Dubai and wonderful views from some locations. The Creek is part of the old Dubai and provides some authenticity though the dhow wharfage (typical ships carrying goods) have been moved a bit upstream to leave free space to the touristic boats.Don't miss a cruise on the Creek (either using the touristic boats providing dinner during the cruise or using a simple boat to see the Creek from an other perspective)

Bustling and hot.... Visiting the spice market, we went on the little abra boats across the creek - very Dubai. The creek area is full of the daily life of the area, and very busy. The abras only cost 1dh to cross from one side to the other. Bargain!! Lots to see here, but so very hot.

Lovely evening view of Dubai. The Dough Cruise is quite interesting.
One can enjoy the beauty of Dubai by evening.
Nice experience

Quite a nice place to see the old cuty. It's a nice place for a walk around old town and dinner but the places do not serve alcohol. You can take an Agra boat to Deira from here and it's close to the metro
Nice, Quite and Romatic. If you wanna spend some quality time with yourself thinking quietly, then this is the place for you.

" Enjoy Abra Ride on Creek !!!!!!!!! ". Dubai Creek is the best place for your evening walk.. The Heritage Village & old Dubai is around it..Just take an Abra ( small water taxi ) from Al Ghubbaiba Water taxi stand for just 1 AED to reach from this point to Gold Souk or Spice Souk....The famous Dhow cruise are all started from here.. in Evening lots of decorated Dhows are welcoming there guest for a Dhow rides..There is a small garden for relaxation at Dubai Creek.. So overall Dubai Creek is surrounded by big Buildings with old Heritage Dubai ...
Let the breeze guide you!. Whether you are floating in and on the creek in a boat or cruise or you are on either side of it, it will create a world around you!

Nice 5 min journey. I think if someone likes history, then this is a must. Personally I liked it a lot as they still maintain the old boats and gives u a feel that you are travelling some 20 years back.Drivers even drive with legs also ;)for 1 AED this is the best think u get in Dubai :)
Mix of Fakery and Authentic. Taking the water taxi - the Abra - is a good way to cross the waters to the old Dubai with its gold and spice markets and markets for fake designer goods
Fine.. Just went there to ride a boat going to the gold souk. Just an ordinary boat ride on a creek. You can see little of dubai's buildings. Fishy smelling water. ;)
Small boat trip. This was a great experience across the creek I did it on a tour and was good fun nice way to see some of the creek and buildings
Creek. If you are in Deira area this is very close by. There are number of boats for sunset cruising and dinner.

Lovely creek. Crossed this many times
1 Dirham each way
Lovely dows and boats
They unload them the old way
No cranes or containers
Always calm
A must see

Not so exciting!. We had a dinner cruise. Food was below average. The cruise was OK and there isn't really much to see for the one hour cruise but it is nice way to pass time if there is nothing else to do.
What a nice way to see old Dubai. I had a solo journey up now down the Creek with my silly Indian captain. It was a different way to check out Dubai and very enjoyable.

Optional - you can see it in passing. We had the view from Dubai Heritage village - a nice view of the skyline. There are restaurants / cafes which open in the evening giving a nice night view. Nothing much to see / enjoy in daytime.

1 Durham well spent. Catch one of the little boats from the creek over to the other side. Have a look around and come back. I did get hassled by one man who decided to follow me and hiss at me. So being a teacher I gave him a good telling off and he left me alone after that. Great markets for textiles on the dubai museum side just head down to the water and you will find them.

Our favourite memory of Dubai. We were staying at the Marina (which is a very long way from downtown Dubai for the first-time visitor). We took the excellent public ferry form the Marin to the old town creek. Form there we jumped on an Abra (local wooden ferry) for only 1 Dirham each, (AUD $0.40) and had an authentic and memorable experience.Once you get off the launch, locate the nearby spice Souk and Gold souk. A genuine and exciting experience.

Cultural and historical. It's not just a Creek for tourists but demonstrating the era from historical Dubai in the past developed into the modern city of Dubai today. Water taxi is the best way to travel between the shores and you can also visit the streets & shops in the surroundings. River taxi charges only AED$1 per trip so feel free to cross the creek as many times as you like.

Short Journey. By chance I came across the tiny boats that buzz across Dubai Creek. Very basic you sit on a bench back to back. Cost is only 1 AED. The journey is short less than 10 minutes. It is nice to get away from the city hustle and bustle and have a nice breeze blowing. The scenery is okay nothing spectacular.

Fun way to explore some sights old and new of Dubai. Four of us hired a water taxi and took a tour up and down Dubai Creek. Ask for a guide that speaks some English and you will find it interesting and fun.!
Very busy creek...... If you like to people watch, this is the place to do it. Lots of interesting activity taking place here at the creek. Lots of locals to see as well.
Cruises. You can take a short cruise on Dubai Creek, with very old and cozy boats. It's very nice, especially in evening, but take care of your valuables as they might easily fall into the water.

Cheapest Site Seeing Tour in dubai. At 1 Dirham to cross the creek on a Arba the best view of what is left of old Dubai. A walk down the creek to see the Dhow's being loaded is still reminiscent of Michael Palin's visit in the 80's. They still ship old car panels, tyres, furniture as well as AC's and fridges. Wander down to the Radison and you have a a world of a choice of cuisine or venture one street back for some realistic shopping and even more food choices. Avoid June to September, too hot, unless you like it that way.

A beautiful Marina that is not used to its full potential.. Great promenade to walk or cycle along, chill with friends or grab a bite to eat. overlooked by high rise tower housing that marks the skyline. otherwise serene and relaxing.

Beautiful! . The creek was so beautiful. Great view and amazing pictures to click throughout the cruise. You get a glimpse of Dubai in beautiful way . The river cruise was nice ,though got a little boring at the end.

Dhow Dubai Creek Cruise. We took this excursion on the evening we arrived in Dubai. Transportation from the hotel was included and well as a very good buffet dinner while onboard. River cruise duration was almost 3 hours and the colorful lights on the other boats made for a very pleasant evening

Fascinating Dubai Creek. Dubai creek was and is still one of the main source of commerce by water vessel travel in what they call the dhow.One can see lots of dhows docking by the pier as well as water taxis and plenty of goods being loaded and unloaded off various sizes of dhows.One of the oldest hotel was The Riviera and it's a famous landmark there. We can take the Creek cruise from here and it's an hourly cruise from 10.30am to 5.30pm.Lots of quaint shops and stalls to shop souvenirs and pashminas or ladies' apparels.The gold souk is just before it and plenty of jewellery shops there to browse too. It's one of the oldest souk district here.It was quite a sight seeing labourers loading and unloading heavy goods and I felt a bit sad at this visage Best way to tour around here is by taking the Big Bus Tour on the red line of city tour which starts from Wafi mall and lasts for two hours. Definitely worth it and one can get a 24 or 48 hours Big Bus Tour tickets.

Pretty. We took an Abra across. It did feel like we stepped back in time to old Dubai, it was evening when we crossed so we ended up with a beautiful sunset highlighting the creek. Enjoyable short trip worth doing.

Take a ride on dhow. The centre of old Dubai. You should cross from one side to the other on a small ferry boat or take a dinne cruise in the evening that takes you up and down the creek for about 2 hours
Dhow cruises. To enjoy the Creek river it was really nice to do a dhow dinner cruise, get all dressed up and enjoy sumptuous buffet with on board live singer, tanoura dance and tradition sword dance.
Beautiful . A taste of authentic Dubai....great to just wondering around soaking up the atmosphere.Recommended for anyone....you use also wonder down the streets to find a bargain.

Very nice!. Dubai Creek is very nice. We had a dinner cruise with dancing and although at the beginning we thought it was a little kitsch, it turned out really good and we had real fun. BUT you have to sit at the bottom deck, because at the upper, it is really windy and cold.

Hot. Took an abra across. 1 Durham each way Fascinating watching the locals jump off before the boat has dockedEnjoyable mode of transportAs an outdoor activity ( but has a small roof) we found it too hot.. Was 44 degrees the day we visited.The docks are fascinating with all the loading and unloading of goods. Check out the old blue boats sailing with the goods.. Must be no pirates around!

Dubai Holiday 2016.. We took a City Sight Seeing Hop on hop off open and closed top deck bus, One half near the stairs was open near the back was enclosed and airconditioned, The ear pieces where comfortable and the english commentary by a lady was very good and clear. We got off near the creek on the Dubai side was hoping to go to the Dubai Museum near the bus stop, It was a Thursday and the Museum was closed until 4.00pm, So we had a walk into town and bought a couple of bottles of water. One of the local people a young gentleman, very friendly and helpful, Showed and told us the hotel with a doorman would have toliets, It did all had an english pub resturant called Sherlock Homes, Had our lunch there the waiteresses where very kind and polite. Later we took a taxi across the Dubai Creek to the Deria side to the Gold Souqi and Perfume Souqi. Real Gold jewellery, too expensive, At the perfume Souqi I bought perfume oil sheik perfume oil the shop keeper put it in a small gold bag, small bottle, also bought a small box and bottle of perfume too, Did some haggling to reduce the prices.

Great Experience while in Dubai.. Visit the world famous Gold Souq. Take an Abra (traditional water taxi) boat… a must to do while in Dubai. Abra ride across the creek is cheap (1 AED) and it's a lot of fun. Great with friends, love one and family.

One of my favourite spots in the city. Even when it is hot the little breeze from the water makes the Creek pleasant. Either from the bustling quayside or from an Abra on the water a must-see part of the city.
Heritage. The nice old Dubai and beautiful harbor need to see in the city where you can try the small boats between the two banks.
Nice experience. Trip over creek is 1 DHS only and its very quickly! Visit next side with small mosque and nice small streets and local market of course:-)
Excellent experience. A must visit for dhow rides and boat trps Here one hets to experience small fairs and rides for kids. A photographers favourite spot too.

green and peaceful. Creek Park is a beautiful,green and peaceful place, lots of different kind of trees and plants, birds, flowers, grass, very good place to relax or to go with kids,some attractions are waiting there for them :) clean, nice and peaceful place
Lovely. We had booked a Dhow cruise through rayna tours. We chose to opt for the upper, open deck (the lower was air conditioned). And the ride was superb, unbelievable that Dubai will be so cool

Best local experience. In my opinion this is by far the best local experience in Dubai.
The creek is home to many fishing boats which hold a firm position in the history of the UEA.
Soo much to see in the short journey crossing the creek but in my opinion excellent experience and my personal favourite.
Only costs 1 dirhim to ride.

The connection of "old and new" Dubai. The connection of "old and new" Dubai is always worth a visit. Take one of the many abra's (traditional wooden boats) across for just 1 AED per person and trip. Or let them take you on a full Abra tour up and down the creek. Wether day time, dusk or dawn, you will be delighted by its magnificent views.
Don't miss it!. It's one of the best boat rides i've ever been on. Dubai creek is a natural one connecting the old and the new world. A must see attraction for everyone.

a good way to appreciate development. get along ubai creek take a water taxi and make a round at the various part of the creek. per se it is not a creek but a sea water channel. it is used to be the key business center of dubai when trade was limited to pearl diving at the gulf.
Awesome. Really nice place and well made. The Dubai creek is a good place to hang out and spend some quality time. Worth the visit. Recommended
Terrible. Dubai creek what a waste of time. The boat is so over priced and at the back of the market which is disgusting! Would not recommend at all!

Memories. This place is part of old Dubai and that is why it is close to heart because I grew up around the area. It is right next to the souqs of both the Burdubai and Deira sides of the creek. Best is to take the 1 AED abra ride that is super fun, short and exciting that takes you from one side to another. In the Shopping festival months, there are fireworks at 8:30pm and it used to be like a full carnival with rides and food stalls etc. but now it is closed for some major construction work. wonder what development is coming up. Parking is a shortage. nice place for evening walks and chilling with the family..

Nice area. We had just a quick visit this time in Dubai. The creek area is a nice place to stay as we were jetlagged we just strolled along the creek and visited the souks which gives you a taste of the old Dubai

Must do when visiting Dubai. This is a must do for any visitor to Dubia. It is more traditional and makes you feel the older flavor of the city and region. It is fun and different, with lots of activity, very safe and everyone always raves about it afterwards. I even love to go here myself alone when I need to get away from the newer part of the city and have some 'exotic' feel for where I live.

Amazing. Amazing feat of engineering - lots of restaurants - all vying for your businessThe lights - cleanliness and safety of walking around late at night and the vibrancy is wonderful Have a long walk - but wear sensible shoes - because its a long walk!

Go on a night cruise on the Creek.. Great fun. You can go one of the many Dhows that ply the waters and get a glimpse of some local river life as well.All with the backdrop of towering buildings.
Go and enjoy.

My favourite place in Dubai. Although many visitors are dazzled by the stunning architecture of the 'new' Dubai (as they should), the old area near the Dubai Creek is easily my favourite place. If you look for authenticity in this modern metropolis, this is definitely the place to go.

A change from the luxury . Visited the creek by taking an Abra across from Bur Dubai to Deira at sunset. Experienced a different type of Dubai in Deira, more indopakistani people and facilities. Good for Asian shopping as has everything you could want.
Get immersed in the old dubai. Really enjoy the old dubai and the creek. Did experienced the abra crossing as welll. The views and the people are authentic
Peaceful mind. If is a place where you feel peaceful mind the two restaurants their are awesome and the sea view especially at night with floating seats
Cross the creek for 1AED. Go here just to cross the creek on the little local boats for 1 AED other than that nothing else to do around here - in my opinion anyway!
Dow Boat Dinners. A lot of fun to have dinner on a Dow Boat and see the sights at night and also very romantic. We had a great time.

Not Worth the Time and Effort. Perhaps if one has not traveled reasonably widely, or experienced old, local transportation, I can see the point. Otherwise, compared with the rest of Dubai's marvels, it simply didn't seem like there was much here. We walked both sides of the creek for aways, and took a couple of abras. The abra rides are short and not really interesting, while the markets in this area, again, if one has never experienced souks/local markets, perhaps its fine, but if one has any international travel experience, this area will disappoint.

Gorgeous!! . The Dubai creek is absolutely stunning and even more amazing to visit on a night as he atmosphere is brilliant but the lights of the buildings make the creek look even more gorgeous. I would highly recommend hiring a pedal bike/ kart whilst at the creek as you can cycle round the marina having fun but also view all the boats on the creek! Great fun!

Nice view of the abras and dhows. It is possible to catch a peaceful view of the abras and dhows sailing past the creek at night. However the abras dont have much safety so I would not recommend with small children. An abra ride costs 1 dirham and to book a private abra is 120 dirham. Didnt see much families about when I visited mostly workers commuting.

Business dinner . Quite and nice place to visit with many choices
Been to collective restaurant in grand hyatt hotel for dinner.
Dhow cruise. Did a dhow cruise on the creek. nice view at night. the abra's buzzing by makes a great scene, but Unfortunately i couldnt catch one.
Relaxing. I went on the daytime dhow cruise as it was included in the hop on hop off bus tour. It was a great, relaxing time to sit back and enjoy Dubai creek.
Nice. Took a dhow along the creek which was nice. Overall, it's a nice place to just boat around or take a stroll

Center of the real Dubai. 30 years ago, this used to be THE location to visit and experience when staying in Dubai, now the glitter and modern facades have moved elsewhere, but the real local Arab ambience of Dubai still remains firmly ensconced here. Other visitors might come to Dubai to see the new fantastically modern (but by my reading sterile buildings), but I prefer to experience Dubai as the exotic flavorful town it once was - and still is - and this is nowhere more evident than in the Bur Dubai / Dubai Creek area.

Fascinating Area of Dubai. The creek area is filled with souks (markets) that sell everything from spice to gold jewellery. Terrific boat tours that offer you a different and interesting view of the city. Dhows will transport you from side to side or give you a guided tour for under $10. A fun afternoon area of the city that is worth exploring.

A must do. Took ferry from Dubai marina to Creek then an Abra (20p) to cross the creek. Old Dubai!. Prices cheaper than downtown modern Dubai. Wander the souks and pick a bargain after haggling. Some decent restaurants with decent prices.

Great Environment. The Dubai Creek is currently undergoing a major renovation so access is difficult.By all means visit this historical area once the access improves. Go to the gold and spice souks. Take the water taxi for a couple of Dirham versus spend ten times that for a tourist boat trip. It's all very memorable and representative of the old Dubai!

Sunset at the creek . Spent a wonderful relaxing time sipping juice at Creekside cafe watching the abras and the sun set. The cafe was in an idyllic location right by the creek and had a wonderful choice of fresh juices
Sit back and watch the busy traffic across the Creek. Sit back at number of the restaurants along either side of the Creek and watch the busy traffic across and up and down the Creek.
The true Dubai. This place shows the real old Dubai . Worth a visit and a ride on old feluka :) best time is sunset before reaching Dubai creek you can pass by the souk .
Beautifully arranged. It was marvelous experience dinner in the sea, very well arranged and good timely pick and drop and very well guided, all in all great pleasurable experience.
Good boat ride!. Went on the creek as part of another tour. It was a very hot day and getting on the boat was totally worth it as it felt even hotter!!

One of few 'authentic' experiences in Dubai. A visit to the Creek area and Deira Souks and Shiva Temple is one of the few 'authentic' experiences in Dubai and gives a flavour of the history of the place.

Interesting. There are lots of hotels down this end of town. I stayed at Jumeriah Beach which is definitely my favourite end of town but at Dubai Creek you have easy access to the Spice Souk and Gold Souk which is a definite must visit to Dubai. Australians you can buy the spice and bring back into Australia so long as you declare it at customs. They have some amazing spices and cheap. Do cross the Dubai Creek just jump on one of boats for 1 Dirham to cross the creek. Some great cafes and restaurants down here as well. You can also catch the Dubai Ferry back to the Dubai Marina. Will def visit this place again

Take the boat tour! . This was a cool place where you can truly become submersed in the history of Dubai and how it was once a trade Mecca. I suggest going for the boat tour, you will learn soooo much and see how they still use ancient techniques in their import of products. Also, take a driver down the street, you'll find the gold souk and experience true UAD culture.

Closest thing to authentic old Dubai. The creek area is the closest you can get to seeing what Dubai may have been like before they found oil. It was basically a small fishing town. In the creek area you can cross the water in a traditional dhow, or a modern water taxi. You can see working boats and also in this area you can find the souks where you can be accosted by annoying people trying to sell you crap.

Nice Return visit to the Creek - Pleasant Stroll along the Bustling Quayside. This is much more Old Dubai espectially on Bur Dubai side. You can cross over from the Abra Station for 1 dirham and travel like a local. A real fun experience. If you come in the morning you can see the Dhows being loaded with every item imaginable.On Fridays really busy when all the workers meet up with their friends etc. The Abras will take you across to the Dubai Museum etc. Always a good place to go to.
old Dubai. Travelled here on boat , met up with daughter and son there, we did not want to stay for long, so we jumped the same boat back

Back To Dubai That It Was. My trip to Dubai Creek was just a spur of the moment decision. Unplanned. Aside from that, It was very hot outside. And so, we got to abra, a mode of transportation through the river, and the cheapest. There is an improvement, but the government sees to it to maintain the essence of old Dubai. There are restaurants also where you can enjoy the views while eating or just taking a drinks. Just prepare yourself for a lot of walking or if you want you can just sit on the benches there. You should try to drop by at the Sheikh Saeed Al-Maktoum House. They have the collections of the old Dubai. And by the way, if you don't want to take the abra(boat), you can take the Metro, depends where you feel convenient. It was very nice for a culture loving person. My review title says it all. It was worth the adventure.

The real Dubai. People often go to Dubai for the glitz and glamour - and it is very modern, clean and glamorous but it does have history- and Dubai Creek is the place to see it. The people who work in the (excellent) restaurants by the creek are very proud to show old photos of Dubai 30 years ago. Food is cheaper and really, really, tasty - and authentic.
you can skip it.. if you did desert safari and cultural dance before boat trip so definitely 1 hour boar trip you can skip it.
lovely view via local boat. Pleasant boat ride and lovely views from the creek, of the city, lovely little shopping arcades, and gold souks.

Landing place of Short C class Flying Boats in 1938/39. This is the river, known as a "creek" where the mighty Flying Boats would land en route from Sydney to London in the late 1930's. Landed here in Southern Sun in 2015, between the busy stream of local timber craft plying the waters.
Take a taxi ride. This was great negotiate with one of the taxi drivers to take your group round the river for an hour its a really pleasant thing to do especially when its hot as the river is cool

Relaxing view. The ideal place to watch life go by. Best enjoyed in the evening as you sit at a creek side cafe, with a drink of your choice, and if you like shisha, the traditional bubbly bubbly tobacco pipe, this is a great place to be as you watch small and large boats go about ferrying passengers, cargo etc. one part is very old architecture contributing more to the feel.
It ok. Is a 1 hour boar trip i think you can skip it but after walking thur the sun it nice just to hop on it and take a hour of relaxing
Evening Visit is the Best Time. This place is a must visit in Dubai.The Best time to visit is evening time.There is ferry ride available for 4 to 5 AED.

Beautiful . This area is beautiful, lovely views when the fog/ clouds clear you can see over into the city and the figures of all the buildings which is a lovely view. Had food at the boardwalk restaurant, lovely view, very rich food.

We took a cruise... very nice. We took a cruise down the Creek. Very nice way to spend the evening. The Creek is in the old town, and offers an insight into the real Dubai (although there are a lot of tourist areas around).
Great way to see the old Dubai. Watch all the abra water taxis travelling all along the creek, its a true taste of old Dubai, visit the souks and have a coffee in waterside cafes near the cloths souq

A bit dissapointed. Grabbed a taxi here to visit the souks.
The river crossing was fun, only 1 dirham each way, souks were ok but not what we expected. Walking around was hard work being bugged by the shopkeepers everywhere. Good experience of authentic Dubai though.

Explore ancient Dubai. Creek is cutting dubai to two halves.From both sides you can see ancient dubai (deira and bur dubai) it is easy to move from part to another one by boat and even over bridges by car.At day time the view is nice as mixture between water and sun, modern and modest city.At night, the area will be colorful and you can enjoy reflections of light on the water.There are several companies arranging dhow dinners on big boats daily.Also there is tours from creek to dubai marina you can reserve earlier or on spot.Enjoyable experience ...

Nice trip. we visited Dubai Creek as we planned to visit Heritage site. Found some of the Arabic restaurants. We ate for lunch and conclude average taste. Well there are plenty of Vegetarian too,,worth visit
Creeky Creek. Yeh get on one of them wee boats and sail up the creek, great fun, hey but is it not half busy, good day oot.

Relaxing walk along the waters edge. In the heart of commercial and busy Dubai it is a relaxing experience to stroll along the creek and watch all the boats along the creek and boats full of tourists going by.Go by late afternoon or very early morning to avoid the heat.

Great walk around and visit the markets. Walk around the Creek to the main market areas. Lovely walk and very open, good views up and down. At the end is a great market selling everything you would expect in the Middle East
No so impressive. Cross the river on local boats for 1 dirham, visit the spices market, drink a pineapple juice and... That's it. Not more to do.

Need to make sure. After walking around to check which boat we supposed to get on for almost 45 min, we finally got on our cruise ship. That whole area docked with at least 20 ships all ready cruising at night ...

Family Holiday Dubai. Went to Dubai Creek to live the nightlife and it was awesome. Wonderful place for couples friends family. Restaurants bars shisha places, scenery if tall well lit buildings, lit up palm trees, yachts . Thoroughly enjoyable experience

The creek. The Creek is an interesting place. It's like an oddity in a city full of brand new skyscrapers and state if the art malls. The boats are far from this...old, made if wood with the only modernity being the sound if the humming engine. It was a fun break from the monotony of the modern. For one dirham crossing over the Creek in a boat sounded like a deal. I saw a few barges passing by, but to mingle with the local people and have a taste of their culture, I think the boat would be a better experience. I've written more about the boats than the Creek but I believe these two go hand in hand.

Mini newyork. Dubai creek is the attraction of the dubai city and seperates old and new city. The boating and the cruises in the night are the main attraction of this place . The whole area is illuminated in the evening as if Manhattan is separated from Jersey city .This Dubai creek is going to be extended and the other end of creek is likely to be connected to the sea so that the water is get circulated and remains fresh.However the sea water in dubai is clean and bluish.This will take around one year to complete this work of connection then this will more attractive
extraordinarily built. never seen a city with such a view... this creek is so awesome i spent one whole evening here with my friend. We went on a boating here which was very thrilling.. superb place

A busy boating route through to Dubai. At night time it is a mass of boats and floating restaurants all lite up in various colours. During the day you can take trips along the creek to the entrance to Dubai.

The Sunset!!!. Oh, the sunset! I love watching at the sunset. Ilove gazing at the different hues of reds, yellows and oranges while the sun goes down. Though I haven't been to Venice, the sunset by the creek emulates the romance that radiates in Italy and the Arab culture that is dominant in Dubai.

The old and authentic part of the city. After visiting the Dubai Museum take a stroll through the textile souk and for 1 AED the small boats called Abra will take you to Deira the other side of the Creek. There are the great Spice Souk and Golden Souk and don't miss the chance for some bargains.
Thames of the Gulf. Since it is located in between Deira and Bur Dubai it is the best way to see city . It is once in a lifetime experience

Remids Me of False Creek in Vancouver, BC. Our Family took a dinner cruise of Dubai Creek on a mild evening. During dinner, we noted a lot of similarities between Dubai Creek and False Creek in Vancouver. The numerous condo towers, restaurants, clubs and the number of pedestrians indicated that this must be the locals live and play.
Great Place To Sit and Relax. For a change Dubai has witnessed the longest period of its exceptionally beautiful cool weather till April 2016. Just sit and relax and enjoy the beauty!

A good experience of the creek. I stayed by the creek on my most recent trip to Dubai. I got to watch workers unload goods from the boats and i took a water taxi (abra) across the creek also. It cost me 1aed. The creek was interesting, and provided an alternative source of transports which i enjoyed immensely. I took an abra ride to the souk.

WE loved it!. The Dubai Creek is amazing and we loved it - we hired a dhow to take us on a private ride and we went up as far as we could to the floating bridge and back again for AED 120 for all of us and we saw so much of Dubai. The life on the creeks edge is interesting and fluid and we watched the city tick over.The Large dhows that travel into Africa being loaded was a sight to behold - Mountains of goods and sailors living in close and cramped conditions. The daily grind of people using the water taxis to go about their lives. Fishermen and families trying their hand at catching something for the table. A large section where photography is prohibited as the family of the ruling Sheik live there.Where the Country Club set and the sailors rub shoulders - so much to see and experience.We puttered for a few hours and had the wonderful experience of the sun setting as we cruised along the water - our driver filling us in on what we saw. Friendly people waving as we cruised by.Its a time reflector and we loved every minute of it! Bonus moment - watching a stingray jump clear out of the water right in front of our eyes!

Decent place for spending time. Lots of ferries, walkways (though crowded due to business activities) on the old city side. The other side has great parks where one can sped great quality time before the sun heats the air or after it goes down.
Fun and Exciting. Dubai creek is much older. If you take the Dhow cruise its more fun and exciting. You can have an amazing view of Dubai skyline.

A different take on Dubai. A stroll around the old part of Dubai is highly recommended - get on a ferry that goes to the other side of the creek and wander round there also This is a working port - not very big but working - interesting to see the Dhows all being loaded by hand.There are some interesting shops selling spices (and the usual tourist stuff)

INTERESTING. After the new skyscraper vista so proudly displayed by tour operators - it was refreshing to get off 'hop on hop off' at Gold Souk, look around then catch water taxi across creek to 'market' - we had lunch on river - great watching water traffic in a more old 'worldy' setting
Beautiful. We visited the creek at night and it was beautiful cruising down the river in a show cruise. Didn't get a chance to see the souks near it but still very nice.

Value and location. Staying at the Sheraton Dubai Creek. Room is great with nice view, large bathroom and free wi-fi but no SnapChat or WhatsAp access. Opted for the "Club" upgrade for about 40 Euros a day. Well worth it. We also have a Sheraton free loyalty membership which I recommend. The Club Lounge upgrade includes a continental breakfast (or American buffet in the restaurant) from 6:00 am to 11:00. Great benefit since our plane arrived at 5:30 am and room check in wasn't until 3:00. Starwood reward program got us a room by 9:00am. Other Club benefit was high tea wth beverages and sandwiches at 3:00. Happy hour with complimentary Wine/beer and snacks from 6:00 to 8:30pm. No alcohol sold in Dubai markets - only hotel restaurants, etc. excellent red wine.Hotel was walking distance from the air conditioned underground metro but wth temps over 100F even a 10 minute walk in the sun is taxing. 24 hr metro pass was 22 UAE$ (abut 4UAE per 1 Euro). Better exchange rates in the bank at the metro than at the hotel. Tried taking metro form Union Station to Gold Souk. Still had to walk a bit and had to also take a very cheap boat/ferry to get across the water to the street gold markets. Fascinating but very hot. Not much of a dress code. I wore Capri pants and sort sleeve shirt. Husband wore long shorts and t-shirt. lots of English speakers every where to answer questions. Hotel staff very friendly, knowledgeable and courteous.

Creek is older then Dubai. This creek existed even before the formation of Dubai and the Ancient Greeks called it River Zara. The creek divides Dubai into two part, Deira and Bur Dubai. The creek have witnessed the birth of Dubai
dhow cruise exhilarating. dhow cruise gives u uninterrupted views of the dubais skyline-one of the best skylines in the world and what u enjoy most is the twinkling lights of burn khalifa
ROMANTIC AND FUN FILLED CRUISE. Had an awesome with raynas tour creek cruise,danced and the meals were excellent.we were greatly entertained.we had fun.

Well preserved. The Dubai creek is a place to visit. That's a nice walk way from Bur Dubai that goes along the see where you can see the old commercial boat coming and going. All this area is well preserved and clean . Few museum are there and coffees. Nice to walk trough.

the best way between Bur Dubai and Daira. You hop on these wood boat for 1 dirham and they will get you to the other side in no time. No buying of ticket you pay on the boat and never have to wait. There are plenty of them. If you go to Dubai you MUST try this at least once. It is exotic and very efficient.

Interesting area as a whole. Go to the Dubai museum and sheik Mohammed cultural center and walk along the creek for a very different view of Dubai. The creek itself isn't all that interesting just a busy water way but the neighborhood in old Dubai is a nice contrast to the modern glamor you have probably already seen at this point.

Cruise. Definitely a dhow cruise I recommend to experience the new and old dubai...one can opt for dinner in that cruise as well which is little expensive. ...I had been through small boats which are available for 1 dhiram to get down at another stop.....had a wonderful time at dubai creek specially evening times....

Adventure in Dubai. Visited this place, walking around the creek, lots of shops n restaurants, a new experience, plus there are the dhow boats a lot to see here, do not miss visit this enchanting attraction.

Relaxing place. Very relaxing place even for nonresident, visiting the place is worth the trip.
I went for a meeting and fell in love with the place.
Very private, very organized amd beautiful

The hub of Old Dubai. Loved this place, Its the old Dubai full of character & markets and little lanes and back allies to explore, bustling with people & Noise from all over, this to me was real Dubai. the Dubai creek area is very different from the new (& very clean) uptown Dubai.
This busy and intense area may not be to everyone's liking.
Saltwater creek in Dubai. The Dubai creek divided the city into two main sections – Deira and Bur Dubai. Traditional Abra boat service is a great experience. RTA also arranges Water Taxi Service

Holleyday tour.. DUBAI creek is very memorable experience in our tour it's looks an evening in paries.full injoy of life is there.buetyfull building sarounding there looks like a Heaven. Thanks DUBAI.

Bizarre experience. We booked a dinner cruise using Trip Advisor, and got it a lot cheaper than using the tour operator directly. After getting to the boat we realised why, but this did not happen until we had spent an hour and a half riding around Dubai in a minivan. The Dhow was appealing but very basic once on board. We had to share a table with another couple, and the buffet dinner was pretty basic, although the food was good and would not complain. The entertainment was bizarre and just absurd, but it made us laugh, and before we knew it we were back, after sailing up and down the creek a couple of times. The whole experience was quite cheese but good value for money. The ride back to the hotel was much quicker after reading we insisted we were dropped off first.

have a nice meal on the creek. get the Ship to have a nice dinner on the creek for a nice slow tour around the creak, we had fun , and dancers on top of the ship with music played, no one must miss this ship to do as an activity

Must go place!. This is a culture and historical place. Old and refurbished building all around. Cool and breezy to stroll along the creek. Sit by a cafe for an arabic coffee. Take a boat ride or water taxi around the creek before sunset, afternoon can be pretty hot! Tried out local restaurant for dinner then call it a day!!

Charm of Old Dubai!. It is a nice experience to hangout munching snacks from the long queue of eateries spread along the creekside. You can see a lot of dhow cruises around which is a main attraction at this place.

Dont forget the old. This is a great place to go. Just walking by the river, especially where the old boats load cargo set for sailing to the likes of Pakistan.It is a very atmospheric area, especially near the Spice Market

Best hangout place.. Traditional boats and water covered with bright lights, best shopping location for whole family..
It's like a seaside market , awesome feeling when you visit there. You can cross the creek in trading boats and reach other side.
Other side of creek looks equally beautiful.

Soothing discovery of Dubai's history. The Creek in Dubai is a great place a pleasant evening stroll. Take the Metro to Al Ghubaiba station ... and walk to the creek side. Then stroll along until you reach the Old Souk ... and on to the old trading areas ... exiting to Meena Bazaar (where all Indian shops are situated). Very historic and has the rustic charm of old times.

Very affordable and a short ride to experience Dubai Creek.. One of the highlights of my trip in Dubai is the water taxi around Dubai Creek. From the Old Souk to the Spice Souk. Very affordable and enjoyable. Most tourists like me just ride it just for the experience and for the shopping. It's a very short ride across the creek. I enjoyed the breeze along the way.

Typical dredged water way. The creek is reasonably shallow, but accepts Iranian and Indian trading vessels near the mouth of the creek.During the day it is criss-crossed by Abra (water taxis) and by night by party boats. Nothing special but a lot cleaner than Asian or African comparissons
John. Stayed at Sheraton which overlooks the creek. Just a great and vibrant part of the city that is not sterile concrete jungle. Loved the hustle and bustle of the gold markets

Relaxing. Don't pay in advance, just walk around the pier and people will approach you, you can bargain with them if its not busy. We didi :)..We went at night for 30 minutes ride. It was relaxing and beautiful.

The lifeblood of Dubai. The Creek is to Dubai what the Thames is to London - it's the main artery - the lifeblood of the city, and the reason that the city exists. It's how Dubai became a hub for trading, so it's something that you have to see when you go to Dubai.We hopped on a dhow for 3 dirham ($1CAD) and enjoyed sailing down the creak and looking at all the places along the docks and sea wall. Lots of old wooden boats moored along the docks make for a great photo, and it almost looks a bit like venice in some areas. You'll have to cross from one side to the other at some point, so rather than using the subway, get on the water!
Boat ride. We took the boat ride across, there's some lovely souks to walk through on the other side but store owners can be a bit pushy, the boat ride is lovely and only cost 4 aed with a nol card
Nice view . It had nice view from my hotel also a good walk by side. It was calm with many restaurants on the boats. The ships and boats view is amazing. It looks great in day and night
Overnight stay. Stayed overnight at the Raddisson Blu Hotel, enjoyed an evening walk along the 'creek' and what we saw of the area. We left early next day to embark a 7 day cruise.
Nice. I love the place. Very good for romantic dinner or family outing. Simply amazing. Good food, good service but no alcohol.

Worth a wander to see the timber trading ships that still sail the gulf.. We stayed at the Sheraton on the Creek so we had easy access to meander along the open docks and see some "real life" away from the glitz and glamour of modern Dubai. Just get a cab to the Sheraton and see some interesting waterfront life.

Dubai Creek- a Must for EVERY Tourist!. I highly recommend taking a deira (boat) ride across the Dubai Creek to get to the souks. Tell your taxi driver to drop you off at bur dubai at the creek. And then hop onto a boat (that only costs ONE AED to get across the creek. In the later afternoon/early evening it is so beautiful to see the sun set and the lights come on. You have old dubai on one side and new dubai on the other. It is a peaceful boat ride that feels so authentic because it is clear that this is a major way to commute. So not only do you get to take the "scenic" route by taking a deira boat ride across the creek, but it is significantly cheaper and you avoid traffic when going to the souks :)
Take the abra. Go local and take the local boat across the creek. 1 dhr. Visit local market before boarding. A short walk down harbor before entering the world of souks.
One of the Best Club you should never miss. one of the club you should never miss when you are in dubai. and this guy (lorens) is very accomodating and friendly ✌️✌✌

Beautiful. Beautiful to walk around all the way , you will see the fish market , the gold souk , the old souk , the museum along the way , and plenty of restaurants , also able to cross it on a boat and see the old side of Dubai , charming and lovely .....
Old Dubai. Nice part of old Dubai where you can take a 1AED water taxi to get across between Diera and Meena Bazaar
dinner cruise. The cruise around the Creek was great with plenty to see the buffet was enormous with plenty to eat and drink

Wonderful, authentic area ~ true Dubai. Buzzing, magical, colourful sights and sounds that must be experienced ~ this is the true Dubai. Here you will find the Gold, Textile and Spice Souks ~ be aware that you will be pestered but in a good natured way. The buzz word here is BARTER its expected and great fun.

Amazing Experience. We went for Dhow safari in night. It was around 2 hours journey in the creek. The boat moves slowly. The package included Dance show (I forgot the name of dance) & Buffet dinner. The dance was excellent. It was a really nice experience about Boat journey with dance & other entertainments. The back ground is Dubai city in night. You can experience the Dubai from Creek in Night.

Good to visit in winters. Good place to visit in winters...in the summers, the heat would make you uncomfortable...the cruises come with packaged dinner...but are quiet costly...even a walk along the promenade is very refreshing and relaxing...

Lovely part of Dubai. Lovely to see the Dhow's and the Cargos getting ready for shipping! It is definitely worth a visit and perhaps one day will have the chance to go back and visit the old part of Dubai.

You don't need a paddle to go up this Creek.. As part of the Big Bus ticket, take the Dubai Creek dhow cruise to appreciate this bustling side of Dubai as it makes its way along the old port of Dubai. Quayside has many bars and restaurants. Cross it with the watertaxi ( 20p ) and ensure you hold on tight.
Used to be GREAT!!!. Used to be a great place untill they started construction ther. This is Dubai, old school, untouched, near and charming.

beautiful, relaxing & great food. enjoy a fantastic buffet or set menu, then sit back and experience the most relaxing cruise on the river. This is a 2hr experience giving awesome photo opportunities throughout. Tables, booths & sofas to get cozy on with the warm 30degree breeze to take any stress away. Passed by others lighting the way with their decorated boats - reminded me of chines lanterns floating out to sea

Dolphin show. Nice arrangements there. Take tickets from there easygoing way. Its little cosly then other (compare to safari world bangkok ) if you are visiting bangkok to no needs to west money here. Otherwise to see worth . Taxi facilities are also got easy from main gate of creek park. Bargain also done in that. Private car also you got. After ride if you got any problems according to fair. Don't worry just say call police. . He don't argue any more on his committed fair. Friday it's not preferred for go. In morning time. One day close so check online before visit and got any deal book tickets. .

Oasis of Character. Most of Dubai is a glittering parade of luxury, modernity and air-conditioned malls, but the creek and the surrounding souks are a fascinating glimpse into Dubai's exotic past. Easy access on the metro, an amble through the spice market or a boat ride across the creek will be a better memory than duty-free shops and hotel swimming pools.
The views are ok. The views along the creek are ok. The food on cruises are not the greatest but it is still a good time. A 2 hr cruise is more tha enough time to take it all in.

A place to relax and to enjoy. Have you ever seen a bus driving in the water, no, in this case you have to go there, it's so funny. The water taxi looks like a bus, really. Nevertheless the place provides you more insights about the former living style and housing of the emirati people in the past. A place where children lern something and the parents can relax having a coffee or tee as well.
Nice for Dinner. Dinner cruise very nice with belly dancers show. Timing also excellent as you return to hotel ready to sleep
Very unexpected gem. The district is not packed with tourists but it is worth the detour. It is full of smaller markets and smaller shops that give you a great feel of Indian and Pakistan.

Great Place to sightsee. Spent some nice moments down by the creek and would have gone on one of the evening tours but was busy. Went across the creek on the wooden boats cost 1 DH great value. There are a few nice restaurants also down by the creek and iris cool at night.

A trip back in time . Loved seeing the creek both in daylight and after dark. My favourite time was at night when it's lit was lanterns and it looks magical. This is old Dubai as it must have been before the skyscrapers and tourists. Go take a look and see something magical.
A romantic place in Dubai. Take your partner and relax on a boat trip on Dubai Creek! I am sure you will be enjoying an romantic dinner!

Great evening walk and cuisine. Definitely worth a visit, try out the many types of cuisine for evening dining with a view, if going boating, don't choose the first seller, barter and get price from the many on offer.
Better than my expection. The creek is wider and the water is clearer than what I had expected. We took a boat to the souks with the fare of 1 AED per person, quite cheap!

A remarkable waterway. If you have the time, a visit to the Dubai Creek will be one of the activities you will surely find memorable. You can take a stroll along its banks at the same time enjoying the heritage sites of Al Bastakiya and the Al Shindaga areas, or walking from one site to the other along the river bank. You can also visit the old markets and take a break by having a meal at any of the fancy and snazzy riverside restaurants that serve delectable meals -- that serve Lebanese, seafood, Mediterranean or Asian fusion. And finally your trip's climax will be taking a trip from one end of the bank to the other via a motorized ferry or better yet, hire one (for 120 AED) and take an hour's tour of the creek from one end to the other. Whatever you decide, make sure that this site you set your eyes on.
Magic of Dubai. Dubai creek is unique and has a magic all of its own Accessible for most shopping areas via the Metro and even walking distance to the Souk

Best value in Dubai. 20p will take you down and across the Creek at Dubai. Fascinating journey seeing the old Dhow's loaded with goods. Once on the other side of the creek the goods are just stacked on the dock before being ferried direct to the shops.Far more interesting than the souk's (although they are just a few minutes walk down the road if you want to see them) and no constant pestering to buy stuff.

Don'd miss out.. A visit to the souks for some bargaining is great. Everyone wants you to go into their shop and look. So you have to be selective or you would be there for hours. Then a boat trip across the creek to the gold and spice souks is a must and costs 1 dirham which is about 20p.
Boat ride. It is an experience to take a boat ride up and down the Creek, or even just a quick taxi ride across. It gives you a feeling of old times, as barges and boats are really old.

Fantastic walk near old dubai . After a walk in the heritage area it was really refreshing to walk around the Creek. You can choose to walk or take a water taxi to cross. There are also small boars who offer one hour long trips up and down the Creek. After some negotiation we went for 100 dirhams for two and we were alone. Up the Creek you can also visit the museum where you can learn some about the history of dubai. It features a nice collection of coins and information on pearl diving and culture. Az least a walk is definitely recommended. Close is the souk too with a number of cute restaurants.
unique local experience. take one of the dows (boats) either to cross the creek or simply wander around and look at all the loading and unloading - nice atmosphere

Amazing culture and traders. Take a walk back in time. As you wander the stalls you will be hammered by salespeople. Whilst it can become overwhelming, treat it with grace and a smile and it will be very fun
Water Taxi Ride. This was an amazing experience. The scenery was awesome and arriving at the Spice Markets and Souks was a really great experience.
Beautiful. What to say.... sunset was beautiful....very peaceful.... Cool breeze........ surrounded by lightining with cool environment........it was too good
Dubai Creek is different experience. If you want to experience old Dubai then Dubai Creek is a must. It is completely opposite to what you see at Dubai Marina which is the new glittering Dubai.

Do a 1 hour trip for 50 Dirhams - English commentary and a great education. Excellent value trip along the creek from The Hilton Dubai creek to the heritage village and back. Learn about the buildings along the water front and the origins and development of modern day Dubai. Also keeps one out of the blistering sun and heat!!

Best location. Situated between the old area of Dierra and modern Dubai, the creek with its activities and adjacent souks is the most interesting part of Dubai, particularly if you stay at the Sheraton Creek Hotel which is the only one with direct creek access.
Water bus. It costs 1dirham , about 20 pence Stirling. you just sit on the open boat with everyone else and are chugged across the Creek. Takes a few minutes but lovely

Arabian Nights . We took an evening trip with Arabian Nights as recommended by our Hotel. The trip was excellent and lasted over two hours. This was a relaxing part of our stay in Dubai. The service on the boat was good and if the food was a bit basic there was plenty. The waiters pointed out places of interest throughout the trip and were well informed. The cost of this trip was well below other options and thus was excellent value

See Old Dubai and Shop for Bargains. Beautiful area to see some of Old Dubai and get some great deals. Lots of markets for anything you want especially spices, textiles and gold. Traversing the Creek on the water taxis is cheap and fun.

Old Dubai. Well worth a visit if you want to explore a little of what Dubai used to be like in the recent past before all the high rise development and shopping malls. It also offer a little more peaceful experience than newer 'frantic' Dubai. Take an Abbra across the creek for a dirham too.
Water Taxi to the Souk. What a great way to beat the traffic and get a nice breeze on the way to finding some of Dubai's wonderful treasures.
Creek side. Really pleasant evening out . Nice view's and plenty of places to eat . Loved cruising the creek and just chilling out with a nice cold milkshake. Excellent would definitely recommend.
Beautiful and Historical. A nice place to go, during the evening or during the day. You can take an abra across the creek for 1 Dhr!

Scenic beuty. Make it a point to take any of the hotels near creek or do visit creek park. The park is very good for kids and creek view is excellent. Its mind refreshing to be in creek and spent an evening there
Day out sight seeing. What a fantastic day something for everybody the old and the new, culture, tradition, fantastic views and good cafes etc.
Holiday . A place you must visit while you are in Dubai . A stroll by the creek at night gives a great vista of the Dubai skyline.Lots of restaurants and hotel bars with entertainment on offer.

Interesting place. The creek area is like an old Dubai interesting buildings and sooks to get your gifts. It's like going back in time and easy to get too on the metro,a ride down the creek in a boat is a must

A must for tourists!. You must visit the Dubai creek! A great history lesson to the old Dubai. Fares are ridiculously cheap - 1 dhiram per ride. A great way to get too and from the souks! Enjoy the water ride of a history book.

Post Lunch Visit with Spouse. We visited Dubai Creek as we had gone to see Dubai Cultural evening at Heritage Village. We tried one of their restaurant for post lunch snacks and found the place average as most the restaurants serving Arabic cuisine only. Also, very few varieties of food for Vegetarians.

Great Place for chill out. Normally we go to creek for two reason. First to visit the only Hindu temple situated at the bank of creek. Once done then you can walk over the creek area which is always crowded during evening. The dhow cruise starts from this place only normally ends after cruising on creek for 2 hours. Not to miss this opportunity while visiting Dubai. Now similar cruise is also available at Dubai Marina as well.

Romantic Night Cruise. The view was nice and the crew were very helpful and accomodating. The only problem was the food. I don't know what type of cuisine they were serving but it was for me kinda exotic. But overall the experinec was good. The boat name is Deep sea adventure. I think there were better ships out there.
Nice. Very calm and atmospheric. Loved sitting and watching the boats go by. Especially lovely at dusk. Recommended
nice break in the tour.. This is nothing special but it was a nice break in our tour over to the souk. We saw some beautiful boats on the water.

Natural Dubai. Good experience in comparison to the development that is most of Dubai. Gives one a feel of life on a day to day basis. Older part of city, Deira. Wonderful feeling with the water and abra's, which is a widely utilized mode of transportation between old and new Dubai by the local population also - not just a merely tourist activity, which makes it great to immerse oneself in real life for a bit. Metro is available on both sides.
Nice views!. With your hop on, hop off bus tour ticket you have a cruise along the Dubai Creek automatically included. It's a great way to see the city, old and new.

A boat tour is a must. to cross the Creek which divides the old Dubai. 1 dirham per person to enjoy the very active life on the water and meet small fishing boats as well as large commercial wooden ships.
Good for walking, many shops. This area is good for walking and seeing all the different shipping boats. There are many small parks along the way, and there are many shops too.

A different side of Dubai - great place to visit!. The Dubai Creek is part of the older areas of Dubai from which the modern sparkling city of today developed and spread.The creek is a salt water creek with a direct link to the Arabian Gulf and has been a central part of Dubai for hundreds of years.Today, the creek holds a variety of things to see for visitors and tourists.There are lots of restaurants around the shores and docks. Simple, wooden boats ferry passengers over the creek between the two sides Bur Dubai and Deira. This short trip alone is worth going there.On the eastern side, you will find a whole collection of so-called "Gold Souqs", essentially extensive markets for jewelry, trinkets, memorabilia and also loads of more-or-less hidden fake brand selling lounges for watches, handbags etc. mostly located in side alleys.The docks are filled with wooden Dhows and other rather "low-tech" transport vessels, representing a somewhat more organic and less glistening Dubai experience. Really something to see...There is also am amphibian bus, crossing the creek as a passenger service - also an experience in itself.If you are in Dubai - do visit and get to see a different side of the Emirate!

Oh the Abras at Dubai Creek. was originally intending on going to the Souk but ended up travelling back and forth over the creek on the Abras or wooden boats. The crossing only cost 1 dirham and is great. Think in my enthusiasm I may have started freaking out the drivers. Never saw much of the Souks, but really enjoyed myself

There are few places I consider magical .... This is one of them !. There are a few places I call magical ... One is Glastonbury 20 years ago ... The other is the creek .. I Love being here first thing in the morning and watch the place wake up , the smell of Diesel engines of the water taxi and the Beautiful old Dowes , the mix of people from all corners of the world , the traders bartering and the smell of spices , I Love hearing the call to prayer especially in the early evening and seeing the Creek get its second wind at night when the amazing restaurants get busy and the lights start to twinkle it's a beautiful wonderful place
Boat ride. Safe, friendly boatsmen. relaxing ride across the creek to Old Dubai for souk shopping. Delightful experience.
Nice place . We stayed in hotel gateway so it was just 10 minutes walk from our hotel. From creek we have water transport ride also for gold suk and spices market for paying 1 dhiram per person only

Good for tourists as well as residents. The creek is a nice place to be at if you're traveling to see different parts of Dubai. Either sitting at an outdoor restaurant with view on the boats or on a boat itself is a nice experience I can recommend for people looking to have a good time

Lovely to see. It was good to see the Creek and imagine how Dubai must have been before the place took off. We were there in the daytime and I would imagine that in the evening with all the lights on it would be magical

OK evening activity. I thought this boat ride was ok. I would recommend sitting inside the boat as the upper level can get very hot/humid. Entertainment, food and scenery were ok. I don't think it was really worth the price for the experience I was anticipating. Nonetheless since it was my first time to Dubai it seemed like one of the must-do items.

It's Dubai, but not as we know it!. Sailing from the Old Souq (probably about 5 years old!) across to the Gold Souq, there is a real timeless feel. Traditional dhows loaded with all sorts of random goods (I saw one full of toilet rolls...) rub shoulders with modern superyachts to give the place a real odd flavour. It's refreshingly different from the concrete and steel of the Burj Khalifa, bringing you to tight, bustling old city streets where trading (and especially haggling) is intense and highly entertaining. Don't go to Dubai without seeing Dubai Creek!

Great views of the city from the water. A must do in Dubai....ride across the creek and back on a wooden boat. Beautiful views of the city from the water. You can even take a lunch or dinner cruise on the creek.

Dubai's life at the creek side - An experience. I headed to Dubai creek to admire the creek side life .By walking along Bastakia Quarter gives me a feel of ancient neighborhood with shops and busy life around its has old buildings , streets , mosques and remains as a historical neighborhood of Dubai preserving it's Heritage. The creek once was a port for flourishing trading point for centuries ago in Dubai History. There dhows keep operating frequently commuting passenger to the other side if the creek to Deira Dubai , Gold & Spice Souk.The Creek can be best enjoyed at the evening hours when the shops ,restaurants and the lights of the building reflects on the water. I took a dhow to Gold Souk for 1 Dhiram. The boat ride lasted only for few mins and I walked along the creek to stroll down and enjoy the fascinating views of Dubai Creek at night. There are lots of piers along the creek and you can hop on and off the dhow to reach other destinations nearby. This is a must visit place to hangout after having a tiring day out in Dubai visiting Malls and other attractions. We can see a contrasting lifestyle of Dubai in Creek with modernity buildings and malls.The saltwater Creek is a main Point of attraction to be visited in Dubai itinerary...

Not a great deal to see. It's an interesting trip to a point. Initially, as you leave the mooring, you see the dhow's loaded up with all imaginable goods. You also see some of the more 'established' hotels and an array of neon lighting up the skyline. If you are short on time give it a miss.

Business with Pleasure!!. The dinner cruise we had on the Dubai Creek was one of a kind...a cruise boat with good music and great company shunting across the creek.I was awe struck by the beautiful and scenic backdrop of well lit buildings scraping the sky and the stars and dubai marina lights glistening onto the water in the creek...No words can express the satisfactionI had on the creek that evening....Just amazing...better at night!!

Top Attraction in Dubai. My wife and I came here after visiting the Palm area. The area was amazing and we decided to take a one hour boat ride. The boat ride is the best way to see the area, which is massive with 200 sky scrapers, sky diving, jet skis, luxury yachts, and anything else you could think of. There is a massive beach as well.

awesome view must see!!. I had a awesome dinner with my husband by the dubai creek. Very romantic. A man goes by with roses. Abd my husband bought me one. Is such a relaxing beautiful view. Everyone is so kind and respectful to everyone.

Lovely part of Dubai. If you are in the area, you need to take a water ferry from the one side of the creek to the other. Costs you 1 dirham -who said dubai is expensive. There is also a quaint little restaurant where you can get a light meal.
wonderful view. Its a great place for nightly walks. The lights at night is fascinatiing and at this time of year very cool

Dubai creek. the creeck was seen from the hotel room with big boats on it , we alsao crosses it while going to bUr dubai , In India we feel it Like rivers but here it is called as creeck as its part of sea not the river, underground roads are also made below creck
feeling the history. The creek is a walk to the history of the real City of Dubai, traditional shops, transportation, food are found around the creek
Must see!. Feels like a different world, the "real" arabian world if you will. This is a must visit while in Dubai. Especially the souks.

Nice scenery. This place in Dubai is a perfect place to have a bit of relaxation. You can find lots of Abra( small boat rides for only 1 AED to cross from station to station ) which are full of tourists with some other people strolling around this scenic area. In this area, you can still see the tallest building, Burj Khalifa and you can also find here some of the oldest places in Dubai especially the Heritage Village which you can find at the sea-side part of the creek. There are also cafeterias and restaurants nearby but the best ones that you will find would be sailing at the creek, the Dhow Cruises ( large boats with restaurants offering different kinds of buffets/styles ), they usually sail at night for a wonderful dinner around the creek.
Old Arab can see here. close to this creek area, there are lot of shops and places that still resembling the old Arab, not the new shopping malls, so its good place..

Great view. Very good place. Peaceful and adventurous. With all the small local shops and the gold cave its a typical dubai gold market. What more you can expect. All the spices. Local dresses. Its basically a old dubai renovated traditional market. A cheap boat ride is the key for crossing the river. Overall its a very good experience

Sailing along History. Fantastic fun filled step back in time on the Dhows and with the traders of Dubai. Cross crossing the creek, stopping in Bastikiya district for coffee and teas. Then into the textile souk for some fun bartering . A must to be done and for those who fancy and swift sundowner, pop into the Sheraton Creekside which we loved and reviewed before.

Cruising down the creek. Went on the Dhow cruise Mariana and got a breath taking view of the panoramic skyline of 'New Dubai'. A perfect leisurely way to enjoy the magnificent skyline of the Dubai marina, Jumeirah Beach residence, The stunning architectural design of the International 5 star hotels with their private beaches, The famous 7star Burj Arab, and world renowned Palm Jumeirah with the mystical Atlantis Hotel are also dotted along our cruising route.
A relaxing Dinner Cruise at Dubai creek. If you want to see Old Dubai, the best way to do it is through a a Dhow dinner cruise. Enjoyed traversing the creek as we ate our sumptuous dinner
Nice view. Nice view, good food, dance performance was very very good. It was bit cold we did not expect, nice long journey.
Awsome places of old Dubai Creek either by day or night. Traveling to Dubai, another places that must not miss were old Dubai creek, a must visit to know learn more about olden age of Dubai

An interesting walk along the creekside.. If you walk along the creekside during the day be sure to take water with you. Lots to see, Bastika Area (now has craft stores and cafe), Fabric Souk, cross the creek in an abra to the Spice Souk on the other side.

A peek into the past. We cruised along the Dubai creek when we went on the Al Mansoor show cruise. It was very pretty and gave us a bit of a glimpse into some of the old Dubai. The smaller water taxis were zooming up and down and across the creek and although we didn't use them, were told that they were a very inexpensive way of getting around.

Favorite destination in Dubai. Lovely and atmospheric location, probably my favorite destination in Dubai. The creekside restaurants and the covered bazaar have a unique flavor unseen in the rest of this glittering city. Watching the sunset by the water here while hearing the prayer call is truly wonderful. I sincerely hope this area remains unaltered even as the rest of the city grows and changes.

Great place to walk around and have dinner in one of the small restaurants. It was very nice to walk around between the small shops, bars and restaurants. There is a totally different atmosphere than e.g. Marina bay. The restaurants are rather cheap in this area.

Great experience. Go on a water taxi!!. We absolutely loved visiting Dubai Creek. You get a real feel for old Dubai and the beautiful architecture around. I would definitely recommend getting a water taxi to get around it is a great experience and cheap!

A must do for first time travellers. This is certainly a MUST DO if you are in Dubai for the first time. There are various options of getting around or on the Creek. My personal favourite is taking the AED1 Abbrah (water taxi0 from one side to the other. You can park on the one side and Abbrah it along the creek, go to the various souks.Having done this many times now, I would think though that something can be done around to jazz it up again. It might just be getting a bit old and tired.

It was fantastic. The creek was fantastic. Seems like a real river. They allow tourists to have a long trip on ship. They call it dhau cruise. They entertain the tourists on the open boat along with lovely dinner.

Across the Creek. Old-fashioned boats called "dhows" criss-cross the water from Bur Dubai on the left bank to Deira on the right. We went on one of these boats on our half day tour of Dubai. It took us to the Gold and Spice Sooks. Very nice

Sweep me away. I took a 1 hour boat cruise, up and down Dubai Creek. It cost 120 Dirhams, but it was worth every cent. It was just the driver and myself. So relaxing, people waving, you get to see the cargo boats come and go, other small boats, the luxury cruiser, the buildings, and the locals. What a gorgeous hour!

Dubai creek - must see. It was fun riding the local water taxi called abra to cross Dubai creek- best way to see old and new Dubai . Must see/do in Dubai !
Helpful tip: have exact change which is one dinaar to pay for abra.

Free boat trip with "big bus open top sightseeing bus". As a freebie with the open top bus ticket its worth doing the Dubai creek boat trip to get a different and more relaxed view. Also worth doing the marina cruise which is free with the big bus ticket as well.
ugly and dirty. we took a boat from east to west to pass the creek. it was dirty and buildings around so ugly. i will not try it again.
