Nice change from rest of Dubai. This is a great place to come to see an alternative side to the modern Dubai. We started at the Gold Souk and then walked through the creek. The Souk is interesting but not for my shopping tastes. There is a lot of pushy salesmen that you need to get used to and handle calmly. A lot of them will sidle up to you and offer you a copy watch or bag.At the creek then we caught the boat across. At 1 AED it has to be the bargain of Dubai. Its a pleasant trip across and well worth it. On the other side we went to the Silk area. Like elsewhere haggle hard.

Worth a visit. The Dubai Creek is in the Deira district of Dubai. It offers a unique outlook on Dubai's origins and provides an insight into the transition from old Dubai to a new metropolis which is now transformed. I recommend you ride on the Abra to get a feel of the creek and see another side to the creek area.

Brilliant fun and cheap too!. The taxi driver told us about going across the creek to Old DubaiIt was only 1 Duram and took about 15 minutes but was so evocativeThe souk was very old school too very enjoyable

See how the river is still part of everyday life. This is a must, The river is forever active and busy. There are many points I\of interest Such a the Old Souk or the Gold Souk. Plenty of Shopping can easily be found in local shops not the big expensive ones. Look for the little local boats where you can travel up and down to the best moorings for the huge fare of 1 Dirham (20p) , Just enjoy and take in the local atmosphere.
Pleasant ride. Very cheap, nice and pleasant ride in the evening. Get down on the old dubai side and go around in the market.

Dubai Creek. Located at older side of Dubai, with museums and sight seeing around. Experience of an Abra is a must to go to gold souk and spice souk. Spending time with family is recommended as there are many souks around for shopping.
Nice water trip.. Nice to have a meal on the creek, see the night sites. Several boat trips available all of similar cost. Food onboard was very good.

dhow cruise. it was a good way of relaxing, so much to eat and drink.
the show was fun, good music, good crew and host, the cruise was very smooth

Good experience . Great to see a little of the 'old' Dubai. Parking can be challenging though and it's busier in the mornings (Sunday to Thursday) and evenings (everyday) as its effectively closed during afternoon. The abras crossing the river are really authentic and cheap at 1aed per person per trip. Can feel pressurised at times with lots of 'come into my shop' but everyone is very polite and take refusals well. If you do decide to purchase something, haggle hard but take it in good fun and be prepared to walk away. Some nice street food available.
Best place to hang out. I visit every few days and its best best place to have a leisure time.Abra ia a must ti try and local souq must visit

Great way to view old Dubai and experience the creek. We decided to stay at the Sheraton by the Dubai Creek so we could experience the real Dubai by traveling the creek as much as possible during out 2 day visit. Loved the view from the hotel windows and at night the colorful boats and Dows were really interesting. We took the Dow to visit the Museum and then ate by the water before coming back along the water to the hotel. We also visited the gold and spice souk the same way. Much better than getting in a taxi! The breeze was beautiful and seeing the skyline from the water very authentic. Cost was cheap, there are people on hand to guide you to the right stops and it was safe. Very happy to spend the time on a boat watching them all pass by. We didn't feel the need to book a dinner cruise. Try it out!

A reminder of the old dubai. Visited the creek and was amazed. Gives you a taste of the original way of living in the UAE a number of souks selling gold clothes and aftershave. Always a bargin to be had

A real contrast to the high-rise skyline.. A small part of Dubai that has retained much of it's old character - colourful, rustic stalls selling all sorts of souvenirs and domestic items add to the charm. We took the 1 dirham boat trip across The Creek to the Gold Souk - quite an experience in itself to chug across the bustling waterway and a good opportunity to take photographs from the water. The Creek is easily accessible via The Metro, so if you visit on the day you arrive you can claim to have travelled on train and boat and plane ! An essential sightseeing destination whilst in Dubai.

Looks so peaceful. It's one of those rare rainy Dubai days. I should be relaxing by the pool of the Intercontinental but intermittent brief showers have put paid to that. Instead I'm looking out of the window from the 18th floor and the Creek has a magical aura to it. All of Dubai's mania drifts away as you stare down the estuary that is The Creek. Beautiful. Peaceful. Calm. There are walks you can take around Dubai Festival City adjacent to the Creek. I reckon that's as close to solace as you might find anywhere in Dubai. See the picture, it really is a great view and the world seems to have slowed down looking into it.

Nice Abra ride cruising along the renowned Dubai Creek. We have been here for 11 years and this is one of the must do list for our visitors. Not only that we love reminiscing over and over again. Embarked from the old Dubai, Deira on an Abra, we enjoyed the breeze over our little ride, it took us to the other side, Bur Dubai station. Had a little walk through the old souq in a fine afternoon.

Favourite place in Dubai. Have lived in Dubai over a decade and this remains the best place to visit, in my opinion. The perfect counterbalance to the glitz and glamour of modern Dubai, It' somewhere you can still feel the history of the place, and appreciate its trading origins. A dirham will take you on a five /ten minute abra journey - a gem of an experience - travelling along the Creek in an old traditional boat, taking in the views alongside. Very peaceful. You can still see the traditional dhows loading up with everything from cars to washing machines to sunflower oil - heading off to war zones the world over. Anywhere else in the world, the goods would be stolen, but here they remain on the quayside, alongside the working boats with the crew who live on them... Lots of lovely walks, souqs and restaurants to explore - clothes, spices and household goods all readily available and if you head beyond the tourist hangouts, a little further back you can get some mega bargains in the backstreets. Enjoy it while it remains rustic - lots of development taking place on the British Embassy side - building restaurants which will no doubt be lovely, but can't compete with the natural assets of the Creek.

Great to see the real Dubai. We were in Dubai to play in the 7's so mostly saw the new buildings and therefore it was great to go down to the Creek to see what Dubai used to be like with all the boats, small lanes and stores. A little trip in a boat down the Creek is a great experience!

if you want to see the real Dubai!. Spent a morning here - taxi from our hotel. Visited the Dubai museum - a must if you want to know the history of Dubai. Crossed the creek on a water taxi only dhiram - probably the cheapest thing in Dubai. Caught the metro, tram and monorail back to our hotel - try it, great fun.

Good view. Good place to walk
Good sitting arrangement
Garden well maintained
Good place to do yoga and other exercise
Good place to have DSF
Good place to have boat ride
Nice place to have fresh air
Dubai Creek. It is good if you want to love to take a ride in Dhow cruise, but i didn't recommend it, ya but it is good

A must see experience. Dubai has many things to offer. Beaches, shopping, entertainment, food and luxury. All these things would be on top of your list I would guess. What about authentic, traditional and historic? Not words you may have picked but you would if you visit the creek. The museum, the Gold, spice and material sooks and the fun with bartering is not to be missed. We spent a whole day there today and we only scratched the surface. Great fun, street food and good bargains. Not to be missed

Avoid this, instead Dubai Marina would have been better. Disappointed with the Dhow cruise, AL Shateer boat cruise was very disappointing, last ship on the stretch and also started 45 minutes late. Nothing much to experience.

Relaxing!. After a hectic day of souvenir shopping in the Gold Souk, we enjoyed a very nice lunch sitting outside along Dubai Creek. It is a really cool place to sit and relax and look at the amazing skyscrapers of Dubai.

Bustling, historical place. When in Dubai- you need to take a Dhow boat ride and see the city from the water view. It's also how you get over the creek to the Souks. A magical, bustling experience. Commerce in action!

very pretty at night. We took a boat across this creek at night to visit the gold and spice souk. Very beautiful at night, the air is warm in April. Remember to dress modestly walking around. Americans are welcomed and it is very safe here.
Had a dhow tour. I must say this is nothing special but it's a nice way to have an overall view of the scenery on both sides of the creek.
Great place to explore. We stayed on the Creek as we reall wanted to see Old Dubai, and we weren't disappointed . The whole area is on the go with boots going across to the Souks and River cruises.
Floating restaurants. Enjoy an evening out at the dubai Creek and enjoy dinner from one of the many floating restaurants as you get a tour around the Creek
Abra. For only1AED , you will experience and you will see the beautiful Dubai creek by riding an "Abra" (a motor-operated boat).

A day in the Old Town. We were lucky to,choose an overcast day for a visit to the Old Town. A great time at the Souks, wonderful for souvenirs but make sure to barter. Found a very nice restaurant overhanging the water just where the boats pull in and had a really good mezze for lunch, a welcome rest from all the walking.

A nice place to relax. Even though the review says Visit time in May 2015, we visited twice more - April and fwb also. And this is a really nice place to relax. There is a good place to walk. Some small restaurants and a nice sitting area. As long as the temperature is on the right side, this place is very good. Good to spend Afternoons, evenings or nights. one of the most relaxing place in Dubai. I have been here at creek quite a few times. I really love this place for relaxing and some stress relieve. As there is a canal you can sit here and have some good and cold breeze. You can even come here daily to walk and also to simply sit here... place is very neat and there are good choices to sit and eat delicious foods..
Great Old Dubai. Nice walk from the old part of the centre starting at the Dubai museum. We walked to the Dubai Creek via the Soux. Watertaxis are available and convenient.

Dubai creek cruise. The booking was done in the morning and the cruise was in the evening. Entertainment on board was good - mesmerising watching the entertainer constantly spinning! Buffet on board which was average. I was going to go for dessert but then saw someone hovering over the desserts coughing without covering their mouth - avoided the desserts which looked yum

Good place for Dhow Cruise. Dubai Creek is a place from where you can go for Dhow cruise. Now this is located at a place where lot of loading unload of goods takes place. The people nearby working there are like really cheap, they stare at females as if they have never seen them. The place minus the people working there is good.Make sure you reach the place at such a time that you just hop on the the dhow, you need not to wait around just. By this you can avoid those people.Dhow is another superb romantic experience you can have the view of Dubai on Dhow while enjoy snacks with drinks. Dhow cruise takes almost an hour for one trip.

nice way to spend an afternoon away from malls. went there as a part of a walking trip around the dubai museum and nearby areas.did not go on any boat ride but did sit on the creekside and people watched .also had lunch at one of the restaurants there.. quite windy ..so u may want to dress appropriately. very close/walkable from dubai museum,you just have to walk through a narrow lane near the wholesale dryfruit shops...i enjoyed looking at all the boats plying with the travellers..

The other side of Dubai. As a frequent traveller to Dubai it was nice to take time out to see the old Dubai. It is a great place to spend the day. You can see Dubai museum, go across the Creek on a boat and haggle in the souks.There is a great little restaurant in the souk next to the waters edge (not the cafe- also good but more of a cafe) where you can get traditional arabic food. A great place to spend a day.

Really nice experience. Fantastic boat ride just for 1 dhiram. This is infact the only in-expensive excursion found in Dubai :) Boats are traditional old type but that was exactly what there is to experience. Loads of seagels will fly along with the boat if you throw them some food. It was a unique experience.  There were restaurants nearby where they had a fantastic view.
Real Dubai. Lovely place to get away from Malls and Enormous buildins. Real old world Dubai. Nice restaurants,coffee shops,beautiful waterside views
A must visit place. Excellent place to visit solo or in a group. There you can enjoy high quality food and drink in addition to excellent tours.

Most enjoyable. We used the Abra to cross the creek from one side to the other only cost 1 AED. Very cheap! we also hired our own for 30 AED per person and took a tour, approximately 1 hour. Amazing view from the water of the modern parts of the city and the old.After wards we asked the driver to let us off in the old section across from where we started from so we can tour the markets and have dinner waterside.Highly recommend hiring your own, lots of fun.

Nice enough. We did not take a dinner cruise as it was too early in the day.We took a small boat ride the length of the creek, this took one hour. It is handy for orientation in the area of the gold souk and the spice souk, also the Dubai museum.There is not a lot to the creek, but as I said, handy for orientation.We paid £15 per person and it was reasonable value.
Bit boring. Had to wait for the boat to arrive about 45 mins - bit disappointing, as I found it a bit boring. No commentary so unsure as to the history and story of the creek.
very good. the creek cruise was very good with good food and the entertainment was excellant lovely views the rates are also cheap

Cheapest fun in Dubai - Nightime is the best. For 1AED you can cross the creek on an Abra and admire the skyline.Night time is even better - with many of the creek side buildings lit up and the gaudily lit dhow cruises to look out for.We often took the Abra back and forth in the evening from Bur Dubai to Diera - just for the fun of it.

A walk to remember. The Dubai Creek is a "do not miss" for all travellers. The Creek and the surrounding "Old City" gives one an excellent opportunity for photography buffs to capture some memorable images. In the old days before oil, the Creek served as a major trading place in the region. Dhows and ships from all over the region brought in goods for trade. To this day you can see them still doing business along the Creek.The opposite sides of the Creek are named "Bur Dubai" and "Deira Dubai". For the exchange of a few coins you can take an "Abraa" boat ride from one side to the other. Do this early morning or after sunset so that you can enjoy the beauty of the magnificent city. You can also book a romantic dinner on one of the many Dhows which are available along the Creek.On the Bur Dubai side you will find the "Old Souk" which is in itself a fantastic experience. If you walk along the many allyways you will find the traders doing business, spice shops and other exciting stuff.
Nothing special!. The creek is not that much of attraction in my opinion. We took a ride on it and you can see the buildings on both side of the creek. Nothing special!!

Old dubai. We took ourselves on a wander along the creek on the bur dubai side and away from the tourist ares. Ended up at creek and crossed on abras to deira. Lots to see through the spice souqs, gold souqs and watching the old working dowhs. It's a fascinating place where you can easily wander away from the tourist feel and end up seeing smelling and hearing old dubai. Had a superb Indian lunch which was tucked in a back alley. Don't be afraid to venture off the beaten track for the most part it's interesting and people friendly.

Peaceful. Great place to relax, walk and to take a boat ride. One can hire a private boat for a 150 AED and enjoy boating for one hour around the creek or take an abra ride for 1AED that will take you across the creek. we tried both of these and enjoyed them a lot!

Loved our Abra ride. We got the metro to the creek and got on an 'Abra' boat for 1 Dirham each. The boats are less than luxurious but were great fun and well worth the trip across the creek. Once across the other side we got a taco to the local mall.

The heart of the city. I can highly recommend going down to the wharf and haggling for an Abra all to yourself; then take a leisurely cruise up the creek as far as you like and back. Fabulous, relaxing, great to view this great city.Make sure to settle on a price of course and if you (like I did) want to keep going, then ask for a price to take you on.

Good view only in Central area. The creek is long and some area is nothing (for example if you go to the Metro Creek station) but you have the best view walking along it in Dubai central area near old town. The traffic, the people, and the skyline as backdrop are all incredible.

A must do when in Dubai. Crossing the creek on an abra is a unique experience. It is really interesting to see the two different sides of Dubai and also to get in touch with people's every day life. And all this for 1 dirham per person. I have done it every time I was in Dubai and cannot get bored with it.

Authentic Dubai Experience and great views. Travelling down the creek on a dhow boat is a must do when in Dubai, can travel between stops on smaller boats to visit the souks and travel with locals, or take one of the larger boats and do a dinner cruise - either option a trip down the creek is great and offers good views and is worth the trip
Beautiful. Stayed on Dubai Creek at the Hilton, it was beautiful, Dhows and Abras made it look how I remembered it from 1970, traditional

Must visit at night to get to enjoy the lovely boats with all the lights they put on them.. Very nice and relaxing place. The trip on the boats is great and we even had a meal on the boat. The food here was nothing special and hardly anything for vegetarians.Apart from the food everything was fine and enjoyable.

Ancient meets crazy modern city. The Dubai Creek was the first time in Dubai I got a feeling for the tradition of this coastal yet desert area. I loved the old boats and the hive of activity in an otherwise static environment.
Up the Creek. A beautiful waterway bringing relief from the hustle and bustle of big-city dubai. a trip across the water on one of the little boats costs 1 dirham and is a fantastic trip.

A through back in time. Visit the Old Dubai Museum to see the staggering progress that the country has made in the last 100 years - it is hard to take in. Across the street and down a block is the Dubai Creek. There are many souks as you approach the creek with all sorts of wares on sale. The creek is crystal blue and it is interesting to watch the different type of boats loaded up with cargo headed out for all areas of the middle east. There are also passenger ferries which cost 1 Duram (same cost as museum entrence). You can take a passenger ferry called a atouck (sp?), old wooden boat, all the locals take it to go back and forth. The Gold and Spice souks are on the other side. It was a very enjoyable outing, and got to see a completely different slice of Dubai
A peaceful walk. A sort of romantic walk along the creek. A few restaurants along the way. The place gets crowded and Dhow operators shout for customers to be fleeced. Overall a peaceful area

Vibrant. We went for a stroll and a bite to eat at Dubai Creek. Lovely spot to soak in all the activity and the souks. Grab a water taxi and go for a trip across the other side and soak it all up... make sure it makes your to do list
old time dubai. nice food and a good place to find a bargain nice to have cheap transport across the river 1 drm per person ( 20p )

Relax On End of the day. The Dubai Creek, offer several option to dinner on board of boat trip, it´s calm relaxing and the food it´s nice. To do this activity on the end of the day could be a relax way to finish the day

Relaxed. This was one of my favourite places to visit in Dubai, some may disagree. What with a small boat ride over the creek for a dirham you have the Gold souk a few minutes walk away. There are a number of restaurants to eat at and a trip to the Heritage Village in the evening is certainly worth a visit.

A fun little ride. One of my favorite parts of my trip to Dubai was abra rides in the creek--at 1 dirham, it's easy and convenient to get from the Spice Souk to the Gold Souk this way, and the experience is great. I think it's a nice, relaxed little ride that everyone can enjoy.

wonderful to behold at night. Jump on an adjab for a mere 1 dirham and take a small boat ride across, you can also rent one for an hour which costs 120 dirham. Peaceful and a great way to view everything. . The water is very still so if you are like my father and suffer from boat sickness you will be just fine. Remember to take a bottle of water and some sun screen !

Very disappointing and a wasted 120 AED.. Had been told to expect to see Dubai 'old town' around the creek-must have missed it. Went to the Souk but quickly left because of the awful hassle.Tried a boat trip along the Creek which was advertised as being for an hour but lasted 50 mins. including a refuelling stop. Only two of us on the boat but no proper seats and had to sit on either side of centre to maintain balance I believe. It travelled at a very slow speed and didn't go very far before it was forced by a barrier to turn back and retrace the same route. Operator didn't say a word throughout-not that there seemed to be anything of particular interest to see. In fact on one bank there was almost nothing other than the wall of a building displaying large 'NO PHOTGRAPHY' notices followed by a building site. The cost was a wasted 120 AED. In retrospect we should have just paid the small amount to cross the Creek a few times by boat as it looked much more interesting.Decided next to take a pleasant walk alongside the Creek and visited what I think was called the 'Heritage centre' or similar. It was free and had nice toilets and that's it because the rest of it was a dilapidated eyesore.
Relaxing!. Good place to spend your evening time. Very relaxing. Visit the Creek Park for kids to have fun. A good picnic spot too.
Old Dubai. A must if you want the feeling of real Arabic atmosphere. Try to cross the creek with one of the cheap boats or take a dhow cruise

Dubai Creek is a saltwater creek located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE). It ends at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary. Some sources say that the creek extended as far inland as Al Ain, and that the Ancient Greeks called it River Zara. Historically, the creek divided the city into two main sections – Deira and Bur Dubai. It was along the Bur Dubai creek area that members of the Bani Yas tribe first settled in the 19th century, establishing the Al Maktoum dynasty in the city. In the early 20th century, the creek, though incapable then of supporting large scale transportation, served as a minor port for dhows coming as far away as India or East Africa. Although it impeded the entry of ships due to current flow, the creek remained an important element in establishing the commercial position of Dubai, being the only port or harbour in the city. Dubai's pearling industry, which formed the main sector of the city's economy, was based primarily on expeditions in the creek, prior to the invention of cultured pearls in the 1930s.

one of my favourite authentic Dubai experiences.. one of my favourite authentic Dubai experiences.you can cross to the spice souk for one dirham.smells are amazing.you can also hire a boat for your own mini tour.-Beware that a 30 minute trip is all you need-you may overheat-there is also not a huge amount to see...

dissapointed. this was my second time.The first time was more excitement.the ship was very ancient .the meal they served was cold.the singers had strident voice.only enjoyable thing was the weather..it was dreamlike when i went on the deck and the light breeze caresses my hairby the way i chose the unique ship(persian ship)

Dubai in different perspective. If you want to see the traditional side of Dubai, this is it. It's more authentic and such an amazing experience and will feel like it transport you back in time, shopping is amazing to when you go to the souks, a must do!

Old Dubai. If you want to see what Dubai was and is still like, this is a good place to visit. All the working Dhows taking their cargo, mostly loaded still by hand. Really pretty to see. Also Dhow cruise by day, the night time cruise also serves meals. Good value for money
Respite from the modernity. The old part of the city, may be the real Dubai.pleasant trip on a dhowwater taxis operate frequently to cross the creek
The Dubai Creek Park. the park is very spacious and has a lot of childrens area for playing and recreation. The dolphin show and the bird show are super.

Really enjoyable. We did a Dow cruise, and really had a good time. Very colourful, and nice to see all the other boats . Food was good and plentiful , staff were very helpful and knowledgeable, the only thing I would say, is a small amount of dialogue would be nice, to know what you were seeing .
Old Dubai. This area is the closest you will get to seeing how Dubai was pre sky scrapers. The old boats and Harbour look like they have been operating for centuries.

Abra boat trip . This is a must while you are visiting Dubai. My wife and I had a personal ride for about an hour up and back along the Deira Creek finishing up on the old Souk side of the creek. Cost is minimal but make sure you negotiate the price first.

The other side of Dubai..... The Old Dubai Souk is well worth a visit where you haggle your way down to the dock area - home to the many small traditional boats to cross the Creek. Health & Safety is not their first thought so just mind your step getting on and off the boats. For the price of 2AED you can go from one side to the other - and pick up the Metro at the other side. It was an experience in itself!

Boat trip on the creek.. Groupon do deals for boat trips for 2 adults and kids separate. Included buffet meal and entertainment .Boats leave at 8 pm but depending where you coming from especially anywhere near JBR expect heavy traffic after 6 . So allow 1hour 30 mins at least to get there. On the way back its only 25 mins . Really enjoyable and relaxing 2 hours . Well worth the trip

Finally you can act like a local.. Walking around Dubai makes you feel you're in unnatural, plastic world. Walking in Deira and taking a boat with the locals in Dubai Creek makes you a traveller, not a tourist anymore. ;)

Just a bigger boat ride with food. I live in beach city and travelling on a boat wasn't a new thing, but sitting in a boat , having ur dinner, while the boats sails slowly through the creek doesn't sound fun to me. its just an average ferry ride with food and dance on it.
A lot to see well worth a visit. Having to go there a few times for our lunches well worth seeing how beautiful this place is.Definitely recommend this place in the night.

Place for a relaxing stroll. Picturesque part of Old Dubai where you can wander along, take water taxis for 1Dh, or 1-hr trip or dinner cruises on the local dhows. There are some waterside restaurants where you can enjoy very reasonably priced meals and watch the water world go by. It is very near the main souks so lots to do in close proximity. Enjoyable area to spend a lazy day.

Best part of Dubai. We loved this part of Dubai. The clash of old world dhows sailing up and down the creek it's the backdrop of modern skyscrapers is quite spectacular.It was interesting to see modern appliance such as fridges and a/c units being off loaded from the ships and onto somewhat battered flatbed trucks and yet a short walk away was the spice souk.Take a short water cruise to get the best views of the city and potter around the markets and food stalls to get the best of this location.

Feel apart of of it. We took a trip on one of the small ferry boats. You get a great sense of the city and it is really cheap. Go to the Burj Dubai Souq , visit the Al Fahidi historic district and Hindi lane to get a different feel to Dubai in contrast to downtown Dubai.

Have a wander through the 'gold souke' near Dubai creek.. It is like a step back in time to walk through the 'souke' with glittering gold objects of every description displayed in the windows. The gold bracelets and jewelry is sold by weight and very good prices can be negotiated. The trips across the creek by water taxi are interesting.

Average . It connects you from one part of the Dubai city to another through a water taxi, as it is popularly called.. Although the service is good n quick, I felt it needs a bit more maintenance in terms of cleanliness..
We cruised the Creek with a public boat for AED 10. We arrived by metro and found out that you can do a 40 min tour around the creek for AED 10. A very nice experience.
Better enjoy in the night. Nice point of attraction more in the night due to illumination of the buildings and cruise boats. Better to to do boating to see the city in night. very charming.
Great ambience during evening. During evening this is a absolutely marvelous place to spend time. Once can take boats and go to souk nearby for shopping.
Get a Boat right Now!. I tried to drive a boat in Creek, it was amazing. I suggest you to pass Creek by boat and visit daira down town.

Old World Charm. Visited the Dubai Creek market by taking an Abra across the river. Visited the old market. Difficult to browse or shop as the traders constantly harass you with their products and drapes. I think if they could be a little bit more laid back they will get more business. By putting everything on your head and over your shoulders they shy people away from doing business with them.

Must visit on Dubai trip. Very interesting museum area, gold and spice souk, poetic trip across the creek, good conservation of architectural interest. Wonderful friendly welcome and explanations from staff, thank you. A really enjoyable afternoon.

Beautiful evening place!. The Dubai Creek is a beautiful place to visit especially in the evenings. It has great views of the skyline of the magnificent city. The cruise boats can be seen in the evenings lit up in neon lights in all their glory sailing around the creek. The place is good for strolling with cool breeze making it a lovely experience.

An Abra ride is must at Creek. Going from one side of the creek to other through an Abra (boat) one must do to have an amazing experience. The boats are frequent saved they don't fill more than their capacity.The system is controlled through Road Transport Authority Dubai and it's very effective and convenient. The ride in the evening hours gives a spectacular view of both sides of Creek under lights. Charge per head 1AED, collected by boat driver onboard, children travel for free.

Creek experience. One thing you must do in Dubai is catch the abra-which is the water taxi from the Deira side across to the Bur Dubai side. It's a fun way to experience the creek life. When you reach the Bur side, you get off at the Textile Souk.

A rìde over abra. The experience of a boat ride over abra is fantastic to reach gold souq and spice souq. One has to experience a boat ride in dubai to get a feel of the city. The charge for a boat ride of 15 ppl is 1AED per person which is cheap considering dubai standards.Theres ample scope for photography around evening and night time over dubai creek which one can find relaxing.For those afraid of water, this ride can help you òvercome your fears.
Nice place to walk along. Dubai creek is a great place to walk along in the nice weather with side trips across the street to the gold and spice souks.
Busy waterway. Greta to walk along and watch fishermen landing their catch. Also plenty of pleasure cruises and restaurants

The other side of dubai. If you want to live the big life of dubai and see the other side, take the Abra and cross the water, mingle with the locals, buy locally made things, eat and drink, everything is there and then the gold souk. A must visit if you come to dubai.
old Dubai. Nice and cheap way to get to the other side of the river. Take the cruise during night time- great photos

Take a Creek Dhow. This fascinating waterway is filled with Dhows loading and unloading wares from around the globe. Much construction work can also be seen on the bank side as well as some stunning properties. You can get a free one-hour tour included with a Big Bus 48 hour pass.

Life line of dubai. Creek is man made canal which devides bur dubai and deira dubai in two.This is beautifully maintained creek all along about 14 kms in length..On both sides creek is very lively and well lit at night..Dow cruze adds to its night life in a magical way...cruze glides on the creek water for very nicely for about 8 kms a very enjoyable ride
Great area. A good area for restaurants and golfing, it has the Park Hyatt Hotel which has a Spa and a few restaurants. You can get there by Metro.
Stroll the Creek. A great place to stroll, have a snack or a full meal. Evenings might be better as the temperatures are milder making exploring more comfortable. Definitely a must see on your trip.

Dhow cruise @ Dubai creek is a pleasent experience..!!!. A Dhow cruise through Dubai creek, preferably during oct-mar is a nice experience. A nicely served buffet dinner followed by a tanura- traditional dance make the evening memorable..

Take an Abra ride along the creek. If you like boating, this is a great way to see some of the buildings of Dubai that line the creek edge. It was quite an experience watching the hustle and bustle of the abras on the waterway when pulling in and out of the stops. Another great way to get around Dubai and see the sights.

A little bit of older Dubai. Dubai is a fabulous modern city with lots of high rise and highways, however take a day to visit 'Old Dubai' and the 'Creek' with its multitude of Dhows large and small which still ply their trade around the gulf, take in the smells, the cargo, the way these dhows are loaded, take a water taxi with regular comuters and you are transported back to the 60s and 70s, away from this modern metropolis.

Old and new Dubai. Well worth taking the hour long boat trip along the creek. The abra run across north to south. Lots to see. Certainly worth a visit, there is a real feeling of the old everyday life of the people, with the new creeping over your shoulder.
Great area for a day out in Dubai. Take a boat trip up the Creek lasting about an hour and get landed on the opposite bank thus taking in the Souks and Both sides of the Creek.

the life of the creek brings Dubai to life the history of this burgeoning city. From as far back as 1981 I have loved the creek it, is the anchor for Dubai, the one place where history prevails. The dhows chugging along the gentle waters or the large Boom dhows loading and unloading their cargo, or the little Abra's, the water taxis that ferry people across from Deira to Bur Dubai. The creek to me is still the heart of Dubai and now with the extension that returns the creek to Jumeirah Beach it will bring to life a whole new waterfront and likely a more contemporary feel. The tradition of the old part of the creek must however remain as the lifeblood of Dubai.

Hire a boat. Had a lovely time with a friend just taking a boat to ourselves. With Dubai trips, i try and look for atleast one outdoor thing, this was it for that day. Especially if you go a while before sunset, worth catching it.

Buzzing and Food. Went there on an evening looking for food, great light displays from some of the buildings, fountains and lit palm trees, The standard of food varies you need to be careful. Actually left one restaurant after seeing what was being served, Ended up at a fab Afghanistan one quite a way from the main entrance. Wrote the named down as I was so impressed but lost it.
Very enjoyable.. We spent a very pleasant day on the creek, the waterways were not busy and it was relaxing and a great way to see the views .

Personal 30 minutes ride along Dubai Creek. One of the Abra operator offered us a personal ride when we were waiting for the next trip across the souk. For 60 AED for 5 pax, it is worth for that scenic view and valuable experience.

Dubai Creek. Located in the old city of Dubai is one of the more interesting features as there are not many historic places, most of Dubai being new. There are some souks nearby also with an old accent.
Liveliy neighbourhod on both sides. Nice to go on a boat tour which brings you over the creek. Cheap way of transportation with beautiful views.

Dubai Creek ... A Place for the best Evening Peace ... With People, Boat & Water Around. Travelling from 1 Side to the Other Side on the Small Boats in the Dubai Creek... Is one kind of Peaceful, Enjoyable & Cheap Ride .... But Sitting just besides the Arabian Sea & Viewing the Beauty on both the Sides is very very Great Experience ......... I Personally have had many evening around this place for just a Refreshment of Mind .....

Better to do elsewhere. There ain't really much to see on the creek side apart from boxed refrigerators, dinner cruise boats being washed over and the chaos of people trying to work out the water taxi fare system. Only if you need to kill and hour or two could you combine a stroll up the creek with a visit to the So. Otherwise get the metro straight to the Souks.
Building site.. Like many parts of Dubai, basically a building site. I am sure that once it is finished it will look like every other part of Dubai.
Pleasant Afternoon Exploring. Had a very nice few hours exploring the old souks, the cargo port and taking a water taxi ride. Highlight of my three days in Dubai.

Boat rides to cross the water body is worth taking . After you have visited the gold souk and spice souk, take the old boat to cross the creek. On the other side is the Dubai Museum. Click pictures while you are on boat. Though luxury boats are there, you should board the old-fashioned boat at least once to get the feel. Each way costs one dirham!
Mad made beautiful blue!. Man made Beautiful blue waters in the middle of a desert. The cruise are good way to encash this but food on these cruise is usually bad, cold and tasteless.
Great Dhow Crusie and Dinner. We had a great experience on our Dhow cruise and dinner. The entertainment was fun and the food was surprisingly good.
Nice place. Nice place. I visited on Friday morning when it is vacant. Nice place. Could see lot of water birds too.

short stopover. I had 6 hours in Dubai on a short stopover en route to India. Decided on a taxi to the Creek; the oldest part of Dubai. for a short visit this did not disappoint. amongst all the skyscrapers of the new city this part offers a glimpse into the old Dubai, with its small water taxis and souks; the spice souk is found by literally " following ones nose"! Well worth a morning to soak up some of the atmosphere of the old Dubai and, for those with the cash, the Gold Souk offers plenty of opportunities for that excellent gift to take home to your wife!
nice. take a dhow from the old Fatiha city or behind the museum to cross the creek, just 1 dirham ;-) it takes appr. 10 minutes

Good chance to see the Old Dubai. A one hour private boat tour of the Creek only set us back 120 dirhams and it was a lovely way to see the Creek and get a sense off the Dubai before high rise buildings and luxury shopping malls. Right beside the gold and spice souks so you can make a day of exploring this area and soaking up some culture. Would definitely recommend.
Taste of Old Dubai. Well worth a visit! Museums and souks, the best way of learning of the history of Dubai. Easy accessed by the metro.

Beautiful creek , old dubai . Lovely place to visit. An abra ride is a cheap and quick way to see the creek's local activity. Cost only 1 dirham. There are different souks and museums arround dubai creek. So it's really worth a visit . You can simply take an Abra ride or visit any souk (specially gold souk ) or visit museums if you are a history lover :) .Here some may find some stray cats specially near fish market and gold souks so be aware .
What a treat!. Amazing to witness the madness of abras, pleasure craft and dhows navigate this water passage. Abra ride quite an experience itself! Not to be attempted in high summer...

Interesting way to travel back in time to the old Dubai. Very short boat ride to cross to the Souk (Market) for Spices and Gold. We rode a boat that cost only one dirham each. Though the water is not that clean (there is a water stench) it is bearable since the trip is very short (3 minutes).
The other Dubai. We traveled as a couple in January 2016. The experience is awesome, as you can see the original Dubai. We recomand crossing the creek like locals.

Dubai Creek. I have done rides on the creek three times and enjoyed all but one ride. This particular ride, tourists kept stepping over me and on me to get "better views". It is a very scenic tour, no matter where you start.

OLD MEMORIES REVIVED !!!. That was really pleasant and welcoming to be at creek sipping a cup of coffee and meeting old friends.
It is good excitement and experience to walk through the area.
Nice sunset. Pretty cool to ride the boats to got to the souks. It's 1 AED. For sure take it at least once, if you can at sunset, it's pretty.

A chance to experience the genuine local life. We booked a dhow cruise via vouchers and sailed in a boat over the creek. We had the chance to see how local people enjoy their evening as we seemed to be the only tourists on board. There was also a special show including tricks and arabian dances. The dishes were galore, various and delicions.The only flaw was the boat did not sail close to the impressive Dubai's buldings and rather along the Deira district. Thus we could not admire the lights of night Dubai but nevertheless enjoyed very much the evening.

More dodgems than dhows. You need to be nimble and brave to take a trip up the creek on one of the many water taxis. They each take around 15 passengers sitting on a central raised area. As often as not, they hit the dock rather than pulling alongside it and they race one another up and down. More of a thrill ride than a serious method of transport. I must admit I loved it but it is not for the fainthearted - or the non-swimmer I would suggest. I saw no lifebelts or jackets aboard any of them but that doesn't mean they weren't hidden somewhere.
fun day by the creek. We explored for the day. Lots of fun. We went to the gold area which was only OK. The area around the cultural understanding had some great little shops.
old Dubai. Every time I get at the Creek it's a new experience...lots of corners to explore, lots of bargains, different souks and museums to visit

Very Nice. ubai Creek is a saltwater body of water that looks like a J-Shape river. It starts at the Arabian Gulf and ends at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary where migrating birds (especially flamingos) seem to like it there. The creek divided the city into two main sections – Deira and Bur Dubai. Several bridges now connect the two parts of the city which was previously connected only via small boats called Abra (still operational today). The creekserved as a minor port for dhows (wooden boats) coming as far away as India or East Africa. Today there is a project to turn the J-Shape creek into an U-Shape one, by extending the tail of the creek to meet the Arabian Gulf waters. A cruze through the creek is advisable where there are planty of boats, yachts and dhows offering lunch and dinner cruises.
Cruise Dinner. It was a wonderful Cruise dinner @ Dubai Creek.Loved the ambiance and services offerd by our Cruise guide.
Hop on an abra for a relaxing ride across the Creek. Inexpensive way to get from A to B (1 dirham per a ride)!!! Enjoy the view of old Dubai and hop off to get yourself a bargain at one of the souks.
Lovely. Lovely place to visit. So relaxing to watch the boats going past or even to take a ride on a traditional dhow boat yourself. It's a great place to visit and is worth a trip to see it
beautiful. It feels amazing to walk around dubai marina. beautiful lighting, good restaurant.They also have small taxi around if anybody does not want to walk.

in the old town tourist area, if in Dubai - might as well. Not like it is a great boardwalk in other cities, but you will see the docks where they are unloading goods, markets are nearby and so is museum.

See the creek's local activity!. An sbra ride is a quick (and cheap!) way to see the creek's local activity!You'll be alongside locals commuting, as well as tourists sightseeing. Once you get on the boat, the driver walks around and collects 1 Dirham from each passenger. It's about a 5 minute ride across and down the river. It's not only a quick mode of transportation, but it's also a great way to see local activity on the creek, including the preparation of trade ships to India. We didn't have time, but it would have been fun to get a tour near the creek (I saw plenty of material on that on various travel sites).
Overrated. Food was pathetic - probably we picked the wrong tour Organizer "Rayna Tours". Service and attitude of the cruise manager was appalling!! All-in-all, can be skipped.

A must when visiting Dubai. This is the place if you would like to get away from the fancy skyline areas. Here you find the creek with boats beefing loaded and offloaded. This is the oldest parts of Dubai and the air is filed with spices from the spice market nearby.Taking a boat and passing the Creek cost you 1 dinar and it takes you to other markets.You will not find any copy brands in any of these markets. The government confiscate every copy brand they can find.However if you ask for a specific brand in any of the shops, the owner will take you to a "secret room" were he keeps the fancy brands, that are not allowed to be sold.To follow him is most often ok, but still not recommendable. You get maybe your bag with the brand you were looking for, but it's not so easy to bargain if you are locked in!The quality? That's up to you!Child labor? Could be!Do remember that you need to get the price down to 10% of what the shop owner offer you!

Boat ride was fund. Gold Souk was terrible, Spice Souk OK. High Pressure sales. This area is mostly dense urban aggressive street hucksters pressuring you to buy a "gold Rolex". I actually had to push many of them back away from me and my wife. They grabbed my shoulders and blocked our walking. They threw shawls on my shoulders as I walked by hoping to get me to stop. They swung incense burning cauldrons in front of my wife. Especially at the Gold souk. This should only be visited by people who are OK with high pressure sales who just want to see the souk area.

Beautiful. This whole area is a chance to get outside and walk. You can stop in at a few museums, go to the gold souk, the Dubai souk, and get on the water to see Dubai in all its glory. It is a nice way to spend the afternoon. Gold souk warning: this has become a bit of a tourist trap with toots selling all kinds of things; however, once you get inside the shops or off the main entrance, much of this annoyance disappears.
GREAT FUN. We had booked a half day Dubai tour which included a trip on the creek in an Abra (traditional fishing boat), not to be missed-great fun and don't forget your camera

The closest to original Dubai place!!. This is the only place in the city that lets you somehow visualise how this "artificial" city could be in the past!! This is why I like it more than the center of Dubai!!
Best place to unwind. This is the best place in dubai to relax and have a quinant time. Restaurants here offer mostly offer nonveg.

Walk along the banks. The selling point of the Creek is the Soukhs (Silk, Spice and Gold) but they were of limited interest to me. I wandered around the streets and found myself on Baniyas Road along the bank of the Creek. Wandering along it I found that the Dhows are still loaded in much the same way they've been loaded for generations - there's a ladder between the gunwale of the Dhow and the quay and men run up it with packages on their shoulders. It seemd a friendly area and fascinating to wander along.

Enjoy the lighted boats. We took a dinner cruise, good buffet with plenty of variety.We sat on the top deck, the weather was perfect. The scenery with all the lighted boats was a great way to spend a delightful evening..
Beautiful experience. The Dhow experience was great. We also did the dinner cruise and it was a great evening experience to see the .night lights
It's water. Worth a short trip but not a great tourist site nowhere near as good as Hong Kong or other waterways worldwide

Boat in Dubai creek. I took a boat (a Egyptian style one) you will notice them when you are walking beside the boats and they where really nice and the did a lot of good shows and dance and the give a good food on the boat you will really like it it is like a party on the boat and they all dressed in old Egyptian style ;) I really loved it

Evening boat tour. Dubai Creek is a nice place to visit. And to make a boad ride in the evening including dinner. Nice view allong Dubai sky line. Boat tour takes approximately 2 and a half hour. Must do if u where never in Dubai.

Old fashion. I use to stay in Dubai Creek during my stay in Dubai more than 10 years ago. Now even the hotels in this area look old. Most of them are also not refurbished since long time. And the old ships along the port do not create any longer the same atmosphere that used to do.

Dinner cruise on the creek. The hotel we were staying at had a boat on the creek that provided dinner cruises. We had window seat on the upper deck and had great views of the river, the riverbanks and all the other boats sailing up and down the creek. This excursion is best after dark to see the all the other boats light up. The food is not prepared on the boat but brought in and is acceptable but not great. There are also a number of people who arrive by coach and their seating area is on deck and the views are not as good.
Bateau Bleu. You Must do this! Fine dining, wonderful grand piano serenading you and best views ever! Brilliant service too!
1 AED ride. give 1 AED to the driver he will drop you at gold souk.fun ride on small boat and see the view.try once when you for gold shopping

should go. all the cruse tours start here. you can see lot of exprats in the area. i felt like i stepped in to a busy stree in India as these Asians are siting on the roads and having snacks. people are just sitting on payments playing cards and chatting. you cannot see any arabs in this area. the gold market is also in the same area. you can visit the IT malls as well.

Trip on the river taxis on Dubai Creek. This is must do attraction if your visiting the old city and souk's for 1 dirham (.22p) you get to ride on the river taxis taking you from one side of the river across to the other where the spice and gold souk's are.A great way to see the old part of the city, be prepared to get pushed and shoved in the rush to get on and off the taxi's but then it's all part of the experience.

Great place to visit. There is so much happening in an around the creek, but it is away from the bustle of the city centre. Lovely to see and rider on the Shows and Abras and see the huge cargo ships being unloaded traditionaly without cranes. Great to visit the souks and other interesting buildings and shops in this area.

The old Dubai. This area is really worth a visit if you wish to see how Dubai was before the hotels and tower blocks came along! The creekside with its Dhows unloading cargo takes you back 50 years and the old Gold and Spice souks retain the charm and bustle of the past . The area is small but a few hours can be happily whiled away absorbing a totally different atmosphere to the rest of the city. You feel , and are , perfectly safe wherever you go and the locals will guide you if your map is not up to scratch . Enjoy! John Adams

My.Memories of the first ride on the Abra. It was 27 years ago in March 1989 that I rode the Abra from Deira to Bur Dubai with a group of friends and to do it again was pleasant experience. Al Khor or the Creek lively with several activites. Before the large Ports were built the creek served as the wharfs for the maritime trade for movement of goods by the Dhows.The creek waters enter the land at Al Ras and winds its way up to Bur Khalifa passing through Al Jedaf. The Abra ride was the quickest way for me to reach The Customs House at Port Rashid from my workplace at Deira.

True Dubai History of Trade. Great place to bring visitors during a holiday to visit the roots and history of trade in Dubai. Don't forget to visit the souks and museum to see where it all started. PS. Wear comfy shoes and clothing.

ONE NICE BUSY DAY!!!. Located at old Dubai sights, you will enjoy the gold & spice souks markets. If you like to walk , you can enjoy it to fing a good restaurant. You can also bring your children to the exotic birds show

Go to the gold souk on the abras!. You must see this historic mode of trade and travel. You can an abra for 1 dirham from the city side to Deira and explore the gold souk for hours. It's small little streets, like a maze, just like it was back in the day. And they have everything you could possibly want there, from jewelry to pashminas, to fabric, to abayas. A must see!
Excellent and well maintained creek. This is a lovely place to go in a yacht, specially at sunset and then watch the citi come to life with lights galore.
A Must! . Cross at least once on an arbra, eat at least once in a small coffeeshop/restaurant and drink in the experience as a whole, priceless!

Great Fun!. We crossed the Dubai Creek on a dhow which was really fun - it only cost about 20p each for the ride and the boat motored along with our captain expertly dodging larger vessels. A great way to arrive at the spice and gold souks!

ENCHANTING BY NIGHT & WONDERFUL BY DAY. When visiting Dubai I invariably stay at one of the luxury hotels on the Creek.From there you get an excellent view of the Creek with its many luxury yacht moorings and occasional passing dows.For me the Creek and Dows epitomise the real Dubai................. before it was swallowed up by a concrete jungle in the last 20 years or so.
If want to know what a dhow is.... ...this is where you can find out. Boats, tours, and the closest you're going to get to what Dubai was before the growth explosion.

Visit from Australia. Now this is a place everyone must go when in Dubai.We caught the first ferry over & the last ferry back,still not long enough to take it all in. I am glad we caught the last ferry back,as travelling the coast line was amazing of an evening.The creek steeped in history of old Dubai.The abra crossing an experience. No waiting ,just hop on board for 1 dirrham to the gold & spice souks across the creek. A must experience. Lots of walking , lots of haggling, but all in a day at the Creek.Next time we will use 2 days 2 explore this magical back to Old Dubai sights.

A day to spend. You can spend a full day there.We visited the municipality garden,the dolphins show,the exotic birds show,took the cable cars ride and by night we had dinner in a cruising old fashioned style boat for two hours
Amazing quality time . We had a long walk then lunch in one of the restaurants in the Creek .Great experience and pleasant weather at this time of the year.

Major construction . We walked around the Gold Souk before trying to visit Dubai Creek but found much of the area is being redeveloped now. We could see the water -and a couple of large cruise ships - but never got to the creek or the boat across.
Cool thing . We did the creek boat ride that comes with the hop on hop off ticket.. Nice views and relaxing moment onboard. You can order coffee and food on the boats
Lovely place. Lovely part of Dubai. You can cross in a little boat. Have dinner at the water side or walk along the river.

Views from the creek. This one was included in one of our tours nice boat, food and views of both sided of the creek since we were on the upper deck. It was not too cold that night. The total tour was about 3-4 hours long. There were a few show and live singer for entertainment.
Old Dubai. Interesting area to walk around by day or night. Went on the water taxi! For someone who finds small boats scary this was not great but obviously arrived safely. Souks are worth a visit.

Good for Day or Night. It's amazing have such a rewarding experience. You get to cross of Dubai, while enjoying unique views over the old quarters of the city. If you want to experience old Dubai visit Dubai Creek. Abra for crossing Dubai creek great experience.

Very interesting and relaxing place. Much bigger than a creek!!. We toured the Creek by Dhow, a wooden boat. A lovely cruise to see the other fishing boats and cruisers in the harbour of the Creek. The day we went there was a hail storm, quite rare for Dubai but added to the fun.

Smelling steam, better have a walk adjoining creek.. Dubai creek is beautiful but not near the city crowd. Just leave the central part of the city and than its charming.
City boats (they call it Abra) are full of diesel smell, engine sound, avoid. Better take a walk around the creek.

Nice dinner cruse view disappoing. Dinner cruse three are a lot to chose from with various price ranges all looked good
Not much to see but enjoyable dinner and show
Lovely place. Well worth a visit during both the day and at night, some very nice restaurants, good way to see the city by boat at a very reasonable price

Abra ride all the way up.... We hired an abra for just 3 of us. It was about 125 AED For an hour. We went down towards the heritage centre then up to the top of the Creek past all the Dhows being loaded and the restaurant boats. It was lively and interesting. The Creek gets a bit smelly further up towards the toll bridge. There is a lot of waste food and paper and plastic bottles which does spoil it somewhat. It's a great experience and we'll worth a visit.
Breat taking. Stayed in the radisson in January 2014 the lights are amazing plus there were fireworks show every second night

Abra ride . We were on the creek while crossing to the museum. Was a great ride for us and felt we more like locals using the Abra, it costs only 1 AED. Be on the look out for the new refurbished abras that have 2 motors and better sitting
the old Dubai. If you go to Dubai, you can't miss the old Dubai town. the area around the Creek is the historic heart of Dubai. Authentic Arabian Style, you can feel the atmosphere back in the years.

so refreshing... me and some friend went here and tried the cruise along Dubai Creek.. its cheap.
and creek is very clean.
one thing that you dont have to miss in dubai ,

nice place to stoll. Its a nice place to stroll around in the evening and have a nice dinner next to the water. You can do some shopping in the souk but don't go with the illusion you will get great deals prices need to be negotiated. Good place to buy some souveniers

Day or Night. We went on this sale during the day and it was most enjoyable as we were able to view the very interesting docks. The old boats were loaded with all kinds of cargo that was piled up on the dockside ready for loading. There did not appear to,be any kind of mechanical lifting machines at all and the boats were loaded by the dockers. The Dubai skyline is very interesting and beautiful. The daytime trip was very reasonably priced and you can also get another ferry boat just to cross the Creek, this takes about 10 minute so get to the other side. We also did this sail at night with a dinner, and this was not such a success for us as our boat broke down and we had to,be towed back to the dockside. The buildings are amazing when all lit up, Burj Khalifa has a spectular lighting show quite frequently. I don't think I would do the dining sail again, but it was interesting at the time.
enjoyed the ferry ride. this place look beautifull in evening time and very reasonable to travel from one side to other and light s reflection in water looks amazing

An absolute favorite!. I crossed the Creek from Bur Dubai to Deira aboard an abra for only 1 dirham. It's amazing how for so little money one can have such a rewarding experience - one that I would list among my favorites in Dubai. You get to cross this body of water as locals have been doing for decades, while enjoying unique views over the old quarters of the city as dhows crammed with goods arrive from/depart to the Persian Gulf. If you want to experience old Dubai you should not miss the Dubai Creek.

An interesting evening.. The food on the cruise that we took was reasonable enough. I guess it is better to pay more for the food on offer than some of the other boats but it wasn't worth the cost to just do a couple of loops in the boat.

The real Dubai. Had a great evening at the creek we got a dhows boat for about 2 dirhams approx 20p each across the river to the market where you can buy spices and scarves it was a great experence as the locals use it as well.

Amazing by day or night. I love the creek, it's the heart of the deira and Bur dubai areas, surrounded by markets, restaurants, souks and other venues.you can go the one side for local feel and to the hyatt side for the trendsetters.
Wonderful. Book a ride around 5 pm so that you can watch the beauty of Dubai ! We had lots of fun for an hour or so and its worth it. Go for it

Visited here on a stop over to try and get the " authentic" Dubai. We went by taxi from our hotel as we had booked a Dhou dinner cruise and unfortunately we were not told about the horrid 6 lane " rush hour" that we had to endure to get to the Creek area at 6 .30, made worse by rain!It took over 2 hours and I was squashed between 102 men on the back seat of the taxi after a 2 nd pick up.It was not easy to see much of the area as it is not well lit at night.Our dinner cruise was an Indian buffet and the passengers were of varying nationalities and had did not dress up for the occasion which was a shame.Later I discovered that the Dubai Ferry runs a return service by water from Dubai Marina at 3 pm for a 1 hour excursion to the Creek for 50 AED which would show you the Creek from the water.In addition there is a service from the Marina to Al Ghubiaba ( Bur Dubai) at 1100 , 1300 where you could get off and explore and at 18.30 when you will get views of the sights and lights on the 90 mins journey .I wish I had know of this facility but maybe another time?
Try a boat tour. An interesting way to see the city by boat. Walkways are lined with interesting cafes. Culturally interesting.

I really love this place. a Calm , beautiful place by Dubai Creek . you can have a nice walk , enjoying the nice view of the creek and Bur Dubai at the other side or you can take the boat taxi to the other side . you can take a cruise trip down the creek.

COFFEE BY THE CREEK. I went shopping by the creek and then stopped to have a quick coffee in the warm sunshine, bliss! I was lovely to sit by the water watching the boats drift up and down whilst sipping a delicious coffee at an Italian restaurant.

Just as expected. We have visited Dubai three times but never made it to the Creek before. We took a taxi from the Mall area which was cheap and took twenty minutes. He dropped us at the Fish Market and we wandered throw there, then the fruit and veg market and the Gold Souk. There was lots going on and people approached us but took no for an answer , so we did not feel hassled. Then we crossed the road to look at the dhows unloading their wares and took a ride across the Creek on a show. After a visit to the home Sheikh Makhtoum grew up in we wandered again, visiting a more touristy market selling souvenirs where the vendors were much more pushy.

Old Dubai and markets. My partner and I had one of the best meals in this area for $4 each, we stopped at one of the little Indian stalls on the road and had the tastiest meal here. We tried as many things as we could, came out completely satisfied and paid nothing. The markets were great and the boat ride across the creek was also an experience. We did not get to spend as much time as I would have liked here but would recommend a day spent in this area.

Heart of Dubai. Dubai Creek also known as Abra..The Oldest Place of Dubai...It is the Heart of Dubai Connecting two Place from Dubai to Diera with a Part of Arabian Sea in the Middle...which also offers the best of Dhow Cruise Sailing g Around the Waters within the Banks of Dubai...One of my favorites since a childhood and Always will be...From Dubai side we have the textile Shops with Electronics and Meena Bazar at the other side in Diera we have the Spice Bazar ans the Textile Bazar as well where most of the Trade is Done...A Beautiful Place for a Walk or to Be seated for a While Enjoying the God's breeze during winters and the blue waters ahead...a alternate way to travell from Dubai to deira is from the small boats called Abra charging a minimum of Aed 1 which is Availble till night time...a ride is a must for all tourist entering dubai....
Walk along the creek. The creek should be called a river. You can just walk along it and go where you want. You can also take boat rides across it or tour it by boat.

Such a unique place. I was staying at a hotel a couple blocks away from the creek. I went SO MANY TIMES. It's a ver nice SUPER ARAB area, with markets and restaurants. You can cross the creek for just 1 or 2 dirhams in the little boats that go back and forth from one shore to the other. You will feel like a real arab on those, full of people coming from work. Such a nice experience.

Part of the Old Dubai area. The Creek is very narrow bur divides the Old Dubai area where all the Souks are...Old, Gold and Spice. Its worth going to and is easy accessed by the Metro. Good photography and good restaurants on the waterfront but not on budget.

A bargain in Dubai . 1 dirham each way on a water taxi just to enjoy the atmosphere of old Dubai and the creek. It is essentially 20 people sat on a bench looking out. You may get offered a personal tour on the boats for 120 dirhams. No real need is my view. It is no hassle at all. Al Fahidi or Al Gubaiba or Al Ras metro stations allow you to get close to the 4 ferry stations that run continuously. You need to just get on and go and then walk between. Explore Deira Old Souq too.

Good Place. Very busy place but very enjoyable. You can cross the Creek with the Abra so you won"t have to walk all around but that is also fun. All the Dohws coming in and out, you can spend a whole day.

Small boats constantly crossing 1 dirham (20p) each way.. Calm waterway with small boats constantly crossing 1 dirham (20p) each way. Decks about 4 inches from water but stable and occasional foot splash from wake of bigger boats.Little waiting time. well organised. They will ask if you wish cruise around - never took up offer. Life jackets stored in roof of boat look like they have never seen action. No sure how often they would be checked

Water taxi experience. Just went to the creek to take the water taxi. Nice experience and cheap activity. Costs one dirham per person. Good to do in between your other activities. Nothing major though about it.. Just an open boat with central seating.

Loved the Abra ride. Dubai creek area is the old part of the city, and much less glamorous compared to the other parts. But, it definitely doesn't lack in character. Loads of old markets( beware they charge you 10 times the actual price), easy to walk around, beautiful at dusk, and cool abra ride from bur dubai to the spice and gold markets.
Stunning view. The Dubai creek is a visual treat. For people who would love a great view of the creek, this is the place to be. There are also many rides across the creek at reasonable prices

Night ride on an abra. We crossed the Creek to the Gold and Spice Souk on an abra - a small boat. As we were part of a private tour, we had the abra to ourselves, but we noticed the others were quite full of people. A short ride, very cheap and quite beautiful at night with all the city lights reflecting on the creek.
Fabulous sunset. We found an outdoor restaurant called Boardwalk. Very reasonable food and happy hour drinks from 5-8pm. The sunset was free and it was fantastic.

HOT TIP Up the Creek - it's a must . The Creek is a bustling vibrant experience so unlike the rest that Dubai offers.HOT TIP - rent your own boat, jump the queue and indulge in an hour of own time watching Dubai from an angle you can't get elsewhere.There are many ways to go boating on the Creek. Common is simply crossing on a mad bus/taxi for a mere 1 dirham. Organised boat trip - which I'm sure is lovely or ask for the Hour Tour at 120 dirham for two.The journey takes you down one side of the creek and back up. Do it! It's just a wonderful experience.Don't expect a tour as chances are the boatman won't even speak English (not that everyone should). But if you fancy knowing what you're seeing take a tourist map.
Pride of Dubai.. The first thing to do when u visit dubai is to visit the dubai creek and come back again in the evening to experience their world famous Dhow cruise.

Amazing tour. This visit is almost included in package by all travel agent. So it was also in our tour. Visited creek in night. There was a tour of almost 1 and 1/2 hour. It wa a boat with dining table for almost 100 persons where we have to seat and watch. Base is Air Conditioned while top floor is open. Nice view from top but coll wind is always there which is not suitable for child and senior citizens.Dubai was seeing colourful on both side. There was a nice dinner along with local dance and some other programme. Not a bad visit.

The old Dubai. There you can see Dubai's "other" poorer side, the real life, so to say. Sly vendors and the usual mix of eastern " things to buy"-scarves, spices,harem pants... Not as glamurous as Istanbul bazaars and the offer is a bit poorer. There's a gold souk on the other side of creek ( a short taxi boat ride) if you're into that kind of things. Anyway, nice to see different side of Dubai.
A good time pass. Relaxing and scenic !. Its alright for a dinner one can take a cruise along the creek and enjoy the meal. Not so much to rave about thou.

Night Boat Cruise up the Creek. Nice and pleasant calm evening - set out with a glass of wine watching all the local goings on at the side of the creek. Sat down to a lovely five course meal with more wine.The evening went quickly - not too much to do - but as expected.
The mighty Creek. Wow, It reminds you of the good old means of transportation, Economical, Refreshing, Convenient & safe.
Not so good , not so bad.. Mixed experience. I can cay you can go and enjoy the Dubai creek but not must go activity. Similar dance and other activities can be cover in Desert safari.

Older side of Dubai. I loved the area around the Dubai Creek. It is older, more history and more lively. Either side of the creek is fun. On the one side you have the spice and gold souk. Also on that side you can see the men loading and unloading the boats. Take a little time to watch them. It's amazing what they can move without lift forks etc. On the other side you have the Indian area and some museums/palace. It's very cheap to take a 'taxi' ride across, but it's also fun to rent your own boat and take a ride up and down the creek.

Awesome to take the local Water Taxi from one side to the other. WaterTaxis are 1 AED and you can go from one side to the other and visit the local market on the one end. The water taxis drive a little bit crazy - but its all good . Very primitive area of Dubai

Beautiful boat trip. We took the 1hr tour of the creek. It's relaxing and beautiful. You see all the olde world ships against the modern skyline. I really enjoyed this.It's not interactive or a guided tour. Our Captain didn't even speak to us. We sat on the centre box on the boat and enjoyed the trip.You get the entire 1hr. We didn't even have to share the boat with others.

Authentic Dubai. Such an interesting day spent in this area. Lots to see and experience. Took the metro here then crossed the creek in a boat. Got almost all my souvenirs in this area as they seemed to have a greater variety and were more authentic. Spent lots of time chatting with shopkeepers about their wares and bargaining with them. If you miss this area, you will miss the true Dubai as it was once upon a time.
Not a Must. We did this as part of our day tour and it wasn't too bad. Only do it if its part of the tour because in my opinion it's not worth going out of your way to see it.

Just breathtaking!. We came here in February, the tempeture was around 25C and we had a fantastic time here.Delicious diners in Iranian Sadaf restaurant. If you are feeling cold they can provide you with blanket!There is a nice play area for kids which is good for rainy days even at night as this is some how covered.I loved coming here at night but day time view is also very impressing.There are around 200 restaurants here and just way to much choice in a good way;)You can even Book your dinner on the Boat.Beautiful place!

Lovely boat ride. This is a little trip up the creak, you can see interesting buildings and some wild life, it is a nice little trip to do. Again this comes free with your bus tickets if you purchase 48hr. Which I think is good value to see a lot of Dubai from the bus trip and get on off when you find something of interest to you.

An interesting walk. The Creek is a fascinating place to walk along the banks, watching men load boats by hand with all manner of goods onto old wooden vessels. You can also catch small ferry boats across the Creek
Interesting. It s little bit like Disneyland All is renovatedClean and emptyBut it s pleasant most of the exhibitions are freeThe walk way is so quiet There is less people than in shopping mall
Sunny calm dhow cruise on the creek. Slowly gliding along the creek, something we have done several times before, such a lovely relaxing trip, refreshments also on board.

Nice area in a nice weather. It's like a man made big lake, beautiful, with all the boats, hotels and restaurants all around. you need a suitable weather to enjoy it. Summer time would not be a good timing because of the very high temperatures and humidity percentage.

Boat trip. This was part of the Hop on Hop off bus tour. It is worth it for 45 minutes, relax on the boat and look at Dubai in a different way. Drinks on board are a little expensive. It is a trip you can fit in easily for free

A weekend in Dubai. A more genuine part of Dubai. You met more normal people here, which air think is very nice. In this area you meet the workers coming from other countries and living here now. I liked this so much because of this. Not so fancy but oh so genuine. Me like.

Authentic Dubai. It is worth visiting the Creek to see the working heart of Dubai including many of the boats that travel between there and Iran daily. We took a trip down as far as the floating bridge and back to the stop for the Gold Souk. It would be much better value if there were four or more in your party! If you don't want a private trip, you can get the abra from one side to the other with the locals at 1 dirham per trip.

" Creek Night ". During shopping at Bur Dubai, we got a time to visit at Creek. We took a boat to spent our quality time to travel on the river and looking Dubai lighting and a melodious sound of water. That was a nice experience and must visit place.

Traditional side to Dubai. Pop down if you want to get away from the typical built up area of Dubai.
You can catch a ride on the brightly lit dhows, or have a wander at the cheaper hub of shops where you can pick up souvenirs and imitations.
Beautiful way to see the city at night!. I loved checking out the Dubai Creek on a Dhow Boat Cruise. It had great food with a beautiful way to see the city at night.

Dinner in Creek. I had dinner with cruise ship. Ship was ok, food also. Entertainment nice.
But it's not nice, that some nationalities don't know dining etiquette.

Lovely Creek especially at night. I made a decision to stay at a hotel facing the creek for this very reason.From dusk to night there is plenty of photography opportunities and it's so beautiful with the boats lit up in different colours.We also took the dinner on a boat sailing on the creek and we got very good seats on the upper deck with good view of the other boats and buildings lit up beautifully. We also saw a few cruise ships and yachts belonging to the 'Royal family'.Food on the boat was just so so, but really weren't there for the food so that didn't bother us.All in all we really enjoyed the creek.
old market. all expensive items , enter gold souk , spice souk and so on number of people will come to u for offer , beware expensive market as thet knew its tourist attraction , do bargain a lot

Boat Trip to remember. Just to experience this is amazing. To pay your one Dib Dab is worth every penny. If you have children hold on tight. Health and Safety are not applied here, but it is great fun!!

Dubai Creek – Must Do, Good for a Relaxing Evening. Been here many times and Dubai Creek still has not lost its charm. Apart from taking a leisurely walk with friends or family along the creek (recommended during winter months only), you can take the river/creek taxi to see Dubai from the water. It cost 1 Dirham from one stop to another. Do this during the winter days but also at night as then you can enjoy the beauty of the many lighted buildings (Bastakia Quarter for example) and the lighted fairy-like Dhows (Wooden boats). Also this is a good way to hop-on and hop-off at each stop/station and visit the Gold Souk, bazaars, Dubai Museum, Fort, street food stalls, traditional trading dhows and historical buildings that are along the Dubai Creek. Another transport option on the creek is the waterbus. You also have the option of chartering small (read tiny) private wooden boats called ‘Abra” and they will take you from one end of the Dubai Creek to the other end. The private operators will usually approach you from their boats as you walk along-side the creek. It should cost about 120 Dirham. Remember to very clearly agree on a price before you get on the boat. On the boat ride, consider photographing your reflection on the glass windows of Emirates NBD building (one of the most interesting buildings for a bank in Dubai).
