It seems to be the must do for tourist. Allocate about an hour or more for the boat ride. Careful when taking photographs at certain stretches of the creek (Some have sign-boards to alert you) as photography of some private-homes and Embassy Buildings (by law) is not allowed.Another more ‘expensive’ option to enjoy Dubai Creek is booking onto one of the Dhow Cruises. It takes more than an hour to enjoy the cruise. Comes with dinner and some dhows have traditional belly dancers on it for entertainment. Price varies according to what is offered.Dubai Creek is also a good place to watch the annual New Year eve fireworks display. Just make sure you take the Dubai Metro to get there on ‘fireworks’ days to avoid traffic jams and also as finding parking during festivals at the Creek can be a nightmare.
You have to do it!. Having a trip across the creek on one of the many little ferries is part of the Dubai experience. The journey costs 1 dirham (19 pence).
Average. If you happen to be from a coastal metro city theres nothing new that u are gonna see. The costs are reasonable and things are maintained well.

keeps your eyes busy. Dubai Creek kept my eyes busy the entire time. There was always something to see. Walk along the small arcade at the creek selling fabric and souvenirs, huge plaza covered with a sail. Experiencing strong hot winds. Walk along the make-shift harbour where people dock their boats next to each other unloading merchandise and boxes, walk closer to where the Gold Souq starts and observe all the tour groups herded together. Take the boat to the other side, enjoying the breeze and the view of the different skyline of each side of the river, get off and enjoy the park and older part of town.it was totally different from the image i got when reading the guidebook. Go there early morning or later in the afternoon. There is not much shade.
Take an abra across the creek. It only costs 1 dirham and is a more authentic experience than the modern Dubai. Both sides of creek have older parts of city and fascinating souqs. Be ready to haggle.
Interesting . Its a good place to see maybe once as a tourist. Slight history to it but it's a dirty side of Dubai. Not very clean, it's a good visit if planning to go see spice souk and gold souk.
good to walk along the creek. it is better to walk along it and visit the Heritage Village rather than taking a dining in boat tour and tour along the creek.

Picnic by the creek. I would recommend the Creek Park (entry is only AED 5) for a picnic with a view.
It has a lovely walking path by the creek and special picnic spots with tables and benches and barbecue facilities too.

Fun place for an evening stroll. A nice place to walk around with the kids, enjoying the water front and take a boat across the creek. The price is one dirham per adult, to pay on the boat. In the evening we saw only few tourist. At the end you can go back to your hotel with the Dubai metro.

Dubai Creek Dhows. There is more to this than catching a boat across to the Gold Souk. Avoid the crowds and walk to the area with lots of small boats, negotiate a price for an hour's trip down the Creek. This will take you past the traditional trading Dhows which still trade with Iran and you will also pass the glitzy restaurant Dhows- great for spectacular views at sunset.

Great place for tourists. This is one of my favourite places in Dubai and somewhere I go quite regularly with my wife. It's the more real part of Dubai, no tall high rise blocks and affluence. Lot's of more traditional buildings as well as the old home of the Sheik. The Souq is interesting and you can barter with the vendours quite easily. You can take a cheap and short boat ride (just 1Aed per person) across the water with the Gold and Spice Souq on one side and the clothing Soug on the other. Both are interesting to see. There are some nice restaurants all along the side of the creek and also a few good ones inside the clothing Souq. Early evening is really nice sitting at the restaurant watching the sun set - a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon and evening. When I have friends or family visiting, its a must go to place for me. It's not that old, but then Dubai is only 43 years old anyway, but still interesting to see.

A Wonderful Site To See.. After a wonderful dinner at Sloane's and yes you should try it. I walked along to Dubai Creek on a amazingly cool night and enjoyed to sites and sound of everyone coming and going. That really topped off my day.

Interesting views of Dubai as it used to be.. An interesting area to explore. The Bur Dubai side of the Creek has the scenic textile souk and the Bastakia area. It's also really fun to walk through the pedestrian tunnel under the creek which is next to the Shindaga tunnel. Or cross the creek on an Abra. There is major construction taking place which s a shame.
Good place, vintage Dubai. I took a boat "Abara" with friends and we felt we're somewhere in Istanbul !, Abara, Old Souq, Dubai Musem.

Dubai Creek Abra Ride. You can rent an abra for 120 aed.The trip takes approximately 1 hour.The boat will head towards the floating bridge then head back, will pass the starting point by at least 1km then will go back to finish the tour.There's nothing much to see in the dubai creek aside from the fishing boats and the birds racing just above the water (in the afternoon I guess)The water isn't clear so you wouldn't see anything.I am not sure if it's allowed to eat or drink during the tour, but at least bring water and some snack if you're bring children with you. Be sure to hit the restrooms before since the tour will take more or less 45mins.The boat has life jackets and other flotation devices, waves are not expected except when the tide is coming.Aside from the abras (wooden motor boats ) I've seen a yacht and a speed boat with tourists probably renting them.It was just an okay experience, just enough to give you a small idea about old dubai.

Unexceptional, But Do See The Fort Museum. Not much going on here, really. It's romanticised as a nice place to walk by the waterside and take a small boat across the river, but actually it's dull and the very short boat rides have huge queues. Worth a visit to the Fort and Museum, however, though the exhibits could do with a refresh.The fake-old Bazaar is a nightmare if you're not a fan of heavy sales hassle. There is a nice courtyard teashop at the far end.Tip: travel there on the ferry from Dubai Marina and get a good trip along the Marina's incredible skyscape, around the Palm island and across the front of the Burj Al Arab. It's 50 DH / £10.
Dubai At Night. Very worth doing one of the boat trips late at night. Good food on the particular excursion that we booked and not bad entertainment too.
Especially at night. Very cheap transport across (only 1 AED for one crossing), only short wait for the next abra; very nice at night when lights reflecting in the water
Lovely way to spend an evening. We went on a dinner cruise along the creek and it was a lovely and relaxed evening. I would recommend it for something a little different.

Charming olde world ambience. This area is a must for travellers to Dubai. It is full of hustle, bustle and old world charm, a complete opposite to the brand spanking new gleaming buildings and towers one normally associates with Dubai. You can catch an old fashioned dhow across the creek, an enchanting way to travel with the locals. A great experience not to be missed along with a trip to the old souke.

dhow cruise. Take the RTA operated cruise which starts from Bur dubai side and leave you at marina it takes you out in the sea and you can view skyline from there the private dhow are waste of time they only with in the creek

A Lesson of Opposites. So much of popular culture focuses on the stunningly beautiful modern architecture in Dubai, but going to the creek shows a completely different side. The souks and waterway of old Dubai are charming and fun to wander around in and on. Seeing the skyline from the water gives a whole new perspective to the viewer. Don't visit Dubai without a visit to the creek. You won't be disappointed.
a must do. if your in Dubai its a must Hop on a traditional small wooden boat taxi for about 20p you can cross the creek.

What a fabulous experience. We booked this at the hotel free transport was provided...food was excellent...would highly recommend this....very relaxing..food was excellent quality.....service was excellent....

THE OLD DUBAI WATERFRONT. This is a busy port area with a lot of loading and unloading of goods from barges. It is the old harbour area and is located in the older part of Dubai ( Old Souq) . It is a very busy area and you take a small boat ( Abara) to cross over to Derra - the Gold Souq and the market.
Jacqui. Nice boat trip on the Creek was very relaxing and seeing all the water taxi and incredible buildings

What a Great Place. The Creek is a fantastic place, full of life and lots going on. The water taxis (Abras) ferry you across the creek for 1 dirham or a longer journey costs 4 dirhams just unbelievable value and such fun. There are one hour cruises and dinner cruises available on the creek as well. It's lovely to see where Dubai began and how the creek and city have developed to what we see today. The Sheikh Saeed Al Maktoum House where the former ruler of Dubai lived is now a museum and is situated on the edge of the creek in the Al Shindagha district and is worth a visit.
Fascinating to see where Dubai was born!. An amazing insight into the beginning of Dubai. Lots to see & do, souks, boat trips- a must to go to when visiting Dubai.

A good place to relax . Dubai creek is spread over more than 4 kilometres on both the sides. Deira and Bur Dubai. The creek has in store a lot of attractions viz. Restaurants , cafes, museums, Mosques, Hindu Temples, Abras, fish market and Gold souq to name a few. On a pleasant evening it is the best place to have a stroll. You will find many people have their daily walk or jog. It's also one of the major place for tourists. You will find a lot of activities happening at this place.

Interesting. We spent half a day here and took the boat across to the gold market also visiting the cloth market. many beautiful items on sale and are much cheaper here than in main Dubai. the food and drink also appears to be normal prices. You can cross the water on boats which only cost approximately £1 per person which is very cheap. Lots of people from all over the world which makes it an interesting place to visit. taxis are very cheap to use to travel elsewhere.

Authentic Old world experience. Creek side is a charming old world type of place. It does get hot in the summer months an would recommend visiting in winter (Nov to March) or then in summer after 7 PM. Walk into the old souq (markert place) for a genuine experience

the abra is so cheap and authentic. We crossed the creek on one of the old abras which only cost 1 dirham each for the 10 minute crossing. Very authentic. Later we hired our own abra for half an hour to travel up the creek which only cost 30 dirham each - around £6

"An evening of fun and frolic in the water in the Dhow Cruise". The half a day city tour was over and we were dropped back in the hotel.By 4.00 pm our tour guide took us to the creek where the boat was docked.The boat cruised along the creek and its an awesome sight to see the sky line of Dubai in the twilight on our way to the tip of the sea.The speed of the boat increased as we were nearing the sea.The boat was filled with sound of music,full of fun and dance.We were served with small eats and refreshments with beverages.The cruise was halting at the entrance of the sea for us to have sea view.We were served with a buffet dinner of Indian food, which was very tasty.On the way back to the creek,we had glimpse of an awesome,magnificently lit sky scrappers and the speeding cars of Dubai.We had a unforgettable experience in the Dhow Cruise in the Dubai creek.

Old meets new. For me Dubai creek is a very fascinating place. Very modern office and hotel buildings are mixed with traditional buildings. The dhow harbor still keeps traditional way of shipping alive. No container, but each package loaded individually. Don't miss to cross the creek by an Arba for just 1 Diham, enjoy the very special, historical atmosphere during this short ride. Visit the heritage sites and the souks at both sides of the creek, eat or drink at one of the traditional inexpensive Arabian restaurants located directly at the creek shore. Or book an evening creek tour on one of the converted Dhaka. In any case do not visit Dhubai without visiting the creek.

Classic Creek !!! Brilliant Dubai !!!. In 1970's Dubai was only 3km long village along this Wonderful Creek, now it has developed in to an high tech City which has everything for everyone.We went to this beautiful Creek area on 05th Feb 2016 and enjoyed a lot, Abra's sailing with people was an absolute treat to our eyes, at 7.30pm boarded the Dhow cruise and it was a fabulous experience !!!
Lots of action. A stroll along Dubai Creek is a must for visitors. You can easily cross it using water taxis that are cheap. There are suqs along the street next to it. It's clean and safe.
old city. you pass by the ultra modern city to old city with a boat who dont give you much trust,but is ok.the old city is great

old dubai. cross the creek on a abra or take an evening dinner dhow cruise- this area is the authetical part of Dubai and well worth to explore and get lost in the spice souq og haggle in the gold souq

Lovely Old Dubai. The Creek is amazing. For just a couple of dirhams you can travel on the creek from one side to the other. It's a great experience, to leave behind the towers for a while and see a little of old Dubai. Lots of bespoke tailors ready to copy your favourite clothes. A colourful part of town.
Beautiful. Lovely place to visit in Dubai as there is no so much to visit or any historic monuments. Get to do the boats, something to do on your free time.

Old dubai feel. The creek gives you perfect knowledge of what old dubai was.You can imagine from where to where dubai has grown to in such a small span.Old creek is about taking ride on boat. Getting view on both sides.You can go to old souks like... Gold souk, spice souk and textile souk.It's nice to take a step back in time and visualise how it once was.Th e creek is where all the trade of ones in for offloading and reloading around the Emirates. It is interesting to see the way this is done it is almost like watching a stage performance and with front row seats.

OK, but not that special. The highlight was the huge amount of dows and the simple way of transporting all kinds of goods by sea. The the views along the creek is both modern high rise buildings and Arabian style city.
family trip. we were on the dhow cruise it was an experience. kids found it boring at times. all in all it was nice

interesting history. glad to take the ride in a boat in the creek very interesting history of dubai views were excellent will recommend just be aware they dint serve food only drinks but wish they do food nice to have something to eat while watching the views guys if you visit dubai make sure you go in the boat trip.
Boat trip is OK. Took a boat trip on Dubai Creek - there was not too much to see. Not too sure that I would recommend it.

Fun. This is an old part of Dubai. You can make a short Trip by boat on the creek. It's also meant for crossing to the other part of town. In the surroundings there is a golden & spices souk! Dubai is also very known for selling milk body spray or skin cream. bghour (fragrance for the house) is a typical Arabic smell that you can create at home. These are a must have!!

OK...not a must do. Ok place for a small walk once you are done with Gold souk and Spice Souk. I will not recommed taking those over loaded boat rides. Women should be well dressed in this area as the area seems filled with notorious men.

Beautiful New Year Eve. We visited Creek on NYE and it was dazzling with lights and fireworks. we saw amazing buildings - real human marvels that would inspire you to the core. Lights reflecting in water will give you the best view.

True taste of Old Dubai. The creek gives a flavour of Old Dubai. The Gold and Spice Souks on one side of the river and the textile souk on the other. Dow trips across the river are a great way to travel over the water at the very cheap cost of about 20p per person. A definate must do, in Dubai

Dubai Creek. Took the cruise from Dubai Marina to the Creek - takes an hour and a half. The Creek gives you an opportunity to visit the souks, enjoy traditional eating and take the little shuttle water bus to the other side. All great experiences. You do tend to be pestered as you walk round the markets but don't engage with the sellers and keep walking. Some excellent opportunities to barter for items should you want to buy anything. Well worth a visit.
The best of Dubai. Probably one of the Crown Jewels of Dubai. Old Dubai surrounded by tradition. Souks an easy walk or a short boat ride away from most drop off points

Cross the creek in a little ferry boat. Really unique crossing the creek in a little ferry boat for 1 dirham. Has to be done . Visit the souks and if early the fish market. Amazing experience if you are a foodie!
Great way to see waterfront around the creek. Good commentary pointing out points of interest Regular and on time toilets available on board boats

Historical Water way in Dubai. A whole new idea that will connect Dubai with a new water way from the Burj Al Arab all around Dubai into the Dubai Creek and that shall allow travellers to visit Dubai by Water and cross the peninsular perimeters of the City with their own yachts or sailing boats. The water way shall bring you through the best sightseeing spots and avoid traffic by going by boat.
A boat trip. For a change go on a trip in a boat . We took a small one and had a tour.It was peaceful and relaxing .

dubai Creek. its great. if you wanna see the splendor of Dubai at night then you must take your family or loved one on the dubai creek. its amazing what dubai looks like from the creek with all the fantastic building with there lights shining bright. its for everyone so just go. the inside could get a bit hot so get a booking for upstairs
Peaceful. Dubai creek is peaceful in spite of the fact that it runs through a busy part of town. Worth seeing.

History . It's so nice that Dubai has retained the traditional aspect of its growth and history.It can be hard to imagine the UAE without the impressive skyline and man made islands.It's nice to take a step back in time and visualise how it once was.A great place to visit. Very humbling

Abras on the Creek. There are abras (small boats) that are a taxi service from one side of Dubai Creek to the other, and it only costs 1 Dirham each way. A beautiful view going both directions. On one side is the Spice Souk and Gold Souk, and on the other side you will find the Old Souk. Take a regular taxi to the gold/spice souk, then the abra across the creek to the old souk.

An amazing taste of old-dubai. Dubai creek was a refreshing change amidst our sky-scrapper filled tour of Dubai. After the Deserts and the amazing buildings we went over to Dubai Creek for authentic old Dubai experience.The Creek has a boat service which gets you for a low cost from one end of the creek to another. The calmness of the place was awesome. We also visited the shopping area near the creek which had some great authentic merchandise. There was also the Dubah Sheikh's old house which was worth the trip.There are also amazing places for good sheesha over here. So don't forget to check it out.
Lovely. Had a lovely relaxing night on a river cruise with beautiful meal included. All the boats were lit as well as most of the buildings along the creek. Fully recommend it.
Dubai Creek. An awesome dinner in middle of those buildings... !! You can even enjoy the good cultural Arab dance after the dinner!!

Bur Dubai is just great. Bur Dubai and the creek are great! Walk around and take the small boats connecting both sides. There are some nice cafes along but don't go to far down the creek, they gat very touristy.. Best is the region around the rulers court.

Re inventing the Creek of my past.. I have had spent ten years of my youthful years three decades ago in Dubai. I remember to have spend many of my evenings there in the the creek not only because there were not many places like the Creed those time but, I always got some sort of positive energy while walking not much crowded creek. The abra used to be dangerously crowded and the innocently rude operators used to shout at commuters. My only adventure those days was crossing the abra paying 25 fils to Dubai side and 25 fils back. That was about the past. The creek has changed incredibly but not to my liking. The walk through creek was not as inspiring as before perhaps because there are a thousand other options. But I love my past.

Beautiful experience. I went severely with my friends and cousins.I really like The tour and specially Dhow cruise (Dinner Cruise).It's really cheap with 5 star buffet dinner.Love it and can't wait to go again
A taste of Old Dubai. Do not go to Dubai without visiting the Creek and all the souks on either bank. Watch the dhows loading their cargo, take a crossing of the creek by Abra -1 dirham each way.
Lovely trip over the creek. We travelled by Metro to the creek area then paid 1Dhs (20p) to cross over to Deira by abra. A great experience with a true local flavour. Well worth doing

The Dubai Creek : Très sympathique... to enjoy a walk and some restaurant.... The Dubai Creek : Très sympathique... to enjoy a walk and some restaurant seaside! Lets do it Fun! Take a two hours tour at least and cover the typical souk nearby, as well as the Golden Fish restaurant... Fish and sea food are succulent!
Average average. Dubai Creek & Dhow cruise is Average as far as entertainment quotient is concerned. Far more better can be done.
What a view. When I'm Dubai for more than one day defiantly worth seeing. Few restaurants and bars absolutely breath taking . Try to avoid in summer cause it's simply to hot.

Different. This is a must do in Dubai. An interesting experience of something quite basic. The creek is where all the trade of ones in for offloading and reloading around the Emirates. It is interesting to see the way this is done it is almost like watching a stage performance and with front row seats.The jewel in the crown here are the views across the creek along with the abras (water taxis). These cost all of AED1 which is so cheap it's unbelievable. The views whilst travelling across the creek is quite something.Once across you have access to the suks (markers) which is another must see.

Great photo opps. Taking the water taxi for 1dollar each way is a great way to get across from the museum side to the would. There are some great photo opps of the boats and the waterside. The souks are a bit daunting, with so many men trying to sell you their wares. You really have to know what you want and what you want to pay. There is everything there from scarves to spices, perfume to pans. The gold souk is incredible too.

Abra boat trip is a must. Authentic Dubai. I must place to visit. Very authentic and old feel, and extremely different from the rest of Dubai! Visit the gold and old souk, and you have to the the Abra trips....

Interesting location to experience the "real" Dubai. Great for strolling with the family. The small streets were quite interesting, but it would be have been even more interesting with more art galleries etc.
Great experience on Dubai Creek. Caught Abra to the souk market and the creek reminded me of olden times back in the bible days. You have a chance to see the old parts of Dubai from the water.
Always nice waterside. Visited the gold souk and spice souk area where you are pestered by hawkers continually. It was nice to 'escape' and take a short boat ride on the creek.

Old fashioned dubai. I have lived in Dubai for 20 years and the creek has not changed in all that time. It's a hub of activity with dhows loaded with goods. It's all left on the side of the creek until it is loaded no locked storage no security but nothing gets stolen over night. The fun is to find the most extraordinary items being shipped and these will range from cars and tyres and pots and pans - even toilets! There are cheap cafes along the way to sit end take in the atmosphere or jump on an Abra which you can privately hire for as long or short as you want and peruse the creek itself. We prefer the public abras and usually ferry across the creek to the bur Dubai side and shop at the souq. Barter hard say you live in Dubai as the tourist prices here are extortionate and I would never buy anything at the first price. All the shops sell pretty much the same things so well worth shopping around. A lovely day out ending with another snack at the cafe this side right on the side of the water. Another must that can be done cheaply and if taking the big bus tour is easy to add in.

Old Dubai. Loved this place..way more authentic and old worldly than the rest of Dubai!The Abra trips were so cheap and a great experience.The old souk was gorgeous and very easy to hop across the water and visit the Spice Souk and Gold Souk.Totally recommend visiting this part of Dubai!

It lived up to its reputation. Difficult to find using the Metro but, when we found it, amazed. Trip on a Dhow for 1 Emirites dollar was an unforgettable experience. Crossed the river and went to a restaurant on the other side -brilliant.Near the gold area as well -enjoy, we did.

Dubai creek. I found the Dubai creek fascinating and enjoyable at the same time. The old boats that they use to ferry one across takes you to another time and place. By the way before we crossed the creek we were in a place called Minna. Very nice jewellery shops and cheap. Taking the boat across the creek is awesome and it takes you right to the spice souk which links to the gold souk.

Get a taste of how Dubai used to be. Far away from the high rises this is what Dubai would have looked like some time back. Well worth a trip or two or more. Walking is the best way to take it all in.

Day or night cruise. You can take a day cruise, about one hour. Is very relaxing, knowing that Dubai can make people be tired, sometimes. You will see especially tall buildigs around, but also the old town, on both sides. You can take also a night (evening) cruise, with dinner and this will be more romantic. Good food and good artistic programs.

great spot. This is a great area we enjoyed the diversity here. Museum is well worth a visit very good insight into life in Dubai. Best place was Al Fahidi historical neighbourhood this is a gem not to be missed. Some delightful architectural buildings and very different craft shops unlike souks nobody is in your face selling. Along the creek is a very nice walk.

Real dubai. The moment I entered Dubai I was feeling bad for its artificiality. I thought I couldn't survive in this place for long but thankfully I spent the entire day in Creek visiting Souqs and Museums. I traveled on boat and it was a great experience.

Cruise down Creek on a Dhow with Dinner.. There are approximately 30-40 specially lit (fairy lights overload), which serve dinner (no alcohol allowed). Very interesting cruise watching working boats and water taxis 'avoiding' each other on a narrow creek

Gold!!! Diamonds!! More Bling than you've ever seen!. This a must stop if you are traveling to Dubai. So many shops selling gold jewelry and ingots-- 18kt to 24kt. If you are not used to haggling, prep yourself or you will end up paying more than you should have. The gram price is posted every day or you can ask the shop keeper. Keep that in mind. Labor is very cheap in Dubai so try to get as close to the gram price as you can, allowing for labor and overhead. There also many people offering fake watches, fake purses, you name it. They will hound you!! As long as you know that you are buying fakes is okay. Again, haggle. Be mindful that Friday afternoon between 12 noon and 4pm is the time for Muslims to take a break and many of the shops will be closed. Not to worry, they open promptly at 4pm and continue til 10 pm. The boats across to the Creek are a great adventure and insanely cheap. I loved the ride.
Unique. was nice to see the old dubai- the creek was peaceful in the morning. The abra boats were moving back and forth helping passengers cross the creek for 1 AED each way!

very nice. It would be very nice to have dinner at one of restaurants on the creek or take a ride by boat or even across the creek from deira to bur dubai or vise versa. I recommend for Khan Zaman restaurant on the creek..food is very good and the atmosphere in front of water is amaxing.....enjoy.

This is beautiful setting. I have done a dowe cruise many times & it is the lifeline for trade still to this day. It is still striking to see the water taxi transfer people form one side to the other. It host many interesting places to see along the journey on the Dubai Creek
dhow cruise with dinner. best way to experience the dubai cree is to book a dinner over dhow cruise. Ships hosting buffet dinner over the creek and sailing for 2 hrs.

The Creek.. It's well worth about £20 each for a personnel tour from one end of the "Creek" to the other on one of the many small boats. You see a total contrast between the old and the new. Dhows from 100 years ago to modern skyscrapers. !!Fred and Dawn from Liverpool.
Business. Enjoyed the trips across and the shopping. What a beautiful sight and experience. The service is prompt and efficient.

Excellent Hotel & Location. Everything about the stay was excellent, from check in to the Executive Lounge to concierge who could not do enough to help. Add to the service a great location and this is a must stay!

Don't bother with a boat cruise. The Boat Cruises are pretty dull and boring. I guess if you are travelling with children then perhaps they might enjoy it. The food is very average and the entertainment seems very forced.

See Old Dubai. A visit to Dubai Creek offers a glimpse into the past and how Dubai flourished through regional trading. Crossing the Creek on one of the many abra (small ferry boat) is a great experience and costs only UED1.Along the quayside are many dhows of various sizes, most of which appear to be as old as The Ark and about to fall apart. Laden high with every kind of cargo, they are manoeuvred like chess pieces and with great skill and much shouting.A worthwhile visit and easily accessible to both the Gold and Sopice souks.

A hot spot in Dubai, perfect to chill. Have a beer, have a Shisha, get a few bites from the grill, and just sit end enjoy the sunset over the glowing and glittering skyline of northern Dubai. A perfect location to end a busy day

Romantic Cruise. We did this on one of the evenings. It was a nice 1.5 hr cruise in the night with dinner. There was a dance too which we enjoyed. The food was in buffet format and the quality of the food was good.Ideal for honeymoon couples.

Nice evening stroll.. Nice to see a different part of town. Nice in the evening for a stroll. Also worth finding a spot to sit down and watch the Abra and Dhow go by. Or better still jump on one of Dhows for a ride up the creek.

Most interesting part of Dubai. We stayed in a hotel near The Creek and are glad that we did. The whole area is fascinating, on The Creek there are all types of boats, a ferry crossing costs about 20 pence and you can sit in a cafe by the water and watch the world go by. There are also several souks on both sides that are worth looking at.
Authentic. Beautiful area, full of what you would expect, don't be put off by the constant approaches by the vendors, they are only trying to make a living like the rest of us.

Creek!!. The creek separates old dubai (deira) from new dubai (bur dubai). Lots of people go on this creek for the dhow cruise. This creek is also used from going from deira to bur dubai or visa versa. It looks very beautiful in the night. Lot of top hotels are situated near the creek.

A good thing to see. Dubai creek was used as a port before jebel Ali came and its the creek that separates Bur Dubai from Dera,spend an evening on a boat ride and one can see the sky scrapper sod Dubai
shisha at the creek. had shisha and mint tea at the creekside. it was fantastic. great view and comfortable weather. stayed there for almost 3 hours.

doen!!. a ferry trip on the dubai creek you can do in various ways, for example with the abra, a taxi boat to get you from one bank to the other, for example if you want to to the souk. or with the dhow, a boat on which you can dine and meanwhile speed it over the dubai creek. though discuss! with a bus or boat, with which you can view the sights by road and creek.

Walk or Cruise to see the old Dubai. Dubai creek is still used by traders for ferrying their goods. Its interesting for a stroll to see the old boats being loaded. Then in the evening a cruise down the creek lets you see Dubai completely differently.
1 dollar!. quick, cheap and an interesting ride at dubai creek. not for those who are afraid of water. bring a friend if you are. so they can hold you! :) a must try
O.k. Passed through on our way to the souks, busy with traders in the day and waterside eateries at night, no worries about going at anytime day or night.

The creek is beautiful at night. We saw the Dubai creek during our night on the Dhow cruise. With the December night breeze flowing, and the soft music on the dhow, the lighted creek looked quite beautiful. The buildings lining the creek, other boats and passengers having fun, the soothing mood on the cruise, made it quite the romantic night out for the honey mooners. The Creek is best viewed at night!
cruising on the creek. Old Dubai away from the bling of the newer areas. See people and boats at work. Take a Dowh and enjoy the experience.
A must. Great thing to do whilst in dubia. Busy sort of place but well worth the visit. Temp in January was about 24 so nice for sight seeing x

Bird Show. Main attraction was the Bird Show with well trained Parrots and Kukutos. Children will love to see the birds in action. Well trained staff in making the show exciting. Guests are invited to take part in certain activities during the show. Memorable Bird Show.

Dhow trip recommended. We had a short dhow cruise which was free, as part of our 48 hour sightseeing bus ticket. A good way to see the creek and all the boats, both tourist and commercial dhows. Amazing what freight they can load on the dhows.

Got to try it. . Make sure you are in the mood for haggling as the souk traders will call and follow you. Currently being called Shakira or Angelina Jolie if you are a female lol. Had to be seen atleast once. Take an Abra across the Creek for AED 1. Food alongside the water is pretty good and reasonably priced. It's easiest to get to via metro, swop onto the green line at union or Burjuman and very off at Al Ghubaiba. Have a look at the art gallery which is a left turn out of the metro.

Enchanting. The creek is a beautiful place to visit, night or day. We were living in Sheraton Dubai Creek Hotel and we got to wake up and go to sleep overlooking this beautiful creek. I HIGHLY recommend that you take some time out of your visit to board one of the dhow's and tour the creek at night. It is truly a different experience, one that you will never forget.
Nice walk in places. No trip to Dubai should miss out on this area....nice to walk along and nice to travel by boat on...some nice restaurants along its bank and a few souks too!!!
Night . Had a great night here. My girlfriend surprised me with romantic evening boat trip with dinner. Great night and only around 70aed pp. The boat took us around the creek for around 4 hours.

View was great but food was pathetic.. You can see lot of ships decorated with lights sailing the sea. Great show on the boat. But when it comes to dinner. They do not have much to provide. Veg is impossible to eat just boiled dals. And in non veg only roasted chicken was ok to eat. Some pakora was there to eat too. Can skip this one
beautiful view. the dhow cruise is a great experience, family and kids will definitely enjoy the entertainment on board and the food was good too.

Fascinating area of Dubai -. As my husband works in this area I have visited here probably a few times every month. I find it fascinating as I love to watch the boats that load up their goods for onward journeys. The old wooden dhow boats seem like stepping back in time. You can also see the Burj Khalifa and finance area in the distance. There are not many cafes but you can catch a water taxi onward to the Gold Souk, Old Souk or other destinations. There isn't much to do but it is a lovely area to just sit and enjoy nature.

The old character of Dubai. It's a must visit. Where Dubai grew up. Great experience on the water taxis. Cheap and great scenery and experience, with a local souk nearby if you want a touch of hassle style shopping!
Dhow. We went for a Dinner on the Dhow Cruise. It was really good experience. The food was not that great as I am a Vegetarian but the Boat ride on the creek was worth it.
Nice relaxed evening. Great setting with a nice boat ride. Weather was good when we there. A relaxed evening perfect to see the evening through.
Nice to see :). I saw this on my way to the textile souk. I wish I would have had time to take one of the water taxis.

nice view and nice boat ride. In my visit to Abu Dhabi, Just for a day tour I have visisted Dubai, and I visit Dubai creek after going to Gold souk, very nice view and great boat ride for very less price. All enjoyed this place

A lively historical and authentic part of Dubai. I love the old part of the city. There is so much life and beauty. You can cross the creek using an Abra which is fun to do and has great views of the city. It's beautiful both during the day and at night. I like grabbing coconut water on a warm day and just sitting by the water. Definitely a must see area when in Dubai.

Wonderful Abra ride. If you want to experience the authentic Abra ride,this is the place to go.best place to experience the old Dubai trade.the spice ,textile and of course the famous gold souk are not to be missed
Dinner Cruise. The dinner cruise is a must do excursion. The buffet dinner is excellent and the boat usually has a tunora or a belly dancer for entertainment.

Beautiful!. One must take the Abra or the water taxi if in Dubai to cross from one side to another.You can see old Dubai. The ride itself is a must-do ! It only takes 1AED per person, which is the cheapest thing to do in Dubai ! You can see the skyline and also various big boats and ships from amidst the locals.Cheap and yet worth it :)

amazing night sites. The creek is very busy with the night Dhow cruise. the boats were brightly lit up. in all a great view, quiet relaxing to chill by the creekside and watch the tourists and locals be entertained. The dhow cruise meals was excellent and the entertainment was super, will highly recommend this to famalies travelling.

1st time on the Dove cruise. Travel on the Dove cruise through the creek at night. The lighting truly brings out the beauty of the city. The reflection of the lights on the water is amazing. Awesome experienceLove the surronding
Old Dubai is as interesting or more than New Dubai.. Great walk through Deira and Bur Dubai admiring the old part of the city. Cross the creek on an abra and feel the history of this great place.

Quirky and cultural area. There is something about the creek that is incredibly quirky. I find it a lovely area to stroll through. Catch a dinner on one of the dhow boats or take a water taxi across to the old souk, both enjoyable experiences.

A piece of Dubai history.... Well worth a visit, and make sure you take the boat across from one side to the other...it costs literally pence and is a real part of the local culture mostly dismissed by most tourists.

The beating heart of Old Dubai. A must for anyone new to Dubai, with opportunities to take the open-air abras across the waterway for a few dirhams, or nightly bateaux-mooches with dinner, amongst the wooden ocean-going dhows, and alongside older and more picturesque parts of this trading city. The one part of the city that - nearer the sea anyway - has hardly changed in all the years I have been visiting Dubai.

Cross crossing the creek. Excellent water taxis to cross the creek to get to various interesting places. Great entertainment dow ships on which to enjoy a relaxing evening meal whilst slowly sailing up and down the creek.

Authentic Dubai. I loved the ferry ride across to old Dubai. It's chaotic, messy and colorful. Don't get intimidated by the touts. Just keep walking and have fun taking in the sights. No need to shop here. Visit this place just for the experience
Nice views of city. Creek is best place to visit during evenings... Cool breeze...doing a dhow cruise in the evening during first day is the best way to go on first day after a tiring flight...

Day or night. A visit to the creek is a must. Restaurants and cafes are on the waters edge. Sheikh Saeed Al Maktoum's house is within walking distances. Abras (water taxis) cross regularly or you can hire one for a view of Dubai's history from the water. The Abras take you to Deira from Bur Dubai where the spice, silk and gold souk is accessible. Day or night it is worth a visit.Of an evening the Dhows light up (you could cruise and dine on one if you wanted to) and the surrounding lights make for a surreal experience. Considering the trade that use to and still does take place it is worth experiencing.

Do not miss!. A pleasant walk in a busy city. You may watch the many dhaws(ships) arrived or ready to sail to Oman, Iran,etc. full of merchandises. The tourist port is closed, but you may use the abra to cross on the other side in Bur Dubai.

Meal for 2 . A friend and I ate at the restaurant that looks like a sail and then went up stairs to the open air bar. Both were lovely. The music in the bar upstairs was fantastic like something from cafe Mambo. You have to go!!
Worst place..stinks... Worst place.. It's actually stinks.. If get the place up stairs.. Then it ok.. But don't sit down.. It's better not to go only..

Beautiful!. We went on a cruise as a part of a package with the hop on/off bus and it was incredible! We were there in August so it was extremely hot outside but inside the boat it was cool and the trip down the creek was very romantic!
Stop over in Dubai. We stopped over in Dubai on the way home from Europe. Dubai has a lot to offer. Make sure that you see the local sites, not just those that are `western'.
went there with my mom. went there with my mom and our relatives told as about it in theire prevoius visit saying we should go there.

Traditional and busy. The main souks are on each side of the top end of the creek. The abra are traditional boats that cross the creek and there are hundreds of them. Cost 1 dhs, €0.25. The Dhow trips are fun and the water taxi service to the Marina is a great way to see the whole waterfront

Excellent visit.. Excellent dolphin show and a lot of activities in a very reasonable prices.
Person must visit this place with kids.
Great place to visit day or night. Dubai Creek is a great place to visit for everyone. You take a boat for one Dirham (20pence) across the creek to the gold/spice souks. Well worth the trip.

Very romantic. Dubai creek is definitely the place to visit if you want to enjoy and feel the atmosphere of Dubai.The lighting, which is not too bright creates comfort and romance, which makes you enjoy the environment and feel relaxed.Shisha (I don't smoke it) but I saw many people ordering it, and they enjoy it very much.. A quick service with friendly waiters can make you ordering it ;)The soft music is another good thing which makes you like the environment.Coup de chapeau to all the staff and waiters here, for their professionalism and making the environment as organic as possible
great view. nice, enjoy your night with your love one , with spectacular view , boats and restaurant spread all over the place you can also buy a lots of dubai souvenirenjoy the tea will be the best
wonderful. a river rounding city holding a lot of souks at side to transfer goods and a busy place.I think it is a real observe of Dubai.

Dubai creek. A very busy place, in the evening the Dhows put on their lights, and you can book a meal & a sail in the evening it looked fun, the port in the day is bustling and busy, well worth the visit..

A Must!. Get a sample of Dubai that's not quite as glitzy by traveling to The Creek. The souks are either side and water taxis cross the Creek (cheaply) making access to the area really easy. Also you get to see the creek traffic transporting goods from all over the world, plus this is home to many restaurants which plough up and down the creek at night.

Enjoyable Dhow Cruise. The Cruise is about 2 hours and depending on the Dhow you book, you get the cuisine served as a choice along with entertainment too. It was an enjoyable and slow ride along the creek

night with fun and romantic. we love to visit this area cause it has very nice view w all boats all over the place also love the vendors especially at night it is so romantic , you can enjoy to ride the boat whit very cheap price

Amazing local experience. The creek was artificially created to let the sea water in to make life easy for traders. There are government operated boats that will take you across the river for 1 AED. On the other side are multiple shops where you can get things ranging from spices to gold.

Dhow Ride on the Dubai Creek.. The boat ride was included with Big Bus Tour. About one hour on a old traditional wooden boat converted for tourists. No meal, no show, just the tour. No more ride than cruise and price was included in the Big Bus Tour.The one hour trip brings you inside the Creek but not that far. Pleasant except for the mazout odors from nearby Abra boats.

Experience. Looking round the Spice Souks and Gold souks was an experience. I enjoyed the hustle and bustle of it all. We then went across the Creek in a Wooden Dhow Boat, with approx 20 people on...it was great. Your on for about 10mins and costs 1dirham each and you pay the driver on the boat. Great little trip.

Try it since you are in Dubai!. To see a traditional boats and have a ride on it you can go the Dubai creek and pick of the boats and enjoy the moment with your family our couple...All the taxis can take you there and I beleive the metro as well but I suggest you visit the metro website to check all the liens.Not bad to try it since you are in Dubai, and also nice to take some photos for the memory :)Enjoy it ;)

Busy with traffic. In the evening the Creek is busy with tour boats that make a steady stream up and down the river belching out music. In between the little bras speed along, mixed with various hire boats that ply their trade for around 150Ds per hour. If you want a meal be aware you will be totally unable to do so unassailed by shisha smoke. It is downright unpleasant and I feel sorry for the little children who have to sit in it.
Wonderful place to see the world go by!. Get to one of the restaurants bride the old creek and watch the boats come and go. A sight you will never forget.
Local residence Gathering place. Dubai creek is the place where Local residence all gather to meet their friends and make new friends

Take a trip. We decided to take the ferry bus on the trip from the creek up to Jumeriah and back. The journey takes just over an hour and you get the chance to take in all the sights and sounds of a beautiful city. You access the boat from just beyond the textile souk and the journey costs 50 Dirhams. If you want to do this I would recommend the 5 o'clock sailing as you also get to see the beautiful sunset and also reasonable temperatures.

Great for budget travellers.. The creek is a very nice place to go and see. To cross it is also very cheap. 2dh per person so don't pay more. You will ride in a boat for about 10-15 people. You get to see the creek in all it's glory. Go across to the spice souk and also see where a lot of the spices come into Dubai. Dusk / early evening gives you a different view with lights.

Half day visit or skip it completely. Downtown is hectic and confusing. Our advice is to do 2-3 hour visit, more is not needed. There is gold and spice market with to many street vendors chasing you. Boat ride (with RTA local transport) has short nice ride to the other side of creek where you can visit Dubai Museum.

Excellent . We stayed at the Sheraton Dubai Creek and absolutely loved the location. It's the old town and really the beginning of the modern city that is now Dubai. Great sightseeing from the Gold Souk, Spice souk and the traditional Dhow boats arriving with cargo to unload. The daytime and evening dinner cruises start from this location. There are so many attractions by the creek like the Museum and the Indian souks. You see the sun setting over the skyline of Dubai with the Burj Khalifa in the distance. The locals enjoy sitting by the creek's edge. A great place.

Peaceful beautiful relaxing creek river. The Dubai creek or river as many tourists may call is a relaxing peaceful quiet river boat cruise or walk along the side of the creek. Very active area at night with tourist enjoying the a abundant of boat ride options available to the local and tourist population. Very family oriented and enjoyable atmosphere to get some fresh air and enjoy a peaceful walk in the day and or the evening.

Take a dinner cruise.... nice,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,. I took a wonderful Dinner cruise here on the creek. What a huge creek! I enjoyed seeing the locals travel on the small dhow boats and looking at the beautiful buildings as we passed by. Great way to spend your time in Dubai...
Took a boat ride.. OK but wouldn't go out of my way to do this again. We went via the big bus who said complementary drinks on board but they actually charge for them.
Greek cruise . Here its a good service available of Greek cruise, its available in day and evening also both experience are nice, here is some cargo ships also can be checked

Authentic Dubai. The Creek is a vibrant place by day or night however, parking is a challenge so I would suggest a taxi. A great thing to do is to hire an Abra (water taxi) for an hour trip up and down the Creek for 120 dirhams or you can choose to jump in one to the other side of the Creek with all the other users for 1 Dirham each way. A nice place to grab a drink is the Raddison Hotel overlooking the Creek with a Jazz bar offering great views over the Creek up on the 10th floor. The Gold Souk is a must visit and runs parallel to the Creek, a great way to experience the haggle factor in a very safe and fun environment. The Dubai Museum is also worth a visit. A great way to spend time seeing Dubai's roots and having time off from the skyscrapers and shopping malls.

We didn't do this on our first visit to Dubai and regretted it!. One dirham ...about 17p .....to cross the creek together with about 20 others ..... (A private tour up the creek would have been available for about 120 dirhams). Just queue and climb onto the next available Dhow.... our trip was around 15 minutes each way and to be recommended ...best value ever! So glad that we finally made the trip this visit!!!

dhow cruise and dinner booked by sun city tours. we were picked up early by sun city tours and visited the city sights yacht area famous marine beach dipped our feet in. viewed atlantis and other famous hotels. tour of various palm developments. sun city throws in a tour before taking you to the dhow that tours the creek and whilst you have a beautiful buffet supper. lovely sights and sounds. thank you sun city tours for a fantastic arrangement to pick us up and drop us ladies back as well as the lovely tour of the marina. god bless you both sonny and sanjay until we meet again in dubai

Pleasurable trip. The DHow cruise on the Dubai creek is a great experience. They serve you traditional Arabian food as well. The icing on the cake is the wonderful Tanoura dance performed by skillful artists

Dhow cruise falcon oasis . Booked a trio through Groupon. Took a while to locate my dhow cruise but it was worth it. Entertainment was on but food wasn't that good and enough. they should have arranged the queue system better, let a few tables go get some some food and then the rest of it. But I didn't pay a fortune for it so it was good.

Nice place. We went to Dubai Creek to crossover to Meena Bazar from Gold Souk. The shortest distance between two is to take a ferry on the creek. The charges for ferry are very reasonable that is One Dirham per person. You dont need to buy tickets and there is a conductor collecting fares on the ferry. From the ferry you can get a nice view of the creek and the surroundings.
good for a long walk. this area is buzzing with people taking ferry bus/boat, its a good walk around in the evening and must see the life around it

A dhow ride down the memory lane!!!. The creek is where it all started for this ever evolving city. You can get mesmerised by the hustle and bustle of the trade activity which ensued the creation of this modern marvel called Dubai. The dhow cruise is a must. The dhow dinner cruise is not going to leave you with any feeling other than elation. The walk along the creek allows you to absorb the local history. It's dotted with souks, malls and hotels each competing for your attention. Take a dhow cruise at sunset. You will see the whole skyline get lighted up as the sun disappears below the horizon.

Quick ride across the creek. Visiting the abra, while in Dubai is a must! Both at night and day as you will experience different views and excitements about the same place. It's a bit chilly at night though and noisy, but it's worth it as it doesn't take long to cross the creek. There are markets on both sides of the creek.

Sense Sensation. Doesn't matter how you cross Dubai Creek, there is always plenty going on. From ferries to floating trading ships the creek is busy but intimate in that people pass close to each other take the time to smile and wave. A great way to reach the amazing souks selling spices, gold, diamonds and textiles. If you're lucky a hint of a breeze in summer may cool you a little. But if nothing else cross the creek in a craft for the sheer bombardment of your senses: the bustle, the aromas, the languages of many cultures, the colour and the heat. It's a sense sensation.
Romantic place. The creek is a wonderful place for a dinner cruise! Many ships are available! Guests can enjoy the lights of nightly Dubai and nice shows in board!

Little more authentic than the rest of Dubai. We enjoyed Dubai, with it's skyscrapers, many restaurants and shopping malls. However, if you're looking for somewhere a little more authentic, then this is it. We spent an enjoyable late afternoon/evening strolling around. We then took the small boats on hand to go across the creek (very cheap at 1 Dirham). The souks weren't that impressive (quite a few things from China in my opinion). Lots of eateries to try. A pleasant way to while away a coupe of hours.
Romantic place. The creek is a wonderful place for a dinnercruise!Many ships are available! Guests can enjoy the lights of nightly Dubai and nice shows in board!

A must-see in "old" Dubai. We did a Big Tour bus trip to "old Dubai" and the Dubai Creek was one of the sights along the way. What a beautiful experience to put Dubai's history into context - especially because we had only stayed in, and seen, the "new" part of Dubai (Jumeirah Beach The Walk, Dubai Marina etc.) This is a MUST see for anyone visiting Dubai.
GOOD EXPERIENCE - NIGHT EVENT. Taking a cruise with dinner, is a better option, for one to see the splendor of Dubai creek. It will be an enjoyable evening with family

DUBAI CREEK . Dubai Creek tour was OK, but it only last for and hour or so, but the meals on board the boat were excellent and the light entertainment that comes with the package was quite entertaining

Night Boat Ride!. If you want to see Dubai skyline by night and from the water then this is for you. Don't be foolish to pay alot for a tour. Just go to the creek (near the Dubai Museum) and negotiate with one of the captains. An under-rated adventure.
Tourist Attraction. Visit the Dubai creek for a local experience. The architecture of the local souq is attractive and authentic. You may even find some bargains.

Radisson blue dhow dinner cruise Al Mansour. Had an amazing evening aboard Al Mansour dhow last night
Food and service excellent company good when choosing a dhow cruise I would recommend this one anytime
Amazing. Amazing place! If it is not too hot it is great to eat outside in on of the cafes, the view is great and it is a bit different Dubai than usual skyscrapers and so on.
Dubia creek. Loved ibeing out and about down by creek much prefer it to beach hotels, lots more to see and do, really clean and good to get out of hotel environment.

Beautiful View At Night. The best way to enjoy Dubai Creek is by taking the Dhow Creek Cruise at night. Dhow Cruise by Rustar served 5star cruise with buffet dinner, so you can enjoy the view while having your dinner.
Good place in Dubai to visit. This is in the center of Dubai so when you are on shopping or just visiting Mina Bazar, you can cover this location.

Charming!!. My wife and i experienced the Dubai Creek as part of our Dhow Marina Dinner Cruise on Xmas Day evening.
The cruise was relaxing and sailing across the creek was charming and romantic. Its worth a visit when in Dubai.
Excellent view. There are a lot of ships on the Dubai Creek which serve you food on the ship. You can walk along the creek and enjoy the view.

Lovely area. This are is perfect to stroll around. There are tons of shopping and things to see n both side of the creek. We went to the Gold And Spice Souk on the Diera side. Then went to Meena Bazaar and Dubai Museum/old town on the the other side. Be prepared to walk a lot and spent a few hours
Romantic . Beware if you go into the souks as the hassle you constantly . Eat local food if you can street food is fantastic

Don't miss the 1 dirham boat. Best time to visit the creek is by the end of the afternoon, that's when the light is the best. Take the small boats that get you across the creek for only one dirham. The view is very nice and the depart near the souks on each sides of the creek.

Not enjoyable. Our group went on a Dhow Cruise on Dubai creek the night before our departure. I felt that the place was jam packed for comfort because the tables were arranged rather close to each other. It was also dizzying and uncomfortable to line up for a buffet dinner while the boat was already on its way. The queue was long and we were already hungry. The food was also average and we could hardly see the sights outside the windows of the boats because it was already dark and there was no one to explain the sights that we were supposed to watch out for. Other than that, when it was time to have the entertainment numbers, the others in the group had to move back, their tables had to be removed to allow space for the performance.
Dhow cruise at Dubai creek. - Lights decorated cruise- Friendly & warm welcome by staff- Foods are 4 star rated- Dance show or magic show

Interesting and worthwhile to visit. It is definitely worth a visit to old Dubai and the creek.We spent a few hours walking around the old buildings close to the creek which give you an idea of how things used to be. Some are now galleries, shops and cafés - worth a look.Then we got on a boat to cross the creek to head to the gold souk. Boat ride cheap and a good experience.

Great views of Old Dubai. The Abra Cruise is a great way to see Old Dubai, the docks and also see the new developments that have taken place along the creek. The Abra Cruise takes about 1 hour and costs about 120 to 150 DHMs and is really good value for money
Old abra taxis!. Old abra taxis! This is the thing worth to come. Costs only 1 AED per pax but u can try which it seems to be a bit locals and not so superficial like rest Od Dubai attractions ;)
Very nice - Historic - The "Real" Dubai. Take an Abra Taxi accross the Creek. Visit the Souks down little alleys. Excellent. Looks completely different at night because of all the neon.

Great experience. We booked a sail trip of 2h in Dubai creek with a travel agency.. A driver came to pick us up from the hotel to the "harbor".. The boat was full but every one had enough space to see the surrounding area.. It was a short cruise but it was excellent m

SO STUNNING!!!!. Dubai Creek is one of the most amazing creeks I ever visited. We spend our honeymoon in Dubai and didn't miss a chance to book a ride on one of those amazing wooden boats. As it was dark outside in the evening, you could perfectly see the Burj Al Arab Building lightened up and changing colours. It was so romantic and beautiful and breath taking. We enjoyed every minute of the ride. Hopefully we soon visit beautiful Dubai again.
Bit of history . Loved this old part of Dubai. Fantastic food served along the Creek much cheaper than we found in the marina or JBR. The Heritage Centre is also worth dropping through.
River cruise. The cruise around the creek was good as it gave you a better perspective of the city and life on the creek.

lovely place to visit. and get some feeling about old dubai :) when you go, take the boat across the river. and eat in ugly restaurants - they usually have much better food than the nice ones by the creek :)

I'll go again!. The dubai creek is a beautiful old sight in dubai. What's more interesting is that one can cross the river using the water taxi for just 1 dirham per person. Just queue up before the deck and the boat handler will arrange the boat for everyone.

Nice place to walk, to know the culture of Dubai. Crossed the creek by boat, which cost very little. Best evening spot to spend some time with your loved ones. Its a cultural walk as well to understand Dubai's rich and beautiful culture.

Dhow Cruise among the city skyscrapers!. This is a must when in Dubai! We took a Dhow Marina Dinner Cruise that took us up and down the creek with spectacular views of some of the buildings that make up the Dubai skyline. The cruise is aboard a dhow in which you are served a buffet dinner. I gave this review a 4 because of the food that is served. If you like Indian spices then you will enjoy the meal. However, if you are not a fan of curry and other spices then you will not enjoy the food that is served. There is rice and salad, but the main food items include these spices. If the food was better, then this review would be a 5.The cruise itself takes about 3 hours and it is relaxing and a unique experience and different perspective of the city. Get your cameras ready and sit back and enjoy this marvelous city and ponder on how it was built and developed! Truly amazing!

Hire a boat. Worth, as we did, asking for a round trip when crossing the creek on the little ferry boats. Gives you nice skyline views and a pleasant breeze. Cheap, and who doesn't like a boat ride as a tourist?
1 Dirham to cross the creek. unique experience with very low cost. you can get from either side for 1 Dihram to another side. many boats are running between.

Nice walking. Dubai creek is very typical and contrast with the modern city,have a nice walk and choose from the boat restaurant hanging there,lot of them are sponsor by hotel so food is good,negociate the price,see all the boat loaded with different goods ready to leave for nearby India and Iran,you can walk late it is very safe,try a ride on the creek by boat and discover another view of the city!

Relaxing and cultural. having crossed the creek by boat which cost very little we wandered around the spice markets and along the port looking at the boats bringing items in for sale.. we then were offered a romantic trip around the creek for £20 in a small boat .. it was early evening so sunset was close which made this even better. the lovely chap that took us explained what all the building were it was an amazing experience

Great fun. Definitely worth taking a creek crossing on one of the old commuter boats. They are incredibly cheap - a matter of only a few pence. It's a great place to view the hubbub of the old part of town. Restaurants and cafes can be accessed along the creek and if you have the time it's with getting on and off at different spots.

sometimes suffer from the outlet of the "old" ships but take it gladly. nice area, nice restaurants,no cars or sometimes suffer from the outlet of the "old" ships but take it gladly.in the evening it is nice fun on one of the terraces

Quaint and cultured . If you want to find out what old Dubai is like head to bur Dubai and take a walk down the creek past the abra boats and dhows to the Dubai museum. We stopped off for lunch at the Arabian tea house down the road too which was lovely.
Interesting place to visit. Wen enjoyed wandering around the walkway at the Dubai Creek. Be sure to take the dhows across the creek to the other side for a special, local, cheap experience.
traditional. It show you a different side of dubai, not so high and very popular, go area to go and get souvenir and all from therere
Taste of "old dubai". Get away from the new buildings, take an Abra down the creek and see Dubai from a different angle of one of the boats that have been plying their trade for years,
Take the transport across the creek. This is a fun experience. There are many boats traveling back and forth and it gives you a unique view of the old city from the water.

See the dhows!. Always interesting to visit The Creek, either for a ride on a water taxi, visit the nearby souks or just to watch the dhows being loaded with a myriad of things, mainly going on a short trip to Iran

Must do!. For 1 Dihram, the water taxi is a great way to get to the spice and gold souks from the other side. I went during the afternoon, so I had the pleasure of catching the sunset as the boat powered across. It's a great way to see Dubai in a different light, and I just really enjoyed feeling the breeze, whilst soaking up the winter sun. I definitely recommend it to everyone - it's not everyday you can take a water taxi!

Must see for the real Dubai. Visitors to Dubai see the big sights and visit the shopping malls, but for a real insight go for a boat trip along Dubai Creek. You will see palaces, minarets and expensive big motor yachts and the south shore, contrasting with the working boats, tourist launches and skyscrapers on the north bank.

Nice creek view in night time !!!. We booked Creek view dhow cruise with my family of 9 including 4 adults and 5 children. we 've been offered a welcome drink on arrival. Friendly staff. Vice colourful view of creek. Food was ok, not to our expectation but enjoyed Tanura dance and magic show.

Visit the old City. Did a trip on the Creek for a Dirham each way as it has been traditionally done for years. The Souks were ok but felt a little harassed when the shop keepers are trying to sell their wares.

Night paradise..... I took this Dubai creek journey through Abra in the night. For a short journey ,1 Dirham is charged. But seeing Dubai in the night time through Abra was a amazing experience. It is to be experienced. It is a Wow......
All the best tourists....and enjoy...

Walk and boat ride. Wonderful area to walk and situated between the markets on both sided of the creek. Great area to walk through even if people can get annoying with trying to get you to buy stuff... A lovely view of the cruises with their lights on the creek.Take the small wooden boat over the creek if just to say you went on it or for the other creeks markets and walking appeal.
Amazing nightout. We had a Creek Cruise on the dhow, and it was a beautiful evening well spent, with a nice weather, beautiful music and amazing food. Magic show & Tanura dance for the kids.
Nice Place. Nice place to visit to really feel old Dubai culture & values , looks very sacred , another place to spend time peacefully

Go on a boat to see nice views. Dubai is not a beautiful or old city so it was nice to find an area which seemed more historic and genuine with a nice local boat ride and pretty views across the river. The boat costs only 1 Dirham and takes about 5-7 minutes. It is a very easy and a local experience. We found a lovely restaurant for lunch right on the water's edge by the Abra station. It had lovely views, food & good service.
Take a Abra across the Creek. Its cheap pay on board & regular Abras leave we went from Gold Souk across to Museum area Loved it as go along the Creek lots activity & good photo shots
Nice spot a bit "old" Dubai. It's nice to spend a little time here - grab an abra, have a drink or some food at a restaurant near the water side
very cool. ride the water taxis for 1 Dh, awesome fun! Shop the soukhs and have fun. Gold Soukh nearby. cool souvenirs and have fun haggling.

leisure stroll. This lovely stroll around the harbour creek is approximately 7 km. and coffee shops and restaurants as well as hotels surround this area. from simple coffee to gourmet meals, this place offers it all. many photo opportunities, as well as a chance to take a ride on one of the various sail trips. you can easily spend the day and night here.

The Heritage Dubai. The mixture of the past with a modern life is side by side on this part of Dubai Creek, in the early days, years ago all the trade use to come into Dubai via the Creek, I believe it was until the 60th from the last century the main port of import and export of Dubai, along the creek you will see lots of merchandise loading and unloading from the dhows, just take walk alongside the dhows. In the past was the fastest and cheapest way to cross the water to other side by abras back and onward across the creek. Across Bani Yass street along the Creek you will be in the bazar and spice market.
Awesome Experience. I went to dubai and my hotel was near the dubai creek. It was a fun experience using the boat just to go to the other side of creek

feel the old Dubai. For 1 Dirham you can come aboard, but you can also rent the boat for 120 AED for a tour around the creek. This is real old fashioned tourism! A good alternative after seeing all the modern Dubai buildings.
Interesting perspective of Dubai, worth a visit.. We walked all the way to the fishing museum to find it closed during the day on a Friday :-) . The water taxis are very cheap.
good spot. old dubai and not as nice as the marina. You can find the different souks here/ gold, textil and spices. Be aware that its a market and they can be a bit on you when you walking around.

An interesting part of Dubai. There is a lot of activity along the creek and it's interesting to walk alongside the dhows. We took abras back and forth across the creek, which was very cheap and fun! Mixing with the locals!

Charming part of the old city. Make sure you explore the souks on both sides of the creek: take the 30 cents water taxi and be prepared to photograph the swarm of pigeons accompanying your short crossing.
Unique views . I like this place in dubai; it has many places to stay in and many views for taking photos. It is one of the best water views in dubai to do many activities.

Beyond All Expectations. After a very tiring journey we arrived at The Park Hyatt Hotel in Dubai City, very late. The staff welcomed us with smiles and got our luggage to our room without delay. The room looked perfect, it was after midnight and there on the bath were bath salts and a candle. The perfect start! I lit the candle, had a hot bath and followed it with a great night's sleep.I guess you can relate to the fact that sometimes when you stay in a hotel you look around and wish you had someone else's room but no, not this time! The next day we looked around, our room was perfect - two balconies - one with a table and chairs and the other with our sun beds. Both overlooked a lovely marina - it was all so very peaceful.From our first breakfast in the buffet restaurant right through to the end of our holiday, the staff greeted us with smiles and absolutely nothing was too much trouble. There were cereals available, continental breakfast and if you wanted the hot breakfast it was made to order and served very quickly.The complex is large as it includes a golf course so it's quite a long walk if you want to visit the shopping centre - no problem! - just mention it to the staff and a unique little car awaits you without delay and you are driven down to the main entrance as part of the service.If you play golf, you will find that it's quite busy but you will also find that you are made to feel very welcome by staff who only want to be reassured that you are enjoying the course.

A park.. Large park with an entrance ticket. Unhelpful staff. Understand entrance for wheelchair users is free but we had to pay. To access the dolphinarium, the bird show and other activities to have to enter through the gates of this park. Tickets are 5 AED per person. Saw lots of people carrying barbecues, takeaway pizza etc. Dont know if officially barbecues are allowed.
Bored during the ferry ride. The ferry went around the creek and it was just buildings after buildings. There was nothing that really stood out.
Must see. We took a one hour boat trip and also hop on hop of bus tour around the creek. There are many interesting historical monuments, bazaars, boats and activities around the creek.

Old Town Dubai. My favorite neighborhood in Dubai. This is the original Old Town from the beginning of the city when it was a cross roads for caravans and camel traders. Both sides of the Creek are atmospheric Bur Dubai and Deira. Eat and sleep here.
Relaxing dhow cruise. We did the dhow cruise, with a dhow for ourselves for 45 minutes or so. A little expensive but very relaxing and nice views of both sides of the Creek.

Experience the culture of Dubai through its creek. It's not just a creek, it has traditionally been a conduit of what Dubai would become. It divides Dubai into two fascinating parts and has culture spread on both the sides that you cannot experience elsewhere. There are many attractions along the creek for the willing, but it's a must see for anyone visiting or living in Dubai.

Ever Changing. I loved hanging out by the creek. If I wanted a busy day I could cross it in an Abra to access the souks but if I wanted a quiet and relaxing day, I could sit in one of the restaurants along the creek and enjoy a leisurely long lunch. One of my favourite places.
One of a Kind!. Awesome! Great view of stunning Bury Khalifa!Waking up to such breathtaking view .I would definitely recommend Hilton Creek Dubai to any one visiting Dubai.

One more boating - not a great experience. If you are in Dubai do not waste time on this. instead you could spend time in a good pub or plan a activity instead of wasting time on this. Not so great food and entertainment on the boat. I would not suggest to waste money and time on this.

Must-Do Boat Trip. You must take the small boat across the Dubai Creek over to the Souq (market). This is like the Star Ferry in Hong Kong in terms of tradition but a lot smaller! Boat trip is about 15 min each way. Great at night with all the lights.
Good old days. While using the "ferry" to cross the Creek it seems vers old ships, even they are outrages, are still in full use.
Very pretty. Dubai Creek is well worth a visit. The waters are very pretty and there is a nice wind around the area.

Really lovely way to spend an afternoon....... We got the water taxi round to here and then disembarked for a wander, light lunch and drinks on the creek.... nice bustling market as well and really traditional feel to the area. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Sat and watched the world go by at a waterside bar/ restaurant....

The heart if city. Dubai greek reminds me of the old days . I like to drive around there .. You can find old hotels and new hotels .. Old souk is close by and malls not far away. It always nice to go there
Beautiful !. The sites of this place is breathtaking. It is beautiful and a great place to stroll and chill out in the evening with friends or loved ones. Worth a visit when in Dubai.

Dinner on Board. We booked a dinner cruise on board to sail this Creek.Its more a river cruise, but the food fails in comparison to the sight seeing... if only they provided us the local cuisines., & since it is the Creek, seafood could be a main staple.We saw fishing boats moored, poured out its catch & selling them to the locals.....maybe this could be a better tour visit activity. It could be a natural tourist gathering point.
Worth a go.. Had a boat trip up and down it, moved very slow, to be honest not that interesting but some things you do because there there.
The boat is so small. The boat is so small that I am so worried that it will capsized. However, overall experience was great.

Explore Old Dubai. Every visitor must walk down the wharf area of the creek. The dhows and buildings along the creek lets you imagine how Dubai was like half a century ago. Taking the abra for 1 AED or the more expensive dhow cruise will transport you to a time when Dubai was a busy fishing/pearl market and trading port.

A great contrast to other parts of the city. A night here will change your impression of Dubai. Not really that much more "authentic" or older than the make-believe areas in other parts of the city, but the mixture of people, the boats and the water and the reconstructed waterfront makes this one of the most charming experiences in Dubai
did not meet my expectations. i was planning on getting all my souvenirs there, however people were overwhelming, too pushy and it was not pleasant to walk there. I did not buy anything.
a true dubai experience. We took the water taxi from the creek to the spice souk.. on a hot and a humid day the peaceful taxi ride brought cool breeze and a refreshing break for us..

The other side of Dubai. Was taken here by my friends who live in Dubai. We parked up one side and took an Abra to the other side of the creek, we had a pint in the oldest hotel in Dubai (Ambassador) the pub in there is very good offering what was probably the cheapest beer I had in Dubai. From Dubai Creek it was a short taxi ride from there to the looky looky market which like every night market needs your best and most determined haggling before you buy anything. The highlight was the short trip on the Abra over the creek

Beautiful creekside. The creek side is very beautiful during the evening and night time. The place gets to be very lively. You can find the creekside restaurants to be full with customers. There is a boat ride than one can take, which shows two parts of Dubai. Overall its a pleasurable experience.
Perfect evening experience. Many shops, restaurants, and dinner cruises to keep you busy for a couple hours. Do t forget to try an avocado shake when your there
Great boat trip. Went on boat for dinner,very nice and the night cruise was lovely ,great at night with everything lit up ,plenty of shops and restaurants
Pleasant cruise and a water taxi. It was fun to cross the creek in a water taxi for just 1 dirham. Brings you to Gold souk from Mina bazaar. The dinner cruise was fun.
