Old city. The city of dubai is separated by a river and the name of the old part is dubai Creek. It's a good place to find cheaper hotel and also is a good location to take the subway
Stunning View. One of the hot travel spot. You have to visit at night so you can see the river banks are light up really colorful. Also don't forget to have a boat ride. You gonna love it.
Golf. Great golf course withh great facilities. Wonderful food and beverage choices and great memories to take away particularly the last two holes.
Go on a Dhow boat. A relaxing trip on a Dhow boat is a great way to see this area. Good commentary, seeing old and new. Authentic boats and a lot of history on the sides as you pass by.

Calm and charming place. Once we visited the creek park the weather was 23 cc and by itself it doubles the enjoyment of such a calm place with tall and quite old palm trees beside the creek.The beach was such silent that we heard the sound of fishes coming out of water to catch flies. We were surprised that the whole park had a wifi coverage which worked good and also the experience of touring the park with bicycles doubled were really nice.The entrance fee were 5 dhs per person and the park has four entrances.The bicycle rental and the dolphinarium is placed at the first entrance.If you remt a bicycle you should come back to the 1st. entrance.It was a good experience for us.

Old Dubai. Wonderful experience at the old Spice, Jewellry and material Souks in Dubai Creek, plenty hustle and bustle but not intimidating, well worth a visit whilst in Dubai, complete change to the 5 star beach resorts. Taxi from Jumeriah / Palm approximately 70 UAE dirhams.
Dubai Creek. I really enjoyed smoking sheesha by the creek. The creek side open restaurants are very nice. You can eat, drink, relax!!
Peaceful walk. Walking besides the creek, during sunset watching beautiful yachts and buildings is really romantic experience

Easy & fun transportation to hop around the souks. It only takes one UAE and very easy and frequent service across the creek. We used it form old souk side to spice souk side and it was about 5min ride or so. Easy and good way to feel Dubai's old city.

Nice experience in old Dubai!. If you want to experience Old Dubai, going to Dubai Creek is the best you can do! Beware of the heat, in summer it's better to go there after sunset because it can get really warm. Take the abra from one side to the other of the creek, it's only 1 dh!

Oldest part of the city.. This is indeed a part of the old city and actually the creek which connected Deira and Dubai. Deira is the old city along with Dubai. You can find boats here and can cross the creek by paying 1 AED per person. You also get to experience the so called Dowh Cruise here at the creek during the sunset. Pretty nice place to visit.

Dhow cruise a must!. Had my birthday meal on an older traditional dhow! Treated like royalty. The food was plentiful, well presented and delicious. It was a great way to see the setting sun whilst gliding through the creek. Information was given about landmarks along the creek, old and new. To see old Dubai was very informative.
Nice. Found this place more by mistake than anything else.Very pleasant on a hot day as there seems to be a nice cooling breeze there

Weired zone. We went here to see the gold souk abd it was +- 7 pm. Oh my God, lots of people trying to sell you watches, shirts, bags, and everybody looking at you, they were even looking to my daughter with 5 years old. I really didn't like it.

An unforgettable dinner. The crossing of the Creek from/to Deira and Bur Dubai is very cheap with the traditional public transport ship, the abra. 1 AED. The board of the Creek is also interesting. There are very good restaurant near the water.

Fun to walk around and for an abra ride. The creek is fun to take an abra ride for ~3 dihrams to go from one side to another. Get to see a few birds, plus generally fun to walk around on the sides while checking out the shops and restaurants.

Must Visit!. This is a very different area to the modern day Dubai, it is a working dock with small and large boats bustling up and down the waterways delivering everything from fridge freezers to the finest spices. We got an Abra from one side of the creek to the other costing a total of 1AED (18pence) to the Deira Old Souk Station where the Gold Souks, Spice Souks and Perfume Souks are located, these are not to be missed and should be explored! We then got an Abra back to Bur Dubai Station.
Worth a visit. An interesting area to visit in Dubai, showcasing some of the city's history. Great views of the creek, don't forget a trip on an abra.
Great views . Lovely to see some of Dubai's heritage. Good creek cruises and nice to see the super yachts. Easy walk to the gold and spice souk.

Last little piece of historical Dubai. This part of Dubai should definitely be visited!!! It is supposed to be the last little piece of historical Dubai containing heritage buildings, a souk, museums, small restaurants, art galleries and a gorgeous view over the busy creek which can be crossed for a small fee with "abras" (water taxis). On the Deira side you can see all the old arabic Dhaus (wooden sailing ships), unloading their freight. If you seek for Dubai's history this is THE place to go to!!! on the negative side I have to mention the beautifully reconstructed souk where the shop owners (hawkers!) are actually a disturbance, throwing so called "pashminas" round your neck to encourage you to buy it even if you don't want to and bothering with other stuff. this has considerably changed over the last 10 years when nobody disturbed you once walking through the souk and you could easily browse through cloths, silk, shawls, spices...any way some people might not experience this as a disturbance!

Do not miss this while in Dubai. A Dhow trip at the creek is a lot better then the Marina, during the less hot time of the year its good to be there during the day or night, and in summer only take a dhow trip in the evening.

This is real Dubai - must see. If you visit Dubai and never make it to Dubai creek you have not in my opinion visited Dubai....certainly not the original trading citySome of Dubai creek is under construction but what remains is greatEverything from a Dhow water taxi - worth w ride even if you don't need/want to get acrossIt sits adjacent to the spice and gold soul both of which are also a must visit for DubaiYou can pick up river cruises and excursions here or just walk though and experience the sites and sounds of old traditional Dubai trading capital
This is a must!!!. It's so nice view there, and really good restaurants. Go there on the evening and don't forget the camera.
Not to be missed. Take the Metro to Al Raz and visit the Spice Souk and the Gold Souk and the Perfume Souk. Look out for the old Museum depicting life as it was, very interesting.

Just do it. Watching Dubai creek and wooden boats crossing the creek really gave a good picture of what old Dubai would have been like. It was a refreshing and different experience from urban, glitzy downtown. The view from the creek was beautiful and it costs close to nothing. Pls don't miss it!

Fun shopping. I enjoyed crossing dubai creek in a small wooden boat. The shopping was fun. I purchased some pretty scarfs, a leather camal for my son and Frankense to burn at Christmas. Definitely worth the trip
Cross the water on an abra. Great area on both sides of the creek. Interesting souks are close by on each side. Only cost 1 dirham to cross over.
old fashioned. we practically recognised everything back fm 1982/83 - well, nearly.... just a good attraction, old fashoned , Water Taxi just for fun. Souk surrounding very entertaining.

Experience the Dubai Creek with a Dhow.. Be sure to make the effort to take a night dhow ride along the Creek. With most of them a dinner is included in the price. Double check trip advisor reviews, otherwise you might land up feeling robbed as a tourist like I did. The views what we had cruising along the Creek was fabulous, but all else about the dhow ride was disastrous. Check my review on this.
A must to travel across. We crossed the creek to the gold soul on a water taxi for one dirham. There are lots of boats to see and another excellent photo opportunity.

Old town Dubai / Souq. So this is where the old souq and gold souq is located. It was an interesting walk around - the gold shops are out of this world and a must see but over all less than impressed versus other souqs I have been in (Istanbul and Marrakesh)

See something of Old Dubai on the way to nearby souks (markets). The banks of the Creek are where Dubai originally started, as a fishing port then trading port and then pearling port. Before oil was discovered, it was the creek which gave Dubai its wealth, so much so that the creek was dredged to enhance its attraction as a port. With pearling & fishing gone and containerisation taking port activities to the artificial harbour on the coast, the Creek now serves mainly the tourist trade. While not a lot of the old buildings remain, the water activity gives some idea of the old trading days. On the southern side of the creek is the historic district of the fort now housing Dubai Museum. It is a short walk from the museum to the local souk in a strret on the river's shore, selling souvenirs mainly. Then catch an abra (small boat) across the creek to its northern shore where a short walk away are the Spice Souk & the Gold Souk. An option is instead of the 1 dirham ride across, to hire an abra for an hour's private tour of the whole creek. We did the latter and found it to be worth the expense to see Deira from the water, as well as the various boats docked, both cargo & leisure.Be aware though that abras going to specific places leave from specific docks. Each dock is govt run with an info office which you can interrogate to make sure you are at the correct abra station for your intended destination across the river.All of the above can be done in a day with the souks open until about 10pm. All of the above-mentioned attractions are seperately reviewed by ourselves if you are interested.
Great at sunrise. Do the Dubai Creek Half Marathon in December for the best tour of the creek. It's lovely watching the sunrise while running. The 6am start is less fun!
Didn't do it for me. Tricked half way across town to this recommended attraction but I found it very overrated. Full of fake handbag sellers if that's your Bag
Great way to experience old Dubai. We went there at night and had a lovely traditional meal and smoked a sisha. Great views at night of the riverboats/ferrys. Open till late and offers shopping.
Good views. This is a very touristy area, but does show off what dubai used to be like with all the trading around these areas!!

Lazy evening on the creek killing time. Hey it was an opportunity to chill out,do nothing and get fed.So we were picked up promptly and taken to our allotted vessel as there is a lot on the creek doing the same thing.Very amicable to please and soft drink supplied early as the food was cooking before we left.The vessel was clean tidy and we left late as we were waiting for others to arrive by transfer bus but Dubai traffic at night is noticeably worse than the day time.So the food was abundant however the type of food would not suit all tastes or nationalities.Need to ask as other vessels may have different food.I did find it enjoyable for the evening but this thought lingers.We did have entertainment on board as a whirling durbish traditional dancer.After we docked we were returned to our hotel very promptly with the same driver.Our experience was at night so I presume same for daylight.

Have a break with view over the Creek. The Dubai Creek is nice to visit. We had some coffee at a restaurant with a view over the creek. It is amusing to see the wooden ferries crossing the creek and the luxury yachts laying in the embankment. It is nice to visit but not very special.

peaceful and serene. CREEK is my fav spot in DUBAI. its peaceful and serene. I can spen hours here. The famly too loved the place. You can relax and eat good food on creek side joints. One can walk thru the flee market nearby and have a great shopping experience. YOu may choose to just tale the abra across and enjoy the waters and scenery post sunset. Creek is a must if you are coming to Dubai. a far cry from the mall culture. gives you the old world charm and lets you be you.ENJOYCheersSandeep Jain
Different to newer part of Dubai. Went by boat from Dubai Marina (£15). Went to museum, gold Souk and spice Souk. Great Lebanese meal overlooking the water.Area worth a visit.

timeless. the creek area is quite unique as it is a working area operating as a port area for trade as it has done for years many of the craft are quite ancient and the amount of merchandise being processed is amazing there are tourist craft offering tours and also small ferry type craft a very interesting few hours if the weather (heat) permits

Wonderful dinner experience. A dinner on boat has been organized by our tour operator and I think almost all tour operators do same. Very good and memorable experience. You can enjoy dinner with local cultural performance.
The Heart of Dubai!. Everyone traveling through Dubai must start their journey at the Dubai Creek. It is truly the heart of our city.

My Dubai highlight! . We took a dhow for a short trip down Dubai creek for AED 60 & it was well well worth the trip! The driver was excellent & we were taken at a very leisurely pace around a short section of the creek.
****TIP**** - take the trip at sunset for some spectacular views across the city.

A creek that divides old and new Dubai. If you can manage to tear yourself away from the glittering malls and expensive luxury hotels, take a walk along Dubai creek (in evening) and you will see how it used to be before this oil business came along. Rent a small boat and go cruising. Its a nice experience.

Interesting but not much to see. Its not a river. Its a salt water channel. It isn't clear to me if it is man-made or simply modified to accomodate larger ships. A good way to see this is via the Dhow Dinner cruise or for the adventurous types... their "river busses" which ferries locals to different points on the creek as public transport. A good place to visit is the bank of the creek opposite the Souks. These are traditional emirates structures remodeled to be shops, cafes and restos. Particularly intriguing to me are the wind towers which are an ancient form of air cooling system.

Well worth the walk, and access to the old souk and museums.. The first part of the souk is bling with the old douws all converted into restaurants. This place is well populated and lit. A good stroll. Lots of well lit boats and some lovely carvings. Many people were taking the water taxis which I heard are good. Further along though you actually come to the real working harbour. A much more dubious area and very few tourists. I think you should be street wise here and not go as groups of scantily clad ladies.I would not have taken my family. I found it fascinating and the men were working unloading huge cargoes of televisions electrical goods and other items. Almost a feel of what the creek may have been like 20 years ago. Well worth a wander out if you have enough time in Dubai- but not the best thing to do.
Timepass. The smell of water with fish may be a minus but if you want to leisurely spend some time with your loved one then try for sure

Old Water Taxis Were Cool. Round trip across the creek on an old traditional water taxi cost 2 UAE dirhams (about 60 cents). Well worth the trip. You will see the oldest part of town and some of the jewelry/gold and spice markets. The Dubai Museum is also worth a visit.

Relaxing and cooling evening stroll around after dinner.. Nice to look out over the water watching the boats both moored and sailing in and out of the creek, took short evening strolls around after dinner to walk it of a little. Which was enchanting with all the boats lit-up, and all dwarfed by the surrounding tower blocks all designed to out impress the next.
take a water taxi. You can take a water taxi for a few dirhams and have the best and less expensive experience of your trip to Dubai.

NOT EVERY DAY YOU SEE A SEAPLANE TAKE OFF. A great part of Dubai with lots going on in a very central location. Great boardwalk area with lots of hotels bars and restaurants. Lovely marina too. Even a park. An area to visit for sure.

A must to see while visiting Dubai. We stayed in Bur Dubai so it was only one subway stop to visit the Creek. We visited the old souks, however didn't buy anything as they were so pushy that you just didn't want to stop and look at anything as they were just pushing everything at you. It was an interesting place to visit and the creek and the dhow boats had all the old world charm. We also toured the Al Fahidi Historical Neighbourhood while there and this was a beautiful find with many museums/small shops, etc. Also the RTA ferry we took from the Dubai Creek and it took us downtown to the marina and this was an absolutely amazing 1 1/2 cruise that you get to see the entire skyline of Dubai from the water. What an amazing place!!!!

Nice way to spend a few hours!. I was invited for a dhow cruise around the Dubai creek, as part of a wedding reception ceremony. The view of old Dubai is really nice. It is very traditional indeed. It is amazing to see that Dubai has emerged into a global city and up until few decades back, all of Dubai’s life was centred around the creek. The view of the Dubai creek is nice and one can even see Burj Khalifa in the background from this place. Would definitely recommend one to visit the Creek for a few hours.

The real Dubai. For those who believe Dubai Mall and Dubai Marina is the real Dubai, think again. Take a taxi to Dubai Old Souq Abra station or take the Metro to Al Ghubaiba. A 1 dirham ride across Dubai Creek to the Spice Souq take in great views of the Dhows.This is old Dubai and a visit to Dubai is not complete without an Abra ride. Oh, compare the 1 dirham fare to what you will be charged in Madinat!

Dine on a Dhow Boat. We took a boat along the creek, these boats are ideal, you can in under cover or up on the top. They all have music and usually dancers during the time you dine. They are brightly lit up at night.You cruise up and down the creek and can view the awe inspiring building lit up at night.Well worth the time.
Beautiful!. I wasn't sure what to expect on the abra ride, but it was quick and smooth. There was quite a bit of boat traffic, but the cost of 1 AED was great!

If you in Dubai, go and visit Dubai. There is more to see than malls and 5* star hotels. The creek is one landmark and learning about it"s history, you learn more about Dubai. Nice places around the Creek for the evening and on cooler days, also day time. Easy to cross with the water bus...

Nice one old cultured view.. Another place you must visit while in dubai...Dubai creek...A Dhaw Cruise ride you should not miss while visiting Dubai, In night you can have a awesome view of city and sky screepers in the lights is just amazing...again with delicious arebic cuisine and traditional dace of Dubai....its just amazing....

A beautiful place for a stroll or a water taxi ride across the creek. Dubai Creek is very close to the Gubaiba bus station and metro station. You can take a water taxi or abra ride across the creek for just one dirham. There are restaurants alongside the creek. A perfect place to visit during the evenings.
Classic beauty. It has a aged carm in the middle of modern architecture and sky scrappers on one side blending it to the old dubai on the other side..

A boat on the creek. Take a boat for a cruise on the creek by night with food and music or have a walk during the day: the taste of the old Dubai city with the view of the amazing towers of the downtown, first the Burij Khalifa. A great experience. A place you cannot forget.

Dubai Creek Water Taxi Tour. An interesting way to have a look at the creek
The fishing boats and small cargo ships are fascinating
The developing skyline along the creek is of interest
A pleasant way to spend an hour - I would recommend finding a group to go with as it works out a lot cheaper
walk!!. nice place for a good relaxing walk by the creek. not very crowded. peaceful place. could be better if there are activities and food stalls on the creek.
Very Relaxing. i been many times to this area my favorite is the dine in the restaurants along the creek side.The best times to go for a souk visit are either 10 in the morning or 6 in the evening.

Evening Getaway!. The creek brings out the traditional side of Dubai! Its great to take a walk on the sides of the creek, walk around, sit and sip a coffee or experience a Dhow cruise. Its an attraction for tourists and locals alike. Some also enjoy having sheesha (hukka) at the little restos / cafes set up by the sides of the creek! Great for an evening walk in the winters

Night Dinner Cruise. We had a lovely dinner on a large teak boat. The main course was divine with a wonderful mixture of flavours and styles of food.The male dancer was exceptional - how is kept spinning was beyond me.

By all means...go. You'll get a different feel of Dubai here. It's authentic...and more relaxed. Go shopping at the souks nearby and enjoy some local delights. Go take the Abraa for 1AED. The weather is windy and ppl are friendly.

Nice place to visit.. It's loading and Unloading port for local and neighbouring countries goods and small ships.Other Side of Dubai Creek is Bur dubai and Diera. During night cruise are operated for visitors which provided good hospitality with dinner and cultural programme.RegardsSunil
Creek to walk. Dubai creek is meant for walking.But some time it use to be very crowded. Good place to relax with family and friends.

Arbas, souks and siteseeing. I love that area, very cultural and lots of history in the surroundings, great place for shopping. Abra rides never fail to provide fun! :) only thing that gets me everytime is the smell
Local Boat Travel. Dubai Creek must visit and at dubai creek you will enjoy new experience . in 1 dhm you can enjoy local boat travel . love it...

Good to see Old Dubai. Worth a trip. Like everywhere in Dubai there is travel involved. If arriving by taxi get dropped off on west side of creek & get a bur (boat taxi)across. Cheaper & quicker. Don't expect signs with directions so take a street map. Can be a little intimidating at first as men constantly appear from nowhere asking if you want a fake handbag / watch, with no wares on them. Pashminas by the millions, be prepared to barter at least 50% as they are over priced. Gold & spice souks are plentiful. Again barter. Do not expect to find a public wc. Museum worth a visit & great wc

When the past meets the future. This is the ane of the very few places in dubai where the past meets the future, it still on then old city style with where you can feel Dubai ! You can enjoy watching the birds at the sunset or enjoy dinner with a sea view or also you can take a wood boat trip for a very nice price :)

No space to walk. I visited in the last week of November 2015. I was told if you like long scenic walks this is the place for you in Dubai. However, there is a lot of construction activity happening now and has restricted the walking activity. It's a wonderful spot at night to watch the boats and the city lights go by and a great space for people watching.

Dubai Creek is lovely. Our hotel Park Hyatt was on the creek. It is beautiful. So many yachts parked and we could even have rented one. We took a seaplane ride from the creek which was cool.Played golf in The Dubai Creek Golf Club which was awesome.
mrs. A must to visit on boat during the cooler afternoon.very interesting and enjoyable .must have a guide

wifes fear. we searched for this creek,for days like 2 kids,we are both 70,we eventually found it,but when my wife saw the tiny boat,she said,i am not going on that thing,I spent 2 hours trying to convince her to try it,then she agreed to do it,it was great fun,the boat was packed with people and when we finished,what did she say,can we have another ride,by the way the cost was about a us dollar for 2 people,great,do not miss it
worth doing. We started at the gold souk then hired a local boat to see the creek at night, which was lovely. Then got dropped off at the spice souk

Came 4yrs ago, brilliant. this year......NO. Went to the Souks in 2011 and loved it..... Came this year and hated it!Everyone keeps 'bothering' you, asking you to buy their stuff etc. I hate this, it's like being in Turkey!Will never go again, sorryAnd NO, did not buy anything except for a drink!
Nice evening walk. Perfect place for romantic walk from Gold soak to Silk soak taking boat taxi from one side of the river to the other...
Great vibe and interesting nighttime spot in Dubai. I was interested in getting a glimpse of Dubai's past, and the reconstruction of the fishing and Pearl Diving village was very interesting
Where Dubai started to be what it is today. Because it is older, Dubao Creek enjoy more mature trees, less bizarre building and the boat trips are nice

A relaxing 7k stroll. If you like long scenic walks, this is the place for you in Dubai. Although the creek offers water taxis, boat tours, and dhow cruises, it's a great walkable area with dozens of shops along the edge and tons of restaurants to eat from.Our favorite part was coming back in the evening for drinks and shisha. It's a wonderful spot at night to watch the boats and the city lights go by and a great space for people watching.

A little bit of Old Arabia. We stayed at the Raddison Blu in Deira right on the Creek. Nothing is Old" in Dubai but what little established development there is you will find here, although the development taking place on Bur Dubai side may put that in question before long. There are interesting souks in he old tradition; small outlets, plenty of haggling and streets full of sections devoted to specific goods. It is said that the Gold Souk in Deira sells some of the cheapest gold in the World, but I cant confirm that! The Spice Souk is also worthy of a visit as is the Fabric Souk on Bur Dubai side. Also worth visiting are the Fort/Museum complex and the Bastakia quarter. Being based on the Creek you have excellent access to the Metro which takes you off to the Downtown areas easily so for us an ideal base of operations.

Worth a visit to see a less glitzy side of Dubai. The Creek gives you a clue as to what Dubai must have been like before it became the glitzy fabulous place it now is. Old-fashioned boats & ferries chug along & traders are busy about their business. Travel here from the Marina on the 90 minute boat (separate TA review) for around £10, then onto the infamous spice & gold souks. Must does in Dubai

Interesting place to explore away from the high rise luxury of downtown Dubai. I have been making short trips to Dubai for a number of years now and usually confine myself to the high rise, ultra modern and sterile shopping malls and the Jumeirah beach area. So this time, having a full Saturday afternoon free to myself I decided to head off to explore the Dubai Creek area.From my hotel in the Mall of the Emirates I got on the Metro and alighted at the Union Squre station. I have to admit that I got a bit lost but eventually found the Creek. After walking up and down the promenade I then decided to board a boat to ride over to the other side & visit the Old Souk. From there I took another boat much later in the afternoon to explore the Gold, Spice and Perfume Souks. In all I walked almost 20 kms that day. There are endless little streets - I sometimes wondered if I was in India rather than the Middle East, there being so many Indian shops and people everywhere. And little place to sit down & have an iced coffee.I returned to the modern part of the town via the Palm Deira Metro station - close to the fish market where the signs advise you that "Carrying fish on the Metro is prohibited".

Relaxing spot. The Dubai Creek is an excellent spot to spend time in the evening in the breeze and having a great view of the waterway. It is very accessible by public transport and taxi. The nearest metro station is the Al Gubhaiba Bus Stand station. There are lot of eateries nearby if you plan to have your dinner before you leave.This is a very peaceful spot if you want to spend your evening just watching the passing boats

Not so great experience. We had been to creek with a family of 10. Even though the boat journey in the night was pleasant, the food served was not up to the mark. The buffet dinner was miserable with the congested space on the deck. Overall it was not giving a professional touch. There is a lot of scope for improvement. Dance on the deck was good though.

Go at night to see the sun go down!. We had a trip on the river as part of our tour bus tour. It was a traditional boat with a canopy on top deck which we chose to sit under.The river is busy and you get a feel for their life.Because it was getting darker we saw it light and dark which I liked as buildings and boats were lit up.
Has to been seen possibly with a boat. If u like modernity lights and sightseeing is a place to be seen. Get a boat trip in order to get the most. Enjoy it on the deck with a fine glass of Wine

A buzzing area of old Dubai. We stayed in the Radisson Blu Hotel,and had a room on the top floor overlooking the Creek. This is a lovely part of old Dubai.Take a walk day or night and look at all the boats unloading cargo to the local shops, the souks and soak up the atmosphere.Well worth a visit.
A nice place to walk. After spending time shopping at dubai or roaming around, one can come here to spend some good time here with a creek nearby keeping the atmosphere grt

One Dirham boat ride. You can pay one Dirham and cross the creek in a boat. Try and visit in evening, will lights all around you will enjoy. Careful with kids, hold on to them when you take the boat ride, times it becomes bit bumpy. 100s of shopping and dining options. One can take a walk on the corniche on the other side.

A beautiful experience!. We took a ferry for a few DHS instead of the traditional and pricey Dhow cruise packages which are in the range of 100DHS and it was a wonderful experience! The gleaming waters, the cool, sharp breeze and the moving lights - it was perfect.
Very touristy . We spent the evening on a dinner cruise which was a lovely way to see the creek, beautiful at night especially.

Fast and not that furious . Took a water taxis for the sights and was amazed by the beauty of the old world of Dubai.. being for Northern New Jersey your used to the water taxis just whipping you from one said of the Hudson to the other back and forth from New York so the chase to ride one was welcomed and extremely breath taking for some of the sights. Sorry no pics used my GoPro haven't up loaded yet..

Quaint area….... Loved it here the Old Town of Dubai a big difference from the modern sky high glass building of uptown. Walking along the creek you see all manner of wooden boats which are beautifully built and amazing to see, you can go on various trips aboard these. There are also the local water taxis we tried both types both so cheap only a few pence each journey you have to experience them. They took us to one of the Souks to shop, loved it.

Dhaw cruise Ride. It is an average experience inside as they take you around in the dhaw creek for two hours with dinner & Taruna dance,magical show.Taruna dance was OK.Food inside again for vegetarian was OK.you enjoy the lightiing boats & some bldgs light while roaming in the creek.

Nice atmosphere. It's great to walk along the Creek and see all the activity. There are the ships, museums, souks. Also at night the atmosphere is very good. It's a part of Dubai that should not be missed.
Beautiful. Awesome view from the sheraton hotel. Dubai is all about shopping had the opportunity of taking the boat ride ⛵across the Creek to do lots more shopping lol. Very reasonably priced.

Exciting place to visit. Very interesting place we took an Abra boat across the creek to the souks which cost 1 dirham (about .20p). The gold souk and spice souk were great fun and yes they do try to sell you all sorts of things but the people were very friendly and did not put any pressure on you to buy things. We were 2 females and felt perfectly safe walking around

Lovely stroll along the Dubai Creek. I love the Dubai Creek area. Make sure that you visit the Dubai Museum, visit the Cutural centre of understanding, visit the souks, and just stroll along the creek watching the boats crossing to the Deira side. wonderful

What identifies the old Dubai. Something that identifies the old Dubai is the Dubai creek.Another masterpiece in the city. The trade route for many years and surprisingly now also. The water taxis make the transportation from one side to the other an enjoyable ride.

Relaxing boat ride. caught a small boat to the far end of the creek and back. Great way to get a feel for the Waterfront and a sense of Dubai pre oil!Very hot though Even with the breeze off the water, so remember to take a hat and even an umbrella for added shade.Wow some of the power boats were spectacular and the old Arab traditional boats are a beautiful sight to see.

A nice place for dinner. I've been here a few times now during different visits to Dubai. I like the surroundings and there are plenty of good restaurants to enjoy dinner, for both business and private companions.
Worth a visit.. The little boats that take you across to the other side of the creek are worth a trip on a hot day. The souks are very close to the creek..

Great experience!. Loved, the transport, cheap, and safe,.and loved the chance of sampling a little bit of history.Authentic form of travel for the Emiraties, and residents. Whilst takeing phots,w as asked by an Indian gentlemen to take his photos so I did!!

Wander around in authentic Dubai. Great to walk along the boats in Deira that get fully packed with all kind of stuff and wander around in Deira spice and Gold souk. Cross the creek for 1 AED to Dubai side and enjoy Grand Mosque, Hindu Temple and Alfahidi Fort. Cheap and great 3 hr evening walk!
A nice area to get out. Dubai Creek is a nice area for walking and enjoying the evening weather in Dubai during the spring and fall months (it's too hot in the summer).
lovely creek walks along the water. just stroll along either side of the Creek to enjoy the atmosphere. Lively boardwalk with some nice restaurants and ample terraces.
Nice part of the old city. Don't expect too much of the souks surrounding the Creek (quite touristic) but there are some good spots on the riverside to get some drinks and food with a great view.

The authentic side of Dubai. Dubai creek fills a major gap in Dubai's identity. We all know the "largest", "tallest", widest", or any adjective with est at the end, attractions in Dubai. But for people who accuse the city of being without a would, just visit Dubai creek and you will change your mind. This is where you can appreciate the authentic side of the city, be it in the souks, the historical Fahidi area, or simply the restaurants next to the water, were you can get the world's best grilled dishes, hands down.
Dinner cruise across the creek. Very en-lighting, a must see attraction and if possible do a dinner cruise across the creek or a dhow ride.
lighting. its mid of the city, every curse fully cover with light & it look very attractive, music, tambour dance & dinner is awesome
Night in a boat is a wow. so charming. select a good boat. food and beverage availed in boat with music. mesmerizing evening waiting for you.
Still a Great Sight. This was my first visit back in 31 years so the only things that hadn't changed much were the Sheraton Hotel's shape, the Gold Souk and the Creek itself.

The Dhows Have It. A few old mud-brick houses that comprised original Dubai still remain along the creek, but the old port is still a thriving mass of dhows and small ferries. Decrepit-looking dhows load to the gunwales with produce for transport across to Mumbai or other smugglers destinations. Busy boatmen in little skiffs take tourists back and forth and down the creek for one or two dirhams. A great way to escape the over-the-top glitz of modern Dubai and pretend for a moment that you're in an authentic Arab trading post.

Old Dubai. This is a very authentic experience . Cross the Creek in an old fashioned Dow for a few Dirhams .Very atmospheric and Arabic . Walk along and see people sitting out smoking the Arabic pipe. Visit the spice and gold souks . Feel the character of the place . I prefer this to the newer parts.
Good day out. We visited the place and took a boat trip for a night tour It was with a buffet and we were pleasantly surprised of the food quality
Awesome way to get to the Gold Souq. Cheap and beautiful way to see the city and get to the Gold Souq. There were some visible construction going on but it didn't hinder the experience.

Heart of the City. Dubai is where it is because of the creek. Unfortunately like London did with the Thames, they fell out of love for a time. The creek was just an obstacle on the way to the airport to be crossed. London neglected the Thames for several hundred years, fortunately for Dubai the rift was less than ten. That thankfully has now all changed. Money, time and effort have really gone into restoring the old town along it's banks. The narrow streets and alleys give a real feel of what things might have been like in the beginning for the early traders. Around every corner is something new and exciting. And there are endless places to stop and take refreshments.

Dhow River Cruise. Enjoyed the experience, the cruise on the creek was lovely, not ideal for little children as we saw families having to keep them downstairs unless they were supervising them on the upper deck.The food seemed to run out and there wasnt a lot of choice, and no labels on the food so didnt know what you were eating, as it was also quite dark inside too. The show was great and am always amazed and how disciplined they are. Staff were great and attentive. We were picked up from our accommodation which was great. This cruise was at the lower end of the budget so probably got what we paid for. Maybe the more expensive cruise has more variety

Creek boat ride into the older city souks and markets!. While you can be mesmerized by the architecture and shopping malls offering all that global brands have to offer. You would be well served to see the creek and take one of the boat rides into the spice/gold/silver souks. Some sellers seem a little touristy but overall you get the time warp of what Dubai was like prior to the boom of the 1990/2000. Good luck and enjoy!

Walto's time spent at Dubai Creek is often and often. When ever I am free and available at Dubai during the winter time I along with my children and family spent more time at this creek and while returning back we used to enjoy a very good dinner from some of the family restaurants around.
A day around Dubai. I took the red hop off and on bus and spent the day exploring at all stops. Plenty to do and see or one could just sit and watch the world go by - lots of hustle and bustle.
beautiful. So much to see and do along the very busy shoreline....lots of tourists and lots of regular business going on....good photo op

Nice park, why the entry fees. One of the few parks in Dubai. Opens too late for runners which is a real pity. Very well maintained. Not sure why this city needs to charge entry fees for parkland access.
Nice walk along the creek. Good evening walk or you can take a boat ride across the river or a small cruise with dinner for entire evening.
visit. great place to go to see a different part of Dubai away from the shopping malls and building works. it shows a more Arabic feel
Great view at night. The Dubai Creek on one of the Dhow boats at night is one of the good ways to enjoy a lovely evening in Dubai.

Creek cruise. We cruised on an old Dhow with the Arabian Adventures booking, unfortunately the duff duff music played was horrible and we where all offered an icecream as we arrived on the cruise, thinking it was complimentary everyone took one only to have one of the crew come around and ask for AED 15 to pay!! Caught us out there, I know it was cheap but wouldn't it have been nice to make announcements first as to the refreshments coming would be so much!! The cruise was lovely, relaxing and the last thing as the sunset a really lovely experience.
Dubai . I will have to say Wow Wow. A very romantic night well spent. A must visit. Food was very average. Entertainment was at peak

Nice addition to trip. For less then a £1 you can cross the creek. Be careful the locals do not charge you more. They will ask for double, triple or even quadruple what they should. A short journey of less than 10 mins. Good thing to do after visiting the gold and spice souks. Then they will drop you on the other side and you make your way back into the city via bus.

Take the boat. Take the simple wooden boat from the pier by the market in the old part close to the museum to the jetty on the other side of the river.It's a 10 min ride for 5 dirham only and it's quite fun.

Interesting. Fun few hours having lunch and watching all the activity on the creek. From the back and forth of the abras to larger older style boats plying there trade on the creek. Well worth going to and experience
Holiday site visit. Old part of Dubai with lots of older type shops and market style shopping , I recommend the boat ride across from one side to another .

Interesting area, taxi boats and wooden freight boats everywhere . Went to Dubai Creek on the hop on hop off bus. I stopped at the Gold Souk area and walked along the Dubai creek. Interesting boats and water taxis. Safe and definitely worth checking out
Spent an enjoyable evening. We spent about 2 hrs, went to the Children's Science Centre and also took a camel ride. The cable cars were not functional and so could not take a ride.

Worth a visit. If you buy a 'hop on hop off' bus ticket it includes a boat trip on the creek which is worth a visit. The trip lasts about an hour and is a relaxing experience which allows you to see a different part of Dubai.

Definitely worth a visit in the evening. I've been on a dhow dinner cruise twice on the Dubai Creek and I highly recommend, especially during the evening/night-time. The views in the evening are stunning as other boats, ferries, and nearby buildings are all lit up. Beautiful and therapeutic-- I definitely recommend it :)
Cruise. Book a cruise with obe of the many companies and enjoy a 3 hour ride over the creek and see Dubai from the water. Very impressing.
Great must viait in Dubai. Must visit in Dubai...worth 1 hour ride...AED 120 charge per boat...boat goes till Creek...visit this place as part of visit to Old Souk...great market place near by...

Watch out for the hard sell. Beautiful place. I went there to visit the textile souk. On my walk from metro to souk, I was asked by about 20 different men to come and look at handbags, sunglasses etc. The hard sell remains in the souk. Barter hard as you could get a bargain. I was on my own and female but felt totally safe the whole time. Wish I'd had time to go up the creek on a boat as it looked wonderful.
Deira. Next the Deira Dubai, close Golden Souk and Spice Souk. Not so easy to park (3 or 4 huge parking area still totaly full), 2 DHS per hour, Friday is free.
Lovely evening stroll. Really nice area to stroll in the evening and lots of nice bars to stop and watch the world go by whilst having a refreshment. Would recommend.

Not A Place To Visit During DayTime. This is actually an old harbour area; redone as a cruise area. Almost half-hearted attempt. I made a mistake of visiting during the day time. Walking around in the hot stifling heat is not a joke. On the other hand, seeing Dubai skyline via an evening cruise is probably not my cup of tea and not worth the fees; there are better dinner cruises elsewhere in the world. I visited Creek out of sheer curiosity and to mark a tick on my Visited List. Don't spend more than 2 hours here.
THIS IS WHERE YOU BUY TOURIST ITEMS. Tourest shopping and a dow (boat) ride up and down the river. Dont forget to barter as it is expected.

Not really worth it . We went on a dinner cruise with a boat on the Dubai Creek. The hotel made reservation for us from "Tour Dubai". Looking at pictures on the Internet,I thought it would be a much more nicer experience but it wasn't really. Paid like 100€ for cruise where you don't see much of anything and buffet dinner was just ok.Loading of people to the boat took time as there were many people coming late! We had to wait for at least 45 min on a boat that wasn't moving, so unless I had colleagues with me who provided me good company, I would have been rather annoyed.This wasn't really worth the time nor money.
place stinks like rotten fish. went only once, all spitting all over the place, filthy the whole place ! got to clean this place or renovate the place or impose fines for trespassers!
Merging the old and the new. Dubai creek merges the older markets with the new exotic downtown Dubai. I loved taking the taxi and seeing the old trading ships in the harbot

Not that much here.... Lit up at night it looks lovely. If you fancy a boat ride, I'm sure it's great but we were a bit limited with grandchildren as the little taxi boats looked as though you could fall into the water too easily. During the day, you'll see the waterways being "dredged" for any litter. It really is a clean place and lovely for walks depending on the time of the day. It gets a bit hot during the day!

Beautiful at sunset. In Dubai most of the activities are either in malls or eating in restaurants, this place is a change from the usual activities. Unfortunately it is very weather dependent, you can't enjoy it if it is very hot or humid

An interesting boat trip from the creek. We took this trip as part of the "extras" included in the Big Bus tours of Dubia.We had already spent 2 days on this tour and the ticket allows you to have as an extre a trip on a boat.The trips run every hour on the half past so be there on time. They have refreshments on the boat consisting of cold drinks and dare I say it BEER OK it's expensive as is everything in Dubai however it was good. The beer I mean The trip lasts about an hour and you are able to get a different view of the skyline and see all the boats that are trading from the creek, you get a good feel for the hustle and bustle of the creek area the water taxies etc and when we went ( the 5.30 tour) good photograph opportunity to get photo,s of the changing colours of the skyline. The spice market is also there and we bought several spices that are very expensive in the UK at a reasonable price.
We went on a dhow. This tour was nice and it was good to see the city from this perspective. You could buy food and drink on the boat and it was air conditioned.

Enjoyed an Evening Water Taxi Ride. I would not go out of my way to visit this location. It was nice to experience the water taxi after walking through the gold souk, but nothing overly exciting or spectacular views to see.

Visit during night and day.. The area itself is very shady, the place has mostly men who roam the street's. Other then that you can pay for a cheap boat ride. The boats are dodgy and are runed by some any cheap motor

My favourite place in Dubai!. Take the time to explore the Dhow wharves at the furthest inland point of the walkway (past the Sheraton Hotel). Trading goes on there like it has for centuries with ancient boats being loaded with all kinds of goods (by hand). You feel like you shouldn't be there but it's perfectly ok to wander about.

Lovely at night. I really enjoyed walking alongside the creek at night. The decorated dhows standing in a row looked wonderful. I went at the end of oct when the evenings were not as hot and since i was alongside the creek the breeze felt nice, it was difficult to find parking though and that took up a lot of our time. We had a lovely cruise on the creek in a dhow by sun and city. All in all a pleasant place to visit although not as glamorous as the marina.
Fun Tour. We Went for a night Dhow cruise in the creek area.The atmosphere was amazing.But Dhow cruise experience was similar to the experience we got in Goa.

Great Views. Loved it down this part of old Dubai! Went to a lovely arabic restaurant for lunch followed by a wander through the heritage centre and the spice and fabric markets. Wasnt hassled at all and the locals were lovely and helpful. Definately recommend a wander down here!

Value. For 1 to 2 AED, you get a 7 minute boat ride across the creek, which provides sufficient time to enjoy the skyline and bustle from afar. The boat drivers were sometimes inattentive and tended to bump the boats into dock and each other, which made it less than comforting. I recommend you take the RTA since it's payment upon boarding whereas the other carriers charge twice as much and give you a RFID-like card you need to use at turn-stiles (un-necessarily complex).

absolute hole. This is definitely not worth visiting - it is grubby, shabby, the locals stand round eyeing you up and there are market stalls where the attendants just harass you as you walk past. Not a nice place and I would advise tourists to stay away

Well worth it. We took an evening cruise with a buffet meal and was not disappointed. This is the way to see the old part of Dubai in comfort with nice views. As it is in the old part of Dubai near the spice & Gold souks it will take you 45 mins by taxi or use the metro.
Another river. Went to the Creek and crossed using one of the many taxis. There was nothing spectacular. There were things to see but for me, not a highlight
Interesting. Cheap water taxi to get from one side to other, only 1 Dirham one way. You can choose some of options on the Creek

The Heart of Dubai. The creek is the hear of Dubai, separating it into Bur Dubai and Diera. one must have a boat ride on the creek to see the real Dubai. Its filled with hustle and bustle and lots of trade. It takes you back in time to the real Dubai.

Shopping - Get Ready To Haggle!. Bought 5 Watches 'Designer' 750 AED Play > Pressed a few buttons on his calculator picked up watch looked at the back spoke gibberish 4000 AED sir for you.Action > I offered 500 AED for 5 - Seller 'this good quality sapphire glass other is poor quality' lol same old lines don't fall for it.The End - 750 AED for 5! 4 T Shirts 'RLP' 160 AED
Dubai looks great in night. while experiencing Dubai Dhow cruse good view of Dubai creek may experience and with good food, enjoy will be doubled.

A taste of Old Dubai. We first saw the Creek when we stayed at the Radisson and crossed over to Bur Dubai for dinner. As the traffic in Dubai is a real issue and the Metro is often packed, one easy way of visiting the great Indian restaurants on the other side of the Creek (Rangoli is worth trying) is by river taxi. It costs 1 Dirham and gets you over the other side in minutes.

Sights, sounds and plenty of colour. One of my favourite places in Dubai. Get the metro to the Textile Souk, explore the stalls and alleyways, then hop on an Abra to cross the Creek and experience the Spice Souk, the Gold Souk and then even the 'bead and trim' souk further on.

Night time cruise. We had an evening meal on one of the many boats moored at the main jetty although the buffet was only average the entertainment and the lights from the many boats on the creek more than made up for it

Take a trip on the Creek - cheap and fun. A must if you are in the area of Dubai Creek. We stayed at The Hilton Creek overlooking the water and Dowe docks. By day you can see far down the cost to the Burj Khalifa, but the Creek is a constantly changing scene with Dows coming and going. Not sure if it's a picture from a pirate movie or what, but this large old wooden ships run up and down the creek by day and night. You can take a cooling walk in the evangelical along the side of the water, or by evening take a tour on one of the many Abra at a crazy cheap price. We didn't do a tour, but went a 10-15 minute journey from Deira to the Old Souk for the price of £1.20 per person return! By night many of the buildings are lit up, and the restaurant boats are lit up too. This is a fun,cheap thing to do. A must!
Cruising Dubai Creek. A must when visiting Dubai. Very experienced, cheap water taxi to transport you from one side to the other 1 Dirham each way! Had a great time, great way to see what's happening
Good overview of area. There is a whole variety of options on the Creek. We choose the individual 1 hr rental up and down the creek on the abras. It was an excellent buy around $15 US but negotiate.

Dubai Creek. Dubai Creek is spread over covering both old city as well as new development... It's just 2 AED to cross from Textile souk to Spice souk... You can take plenty of pictures during this 5 minutes ride...

You must cross on those little boats. The Creek divides two of the older sections of Dubai. On the far side (Deira, the older section) is the spice souk and the gold souk. On the near side are some old forts, old restored homes, and the dubai museum. You can take little wooden public boats across the creek. The trip on these boats are very pleasant. On the Deira side you are let off near the spice souk. From the spice souk you can walk to the gold souk.

Fantastic nightime experience. after visiting the spice and gold souk (markets) we opted for a trip on a Abra, a small wooden boat, for only 120Drms (about £11) we have exclusive use of a boat and skipper for almost an hour, good value and a fun experience
Local Dubai Feel. Must experience if you have the time too, this is what separates the old Dubai from the new one. The have cruise dinner table -but it is-int the best.

Worth a look to see the old Dubai. After modern, high rise Dubai this is a welcome change. Stroll along the Creek, taking in the souks, take a water taxi across for a couple of Dirham and get a sense of what old Dubai was like (kind of!).

A traditional Old Dubai place. Sets this apart from the modern Dubai with some traditional Old Dubai set up. You should experience this part of Dubai as well. You can reach the other side of the river using the Ferry service whose service is very frequent and is very cheap - 1 Dirham. Must try
Nice to see when shopping at Souks. Just walked along after evening of shopping at Gold Souks and Spice Souks- nice views overall. Perhaps there's more to see of it, but we just walked around a bit.
Nice place to hang around. It was a good experience with friends to spend the evening here, breathtaking view and good weather condition, it was perfect

The traditional side of Dubai. Lovely to wander round the souks, take the traditional abra boat for 1 diram across to the spice and gold souk. A few nice little restaurants right on the waterfront serving traditional food. Be prepared to haggle in the souks, they drive a hard bargain but are very friendly and you feel comfortable walking around. Found a great little kiosk serving proper arabian coffee strong with cardamom.

Nice. You think that you are a citizen of the world when you visit the creek. There are restaurants of every kind of food. No matter what you want you 'll find it there. Nevertheless be careful what you eat because some restaurants might not have such a good quality.

Historical, Magical Dubai. The very, very best way to see the creek is by Abra. Take a traditional water taxi from one side to another of this famous attraction. The Abra ride will give you time to pause and soak in the magic. Best time is by night. AED1.00 per person. Try a traditional Sawarma at the Al Abra Kiosk.
Challenging and Picturesque Course. Fantastic and challenging course. Course has alot of water to navigate. Very well maintained as you would expect. Amazing closing holes. Preference for four balls.

Breeze during winter, hot in summer. Been to this place many times...full of small boats and small 0cruises ..this creek is divided the city into two parts - deira and bur dubai..water taxis and dhow cruise are available..must visit if you are in dubai
Nice place. A very good place to spend your evening and relax if you dont already have a planned sight-seeing. There are a couple of good joints along the creek such as the QD's

Lovely area. Lots to see both day and especially night when the Creek comes alive with dinner cruise dhows. A morning stroll see the real creek at work with lots of dhows laden with goods plying their trade up and down the water. There are also water taxis to take you anywhere you fancy along the creek.

Good for inquizitive minds, like Mission Impossible filmmakers. Dubai Creek is where it all started they will tell you, the exploration, trade, prosperity and movement. It continues to be the nerve center of marine trade and tourism explorations. A day or night on the creek is well spent understanding the facets of the city that you would otherwise never see.

A Great Way to experience Dubai. Rent an abra for an hour and view the old and the new along Dubai Creek. Modern hi-rise office buildings overlook the ageless dhows which deliver goods all over the persian gulf area.

The heart of the city. Yes there are malls and skyscrapers but Dubai actually became because of the creek. Unbelievable to see all the dhow boats filled to the brim with anything imaginable going across the sea, surprisingly I found the creek enjoyable and little pollution.

across the creek. While visiting the old creek, do take a short ride across the creek on one of the old wooden boats,costs only a few pence to experience these ancient little ferries, have done this quite a few times , & never tire of the sights & sounds.
Pleasant. As part of our Big Bus Tour we took a dhow ride on the Creek. It was most pleasant as there was a nice breeze. It is great to see a different prospective of all the sky scrapers.
Interesting ride.. Great way to fill in time whilst you wait for the big red bus to pick you up. Took us across the river which would gave tsar ages by the bus.
Beautiful old Dubai. Here you can feel and old and new Dubai, a lot of restaurants around you. You can visit also the old souk from here.
Nice Place. A water cruise is arranged here every evening and there are many companies who are managing it. You can have a experience of OLD Dubai by visiting this area.It was an nice experience

Amazing Experiance. Wonderful to see the city in two parts separated by creek , which was used in olden days for trading by Arabs , today also this happens , one side is Diera and the other side is Bur Dubai. We enjoyed Dhow Cruise in Creek.
Cruisin in dubai . We went on a dhow river cruise on our first night in dubai..it was really lovely..good food while cruising up the creek..organised and efficient. .recommended 😀

A different thing to do in Dubai. A cruise in the Creek was one of the best activities we did while in Dubai. The boats are generally luxurious, serving both international and local cuisine, all in a formal atmosphere. The chef was present in the dining room and was so happy to receive positive feedback from the diners! The only downside was the humidity on the open, smoking-area deck.Also the Creek can be used to access the old town & market by small wooden boats used by locals, for a small fee.

A must when you visit!. The creek is a must visit for anyone coming to Dubai and wanting more than the shops, pools and nightlife! Get the local abra across the creek to the gold souk (only 1aed each way) no need to pay for a 'private tour' you see just as much on the normal taxi and you get to feel like a local!

Walk by the old creek and feel old Dubai. The creek was and to some extent remains the heart of trading Dubai, it is where the boats or Dhows as they locally called moor to pick up or offload their goods, as they come and go to and from the Persian Gulf and from there into the Arabian Sea, if it is not too hot walk by the creek and pop in for lunch at the excellent Iranian retain aren't that has been here forever "Shabestan".
our visit. We crossed the creek to the SOUKS on a private city tour it was certainly the way to see Dubai with a guide and driver

DHOW CRUISE MY BEST DINNER BUFFET OF MY LIFE. Dubai creek is just like river, but if you will go in the evening and book show cruise , which is like premium boat with all over lightning , and delicious dinner buffet , with some amazing show on the boat and boat is running all over the Dubai creek , most amazing night , must visit place

We did Dhow Cruise in Creek and it was the worst experience. We did Dhow Cruise in Creek on 22nd Oct 2015 and it was not so great and boring. The boat was good and food was OK but it was boring as it did not provide any great view of the city. I would strongly recommend people to go for Dhow Cruise in Marina only.

Gold Souk. Disappointed by the amount of hassle from illegal traders offering copy watches, handbags etc. They don't give up even when you are firm with them and it spoilt the the return to the Gold Souk in particular.

Best place for outing. Relish the old monuments and structures of the modern era as you cruise along the creek. Touch the sea and comeback. Book a good dhow cruise and enjoy the atmosphere. Lovely songs, Tanoura dance and a great dinner would make it a complete visit

Different Dubai. Get out of the mall and see a version of what Dubai used to be like. It is still very touristic but there are some gems to be found. Textile souk for pashminas. Spice souk to see a wide range of anything you might never need. Gold souk for excess. Abbra ride is best 25 cent attraction in Dubai.

Nice time for a couple . It's a nice place for couple to spend their evening. Wander the laneways down to Dubai Creek and hire an abra (a water taxi) from the abra station.At sunset, light reflecting off the glass facades of the city's modern buildings makes a romantic backdrop. There are dinner cruise and one can enjoy a romantic dinner by moonlight in dubai creek.
Great insight into old Dubai. We went on a cruise on the creek and used the Abras to cross it a few times, worth a trip if you're in Dubai for 5 days!
Not worth. Dubai has two portions named Bur Dubai and Dera Dubai, both the portions gets divided by creek, you may choose to cross the creek via water taxi which is memorable.
A taste of old Dubai. You have to take an abra ride accross the creek to the spice souk it will transport you back in time to old Arabia!
A budget activity to try. Dubai creek offers small boat rides and similar activities , it is not a must try to me in dubai but if you got extra time it worth trying

Where old joins new. This is a must for all visiting Dubai! The shallow creek which divides Bur Dubai from Deira is a hive of activity on the Deira side where small freight boats are unloaded manually with every imaginable item from foodstuffs to vehicles as its too shallow to accommodate container ships. This is also the point to pick up a water ferry that goes all the way to the Dubai Marina or perhaps just make a few crossings on the olde worlde Abra which are small water taxis that cross the creek 24 hours a day for just 1 dirham. You can also rent one very reasonably for runs up and down the creek for around 50 dirhams to soak up views of two different skylines, towering buildings that include the Burj Khalifa to the South with a thriving bazaar where bespoke suits can be made literally overnight and lower level city views on the North side with easy access to the old gold souk, spice shops and endless shopping..Both sides offer many choices of Dhow cruises and dinner on an old Dhow watching the sun go down will be a lasting memory as you leisurely cruise the length of the creek.A wonderful end to any day.........

Eat while you cruise. We were picked up from our hotel for the Dhow cruise at around 7pm. The cruise started at 8:30. The ambience was good aboard the Dhow, a wooden boat....dim lights and soft music. Food was decent. The cruise lasted for little more than an hour. Would recommend taking the Dhow cruise on the land you land at Dubai as you can have a relaxed evening.
The'old' merchant Dubai. Interesting to visit the gold market and to make a cruise on the Creek . The historic part of Dubai is worth visiting.

Excellent night view of creek. On the very first day of arrival in Dubai, we were taken to Dubai Creek Dhow cruise Dinner. The night view of the city was fantastic. But more attractive were the Dhows decorated and illuminated in bright colours. This was a very good opening of our Dubai visit and we enjoyed the dinner also although it was not of very good quality.
Worthwhile to see. Nice to see more traditional Dubai. Take a trip on a dhow. Gold market close but beware of being hassled to buy fake watches!!

"Nice to travel up the Dubai Creek via boat". We travelled up the creek from the old Dubai District after experiencing the Gold and Spice souks. We struggled a little to buy a ticket and to know which area to wait for the boat, however an elderly local who could not speak english did his utmost to help us with a lot of pointing and head nodding or shaking - we were so grateful and thoroughly enjoyed the night lights along the creek.
A place for an evening stroll or boat ride. An evening boat ride in one of the colourful lighted boats is great. Meals are come with the ticket, but they are not the greatest food.
Cruise at Dubai Creek. Evening cruise at the Dubai Creek. Great view but its a little too warm for my liking. Serve great food. There are space for improvement on the on board entertainment.
Cruise on the creek. It is a wonderful experience to view the architectural styles from the vessel, while dining on a sumptuous buffet dinner.

Fun time. Take a cruise along this creek and enjoy the lavish food they offer... they may have some dancers on board too.... anyway the sights are good and so is the music... you can dance too if you have company....
Spices. Great cheap trip on Abra boats.Get a taste of old Dubai as you go round the narrow ally's of the spice market

Must visit it. I have been for long time in dubai and never had the chance to visit this park i went into others but didnt enjoy them as much as this nice area clean and tidy and also for BBQ with the family and friends and they have a small beach if its right to call it beach or river bank but loved it.

Shows that Dubai has "life" outside the urban jungle. A trip to this place is especially proper and apt when you are tired of seeing all the buildings and the "lifeless" feel of an urban jungle. Boats are available to cross the Dubai Creek as well as for cruises.

Still some sights of old Dubai. If you wander along the creek side you can still see sights that were common in old Dubai. Dhows, Abra (the old style water taxis), and a few buildings still existing from the time Dubai was still developing, before becoming the mega city it is today.

A great way to see Dubai. I absolutely loved the Doha (boat) ride along the creek, the weather is always good. The markets are full of interesting things. Be careful to keep a check on where you are as it is easy to wonder and get lost

Different side to Dubai. We visited the cultural centre and then walked down to the waterfront where we negotiated with one of the boat owners to take us up and down the creek. We paid around 100 dirham for 1 hour. Being on the water is amazing and paying for a private boat meant we didn't need to bother with the crowds. Definitely worth doing.
Wander Around the Souk. There are some boats on the creek if you want to go for a ride. Otherwise, there's not much to it except for the nearby souks.
Restful Visit. I spent many quiet evenings working in the large room, bar area and lounge. The Honors Lounge is quiet and has great snacks.
Great to cruise the creek. Taking a cruise along the creek is a great way to see some of the most interesting sights in Dubai, the architecture, the trade ships and the water taxis.
Nice evening cruise!. Visited the creek as part of a Big Bus tour and then returned for a dinner cruise on a dhow. Spectacular and the dinner cruise was very good.

Best 1 Dirham spent!!. The creek is best seen by Abbra (the local ferry craft) they can be hired for individual groups or using one to cross the creek from Bur Dubai to Deira. The atmosphere along the creek is typical Arabian with Dhows unloading at the quayside. At night trip is worthwhile to see the buildin.s etc all lit up.

Interesting creek. I spent there a couple of hours, I took a bout tour in the creek which was full of scenic places which are a mixture of old and new buildings,I really liked the creek especially the old styled boats carrying various types of goods.

A different side of Dubai. One of my favorite simple activities in Dubai (aside from watching the fountains) is riding the abras across the creek. They are water taxis that go from one side to the other for 1 dirham. They are simple wooden boats but with a lot of charm. An abra ride lets you watch the Dhows get loaded from the water and people milling about the souks. It's a short trip that connects the gold and spice souks to the textile souk on the other side. You can also get to Bastakia where there are places to sit and eat along the creek. Keep in mind, bathroom opportunities are limited unless you are eating. You are also outside most of the time and walking, so you are going to get hot, but it's definitely worth it!
Amazing Evening. It is not believable that Dubai has got such a river. They have make longer and wider. To see in night, it is a great pleasure to see color full cruses.
nothing much to see. really nothing much to see in the area. good to spend half a day there for the sake of it but dont expect too much
Splendid. Absolutely splendid and especially in the night its lovely seeing the boats all lit up. A must in Dubai!!!

"Dubai Creek- Old is Gold". "Dubai Creek- Old is Gold" as going there is always my favorite as you can spend a day by visiting these places. Museum is near and those boat to Abra station is very old styled and take only "one Dirham".

Informative and Relaxing. We took a traditional Arabian Dhow cruise down the Dubai creek, it was informative in that it explained the history of the creek and how the sea merchants have traded for centuries. It was also relaxing.

See the tipical part of the real Dubai. That's the most tipical and real part of Dubai. As each metropolitan City all over the world, the city began to start near a main river. And that's where you can find tipical souks, golden souk, big commercial and coloured boats (if you stop to speak with someone you will discover some amazing stories) you can even cross the river with small boat taxes for 1AED expenses and that's the normal way to cross the river. After you see the new Dubai you cannot miss that part.

Nice place for evening or morning walk. I did 7km jog along yhe Creek early in the morning while sun is not up yet. Met with other runners as well. It is a nice and safe place to run or walk for foreigners. The creek is lined up with boats and traditional dhow for dinner cruises and other activities. Didn't use them
Dubai Creek and Dhow trip an Awesome Experience.. We celebrated an event on dhow trip, we got awesome view of creek side life in Dubai. It was one of the most beautiful experience of life.

Still charming after all these years. It is a cliché to say that the Creekside is the old "heart of Dubai" but it is nevertheless true. This was where the city was established. Most of the buildings from the early days (which, in Dubai, means only decades ago) are long gone; some have been rebuilt although not always in a way that faithfully represents the original character. Nevertheless there is something special about this busy waterway, often wrongly called a river (there are no rivers in the region). It is exactly the things which have resisted change which give it its character. How much longer that will remain in a place which has an urge to build shiney showey things I can't say. My favourite time is the late afternoon in winter. Spend a one Dirham coin to cross on an abra. No tickets, just join the people who are clambering on, and pay the "captain" into his hand after you've taken your place. Enjoy the short ride on the open boat. Avoid the modern closed water taxis. Do it soon before it disappears.

Calm and relaxing experience . Along the Dubai creel are several dhows offering cruises in the creek. We booked an online package for an evening cruise which included dining and entertainment.As it is very hot durinf the day, I would recommend doing it in the evening. The food we had a great traditional buffet and the entertainment included dancing and a mime. The best part was just being on deck watching the old city by night. It gives you a better impression of the history of Dubai, transportation and trade before the malls came up. After a cruise, take a lazy walk along the waterfront. Dubai is safe and very clean.Do carry a scarf with you. While it is warm outside, the indoor temeperatures are low because of the air condition systems. Its not usual to see one set at 18 degrees C.

Choose a hotel on creek side. It's a good choice to make as the base for your stay.The river view is good, there's a slight breeze and you can walk down the Dhow Achorages to see the lights.Taxi are easy to hail for a metred ride.Not far to Heritage Village or to the souks

A cultural experience. A very different side to Dubai yet it is the more traditional side to the emirate. It is a must if you want to experience true tradition and culture but be warned, you will be asked if you want to buy a pashmina or a Rolex watch more times than you can remember. Best to go in cooler months as there isn't many places you can go to escape the heat.
Old Dubai charm. Aside from the glitz, this is the old Dubai with many traditional buildings. Also, wonderful souks (markets) abound and plenty to shop and walk about.

....... Whenever anyone of my friends will visit Dubai, his journey must include a visit to Dubai creek.This place is full of smell of history.Heritage Abra(small boats between creek sides) is really nice experience.There is multi restaurants around and multi places you can visit there such as spice market,heritage village and Shaikh Saeed house.

A nice promenade to walk along and you must ride on an Abra. The Dubai Creek has a great promenade to walk along and enjoy the views. Be sure to take a bottle of water with you as it can get very hot. There is the old market and the Gold Souk on the north side of the Creek (Deira) and the Royal Palace on the south side (Bur Dubai). The Palace is not open to the public. There are tourist attractions on the south side, such as the Tourist Souk, Dubai museum and the old areas of the city that they did not bulldoze, and these areas are worth a visit. You can cross the Creek by Abra - a local small boat which charges a 1 Dirham fare to cross the Creek. You pay on the boat and boats depart from either side of the Creek every few minutes.

Always crowded, hot and humid.. This is the Creekside area of Dubai where the old souks are located. The traditional way to cross the creek is on an Abra boat for 1 dirhan (about 34 cents). The Gold Souk contains many hundreds of jewelry shops, and the wide tourist finds the arcades that are air-conditioned! There are also a fragrant, spice souk and a textile souk. Interesting and worth a visit if you have a few days in Dubai.
Good Place to Hangout. A nice walk along the waterway (if it is winter). Lined with restaurants and shops and overseeing the many yatch...a good place to be

Boat ride with some nice food!. it has a boat ride , dinner is served in the boat ( both veg and non veg) .The boat has two sections open and air conditioned.Depending on the weather this can be chosen. seats allotted on first come first served basis.Food was good taste wise , however is you are a veg then the food aroma around might not be a good for you.The cruise takes you to through a road which witnesses great Dubai Skyline.Some beautiful towers and malls can be seen while on the boat. Evening overall well spent with some great pictures.

24 Hours in Dubai. Dubai creek is the old town and it provides one with a peek into the past when Dubai was a trading hub. The old souk is located here as are multiple residential neighborhoods - mostly working class.
A different view of Dubai. Take the 1 dirham 17p trip across the creek for a different sort of journey. Amazing crossing, cross with the locals, we went across to visit the old gold souks

Trip back in time. Go for a visit here to sample a bit of what Dubai was originally before becoming the metropolis it is today. Spend some time wandering about the area, both on foot and on river taxi. Lots of interesting things to see. Would recommend combining this with trips to the gold souk and spice souk, both easily walkable from the creek.
Sailing The Creek. We would have been better advised to use a local ferry rather than the tourist boat which was not clean and the staff were unwelcoming.

Where it all started. Visited on a bus tour.This is an area rich in the establishment of the Dubai that we know to-day.Dhows still operate from the wharves; in fact you can experience them with a ride on the creek.
Outside view . Couldn't go inside but enjoyed from the corridor of that hotel we stayed in " pullman hotel was nice view
Interesting busy area. Crossed creek as part of city tour, good to see this part of the city, be prepared to run the gauntlet of market traders in the spice souk when you get off.
gold souk and spice souk is worth a visit. Boat trip is a good way to see old dubai , most shops closed in the afternoon in gold souk and spice souk

Nice simply experience in a very energized city. A very good experience, i enjoyed the ride. And it's very cheap. It costs only 1 Durham
This wooden boats between this tall fancy building is a experience you have to try
It's a mix between the history and the future

Nothing out of the box. Dubai Creek is a small inlet which separates parts of the old Dubai with the new Dubai. The only really interesting thing about it was the old dhows which are used for trade between Dubai and it's local neighbours and the continuous stream of wooden taxi boats that went from one side of the creek to another. Otherwise nothing worth rushing to se.

Magic views. If you stay in a hotel on Dubai Creek you get an amazing view out of your window. If you're facing the Creek that is,. There are many different types of boats to watch and it's a nice walk in the cool of the evening. It is near or in the old part of Dubai which we think is much more interesting than the newer part. The souks are there and authentic restaurants and also the old museum which are all worth a visit. Watching the sun rise or set over the Creek is beautiful and at night the dinner cruise boats light up with so many coloured lights, it's magic.

Lovely. Old part of Dubai with great charm . Best to visit at evening time were u can visit floating restaurant or just chill by the creek to see great site. Plenty of restaurant to eat and drink.no 5star establishments tho
