Dhow cruise. Very interesting juxtaposition of old and new. Great cooling cruise along the creek and creek side coffee.
Worth a visit.. Interesting look at what this place looked like before the glitz arrived. Go here after visiting the Dubai Museum. Boats available for hire creek-side. Skip the tours.

nice place to experience old Dubai. I enjoyed the Creek as represents the old Dubai. You can get across from one side to another one by water taxi which costs 1AED one way (from Dubai to Deira and the same rate to come back). There are a couple of souks you can visit too as a part of your experience. Recommended for people who want to see some history and tradition rather than modern Dubai.
Funny.... The cheap and easy way to go through one side to the other.I enjoy it a lot... The "abra" is a good option to enjoy the view from several sides.
Back in time. Enjoy a trip over the Creek for a cheap price! Take a look how the old city still lives and let it take you away from the expensive and big hotels!Enjoy the gold, spices and the locals!

Old and the New. The Dubai creek was right next to our hotel. Nice for an evening walk (provided the weather is nice). We also took an abra ride and somehow the creek gave a feeling of converging the old and the new - old dubai (deira, bur dubai) on one side and new swanky hotels on the other. Creek converging them together

From Sheraton Creek it is the best way for travelling to Old Souks...take in the views of the city new and old.. Great for walking by and taking in the views, places to eat and ferries ready to take you across to the old Souks/ Dubai Museum. Especially lovely at night, would recommend to all.

"Breathtaking". A beautiful place to visit , we went went on a rather hot day the area is spotless and plenty of boats across the creek or a cruise around. A must is the souks a very interesting place plenty of gold, spices and materials and the locals love to barter. We opted for a fresh coconut extremely tasty and refreshing or a freshly squeezed orange juice.Its well worth a visit.

Romantic dhow trip with buffet supper.. Go for an evening dhow (floating restaurant) trip along the Creek. This was great value for money, very romantic, with mood music. Terrific food, and plenty of it. Don't be afraid to go back for 'seconds'. We LOVED IT.
Dubai Creek. Well worth a visit. Lovely place to wander and some good eateries at the waters edge. Worth taking the boat across the creek for a great view of the Dubai skyline.
Good. Went at night.the souks are there if you are looking for a bargain. Also done the dhow boat. Wasn't as good as I thought but our entertainment wasn't on due to aed festival
Beautiful And Worth The Visit :). This is a unique and different place to visit. You can take a nice boat ride, I think one visit is more than enough - but it is worth a visit.

Breezy. The view is extremely beautiful. The area is clean and very breezy during the month of January. One can opt of Dhow cruse or Creek boat according to their convenience. One should definitely visit this place when in Dubai.
Interesting. Beautifil and interesting to see how the old city becomes the modern city when sailing there. One visit is enough for me though.

a trip throuh time. a fantastic trip with the traditional boats is enough to send you back in time to when life in Dubai was all about the creek,many historical places to visit around and some nice shopping especially nearby gold souq.

Just interesting. If you take the Hop On/ Hop Off, the Creek boat tour is included. Nice views on the skyscrapers along the banks of the Creek river. I would certainly not pay seperately for this attraction.

the soul of Dubai. Dubai Creek is in the old area of Dubai. Fed up of malls, beaches and glitz? head to the creek, in an inexpensive taxi or try the metro, Al Fahidi stop. Walk to the Dubai Museum, on to the Souk and the Hindu temple, and out to the Creek. Grab a bite at one of the many Indian street vendors, or sit down for a meal at the Creekside Cafe. Cross to the other side in an Abra (small wooden boat) and visit the souks there. do bring your camera, lots of small change, and avoid noon especially in the hotter months. spend as little as a couple of hours or the whole day.
refreshing. even though we know everything in Dubaio is man made, Dubai creek and the the park surrounding it make you feel theye are really natural. Fresh air to enjoy in the hot weather.

Leisurely boat ride on the Creek is the perfect antidote to Dubai's hectic life. Dubai Creek is bustling with activity, and it's a great place to get a glimpse of what life was like before Dubai became a busy, modern, megacity. We (a family of 4) rented an entire abra (ferry boat) at a throwaway price for a private short cruise on the creek, and it was simply amazing! The breeze was cool in our faces, and the hectic pace of Dubai seemed a long way off. Perfect way to unwind!

Lovely. The only old part.. I visited Dubai to see friends, it is not somewhere I would choose to go as it is all man made and modern. The creek however is a really lovely old traditional area that was great to walk around. Full of different souks and daily traditional export boats. Get a boat there from main part of Dubai as the boat trip is well worth doing on its own.
Worth a look. Quite a trip from where we were staying on the Palm but better that than staying in the Creek area. Do it as part of a visit to the Souks nearby, to experience Old Dubai
I just love it here. Dubai creek was my first port of call, though hot but excellent view. Can't forget the 1 dirham boat ride across the creek....Just wow

Busy creek with lots of small boats very colourfull at night. Busy day and night. You can criss cross creek on water taxis very cheaply. We also did a dinner cruise on lake which was very nice. Boats all decorated with strings of lights. You only go a couple of miles up and down creek and water very calm. Boats don't go in bad weather. Our hotel (Hilton Dubai Creek) was just across road from boat.

Good if you want to see "Old" Dubai.... Was okay if you want to see "old" dubai. All of the Souks down there, Gold and Spice. Was very disappointed, wanted more hustle and bustle but Spice souk was just a few stores selling the same spices.Boat across was cool and very cheapl! 17p! 1 Dirrum.

Nothing to see. Nothing special to see on the boarders of the creek. It's a normal tour in a boat in the water . We went there with the family by the wonder bus where the smell of diesel inside could kill you...

Feels like the Duabi you came to see. If visiting Dubai, this is a must see. There is so little to see of Dubai near your hotel unless you like malls. This is the hustling bustling older part of the city that makes you feel like you are in the Authentic Dubai. The shipping looks like it hasn't changed in 100 years, large boats arrive and are unloaded by hand onto push carts for delivery. I saw 8 fridges in their original boxes unloaded and pushed away by hand labelled with delivery addresses, it is quite the site to see. For 1 Durham make sure you do the crossing into Deira and just walk around the souks and the area.
Relaxing view.. Nice and relaxing. Great if you have someone with you that can point out landmarks and with a bit of info about the shipping.
Good experience... very hot!. good experience, be prepared to be swamped by all the traders and merchants! it costs 1 dirham per person to get the boats across the creek to the souks.
Nice and quick. Cross the river in one of those small boats, it's really nice, you can see both the Souks and it's pretty cheap doing this so don't miss it.

Dubai Creek/Old Dubai. It is a MUST see when you visit Dubai. What I loved was the authenticity and originality of the area; little has changed since the 80s. It is something you have to mentally prepare yourself and physically because the heat is draining. A lot of people wanting your attention and money. Here you can find nice purses, handbags, perfume/oils, dresses, etc. Also recommend that you take a water taxi over that is 1 UAE over to the spice & gold souk. It is a remarkable thing to see first hand and experience. This gave me a different level of respect for Dubai and the process it took to evolve into the "New Dubai".
Creek area. This is the heart of Dubai, ( old dubai ) it has a nice atmosphere to walk around and see all whats happening. Its nice to cross over the dubai creek and see the local market
Dubai Creek - Time Pass. This creek divides Bur Dubai and Deira Dubai. You can criss-cross in a ferry by paying 1 Dirham from one point to another

Can't leave Dubai without a peek here. The creek, especially the dhow harbour is a must see for every visitor to Dubai. Little changed since the 80s (before that Dubai was not really on any map) it still displays the spirit of the regional trading hub, as opposed to the global one. Have a taxi drop you at the spice souk and walk up the creek to the Sheraton. It is also recommended to cross the creek by Arbra to Bur Dubai and back.

Too hot to enjoy. We were staying at the Sheraton on Dubai Creek and thought we ought to do some exploring. We took a cruise on a small boat but the Creek, don't know why they call it this as its more of a river as it was really wide. This made it hard to see much at all. The food had been in the sun way too long and the drinks were not cold. I wouldn't do this again. It was mid summer and just too hot.... And we are Australian and used to 40 plus heat but not the humidity... Phew...!!! Couldn't wait to get back to out lovely hotel.
Sigh of relief by the water on the boat. Feel like home...stress free place wid numerous cafes by the water side. The market is one of the oldest trade locations in dubai

Unique but hot and busy!. Hot and crazy busy, take water and be prepared to be asked if your interested in countefeits. However lots of stalls and getting an Abra across the creek is a fun experience!

Such a buzz. This is one of the best places just to sit & watch the world go by. We have visited the creek in an Abra, stayed in a hotel next to the water & watched the dhows unload & its sailors sleep on the sidewalks. Just love seeing what the old Dubai must have looked like. Take the opportunity to Wander around the many souks in the area too.

This is where you will see old Dubai. This can be a busy place with lots of people just going about their business. Lots of narrow ally ways to explore and small shops everywhere and very safe. You can eat very cheaply in the kebab shops and in some of the open shops you can barter as well if you feel up for that. This is where the gold souk is, never ever seen as many gold shops all in one place. Suppose if you know what you are buying you could get it for a good price.Has to be experienced if you are in Dubai.

Dubai as it is!. This is the real Dubai without the expensive hotels. Here you see the ships which load and unload all the goods coming from other countries. From food to refrigerators. The street next to the water is loaded with goods. Lot's of people coming from the office area's to the ferry's going somewhere else. We enjoued over here several times the little street food places where they serve real fresh fruit like pineapple juice. Great drink.

Interesting and safe trip out. A good way to spend an afternoon is the gold souq near Dubai creek followed by a trip across creek in an Abra with a fare of an amazing 1dhiram each way. Lines along the opposite bank to the gold souq are a number of riverside cafes and restaurant last with excellent food and great views of the river. It feels really safe to wander around and is a nice way to see old Dubai.

Worth a visit, hustle and bustle and totally different from the new city.. Loved going here, total culture and very busy. Hustle and bustle of the locals and the boats crossing back And forth across the creek. 1 dirham gets yo us cross and it's a good cultural experience. Deffo worth a visit if you can.

Good place. You get to visit this creek through Dhow cruise. The creek looks good at night with lighted buildings all around. There are lots of dhow cruise you can select from but most probably you will get one with your tour package. We were with lama tours so our cruise boat was good. There were two floors one ac and other non ac. The food was good on boat. Overall an experience which you will have as your tour itenary.
Small boats moving back and forth on dubai creek. I just love to pass from old souq near gold market to the other side near al kabeer for a lovely dinner next to the creek
Cruising along Dubai Creek. Great way to experience the old part of Duabi and the nearby souks, cost 2 Dirhams per trip and payment to be made on the boat.

An area of hustle & bustle. We took a dhow cruise, it was very busy as it's close to the Spice Souk, with aromatic smells pervading the air.The cruise was a joy, lasting approx. 1 hour to see many of the creek facing buildings not seen on the adjacent road.An enjoyable experience, well worth doing

fantastic. Who goes to Dubai need to know the River Creek, local people use to cross from one side to the other of the city, to meet the gold market and spice you have to cross by boat and besides being cheap 1 Dirhams you still have the experience to experience the daily life of the locals.
a nice ride. taking a boat ride across the creek is a nice experience. it's a nice way to take a look how the city lives and breathes.

Not worth getting off the Big Bus for!. This is not worth getting off the Big Bus tour for. There is a cruise advertised and it is boring. Literally up and down the creek so stay on the bus and get home earlier!

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit in Dubai. The area around the creek is a little more authentic and traditional than the rest of Dubai and can be tied in with a trip to the Souks, a taxi across the creek and some good quality and reasonably priced restaurants.
Must see. The other side of Dubai, this is a nice taste of the original Dubai. Get a boat across the creek and visit the markets, they're excellent, be prepared for bargaining.

Visit along the dubai creek. Well worth a visit, if your luck you can try and chat a dhow owner for a v small fee, to take just your party even if there is only two of you....we did, along the creek and show you all the sites, even maybe tell you about them and what they are called. Also worth a visit over the other side to the gold markets, and the spice shops etc, see a little of the old dubai!,
Nice boat trip. . Nice small cruise i the creek. Not much to see except of the Dubai glass buildings, ut that's the town I guess. We had a nice time, but such a trip is nothing special.

Almost unavoidable. When you are in dubai, Gold souk, spice souk, meena bazaar , dinner cruise etc are normally a must for ant tourist. All these places and the cruises are located around this creek so will be vising it more than once
Old World. An interesting place to see some of the old traditions in Dubai. Something not to be ,missed away from the usual tourist attractions.
Take boat ride across for 1 dirham only. Old exotic neighborhood with traditional markets. Ride across the creek is only 1 dirham. Access to Gold and spice markets

A feast on the water. We took a 2 hour Dhow night cruise of the creek booked via Travco, which included a wonderful buffet meal.The choice of food was varied with generous portions of meats and fantastic deserts. The price of drinks were on the high end but tolerable given that the occasion was special. The guide was very helpful and informative with regard to the iconic features surrounding the creek.

Middle Eastern Charm!. While we were station at Dubai downtown - which is now almost man made, the "creek" has the real middle eastern charm. We took a ferry from station to another , got a chance to see the Gold Souk and other spice market. It was an exhilarating experience.

A good evening place to visit. You can spend your evening here at a few restaurants near Dubai Creek. It is very well maintained and clean place and you can go for the Boat ride from the water bus station. A good time to spend for the couples.

Still the lifeblood for Dubai. I have grown up in Dubai having spent almost 43 years here. Fair to say I have witnessed first hand the tremendous transformation in the city and the development of Dubai Creek which was dredged before land reclamation made it narrower.The Abras (water taxis) are still there and offer a cheap mode of transport - I used to make daily trips on the abras when home for school holidays. More sophisticated water transport is now available.Walking on either bank of the creek in the cooler weather is ideal. Dubai Creek remains the pulse and heartbeat of a vibrant city and is a must visit for all tourists.

Great views. Dubai creek was a cool and refreshing place, we just explore the place when we had dhow cruising the area. The view of the city was spectacular seeing all the high rise and the busy traffic was incomparable. Best for couple and families. Recommended for traveler.
Great place. Love to visit this area of Dubai with the bustle and the abras. A meal on an old fashioned dhow is a must but only in cooler months.

awesome. beautiful and the evening cruise is very pleasant. during the night one can see all the lights of the buildings around the creek and it is awesome. the meals and entertainment is also well worth it

Fresh Air!. Take time to visit this part of Dubai. So many holidays will centre (quite rightly) along the beautiful beaches, but the Creek, gardens and buildings here are gorgeous and there is a sense of cool fresh air here. i was lucky enough to each at the Creek Golf Club and can recommend the Lobster, but just as a tranquil place to watch the Dhows and the people for an hour or 2 is just lovely!

Old dubai. Old nostalgic feeling you will get here in creek.its a basically a water body, from the begining of dubai this area was mainly used for dock purpose for business or trading.you can cross the water body by using boat with 1aed only.its a kind of steamer mechanism.

Dubai creek offers nice views and gateway to shopping. Catch the abra, water taxi, from Bur Dubai to Deira or reverse and get caught up in some unique shopping experiences. A little like being in India and southeast Asia at the same time, which makes sense since this is where the Indians, Pakistanis, Afghanis, Iranians, Filipinos, etc tend their wares. Although I'm convinced after walking through the markets that everything's owned by a few Emiratis because everyone's selling the exact same stuff, it's still worth it to hike around the markets to see the fabrics and gold. You'd think someone would break out of the mold and try an entrepreneurial approach, but that doesn't happen.Worth the shopping experience but prepare to haggle especially if you look like a foreigner. I was surprised at how the prices were initially - at least 10 to 15 times what I was willing to pay. For example, a T-shirt with a picture of the Burj Khalifa on it should run you about 20-30 DHS but they were initially asking about 200. There was no way I was paying that so it took some time to negotiate down. What I should have realized is that there's another vendor just down the way offering the same damn shirt. So don't be afraid to walk away. you can always come back if you can find the same stand.
wonderful. Great area to stay, not far from down town dubai, and the airport.lovey walks along the creek, with locals small boats to take you to places of interest.
Lesuirely Cruising down the Creek. It's really bigger than a creek. Take a ride down the 'river' and enjoy seeing the hustle and bustle of Dubai from a different perspective. worth doing.
could have skipped. There is not anything special about this, except that its part of Dubai. the boats are not cheap and the smell of Gasoline on the boat is not appetizing.

nice to see at nights. walking along creek is relaxing. some people are running by the creek. so many restaurant by the river. we tried one of them and it was satisfactory. nice to see at night. so many light from tall buildings makes daylight effect.
Nice ferry travel. The Dubai Creek can be crossed using small vessels. This way one can get nice views from different areas of the creek.

Beautiful boat ride up and down the River. The old town is lovely. Kept very well and full of interesting little sooks and lane ways. Takes you back a bit in time in a good way. Cheap eats along the way and just Devine.

Dubai Creek worth a visit. Dubai Creek just as you hope; alive and bustling (except on Fridays, prayer day). From trade ships near the souks end to tourist dinner tours on lighted boats at night, the creek never seems to bore the eye. Walking along from the Sheraton Dubai Creek towards the souks, the beautiful wooden Restaurant boats gradually make way for bright blue trade ships with the quay side stacked high with tires, boxes and all kinds of assorted trading stuff. Interesting to watch and seeing how the true locals (mostly Indians here) deal with life as opposed to the glitzy side of Dubai. I was planning to go across on a dow but didn't. Each docking station seemed full with locals, only men, and as a solo woman traveler, I found this daunting and wasn't even sure if it was culturally okay so I didn't do it. I could have boarded at a big Dock but that was so close to my hotel it defeated the purpose of how I was wanting to return from the Gold Souk. I wasn't part of a pre-booked tourist tour to include a dow trip; maybe that's worth it but in general I like to do my own thing. Dubai Creek: I'd say definitely worth a visit

Nights of One Thousand and One Nights in Dubai. Dubai Creek story of the hug sea, desert and civilization.Cruises for two hours with dinner and entertainment in the traditional ships .Rates are very symbolic and vary depending on the companies that followed each ship between 80 and 150 dirhams per person, excluding everything.Date cruises usually eight o'clock or eight thirty in the evening.Recommend to experience cruises in the Dubai Creek are a great opportunity to break the routine bustle of the city.

Great Dhow boat trip.. Lovely boat trip around Dubai Marina and Creek in a Dhow boat. The scenery is beautiful and the buildings just magnificent. The trip lasted about and hour and I thought well worth the money. The only thing I didn't like was the price of the drinks as a can of coke cost me 4 euros. There is so much to see on this trip and to see all the big yachts in the Marina is unbelievable, there is obviously a disgusting amount of money in Dubai being one of the richest countries in the world. A trip well worth taking.

You can see the old and the new. It is interesting to see the old wooden vessels that take cargo across to Iran and also the wooden floating restaraunts that tour the Creek of a night. You can also take a taxi ride across the Creek on a vessel that you could only describe as very basic. Then you can also observe the modern day Cruisers.

walking around dubai. loved the boat(abra) ride on Dubai Creek. they called it the water taxi. sitting in the boat with the locals gave me a perspective of the day to day life of the traders in the nearby souks.

Probably as close to real Emirates (and foreign workers) as you will get. We just used the 'free boat ride' ticket on the Big Bus trip. Got off the bus, browsed the Souk (outdoor street market) and got on an abra to ride a kilometer to the other side. Crowded as the London Tube at Piccadilly, but interesting experience with 'local' families an workers using it as their river/rapid transportation. If you don't have the Big Bus ticket, I think the charge is two dirham.... loose changeHmmm, just realized not handicap friendly.
Nice view from water. It is really nice to take a boat tour that will also take you to the creek. Nice to see the creek from water also, so you should do that if you find time.

Authentic original Dubai experience. Great opportunity for an authentic old Dubai experience.. Did the dinner cruise on one of the many floating restaurants.. 80 AED per head. Can also take the Abraa - small boat for 1 to 3 AED and get to the old souk/market - to get some bargain shopping...

The Old But Real Dubai!. We visited Dubai twice, once staying on the strip and once in the Deira. The experience was night and day. The Dubai Creek and Deira area is what a visitor wants to see. Big hotels, traffic, and expensive malls makeup the new strip Dubai. Yes, you do need to visit the tourist attractions on the strip, but the light rail will get you anywhere and eating and walking on the Creek and it's attractions and Arabic shopping were what suited our enjoyment of Dubai. If you are in Dubai for business, shopping, or the beach, then stay in what I call the new Dubai.

Well worth a visit. Take a trip on one of the local water taxis across the creek. Watch the dhows being loaded for their journeys across the Persian Gulf and be amazed at the variety of goods which are transported. Everything is loaded manually!
Old Dubai. A fascinating stroll brining you closer to old Dubai,watch dhows being unloaded with giant fridge freezers and other white goods stacked on the harbour side. No container ships here!
Rent a Dhow!. Get a tour on a Dhow - but hire a private boat for your group. It's very cheap and a nice novelty having your own boat.
Dubai Creek. This is a great place to visit when seeing Dubai. You can go down to the Gold and Spice Souk for shopping.
Romantic thing to do !!!. Nice Romantic dinner, but a bit corwded so i suggest you sit on the top floor of any boat/cruise/yatch you pay for !!!
dubai creek. the Dubai creek connects the old part of Dubai with the new Dubai and a ride on it by Abra boats is worthwhile

Nice tour. I take a tour with Raynatours.com : Dhow Cruise Creek Deira/ Bur Dubai with dinner.This tour give the opportunity to look at evening Dubai floating slowly in the Creek , tasting local cuisine and looking funny Tanura dance.

Boat ride to cross the creek which devides the 2 sides of the city of Dubai. Nice boat ride on the Dubai Creek shows the contrast between the old Dhows and the modern architecture of the ever expanding city. Just the crossing from one side of the city to the other is already a nice experience.

A must see in your Dubai trip. The creek is a must see. It connects to other end gold souks, spice souks, means bazaar. The boat ride are very cheap for 1 dinar you get to the other side boats are regular.
The shops around the area are tucked away in old alleyways and have a Arabic influence. I loved the ambience around here .

Don't miss this. If you are making the trip to the city, you absolutely must stop by the creek, Deira and Bur Dubai. Don't recommend doing this in the summer unless you are very tolerant of heat, but any time between October and April the weather is quite reasonable. Why go there? See the dhows which still ply their trade with small voyages across the gulf. This trade is what first put dubai on the map when a wave of immigrant merchants arrived and were given permission to use the port as a base. See the buildings which are less than a 100 years old, but still use methods of construction which were in favor for centuries. They are built to be reused and many materials actually made their first appearance in far older structures which are now forgotten. Take a water taxi trip with the people who keep the city running, living a whole other lifestyle quite detached from the 5 star facilities frequented by the upper crust. If you are a photographer the small alleys provide tons of colorful surprises and interesting people. Grab a camera and spend hours looking around.

Lovely to walk along.. Great atmosphere down at the Creek ,everything from car spares to cookers line the pavements waiting to be loaded and shipped to India and beyond in the old wooden boats called Dhowes, catch an Abbara across to Bur Dubai see the old and new sides of the city from the water. Fab.

Amazing place for Barbeque. with pleasure i saw the boats sailing up and down the creek,that show how trade once was and still is conducted the enchanting lights from the boats surely attract everyones attention.recomment every one to visit alteast once it is an experience for all
Good to visit. Good to visit it, enjoy the time with family but need to fix some direction board as you can lost easily hahahaahaha
Dubai creek. Went in a boat for an hour absoultely loved it, kids loved it and the scenes around it were stunning, take plenty of water as it does feel very very hot, one hour is more than enough

Chilled out boat tour. We did the city tour on the bus which included a boat trip up the creek. It was lovely and the sights of the buildings kept everyone quiet as we watched the world go by on the boat :)

Serene place to spend your evening , a no-cost leisure. Nice view of the waters, a little crowded during the weekends and finding a place to sit could be an issue. Worth spending time in the evenings , especially during the winters when the weather is cold..
Interesting but maybe not a dedicated visit . If you are in the area, or bored of shopping, creek offers somewhere pleasant to stroll. But otherwise, nothing special.
Dubai Creek must visit. You must visit this place where you can see a floating bus on the river. Awesome. You can see the twin tower of Rolex building.
romantic place. it is a place which situated besides a river....a couple walk, jogging etc can be done...a cold and fresh breeze one can experince there

Night visit . What a beautiful place. It's glorious at night. The temperature has dropped to a more comfortable 30 degrees and a gentle breeze passes through the air.
We went on a cruise for about an hour. Cost £14 each I think. So relaxing. Really romantic.
Lots of bars and restaurants to carry on the evenings entertainment.

Authentic, lively heart of the city where it all started. The Dubai creek holds the history of the city and that is why I love it. You can find some authentic houses here, and have a look where it all started. You can take a dhow and go to the other side of the water.My best tip is to read about the history of Dubai before you go to the creek, so you know what you are looking at.

Nice busy area with lots to do & see. We always find ourselves spending so much time at and around the Creek. You can not go to Dubai and not visit the Creek. Hang Out With Friends or Family.... This place is not like a park or some kind of attraction, its a big area where you can have access to restaurants, the Gold souq, the spices market and also trading of all kind of time. You can pay 1 dhs and ride the botes that will take you from one side to the other side its like the aquatic bus! Wonderful. Viewing Dubai by water is a wonderful way to see how time has altered this diversified city.Waters are calm and clear, and feature a mixture of yesterday and today.Certainly worth a visit, perhaps best seen from the cooler months of winter.

A smorgasboard of activities to do!. When you first arrive around the Dubai Creek area, you might feel a bit intimidated by the activity of the many bustling businesses (and hence, pretty horrible traffic) happening on both sides of the creek. However, this is the 'old' area of Dubai, and in my opinion the most interesting. On the Bur Dubai side, you have the Dubai Museum (fun fact: opp the Dubai Museum is H.H. The Ruler's Court complex, one of the most important government complexes), the Textile Souk, and lots of small shops selling textiles, food, and others. Catch an abra (small boat - costs you 1Dh per person!) to the Deira side, and here you find many many dhows that transport materials of all kinds to places like Iran, India, etc. It's fascinating walking by and seeing all the random assortment of things the dhow owners will transport - individuals will give them anything from a huge load of refrigerators, so a small pack of money to take to a loved one. And everyone trusts these guys - it hurts their business model if they were ever caught (or even accused) of stealing something they were trusted with. Also on the Deira side is the Gold Souk, the Old Souk (lots of souvenir options here, from gorgeous lamps decorated in mosaics, to scarves - but it also has plenty of everyday household things so as a resident, I always like pottering around to find something for the house, be it cooking utensils, kids toys to give friends, or anything else. Be warned: it's a bit of a maze, so be prepared to get lost!), the perfume souk (not really very established, but it is there!), and again, plenty of small shops with wholesalers and everything you can imagine. Go a bit futher and you'll find the Fish Market (great, fresh fish at amazing prices) which also has a fruit and vegetable market (in my opinion, the produce here is of MUCH better quality than the fruit and vegetable market out past Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Rd). I do all my produce shopping here. This area reminds you of what Dubai looked like before the construction boom that has overwhelmed pretty much everywhere else. Try and go during the cooler times of the year, as almost everything is outdoors (save for the occasional shop with AC) so you won't get much respite from the heat. Also, sellers will bring down the prices, so be sure to bargain - I always try to get down to 50% (at least!) of their original price, and often I can do much better (if you like bargaining, this place is amazing, but you have to be firm!).The reason I don't give this place a 5-star rating? 'Disability access' is just non-existent. The traffic is horrendous (so coming by Metro, or parking nearby and then catching a taxi into the heart of it is the best way to go - parking is a nightmare), and you need to be wary that quality of products vary wildly - some sellers will happily explain to you that they have both fakes and the genuine article (e.g. pashminas), whereas others will try to trick you, and others just sell bad-quality products outright (I bought a terrible knife that was thrown out straight away). So if you want genuine products, know what to look for (e.g. real pashminas don't flame if you put a lighter to them, real leather won't melt if you put a lighter to them), and do your research. As a resident, I have worked out who I can trust and who I can't, so ask locals/residents if you know any. If you can bargain in Arabic, sellers will be very impressed!You can easily spend a whole day here, so pace yourself, enjoy the ridiculously cheap (and authentic) food and drink you can get at the small restaurants and stalls (Persian, Indian, so many choices!). If you buy something, many shops are happy for you to leave your (heavy) bag of goods at the shop, to pick up at the end of the day just before you go home, so you are not carting it around. Just ask!

tradional dubai. it took only few minets from side to side. will take you from modern dubai to old market. best way to get to the other part so you dont neetd to get car or parkings. very nice diffrents view both side.

Nice. Did a dinner cruise on the Creek. Quite pricey (325AED) but the food was nice and it was a nice experience. The show was weird and not that entertaining, and the boat went really slow, not much to see
Peaceful Place!. Beautiful Place. A few buildings around the creek are under construction. The Dhow Cruise Dinner ride happens in the creek. Worth a try.

Pretty Dhows!. Went on an Arabian Nights Tours Dhow Cruise for my sister's birthday. The lights on the dhow when we arrived were spectacular, so we thought we were in for a treat.My mother and I are both disabled, so climbing the steps was very difficult for us, and although there was a ramp at the top, it was much too steep and it took three people to help us on board.The interior of the boat was lovely, with a huge buffet service down the centre, serving mostly spicy food, which I, unfortunately, couldn't eat, due to severe allergies to certain spices. However, the chef very kindly prepared some kebabs for me without any spices. The desserts were delicious.The music was way too loud, to the point where we couldn't talk to or hear each other, and we would have appreciated a commentary every now and then, telling us where we were along the creek.Other than those issues, not a bad night.

Try choosing a hotel in the old section of Dubai,near the creek ,Dubai is much more than a shopping destination.. Our hotel was one street away from the Dubai C reek and in the early evening cool we strolled along the far bank,we reached this on a tiny water taxi,only a few cents each and so cool out on the water and the total view of each bank was very interesting,we landed on the other side right in the middle of a market for everything,everyone was so friendly, of course hoping for a sale but no one pressured us and were happy to chat and ask us about where we lived and what we did.We then wandered on ,all the pathways are paved and many,many restaurants setting up their tables for the dinner trade right on the waters edge,fairy lights everwhere and beautifully set tables with amazing Arabian style pottery plates and lamps,very charming.Would have loved to stop and eat but my husband had other ideas,further along the creek is pedestrian underpass that goes under the river and comes out at the Gold Market" ,very busy and a bit confronting as there is sooo much gold to look at.Just down the road a bit is another metro station ,so we had an easy ride back to our hotel which is just over the road from the metro,which incidentally is a must to use in Dubai as it gets you everwhere quickly,cheaply and is A/C.

Lovely relaxing place to spend a few hours. Beautiful part of the city. Very much a chilled out section where you can walk along the waters edge to your hearts content. Get an abra across the creak for 1 AED and go and enjoy the gold and spice souks.

A nice boat ride. This area is part of old Dubai with heritage opposite to the new Dubai. The water is calm and there are plenty of boats and launches moving across.
Good cruise. I think this can be little better organised. we used Rainbow cruise, only thing was they need to organise it little better way. The performaers are come and distrub.

Go On ... You Know You Want To. Probably the best value for money that you will get in the whole of Dubai. I'm sorry it did nothing for me.... It's the other extreme of Dubai, not glitzy or OTT. it's a working old fashioned docks. Its sort of quaint, but not sure if it's worth going out of your way for?It is, I'm told what Dubai was like 20 or 30 years ago.If you want you can get a water taxi from one side to the other, that's very cheap.

Fantastic area to discover the history of Dubai. As always we took some visitors to Dubai Creek, to have a look around and get some dinner. Although it's hot at the moment, the restaurant we ate at still had seating outside and was still serving food outside. The food, as ever was amazing and traditional arabic food, giving everyone the experience of traditional Dubai in contrast to the new, high rise Dubai that is taking over. We also walked through the heritage village, which unfortunately was deserted, but having been there before the area is great for tourists giving them an idea of what Dubai was like and an opportunity to buy some tourist souvenirs and pictures. Watching the boats sailing up and down the creek is an experience for all, the lights from the boats attract everyones attention and the dhows sailing up and down show how trade once was and still is conducted. This is definitely an area to visit when in Dubai and enjoy some local cuisine.
Dubai Creek. fantastic view and merger of old and new Dubai across the entire stretch of the creek... Dhow cruise is a must go..

Great spot for lunch. We walked from the Arabian Courtyard Hotel through the textile souk to the creek and spent about an hour over an enjoyable lunch and watching the world go by in their water taxis

The oldest / newest part of Dubai. The creek runs through the old heart of Dubai, as it was before tourism, petro-dollars & influence started a building craze along the entire Dubai coastline. New & Old sit side by side, the experience can be jolting & is not easily forgotten. Ladies should respect local sensibilities regarding dress as there are a number of mosques nestling within the tangle of streets & alleyways of the old town and a respectful traveller is always the most welcomed.
Boat trip worth visit. Old part of Dubai, we took a boat trip to look around on beautifully sunset. Many small stores around with good bargains.
Nice experience.. Something I never imagined existed. The ride on the river in an open boat was smashing and thrilling.

A civilised way of seeing Dubai. Last year we visited Dubai with Carol's sister Gillian as she was taking part in a production of "Messiah". We enjoyed the city very much. The boat trip around the creek is a great way of seeing the city.

The real Dubai!. You can visit the Dubai museum and shop in the old souq. You can find Arabic and Asian street food in different parts of the creek. I usually take the boat from the creek to the 'Old Spice Market' which is in Deirah Dubai from there you can walk into the world's biggest 'Gold Market', a place for Gold bargains!

Must visit place. Evening Walk and to visit the real Dubai, Dubai Creek is the best place. Moving dhows and Cargo Boats, Loading and unloading stuffs on the creek dockyard, its all gives you a quick g limes of old trading port. Nice view of twin city Bur Dubai and Diera Duba with Modern and Historical Building. The birth place of Dubai City is Dubai Creek Side.
Cheap and easy.. Take a ride on the water in the creek and enjoy the scenery. Its a pleasant few hours and then you can explore that section of the city.

Legend. This is the main vens of DubaiBoth old down towns are located on both sides of the creek Historic buildings aroundTry Abra as trasport or water taxiLocal markets in both sidesShort cruise is a good choice also

Creek is like river surrounding Dubai. One side is shipping areas taking products to other countries and you can see many goods stacked up and many smaller boats. The other side has a park for locals, nothing special. You can take a boat ride here but not much to do just to go to creek.

Discovering the charm of Old Dubai.... ...a clear geographical and cultural divide from New Dubai, had me enthralled. The city first began to grow around Dubai Creek, where it is still used today for importing and exporting goods to and from different areas. Also, the creek’s waterways are still used as commuter lanes where passengers cheaply cross to and from Bur Dubai to Deira on the brightly decorated wooden dhows. Dubai Museum, in the Bastkiya area, is located within the city’s oldest building, Al Fahidi Fort, which was erected in 1787. The house of Sheikh Saeed bin Maktoum Al Maktoum, who ruled Dubai from 1912-1958, is considered to be one of the most important buildings in Dubai as it once housed a ruler. This is definitely the place for bargain hunting within the souks: the spice souk (be prepared for a surrender of all senses), textile souk (best pashminas ever seen, but the thought of buying one in such heat completely deluded me) and the gold souk. Abundant food stalls selling tasty finger foods are worth sampling – I couldn’t get enough of the large green spicy capsicum chillies dipped in a light batter; moreish is not the word… Would you believe that there’s even an authentic British pub called Sherlock Holmes, and is brimming with both locals and tourists? Really!View more images here: http://beanon.co.za/dubai-diary-the-old-dubai/

Great experience as part of a day's tour of the area. Part of a day trip to take in the Creek, Dubai Museum, Souks, Jumeirah Mosque etc. If only for the water taxi experience, you have to go here for the culture and to say you have done it :)
Must spend some time and walk along the creek or take a cruise. This creek flows right through old dubai. Evenings are cooler and beautifully lit boats dot the creek at sunset.

Great to experience 'Old' Dubai. Great to experience the hustle and bustle of the Creek, visited a souk and saw the abras coming and going across the Creek. On the far side of the Creek saw numerous dhows moored together, loading and unloading all along the wharf with a variety of goods which emphasised that although a tourist attraction it is actually a busy trading port with a long history.Dhow trip on the Creek a 'must do' if you can.

relaxing atmosphere that worth trying.... we got a cruise in the creek. very relaxing trip. a non guidance trip, but you will enjoy the view from the water. Every thing you may buy on the boat is really expensive. enjoy..

Real Dubai. We took The Bateaux dinner cruise on the Creek and also the Abra ride for 1AED. We were sorry we didn't spend more than one evening around Bur Dubai & Deira. The souqs and the craic seemed good. The different cultures unloading their goods. Al worth the visit to the area.
Cosy older place in dubai. Very cosy atmosphere next to the water if you want to go for a nice place for dinner. Dinnerboats is available as well.
Fantasic. wonderful experience of being on a ferry in the middle of a town, lovely indeed. seeing Bur Dubai and Deira with a close eye!

Budget Creek Boat Ride. If you want to go on a creek boat trip a cheap option is to use the ferry crossing with the locals, it only cost 1 Dirham compared to the 50 that the tourists pay for a similar trip. The experience is much the same.
nice buildings but have experienced better. Having took a tour on a small boat it was not as impressive as one would have expected and the heat was not helping

The two faces of Dubai. Dubai Creek is the meeting point of modern Dubai and the old part of the city. Its an exciting mixture of experiences. One can observe the modern, luxurious buildings of Dubai and the old souk (market) with its narrow streets with the effervescent bustle of everyday life. I was deeply impressed with the cavalcade of people of different nationalities that live in the poorer part of the city. The old souk and the gold souk throw us back in time. We also took a trip with a dhow (or abra), which took us from the trading port to the Indian flower market. I loved how colorful, peaceful and multicultural that place was!
Enjoyable experience.. Used the water taxis in and around this area very quaint and an interesting experience. Will be amazing when all the work they are doing is finished.
Nice!. This is a pretty nice area, and can be a relief from Dubai's buildings. I took a water taxi from the museum side to Bur Dubai area. Worth a visit.

Evening in the Creek. We had taken a boat ride in Dubai Creek for an hour on of the boats which ferry passengers across the creek. It is an experience in itself where charms of Old Dubai with limelight of Dubai built new is a combined view. Must try for travelers and families. Be safe with Kids.
The Creek!. This is probably one of the best places in Dubai especially after the sun sets. You can go for a stroll or fishing or just to have some beer!

Dubai on a Shoestring. Dubai Creek is basically the old waterfront and heart of the more traditional Dubai. Nowadays there are many a chic hotel and fine dining restaurant dotted along its charming banks, but there is still a lot of culture to be found in this much cheaper district of this fun loving city.You can find many a cruise on an abra (traditional water taxi) that will take you from one side of the creek to the other. Along the creek you will find old style souks that are a fraction of the price of the later air conditioned malls.However, nightime is when the creek really comes to life with traditional Dhow sailing ships decked out to offer guests a cruise up and down the creek, showing it in all of its lit up glory. On the cruises you will be treated to an all you can eat banquet and usually a light hearted show of some sort. These can be excellent value, but for those searching for a slightly more romantic feel, there is the bateau Dubai, which is a floating restaurant offering some fantastic gastronomic delights and a Friday brunch extravaganza.Dubai Creek should not be missed!

Dhow Cruise - Loved It. The Dubai Creek, said to be a salt water creek divides the city of Dubai into Deira and Bur Dubai. It allows large scale transportation through dhows. One of these Dhows we visited in the evening was spectacular and it was great feeling. You can see the beautiful building of Rolex and a lot other buildings. The water shines at night and the Dhow Cruise is a great experience to feel.

transport why the metro, try the small boats?ferry to take you across. they run from early morning till midnight.. this is the perfect way to expirance the ancient way of travelling in the ancient times. you can cross over to Bur Dubai from Deira for just 2 dirhams and once across there are some lovly souks to go and see and have a good haggle and bargain.

Old Dubai - a complete contrast. Great to wander around and visit a few of the heritage museums.Catch a traditional RTA Water Taxi - 1 Dhirham - don't get stung by hiring a whole boat for a tour.Visit the Spice Souk on the other side then back for a wander.

Lights At Night. It was really a great experience to have a night cruise in Dubai Creek, we took that boat called Dhaow which is sailing along those amazing views of Dubai at night, it is really considerable to be aware of the high level of humidity over there, and it is advisable to do it in winter not in summer.

Great place, especially in the late evening. A truly nostalgic glimpse of pure classic Dubai trading - with all the wooden dhows, and cargo waiting to be shipped to nearby places. This is how it must all have been before the multi-storeyed towers came up! With the lights glimmering in the evening sea, truly a beautiful sight.
Another creek. A commercial creek. Good views and and a good place to pass time on a cool day. Very close to city and airport

Wonderful at night. A nice contrast from modern Dubai is the creek with its authentic Dhows cruising up and down. Especially at nighttime this is a great spot as most of the dhows light up like christmas trees when they go for their dinner cruises.

Visit Dubai Marina instead if limited time in Dubai. The Dubai creek was an interesting place to visit to experience a feel of old Dubai. You can visit the creek after visiting the gold and spice souks as they are just walking distance from it. Personally I was more impressed with the Dubai Marina as it has more to offer.

Creek Location. Dubai Creek is an excellent location to stay whilst visiting Dubai. It's only a 15 minute taxi drive from the airport. It is convenient to visit the Spice and Gold Souks as well as catching boats across the creek or going on evening cruisers. View of the Burge Kaliffa is excellent. Most hotels offer shuttle bus services to the beach and Malls. Most malls are within 10/15 minutes away from this location.

Doh trip on the creek. We booked a trip on a doh ( not sure how to spell it), an old wooden boat, it was air conditioned and we had a beautiful meal on board, you could sit on the top deck and watch the world go by, great experience.

Cheap destination in Duibai. Dubai Creek has a lot going for it. There are a number of restaurants right on the Creek where you can watch the river traffic and the people coming and going. There is a great souq for tourists on the south side, right near the water taxi station. In fact, the shopping all around this area is worth a look for inexpensive clothing and the usual tourist items. There are also many really tiny eateries where the locals eat. Extremely cheap food and really delicious!The water taxi will carry you across the creek for 1 dirham. Pay the skipper on the boat. This will take you across to the other side where other attractions are within easy walking distance: the spice souq, and of course the gold souq. These are not to be missed for any traveller to Dubai. I come back here time after time just for the hustle and bustle.At night there are a number of gin palaces that offer dinner cruises up and down the Creek. These are lit up with all sorts of colours and make a spectacular sight.
Dubai Creek. It is a national Heritage of the emirates. Best of Both Worlds. Could see seagulls flying around. Good experience
Peaceful. It is a nice place to take a walk with anyone dear. And ofcourse we can see a lots of exclusive cars around the road

perhaps it was our tour. could have been interesting Im sure but we went on a boat so slow we could have swum faster. There was no commentary - at least not up top where we sat to get some sort of breeze. Inside was stifling! Avoid this if you're doing it as part of the Dubai Big Bus tour
Pleasant evening. Quaint boat, good food , interesting entertainment, piped bollywood music was a mild irritant- but all in all a pleasant evening floating down the creek.
The creek. A nice place to walk around - lots to see and do (mostly shop) and lots of expensive cars to see! The city is very clean and we felt very safe
Fantastic at night. Nothing to dislike, everything about the creek at night is alive. You have to do a after dark dinner cruise to get the full value of the creek.

30 Mins of Tranquility. We stayed in this area and not too far from the souq are the water taxis that ferry people to and from work but some are also used for tourists. We were offered a journey up and down the river for £10 for 3 people and though t why not as it was late afternoon and we'd had a trigin day walking about. The water ride was very pleasant and gives some lovely picturesque views of this area of Dubai. Not many loud noises to contest with just the peacefulness of the waves off the boat!

Old city. It was nice to see some heritage of the city and what made its name in the region with the pearl boats. The interesting but crowded Dow taxis. You can walk down the old municple road, old Balydia, to see old structures of the original city center. Not too far away is the Gold Souk.
A great night. We had an evening dinner cruise which was great. To see the creek at night gave another prospective.
Appalling. It may be just me or it maybe because of the quality of the dhow cruise. Overall I was very disappointed by this entire affair. Less talk the better.

The Creek ( big) runs thru the old town called Deira.. On the north side of the creek , which is quite wide, is all the old markets (Souks) from spices souk to fabris souk to silver souk and of course the Gold souk. You can spend all day here exploring all the nooks and crannies but the salesmen hound you to buy their wares. Some say it is better to not look them in the eye, just look at the ground, but what fun is there in that!! You can have fun with them but they will stick to you for ever! They will wear you out. Other parts of the Creek have restaurant and we were fascinated by the not that big boats that were loaded high with goods of all sorts including cars, all piled on the deck in no particular order. They were apparently going to Somalia and I wonder how many would make it!

A very hot day out. We did an half day city sites tour which finished with a trip across the Dubai creek to visit the traditional Dubai spice markets and gold souks on a very hot 42 degree day it was a very authentic experience.
take in the sights of the city on a ''ABRA'' ride!!. enjoy a peaceful boat ride on the waters of the famous creek and take in all the surrounding sights and sounds!
Best part of Dubai. A relaxing water taxi journey in Old Dubai on an old fashioned open-air boat, without all the crazy modern architecture.
This was Dubai. Dubai creek, is the origin of Dubai walking in the area you may understand how fast the grow up has been on the last 20 years.

Reminiscent of the Arabian stories and movies back in the days.... It was breathtaking to seethe old merchant ships I used to imagine when I read Arabian stories and watch Arabian movies! I visited during the day and saw lots of Dhow cruise ships. A lot of the merchant boats were offloading their cargo. I will take ride on one of those next time out!
The real Dubai come see where it started.. Great area to seek the traditional dubai, spice markets and gold souks really give you the authentic experience.

Old Dubai at work, provides such a contrast in this amazing place.. So interesting to see the older living breathing commercial part of this city. Find a cafe at the waters edge, have a drink and something to eat whilst you watch Old Dubai working. It's fascinating and atlast Dubai seems 'real'. Loved it!

A time to cherish. We lived around Alfahidi Str when we were kids & used Abra (water taxi) as known to our tourist friends!
Sitting in one now, takes me & my siblings down the memory lane. Especially the sunsets.
I sm sure the visitors enjoy it & have fun.
Little boat. Refreshing and fun!!! Beautifully view, nice short ride from one side to the other took the abra boat only 1 dirham !!

Pleasantly surprised.. we did the Bateaux Dubai Dinner Cruise and were really surprised , turned out to be our best night out which during Ramadan is quite an achievement. We were greeted and seated promptly. the staff were wonderful and the meal was to perfection. well worth it.

Great alternative to "5 star" Dubai.. Well worth a look and exposes you to a different area of Dubai across the creek. We have spent a few afternoons exploring the area and combining it with a cheap lunch in one of the many restaurants on the Creek side. It costs 1 dirham for a ride across the creek in an Abra and well worth it.

You can catch a boat from on side ot the other for 0.20 $. You can catch a boat from on side ot the other for 0.20 $. Nothing special. We did a Cruise Chow Dinner that was not really good . Nothing much to see there.
Dhow Cruise. It is fantastic to cruise in the creek in the night and have a buffet dinner. Take memorable shots with your family.

A GREAT CONTRAST TO THE MODERN DUBAI. Dubai Creek was waaay nicer to visit than we expected. Interesting market stalls and narrow back alleys, but a totally different contrast to the high rise construction and air conditioned shopping malls. Make sure you grab a bite to eat at one of the restaurants on the creek side - you won't be disappointed
Hustle and bustle all day. Walking along the Dubai creek is fascinating. Very busy harbor, loading and unloading all day and into the night. Take an Abra to go to the souks.
Something really arabic n original. Enjoy visiting the creek and have sense of how people in dubai used to earn their living 40 years ago.. And take abra ( ferry) or water bus for 1.5 dollars per way

Dubai-burdubai water highway!. we took cruise to roaming around burdubai-dubai, lovely place in late night, dancers will dance on cruise and great hospitality by locals.we liked the cruise round a lot, we were ther on 25th sept 2013, very beautiful
Best outing . One of the best outing in dubai. This is family place. Childrens will enjoy a lot. Nice atmosphere. Very clean place

Go Before Redevelopment is Complete. So much of Dubai's history sprang from this area & there is so much activity along its shores, it is worth the visit just to watch the movement of people & goods. There are also some very good restaurants, groceries, & shops to visit. This is how the vast majority of the population of Dubai lives, not in gold & glass shopping malls. Yes, it's not sparkling & shiny like so much along Shaikh Zayed Road, but it is real. For those who get a bit squeamish about less polished places, it is perfectly safe - from the sidewalks to the street vendors. It's very easy to reach on the Metro.Do yourself a favor & take a water taxi, before they disappear.
Another must. Close to the spice and gold souks it is a must do visit. If not on a tour haggle the price of an abra. Mosques and other buildings line the creek.
Scenic and tranquil. Scenic and tranquil ride on the creek accompanied by lively cultural music and dance. The buffet dinner offers a good variety.

we followed the creek around the different areas and took a ride in a Dhow. Twenty people crowded into a Dhow to go from one side of the creek to the other.
It gave the feeling of what the locals do in their every day life to commute to the area of the Spice Market

Interesting sight. In the heat of the evening there was a cooling breeze as we wandered along the Creek. Cloth markets edged the water and there was a lot of activity to watch both on and off the water.
Old dubai creek. Great experience !. Took a private ride for only 120 AED along the creek for one hour. You can see some landscapes and interesting places from the creek.

Take an abra across the creek - refreshing and a taste of the local. We experienced the creek by taking an abra (small river ferry) across from the textile souk to the gold/spices souk. The boat ride is cheap, the other passengers were local, and it gives a refreshing open -air experience of the creek, with nice photo opportunities.
some history. Dubai is so new and modern there is not much history visible there. The creek provides a different flavor to the city and shows more local approach of day to day life.

Real Dubai. This place is real Dubai very different from new Dubai you must experience this yourself, simple boat ride and old buildings with small side streets you can get lost in but its always very safe no matter where you go in Dubai you can find a real bargain here if you know where to look.

Abra ride is a must. Just so I could say I did it, I enjoyed an abra cruise on the Creek, from one side to the other. The water is quite clean and it appears the locals look after it, as there was no rubbish in the water, as I saw in other cities I visited (Rome especially- the Tiber was disaoointing)

Varied activities.. We've been to the Creek on a number of occasions. Sometimes, as most people to look around and boat across to the other side and later on, back again. Also, just to walk up and down and take into activity. The cafe places that are mostly open serve simple food and canned drinks and even coconut drink in the shell. It's best to ask th price of everything before ordering as this most often varies according to the servers assessment. More lately we cycle along and that makes quite a different experience, although a bit limited. You can of course combine with other things and we cross over to the Marriott for lunch.

There's not a great deal here to do.... Dubai Creek! First of all you have to get there and if you've hired a car, don't use Sat Nav as there are roadworks which bar your way from parking and walking, even though you'll see it through the workers' fence. Once found after navigating the truly horrendous road system (flawless tarmac though) there's nothing in the Creek other than a few old wooden clad junk type boats (I can't remember the proper name) masquerading as floating restaurants and few bar/restaurants and a couple of dingy cafe outlets. There's a grassy area with a couple of plastic camels that you might want your photo taken with.

Authentic experience crossing on an abra. We took an abra across the creek at night with our two children. All of the other passengers were local men. The driver repeatedly beeped his horn and swerved to avoid a large boat heading straight for us. The trip is quick and atmospheric. As you arrive at the souks be prepared to be bombarded with sellers!

Wow. Interesting water taxies and water restaurants, great food, the cruise is worthy a try, i wish the distance was longer.
Big thanks to Sun and Sky management.

Visit Twice. If you are in Dubai, you will visit the Dubai Creek. Just do yourselves a favor and make 2 trips - once during the day time and the other at night. Both experiences will be drastically different.
Nice and historical. Very nice place, part of old Dubai. Historical and full of places to shop. Pay attention on the music that plays from the mosquees calling people to pray.

Great place to see. A great area to explore on foot as by water taxi is the Dubai creek. It's like you dive back into the past. I took the water taxi ( inexpensive) and went exploring. It was amazing..

Take a camera. the Creek is a purpose built inlet, where you will find shops, restaurants, and lots of very tall buildings, that have to be pictured. we spent 3 nights walking the creek, and stopping in different restaurants, a great place, and makes you feel very small

Old meets the new.. Experience the old and new ways of life of Dubai. Take a trip across the creek in the 'abra' style of boat where the mode of transport probably hasnt changed for decades. The cost of crossing the creek is only minimal.Plenty of good creek side restaurant to choose from and the ambience can be really enjoyed. A short walk to the nearest souk. It all happens within a very short distance,

Prepare to be sold to at the Souks!. The Creek is where it all started so definitely worth a visit.The Souks are well signposted and the taxis will drop you there.The Gold and Spice Souks are on one side of the river and the Textile Souk on the other.Use the boats to cross the Creek (1 Dh each way) as they're good fun.The Gold is exquisite. Plenty of gifts in the Textile Souk.Yet bear in mind that you will be hassled as soon as you get out of the taxi to the moment you get back into it. So be prepared and politely decline even the most persistent salesman!

Night Cruise. The name Dubai Creek belittles the night cruises available on the Creek, I prefer River.2 hour cruises normally include food of average standard, but the ambience of the night lights and visuals from the Boat is well worth the time.

A must visit. The creek is reminiscent of what Dubai was like in its day. It's an interesting place with cargo being loaded onto wooden dows. The ferry across the creek is inexpensive and fun. A visit to the creek is a must for any traveller to dubai. It's one of the few real things left of the original dubai.

Do it, take one of the taxis across the water... Great entertainment. Walk along the eater front and see all the wooden ships laden with everything you could possibly think of... Take a trip with the water taxis across the water... The man collects the money by banging his fist on the boat or his money box... Soak up the atmosphere... We love it...
Great evening walk. You can just stroll down the creek . If possible visit during the DSF as there are few programs conducted.

Has a different flair for Dubai. The bastakiah and Dubai Creek stands out in Dubai as it is not the posch side of the city rather the most close to normal life in the city. Having a tea by the sea in these small cafe is a must in Dubai for sure
Great old town area.. A great area to visit to beta feel of old town Dubai. Make sure you use one of the local boats to cross the creek..well worth the experience and very cheap.
Dhow Cruise - Dubai Creek. We got it for free from the Big Bus Tours. It was quite relaxing after a day's touring. But then, there isn't really much to see around.

Two worlds. Wow what an interesting place they call it a creek,it's more like a river,which is also a port that is full of junk type boats that deliver allsorts of goods,from second hand cars to new fridges etc etc,to South Africa and other faraway places,my wife and I just walked up and down the wharfs whatching how they load ad unload,old tyres stacked between cars,pieces of fence sheeting to raise the sides of the boats,so they can stack things even higher unreal.on one side of the creek is the wealthy Dubai,and the other sides are spice markets,gold or souk markets,peddlers,and of course food stalls galore ,definitely 2 sides to Dubai,and a quick tube/train ride and you are back in the middle of high rise,definitely worth a visit if you in Dubai.
My place. Ofcourse its gonna be my favorite Place. It's neer to amazing restaurants and my daughter loved Dubai Creek Park. A must visit park in Dubai. Especially for kids.

Hire an Abra. We hired an abra from the Abra station near the spice souk (60 dirhams for 30 minutes) and took a ride up the creek at sunset. A lovely way to get a feel for the old Dubai, well worth the money and a 'must do' whilst in Dubai. Afterwards we strolled through the spice souk to the gold souk, all very easy even though it was 40 degrees in the shade.

Hidden Treasure. Do an Arbra trip on the creek ...rent an Arbra water taxi to yourself and go for an hour boat trip up and down the creek...really nice and one of those things you can do when its a bit hot towards summer... Alternatively ...go to the Dubai Yacht Club...if your then in the cooler months and have lunch on the wooden baconys over the water...and enjoy the view and the boats

A Different Side of Dubai. If u like to try the boat ride, take dubai metro to Al Ghubaiba station. From this station u'll able take boat ride across the river with just 1 dirham. Once cross the river, u may go to the spice souk then gold souk.

Take the abra or a cruise around the creek. Old word charm of the creek is still evident and you can marvel how those little dhows went across the Arabian Sea and to countries like India. Take the sunset cruise and enjoy the Dubai skyline.

Well worth the visit!. We took a very nice boat ride from one side of the creek to the old part of Dubai!
The creek portrays well how life is like for the people from this area with their trades.

1dirham boat ride. Get a small boat for only 1 dirham per person... They are mainly used by locals for work but tourists are welcome and its a great opportunity to see the old town from a different view. Great for panoramic photos!
an awesome place for couples. one of the most beautiful place in dubai..... and also good or morning or evening walk...an ideal place to hangout

dubai creek. Interesting place to see. lots of different people . Places to see near the creek are Deira Twin Towers, Dubai Creek Tower, Sheraton Dubai Creek, National Bank, and Chamber of Commerce On the other side of Al Maktoum Bridge along Dubai Creek you will also find Dubai Creek Park which is One of the largest and best park in Dubai

Little slice of water heaven in the midst of a bustling city. I had the luck of having friends take me to the Creek Park for a birthday party and it was just amazing. It's a bit of a slice of heaven in the middle of a busy and bustling city. Definitely worth a visit on a nice afternoon for a BBQ with friends.
Historical Creek. Take a ride in Dubai Creek, you will feel like you are travelling into history. It will take 90 minutes to cover the trip. Big bus tours will give you a free ride.
Different. Very different experience but a good one a different way to see Dubai boats are interesting guides informative
Go at Dusk. It's a beautiful walk if you go at dusk when the temperature is dropping - it is a great photo stop and you will be amazed at the little shops etc you can find.

A quick look covers it. Went on a dinner cruise on the Dubai creek.
I did not think it was anything special. Some interesting boats.
Great experience. Great experience learnt allot from the cruise on one of the boats. It is a must do to find out more about Dubai and the surroundings.

The Dubai Creek. Traditional and steeped in history along with modern new world is the Dubai Creek. Many heritage attractions are there to see and the best way to explore the creek is going on a leisurely dinner cruise on a Dhow- Or take a hopping trip in the water taxi (Abra) Anywhere on the creek is amazing.
Enjoyed Sheesha by the riverside. Dubai Creek is good to visit in the Evening...Meena Bazzar is near by Creek...and there are many Cafes by the river side where you can enjoy sheeshas and coffe.
Awesome Dhow Cruise. A good concept of Dhow cruise(traditional Cruise) with snacks, dinner, entertainment shows on board itself. just duration of cruise is 2hrs only which I think is less.

Interesting!. The old world and the new world is buzzing in front of you! Boats of varying sizes, water taxis, freight barges it's all there! What a place! new heritage areas brush close to banks and shops and bars and restaurants and, there is just so much! The Dubai creek was just a short walk from Arabian Courtyard and if you are there don't miss visiting Dubai creek.
Take a little boat and make a day of it. Make sure to cross the creek in the evening at least once. However go to the museum, buy some spices and eat at the shuk.

Very historic. Definitely book an evening boat trip with your travel mates, best thru your hotel - a great way to relax and learn some amazing history while enjoying a great meal. Some of the best sights in Dubai are seen at night all lit up. If you walk along the creek yourself during the day, check out where the fishermen are docked, watch their activities and admire very old and beautiful boats!

Our feet visit was not a let down. I loved this place it's so busy and going across the creek at night in there little boat was fantastic soo cheap as well . This is a must for all the family night time is best for this to see all the boats lit up is really lovely

A place to relax & do absolutely nothing. A great place to just sit by the water without getting sand in your shoes. A place to relax & do nothing. The great part about it, is that there are restaurants over once side of the creek where you can taste Arabic food & dine by the water side. Over all a great place to spend some time during the cooler months.

Once in lifetime experience. This is the one place that I insisted going first when we reached Dubai. It is beautiful and there is an abra (public local boat) which dropped us at the Gold Souk. It cost only 1 dinar per person.
Memories. Its wonderful to at the creek,especially going back and forth on thetraditional Dhow watching the sun set
nice but not great. The place is interesting, the views are different but it is SO hot! My son thought is was simply boring! If all you want is a boat ride, find something better.

Dhow Cruise Dinner at Creek!. You'd enjoy the two hours of cruising on a Wooden cruise known as "Dhow" and that's the name of the boat of similar kind. There would be a traditional dance show called "Tanura Show" performed by Egyptian Artist and it's really amazing. You may sit either in Air Condition in the lower deck or in the Open Air to the upper deck. For good views, go for the Upper Deck. You may access both the decks after you finish your dinner. Not too Expensive though!
Cheap thrills. Take the abras to the souks! They are a great experience and cost about 1 dirham (30 cents) per rider.
dinner at dubai creek. dinner in Dubai creek was jst unacceptable . it was not hot at all ...and the boul which were there for customer were broken not only one all ...

Cheapest transportation from Deira to Dubai and viceversa. Dubai Government has widened the transportation network through out the whole Emirates. A traveler has various choices to travel from place to place either by road, sea or air. Here at Creek area you can cross the sea separating Dubai from Deira via traditional boats or modern full airconitioned ferries (a bit costly), both carry you to the other side within less than 10 minitutes.
Nice place. Nice place. Beautiful views. Fresh air. Very quiet. The best view from Hyatt Park hotel, and Golf Club

SAIL AWAY. Loved the creek, i went on my own (lady of 40), didn't feel scared or under any pressure, lots of people come up to you saying come with me for bags,went with a guy took me up some stairs and there was two rooms full of bags ``(loved it was in designer bag heaven) do lots of bartering the souk were amazing the smell is great buy saffron very cheap, then took the boat across the creek,

Dubai. one of the most peaceful places in Dubai-- the Creek.The Abra ride is kool one should try.The Play area for children, along with other activities.The Museum is well maintained and entertaining.The snacks here are wonderful.there are many resturants too. get really cold during night during the cold season.

It was beautiful. The experience was amazing. The foods quality was really good, as we went on a cruise dinner here book via Rayna Tours. The ship staff took our pictures, moreover my phone was out of charge so the individual took my wife and my picture and whats app me the pictures with a few more different pictures of the view. The experience was amazing.

green peace. almost all the schools in dubai have one school picnic at this place. i went there couple of times. its a pleasant experience if you want to get out of the city life relax and go some activities.
LOVELY EXPERIENCE. It was a very relaxing not to mention romantic experience. i would gladly do it again and again and again at any given time

boat ride. not very interesting there are better things to do around town
PLEASE MARK THIS AS A HELPFUL VOTE, in the link bellow

Worth seeing. We took a boat trip around the creek one evening and had a very pleasant time. The views of the city scape, local fishing boats and the more historical areas of Dubai from the creek were impressive.

My favorite place to relax in Dubai. Creek the very surroundings are spectacular. Its the perfect place to un-wind a day and relax. Fusion of Old and a bit of modern Dubai, bargain your way through to buy the things you need. Very original and no supplicate... Do not buy the 10 or 20 Dirhams Arabic perfume; its crap....

Abra. The feel of true Dubai, the Dows with all of the goods being packed and unpacked, the Gold Souk. A must is a trip across the creek on the Abra very cheap regular boats, a beautiful view of the creek from the middle and you get the true feeling of the trading post that it is.

View this stunning city from the Creek. The beautiful old wooden dhow slid across the water giving us fantastic photo opportunities as the sun turned the buildings into glittering gold and silver reflections on the creek. Water taxis and boats low in the water with their cargo piled high passed us. It was a relaxing and enjoyable hour cruise.

View dubai coast with a ride on the creek. A ride over the creek either in the RTA boats or the dhow is wonderful in the evenings when the city lights up. Also most of the shopping areas on either side of the creek and so the ride from one side to the other is better used.
nice view. Dhow cruise through Dubai creek gives a very nice view of the Dubai city on both the sides of the creek. Abra dock you can enjoy the traditional mode of transport to cross the creek.

Beautiful place. Dubai creek is a nice place where you can enjoy both shopping n abra ride. Always full of life with shops selling souvenirs and local goods. Near to temple and dubai museum. Best time to visit is after 5pm.

Good Dolphin Show. Visit the Dubai creek and see the Dolphanirium. Here you will see the seal and dolphin show which is superb! If you book in advance you can also swim with the dolphins which is a great experience. The cost is 500 AED to swim with the dolphins which is a 45 minute session. You can also see the bird show which is equally good. Visit the mirror maize and try and find your way out from it. Also for children you can visit the Science center which is a few meters away from the dolphin show area.

One of the unique in its own way. It is one of its own creation. The area is surrounded by lots of things to do like boating, shopping in gold market and many more. I feel it is a good place to relax.
Greek. It is one of the important place of Dubai. Moving inside the Greek is enjoyable and fascinating. One should not miss that
