Simply oved the Creek Waters And Ferry System !!!. Dubai Creek is good to see Creek Kind of Place in Dry Desert area of Dubai..But it is well maintained with Adjoining High rises and Crystal clear Water in the Creeks ..Simply well Maintained and Has Good influx of Tourists and nice Ferry systems in Middle East area...Highly Recommend...
We always like to get onto the water. The Dubai creek ferries are a great inexpensive way to relax and look around, taking us to interesting parts of the old town on both sides of the creek.

Take a cruse and watch the comings and goings. We found the souks interesting, however dirts and at times intimidating. Most people were friendly, we bought some jewellery.
We went on a Dhow cruse, it was nice, interesting to see where Dubai was founded

the old town is not what you expect. I found the old town and souks to be dirty and not at all what i expected. not really any culteral buildings and we were harassed by local shop owners as walking past
Dubai Creek - Take a ride on a Dhow. Interesting part of Dubai - make sure you take a ride across the creek in a Dhow to the Spice Markets & Gold Souks.

One time Go. we have been to the creek for a dhow cruise dinner. It was good and a different experience. One must carefully choose the dhow cruise vendors as some are disgusting and will leave you a sour taste.
Have a visit. Not too much attractive but a must watch place on the go. Read about the history of the place and you will know its importance. Cool relaxing place to spend time.

Dhow cruise . The creek itself doesn't offer anything but a nice scene at night but the activities offered on the creek makes is worth visiting
My recommendation is dhow cruise a very relaxing and romantic experience

Finally something real. In between many tourist attractions and markets waiting for you to spend money, I really enjoyed walking along the creek. Especially the trade ships were a pleasant surprise to look at and provided a different view on Dubai and its roots.
Good experience. Good experience...and dnice view but lot more fun and better things to do in dubai...can try it atleast once
Old Dubai is amazing. Travel across the creek on a water taxi this is the quickest and easiest way to visit the spice and gold souks and the textile souk if you want to pick up a pashmina

The best part of my Dubai Trip. Loved this gem! - The Glass, Chrome and concrete of Dubai is an amazing sight to see, but the old world charm and history of the Creek was the best part of my trip to Dubai. Loved everything about this spot. Make sure that you set aside time to stop in..enjoy a cruise on one of the local ferries that cross from side to side...super cheap and great fun. Definitely have some food and just wander around and enjoy the sights..lots of old world charm, little passages and shops to explore or just sit at a waterside cafe and take it all in. Something for everyone there. If you are lucky enough and the weather/sea conditions are perfect you can catch the ferry from here to the Dubai Marina.

A fun tour. My daughter & I booked a four hour Dubai City Tour with Dubai Private Tours. Our last stop was the gold and spice souks. We caught a dhow across Dubai Creek then had plenty of time to wander around the souks.

Simple awsm!!. IN case you drop in to dubai ...do not forget to visit the creek. Make sure you try the seesha available in every nook and corner and take a ferry till the floating bridge. Its a totally different world all together.

Dhow cruise. We went on a Dhow cruise along Dubai Creek for our last night in Dubai. It was pretty nice, with good food and a good atmosphere, though I think next time I would go for the cruise on Dubai Marina instead. It was more expensive, but I think the views would be a bit more interesting.
Dhow Cruise. Nice cruise in the evening with good food to top it to take you around for a trip for 1 hour. Enjoyable but have seen better cruises.
Dhow Cruise. We have booked the dhow cruise 3 times and still enjoy the experience. The dhow cruise takes you up and down the creek taking in the views along the way. Food good and atmosphere amazing

Nice, old Dubai. small boats that will take you in the older part of Dubai. Nice for visiting during the day, and also the cruiser for the evening. if you are interested in spices and gold, you will have lot of things to see and buy.
Amazing Old Place. Amazing old place you can visit in Dubai. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants, you can smoke shisha around. In the summer, it's very hot.

great eating and cruises. This is the older part of town ... great place to walk around and get the local ferries over to the Golden suk and the other side...see all the old ships loading up with the cargo... heading out for the Indian ocean ...

Nice River Cruise's. Lovley Boats River Cruise's Floating restarants , lots to see and do. Not to many people Hassling you to take ther Trips which is really good. we all want to look at these thing in our own lesure. To hot this day so could/nt walk along to Much. nice to see the Boats at night with the bright Lights

Old dubai . Even though it's the old dubai it still feels forced. The old areas almost look as if they are made to look old. Some areas are absolutly deserted and it's simply depressing. It's sterile and even straight out boring at times. We took one day walking both sides visiting the gold and spice souks, museums, heritage villages and taking the 1 dirham boat. The gold and spice souks were fun to visit for a little while. Be prepared to get harassed non stop by sales people.The heritage villages are a joke. Its empty and really booring. I love history and historical places but what dubai heritage villages offered was truly dissapointing. Not even the photo opportunities are that interesting. Again it all feels forced and fake. And yeah no locals shopping , there were only tourists to be seen.The best part was the museum and a shawarma we had at small restaurant. We had dinner one night overlooking the Creek, that offered nice night view.I wish I had better things to say about the creek but I don't.
Creek. great place to have sheesha in the evening after a boat ride. cool breeze and specially in Jan and Feb its beautiful. Nice Sheesha and Tea one can spend hours....
Big Bus Dhow Cruise. Dhow trip on Creek This was taken in afternoon as inclusion on Big Bus ticket. Well worth it as you see city from a different prospective.

A really neat experience. I really enjoyed walking around and taking a taxi across Dubai creek. It isn't only a tourist destination but is clearly part of the city. Be sure to get away from the high rise hotels and get a glimpse of this part of the city.
Nice walk. Some nice shops and small souks but we did get badgered to buy things. OK if you've got spare time to go wandering around.

Dhow cruise. Well kept dhow boats that take you around for about 1 hour in the creek. Make sure that you are a bit early to get a good seat near the dance floor. Good food. No commentary on the landmarks that you would be sailing past. If you are booking the dessert safari and the dhow cruise better to book through different tour operators else the chances of seeing the same performer performing the same show is very very high.
See the real Dubai. Catch a glimpse of the less explored side, and the real side of Dubai from the creek. You won't see many majestic buildings, but this is the real dubai.

Authentic trading and transport area.. Wonderful culture, all different boats loading and unloading. Couldnt believe the casual way everything including televisions and fridges stacked on the open docks. Had a boat ride, very hot.

Nice place to walk around - weather was slightly overpowering. Creek was scenic - although it would be better to visit on a cooler part of the day. Went there around noon time. If you would fancy a short trip then the water bus at AED 1 was definitely worth the money.

Relaxed. Took a boat trip around the creek. It is not that cheap compared to the price of a simple crossing but nevertheless worth it. The more you share with the less the price as you pay standard rate for the boat. Experience was very good though. See lots of landmarks. If too hot make sure you are protected. Sun and creek breeze!

An evening spot... Took a dhow cruise at the Dubai creek. Now the experience on the dhow is another story. Bad decor, pathetic food and lacklustre entertainment. So I just moved out of the dhow to the open area in the front, and that is when the fun started.The creek looks beautiful in the evening. The lights of the buildings shimmering on the water, the gentle sea breeze and the sound of the dhow gliding across the water...a heady cocktail. The temperature during the day was 46 degrees, but the weather by the creek in the evening is really pleasent. Do visit the creek. But avoid the dhow cruises.

Nice area to walk around. Dubai creek (I'd call it a river, more than a creek) is a nice area to walk around and get lost. On one side there's the market with lots of shop to bargain and buy. You can take the taxi boats to cross the river
Creek. Wonderful architecture. Unusual gifts. Great views from the river.Take water to drink as its hot outside in June - 45 degree heat!

Magnificent . Dubai creek is the main vens of Dubai..The surroundings areas are rich with the heritage and traditional buildings..Both sides have the old central down towns and markets , which are full with all what you can imagine with cheaper prices than the malls..For getting the best experience dont forgot to use Abra .. the traditional wooden boats.. these used in the past for travelling between the two sides..

A great place to spend some time. No matter how many times you visit the Creek offers another glimpse of a mixture of the traditional dhow traders with the modern elements of the city. The ride across on the abra, a small ferry boat for foot passengers, provides the opportunity to see the working elements of this busy creek. Stroll along the Deira side and see the dhows, the varied cargoes and the crews who are often photogenic individuals who add character to your images.

Old waterway full of life. A visit to Dubai creek is an interesting time. If you see it from one of the bridges, it just looks like any other waterway. If you take a boat ride on it, you get a different perspective on it. Although all the boast are motorised, you down on water level and you can clearly see that the waterway is alive. There are old Dhows still on the waterway. You will also find some old style cargo ships which still ply their trade along the coast.

Dubai Creek evening. easy to reach by metro, short walk from the station and you reach the manmade creek, before you get off at the metro take a mono rail ride inside the jumeriah palm residences and take in the sights and then head to the creek.

Great Historic Area. Nice area of Dubai to ease back and chill, and take a nice cruise around the creek, or you can go around the souk and catch a ferry across the creek, with the gold souk and spice souk in the area and an excellent museum, a good area to escape the named brand shopping

Very average. Go only if you have time to kill. Was not really worth going to the creek on a baot. Although the sights are good but the sailing is in a very small and limited area and hence does not feel great.

great evening. everything was perfect....must do...food was great, music and the views were indescribable....I miss having a glass of wine with dinner sooo badly but that happened often along the trip.....

good to get away from the malls. Walk along the creek, look at the abras (passenger ferries) and mooch though the souk at the Hindu temple, just to remind yourself that the middle east is not all Las Vegas, Dubai style!

Nothing great about it. Dubai creek area is in the heart of Dubai, seperating Bur Dubai from Diera.. It was different from the main Dubai which has lot of skyscappers.. Since we visited it in the morning, there was nothing much to do here.. One can just go for a walk or a cruise there, that too in the evening or night, because its too hot in the afternoon or morning hours.. So its a one time visit place but avoid morning hours..

Experience the creek side. This is a busy creek where boats carry both people and goods. The ride is cheap and the views are ok. You could also walk along the creek on a cool day (which is hard to find). Not a must do really.

rent your own boat. its nice to go by night and you can ask a man in the boat to have the boat all to yourselves! it will cost more but it is a totally different thing to go alone, really romantic and worth doing! you can see all the boats in different colours and lights and see the city from the water witch is cool! its ok with 20/30 min, more than enough to us!

awesome experience!. it was really good to travel by private water taxi across the Dubai Creek, observing all the shoreline and all the old boats with interesting merchandise and the flavor of the new and the old part of Dubai.divided by the Creek :)

Fantastic. Head down to the souks, catch a boat across the creek for a couple of dirham and enjoy the sights and sounds.This is a great little insight into the traders who work ferrying goods up the creek on dhows to all of the souks. It can be quite refreshing on a warm Dubai day.

Nice place to relax. The creek is located in the heart of Dubai. Many people use it to cross over to other part of Dubai using small boats called 'Abra' costing just AED 1.00. There are also several small cruises providing a evening ride along with dinner and some entertainment.
Old commercial area. Definitely worth a visit to the creek port to see the fishermen and their boats and trading - also on the one side of the creek is the old castles which is worth a visit.

Walker friendly. The Creek is a beautiful and tranquil walk. At night it is lined with many boat restaurants which are lit in different colours adding a diversity and quaintness to the area. The walk has nice resting areas and you can simply sit on a bench and watch. The only downside was the heat, at a scorching 37 degrees at night it was to hot to be outside for long.

A little bit of old Dubai. Walk along the creek and watch the hussle and bussle. Catch an abra across the creek and experience a little bit of old Dubai. Not much of it around, and such a contrast to the glitz and glamour in Downtown!

The Creek. Dubai is ultra modern so it's good to see the old areas ( which are few and far between ) the old boats ( dows ) are still there amongst the more modern boats , try and miss 12 noon till 3pm as the heat is oppressive ( present temperature 40 degrees !

Old Town Fake!. Took a taxi down to the Dubai Heritage Village to find an obvious reconstruction complete with tourist traps such as Coffee museum, Coin museum and Stamp museum amongst others. After wandering through these streets for a while I headed down along the Creek and through the souk to the abras station to take one of these small wooden water taxis across the creek to Deira. The souk is full of the usual middle eastern hassle merchants who make the journey through it a bit of a gauntlet running experience with guys trying to wrap you up in various headgear whilst shouting at the top of their voices that you must buy something from them. "Why do you come here if you don't want to buy something". The abra crossing was a mini adventure in itself though as the boatman will definitely try to rip off tourists. It costs 1dirham to cross but they will inevitably try to get more out of the unsuspecting. The Diera side is a hive of industry and as you stroll along the creekside you can watch the dhows being loaded as they have been for hundreds of years. These days though the main cargoes seem to be vehicle tyres and refrigerators. Further along cross at the lights and into the narrow, shady passageways of the Deira Souks for a look back into history. Try one of the creekside cafes on returning for a refreshing fruit juice. Kiwi is highly reccommended.
Memorable. Cross the creek at night on an abra for about 30 cents (Australian) for an exciting way to get from the Dubai museum side to the gold and perfume souk on the other side.

Scenic Ride. Took a ride along Dubai Creek with my family and it and it was just magnificent. The ride took us to the historical areas of Dubai and we got to see a different perspective of the city. It was fantastic.
relaxing. there are lots of things to see at the creek i do recomendthe boat dinner toursthey are offered all year long but best months to visit dubai is oct thru march!
Night View.... Great dhow cruise experience at Dubai Creek... Wonderful view from cruise overall experience was not bad...

A creek with colour. Worth a visit to the wharf area to watch the boats and barges being loaded and unloaded with...well, everything. The Gold Souk is just a short stroll away and, nearby, for those with a camera compunction there's the Spice Souk. Don't leave your bargaining skills at home.

Dubai before the oil.. The museum that recreates life before oil is on the creek. This is the old area of Dubai and def. worth seeing. You cannot spend all your times in malls. The Gold market is also nearby.

Relaxing. We planned to just cross the creek for the experience, but we were told that we could hire a whole boat for 1 hour AED 120. we opted for that, and it was worth it -- we had a lovely relaxing ride, enjoyed another perspective on Dubai, and watched the sun go down over Old Dubai from the creek.

An impression of old Dubai. During my visit to Dubai I stayed in a hotel in the Dubai Creek, this is referred to as the traditional/old Dubai, as the new downtown (with the burj Khalifa) was only built in 2005! This part of town has less high rise and gives you a better impression of how things used to be. There are boat tours you can do and it is just a nice experience to walk along the creek.

FUSION OF OLD AND NEW. Abras carrying people still cross the creek all the time when modern restaurant boats serving wonderful dishes roam around carrying thousands of people every day. Connecting Deira and Bur Dubai the creek is full of memories of the past......
Serene Sailing. I celebrated my 40th birthday on the 5-star Bateaux dinner cruise. The water in the Dubai Creek is calm, serene and not overly populated with water crafts.
Relaxing cruise. ideal to cruise and relax after a warm day ...best in winter of course but the Dubai marina is more impressive. Food is strictly okay

Inexpensive boat ride to historical part of Dubai.. After visiting the museum we walked a few blocks towards the Creek to take a traditional boat ride across the Creek to visit the Spice and Gold markets. We stood in a line with a number of other locals and tourists. The boats loaded with 20 or so people and left for a brief ride up the Creek , dropping us off at the other side. We paid a nominal one dirham (about 30 cents). This was a fun experience.

Perfect place for family picnic.... Beautiful landscaping, views of the creek, greenery for sore eyes in the middle of the desert..Has designated BBQ pits , recreational areas, Planetarium shows, Dolphin shows and cable car rides with great views. Entrance fee to the park and the other attractions is very economical & worth every cent.
Irish Bar. We had a fantastic night down there great food and a Feb night out so friendly and the world Darts was Awesome
good visit. It was good, the food was great. There was nothing much to see or enjoy . A visit is ok whilst you are there

Great location to visit the Souks or a Dinner Cruise. Dubai Creek is a good location to visit the real Souks to buy local goods or bargain jewellery. It is also where the boats are leave for the evening dinner cruises.

My favorite part of the Dubai trip. So much fun seeing what old Dubai must have been like. Loved taking the boat across the creek for only 1 AED. Walking through the spice market can be overwhelming but the sights and smells are worth it. I ate some of the best Middle Eastern food I've ever had around the creek. A must do in Dubai.

Historic. It was good to see and feel the historic as its give nice view and overall idea. Since was day time it was hot but still it was good to see and experience. Good place to visit and to know about it.

Dubai Creek: A trip down memory lane. Back in the 80s we hardly had the malls and entertainment hubs that Dubai has today. You could count the number of places to check out with your fingers, however, the Creek was always a special place ; where Dubai first began from how families connected to where pearl divers went off to sea to where our trading center began and on either side of the Creek there was something to do. I took my son on an Abra ride like how my mom used to take us - a 30 minute journey that reminded me of what a special place it was and still is - definitely on my to do list anytime of the year

Passing it in an abra is the way to go. It is true that you get a good feel of the day to day Dubai life when passing the creek in an abra, and it's cheap and doesn't cost you a lot of time. We took one way, walked 200 m and came back on another route, just to take the abra (from bastakia)

Stroll or Cruise: your choice. Dubai Creek is the lifeline of Dubai city. Even today age old Dhow's (boats) bring goods into the city through the creek and the entire area is dotted with boats moored across the creek. You can even find stunning yatchs on the waterfront of Sheraton and other hotels. This is the place where during the day or specially in the evenings you can take a cruise down the creek. A good place to walk around during morning and evening. A lovely place of Dubai, worth visiting.

The Real Dubai. This is the heart of the old Dubai with so much to see and such a vibrant place, you can imagine what it was like 50 years ago before all the high rise towers.I recommend everyone to go and spend some time walking round the side streets and then take the Abra's from one side to the other (and visit both the Fish Market and Bastakia also).

Old and New Dubai. A great way to see the Dubai Creek is to take a Hydrofoil from one of the departure points in Dubai and drive down to the creek and then travel along the creek to the Old Souq. On the way you will see old ad new Dubai on either side of the creek- great views. You can either get out at the Gold Souk and stay and shop or remain on board and return to the Mall whereyou were picked up. I believe it is worth going to the Gold Souq but I have not yet visited thereYou can also have a dinner or lunch cruise which i also did not take bu ti am sure it would be a pleasant way to pass the time

Wonderful Place to relax. Just behind the Temple (only one in whole UAE), you can just sit across and relax and saw wooden boats called as Abra which can take you to the other side of the canal for just AED 1. Beautiful and a part of OLD Dubai so full of Abras, Souq (Market Place). Best Time in winters 5 PM to 7 PM, in Summers 7PM to 11 PM

Amazing view and lot's of charm!!!!. Get away from all the hustle of the city life and take a boat ride over the Dubai Creek. Located in the Deira section of Dubai, the creek will make you feel like you've entered another country. Here you will find older homes, buildings and old fashioned wooden boats called Dhow covering the creek. Considering everything fancy in Dubai, I appreciate taking a step back from the ultra modern and wonder into another time of old fashion values and culture.When in Deira, wonder into the Al Bastakiya region (click here to learn more), or jump into a Dhow and cross the creek and shop at the Souk. Hope on the Dhow and take a ride across the creek. Across the creek you will find the spice and gold market. I had a great time here!

Great to get history of Dubai. Dubai Creek is excellent to visit to experience the early days of Dubai
The spice markets, the creek and to take a cruise up the river
Good views. The trip across the Creek is brief but does give a good view up and down the waterway. Not for the faint hearted as the boats have no sides.

There is still another Dubai to explore beside the bling-bling. The best way to reach the Creek is by Metro up to Al Ghubaiba Metro Station. A few footsteps away you will get the most beautiful view of the former lifeline of Old Dubai. Especially before sunset the light turns the whole area into a magic place. Some people compare the area with the "Venice of Middle East". Walk into Shindaga Heritage Village to get to know more about the former life of the Dubai citizens. Some surprises are awaiting you.

Old Dubai. This creek is the dividing line between original dubai (deira) and old dubai (bur dubai). You can take boat taxis from one side to the other and you can even rent your own boat for 30 mins and go up and down the creek. Get off on the deira side at the bastikiyah old souk.

Real Old Dubai!. Eventhough people get attracted by ultra-luxury high towers and huge shopping malls, I value the history more even in Dubai. If you want to touch history, please visit Old Town and Dubai Creek. Spend half day there and if possible visit the Bazaar and Museum too.

Too Little of Old Dubai. A great way to see new Dubai and a little of old Dubai, in fact too little of Old Dubai in my opinion. After all once you seen the first dozen skyscrapers of glass and metal you've seen them all.

Well worth a visit. WE had a lovely stroll along the side of the Creek at dusk, just as all the floating restaurant light came on.We then had a private cruise along the creek for an hour.Well worth the price we paid.A definate must see in Dubai.

Loved Old Dubai.. This is the place to go if you want to see the traditional part of Dubai, as I suppose it was twenty years ago.Get a Dow boat across the creek and visit the souks. Wander down the small alley ways and soak up the culture. The gold souk is a great place to wander round, and the spice souks smells great. You can buy pretty much anything you want here, but remember to haggle. It beggars belief after wandering round the old part of town 20 minutes later you could be stood at the mighty Burj Kalifa! Awesome place to visit. If your pushed for time buy a ticket for the hop on hop off bus, it's really good value for money, and will take you to all the places of interest.
Museum visit. Great museum, fun catching the local ferry across the river. Amazing number of fantastic traditional wooden boats.

Lovely view and well maintained Creek. I liked the clean blue waters of the Creek and the Dhow cruise on it in the evening. When we drove past it in the morning it was a lovely view. Excellent preservation done.
Excellent. Dhow cruise was great. Creek is house to many shops and restaurants. Playground also was very exciting.
Relaxing stroll. A must do , stroll along the creek then cross in a Dow to visit the spice markets , the smells are amazing .Buy some gold in the gold souk, worth a spend .A great experience

Must try by wooden boat by night ! Very romantic !. Dubai Creek is a very interesting place to visit during the day or in late evening . It's a combination of old time and modern Dubai . The feeling is like you are in a busy market place few hundred yeas back and at the same time on both sides of the creek are the tall modern buildings . It's located in Bur Dubai area which is not far from down town . I can say that without traffic it will take approximately 12-15 min from burj khalifa by car . From Atlantis hotel will be about 25 min . Avoid rush ours : after 5 in the afternoon . What to see : you can park in Meena Bazar area and walk to the Abra ( the old wooden boats) station, where for one dirham (0.27 us$) and together with another 20 people , they will take the passengers to opposite site of the creek . I usually tell the controller "engaged " and he don't allow other people on the Abra but the price will be 20 drh ( 5.50 US$ ) . I pay the guy when he drop me to opposite site . There is option one can engage the boat for a 30 min or one hour creek tour but you have to try to push the price down and he will . I love to go and take trips in the late evenings , just to cross the creek and walk 5 min to Gold Souk . It's a very romantic experience especially if you are couple.
my favorite hotel in dubai. i used to live in park hayer in creek and it s amazing hotel service food ambiance decoration,,,,,i love it it s my favorite

Nice cruise. You can take a cruise down the creek and see what is around there. Nothing exciting but i would recommend it if you have spear time in Dubai. Many Cruise Boats to choose, they also ofer Dinner, but the quality is from average to poor.If it is not too hot you can also walk around, at night it is better for a walk.
Gentle journey. A trip on a local Dow is a must. To see the Vista from the water is truly great, but be aware that the seating arrangements on a cushion are anything but comfortable.
Markets. Absolutely fab. This is the old Dubaii. Very safe to wander around. Not cheap like you expect but great to haggle and have a laugh with the traders.
Good perspective on Old Dubai. You can see trawlers and small boats transporting stuff for trading.. gives you a feel of what it originally must have been
Dolphin and seal, exotic birds show. An exciting experience specially for kids, well trained dolphins, seal and birds.it was fun and something that we can introduce to our friends and love ones.

Lush boattrip!. Renting a boat with a captain or just stepping onboard a watertaxi that take you around the creek is good fun. You get to see the daily life around Deira and Dubai Creek and to meet locals that are going back and forewards to work.

Amazing Dolphin Show. Dolphin show was excellent.
Seal Show was average
Bird Show was average
lawn was good.
Cable car was not present during our visit. We were informed that the Cable Car service is stopped permanently.

Fascinating for us Westerners. We have been to Dubai lots of times and always take a few trips on the creek. Just going across to the Gold or Spice Souk is always interesting - especially at rush hour when the abra are always fully loaded and the waterway is very busy! It is very cheap entertainment and a sightseeing adventure we have not found anywhere else.

gondolas of dubai. there is a market next to the boarding station of abra, do not forget to visit it has got some amazing artifacts will take you to the olden era, coming to abra it was a beautifull sight more loved by my family , you could actually touch the river amazing!!!!!!!!!

Interesting. Nice to see the old boats and an amazing feeling of old Dubai. Souks to visit with lots of ethnic products on offer, you should bargin. Boats take you from one side of the creek to the other every few minutes. You can also do a creek tour from there or take a boat taxi around the bay to the Marina.

Soul of Dubai. creek area give you a very different feel. Unlike the concrete jungle and new constructions, this area gives you a very warm feel. The creek side is normally cool with winds blowing over water, small abraa boats, very old houses. this is the real stuff. must visit when in dubai

Two day stopover. Excellent trip to do in the heat of the day. Good views of the wharves and water taxis. The free one associated with the hop on hip off bus doesn't go out to the bay as shown on the map.

Enjoy the Creek. There are a lot of buildings to see and attractions in Dubai but the Creek is the contemporary neighborhood with modern apartments and marinas and lots of restaurants. Pleasant strolling and relaxing out of the hustle bustle of the rest of Dubai.

Quick Boat Ride Across The Creek. There is not much to say about taking an abra across the Creek. It is a quick, cheap way to cross from one side to the other, nothing special nor nothing bad about it. Lots of boats in the water and you do see some of the city from the Creek.

Creek has a cooling effect in hot Dubai. In most seasons Dubai is hot. The Dubai Creek provides a cooling and calming effect in an otherwise dry metropolis. From our hotel the Creek was great to view at sunrise and we could see sea planes landing and taking off for tours from here.It would be nice if a track is built adjacent to the Creek to allow people to walk, jog or cycle in the evenings when temperatures are bearable.Dhow tours are available on the creek.Munir Daya
Atmospheric. A glimpse of old Dubai - the dhows on the water and the old Arabic buildings, Food was economical and one could sit outside with good service.

lovely trip. We cruised the creek on the 'Bateaux Cruise' boat and it was delightful with the lights from the building reflected on the water and all the boats lit up (and the food on the boat was absolutely fabulous).

Great place to enjoy the scene of Dubai. Great place to enjoy the scenery of the creek.
In winters its a great place to stroll around with your partner.
Many people go in the mornings for a walk/excercise in the mornings.

See the creek come to life in the early morning. The Dubai Creek is a must do for your Dubai visit. The creek is the heart of Old Dubai and still gives a sense of stepping back in time. Dhows line the banks and are a curious site piled high with an assortment of goods from washing machines to bags of rice. as they have for generations! the open sided abras carry passengers to and fro across the creek for the princely sum of 1dh (30 cents). For most of the day, the creek is a bustling commercial hub, however, after an early morning airport pickup, my aunts and I arrived not long after dawn recently. The air was reasonably cool, the creek was still with the early morning light reflecting off the water, and the locals were taking their morning walks along the banks. As an added bonus, wandering through Shindaga heritage village, we were welcomed to ghawa (Arabic coffee) and dates by the charming Yemeni worker who was just making his first brew over an open fire. My aunties were fascinated by the traditional architecture and recreated structures of the village. Following this, a trip across to Deira on the abra brought us to the spice souk. A few shop keepers were beginning to set up shop and we were able to browse the exotic spices. If you can brave the early start, the peace and quiet are worthwhile.

Interesting trip across it. Souks very near and great to look round also visited 1st built school in Dubai that was interesting, had evening meal on board a boat on the creek, nice food and good views of Dubai lit up at night

Dhow Cruise at Night: The right cruise makes all the difference. Doing a Dhow cruise at night is a lovely experience. On one hand, you get to go down memory lane of Old Dubai - the old shops, the souks, passenger ferries, etc. And when you go out into the Marina, you come across the Glittering Dubai Skyline rising above the Beach front. You have the choice of doing this on a traditional Dhow Boat or one of the modern fibre glass ones. A word of caution though - Making the whole experience a memorable one with the right ambience, music, food and entertainment is a question of picking the right Cruise. Almost all operators promise the same , but only a few who get it right. Blaring loud film music, no live performers, serving cold tasteless food are some of the common complaints one hears with many operators, so get your feedback from multiple sources before you get on-board. But you do the homework right and it can be THE highlight of your trip at Dubai.

Up the creek. As everyone is saying, take an Abra across the creek, very cheap trip in a very authentic mode of Dubai transport.Soak up the atmosphere and hustle bustle of old Dubai, the contrast to new Dubai is unbelievable. There are still really old buildings and a museum inside the old fort there, worth a look and very cheap.Plenty of shopping opportunities. Lots of original fakes!Check out the gold and spice souks, but not is you don't like to be hassled.Eat at an authentic arabic restaurant overlooking the creek.Check out the heritage centre.You can take the metro to the creek very easily.Take a taxi down to QDs and watch the sunset with a drink and a shisha, lovely day out.

Beautiful abra. A very cute place, must try the water taxi (abra) it's just one dirham but gives you a nice feeling seeing another Dubai life style. all the area having relaxing sharm. I enjoyed being there.

As busy or as calm as you want to make it. The Creek is one of my favourite places in Dubai. It is as busy and chaotic or as calm and tranquil as you want to make it. The different souks with their chaos and bartering, the loading and unloading of cargo or the calmness and tranquillity of a river cruise or just sitting by the Creek watching the world go by. A must is the dhows, the little boats that cross the creek. Pack on with the locals for only a dirham to cross to the other side , a wonderful way to cross the Creek. Some great food around the Creek for very little expense too.

Unique Experience. Having lived here twice, it is always amazing to see how the Creek front changes with each visit...just like all of Dubai. What does not change are the Dhows that still go back and forth to far off lands loaded with everything from huge truck tires to diapers. Whether you walk along the shore or ride an abra or another boat, take time to visit one of the most interesting areas of Dubai.
Al Mansour Dhow. Took a night cruise on the Dubai Creek. This was an experience I wish I could share with my friends. The views were spectacular and service on the Dhow was great.

Evening visit. We came here for an evening and had a trip on the water taxi .20p each way. Not much to do here in the evening and if you venture into the shopping area in the old town you will get hassled, and taken to secrete shops if you show interest in handbags or sunglasses

A look at the old Dubai. A wonderful contrast to the newness of the city. We caught a boat over to the silk souk and allowed our senses to be delighted by the colour of the fabric and the personalities of the market stall owners!
Nice dhow cruise. Thanks to my City Sightseeing ticket I was entitled to a free 1 hours dhow cruise. Very nice to see the hustle and bustle on the water.

Do this for sure!. I am not good on boats usually but this was the most pleasant trip over the Dubai creek to the spice and gold souk markets, the water is calm and the breeze is cooling and it is a most relaxing journey although only 10 minutes long!
Take a water taxi. The area has a nice view, and for us one of the best parts was taking the water taxi (abra) across the Creek.
Beautiful area. Also close to the famous Gold Souk, Silk Souk and Spice Souk. All of them Worth a visit. Very popular among Tourists and natives.

Nice night view of old Dubai. When in Dubai, a tour of the Creek should not be missed. This is the heart Of old Dubai, where the you can grab what real life in the Gulf really is. An inner river surrounded by the old souks, this is where Dubai is most romantic

Loved "old dubai". Spent a couple of hours in the area, enjoyed the different markets and to barter with the dealers to get a good price for spices, souvenirs and a traditional dress. It felt like old dubai, very safe and a nice contrast to all the new modern hotels. Must do: cross the river with a ferry.What I didn't really like were the guys that were trying to sell you fake watches.
It's a must to see by tourists and expat residents.. Perfect to see and get to know Dubai its history and culture. It's also the place to visit the unique Gold Souk and have a bite at Bayt Al Wakeel

Very beautiful and clean. It carries a very unique flavor... its beautiful to be there between 5pm - 7pm.. Not too hot but watch the sky changes its colour and how it reflect upon the place. Nice place not to be missed

Don't Miss This .... Easy to miss out with so much to do in Dubai but the abra boats are really fun and cheap (1AED). They give a sense of culture to Dubai with a great atmosphere. A definite must for any traveller.
cool. nice feel of the "old" Dubai this is a must visit! Get on an abra (little taxi boat) and get across to the other side of the Creek for just 1 AED.

Free cruise with bus ticket. We did a cruise along the creek which was included in our bus tour ticket. It was quite informative and very relaxing. We did it later in the day when the temperatures were a bit cooler and the sun much lower. Great way to see the older part of Dubai.

Hustle en Bustle of Dubai. To get a nice feel of the "old" Dubai this is a must visit! Get on an abra (little taxi boat) and get across to the other side of the Creek for just a Dirham. Very nice for taking pictures and views of both sides of the Creek. Including the Mosque and the Iranian trading vessel that are usually docked there.

Dinner Cruise.. Lets you see the Creek at it's best. 2 hours of relaxing eating and entertainment while cruising the length of the Creek.Walking during the day can be pleasant but not recommended when the temperatures get to 38+

Over-rated. One or two interesting places to visit - albeit poor signposting and a fair walk to get to some 'attractions'. Cheap water buses. Don't buy a fake watch in the Gold souk - you have been warned.

Very cool!. Dubai creek was a bonus, I thought all Dubai was glass and steel, but this area, with it's old souks (markets) along the creek has the feel of Cairo to it. Spend an afternoon there (if it's not too hot) and try not to be convinced to buy anything, I guarantee you'll come away with something you didn't know you needed! Also take the water taxi across the creek, 1 DHM, very cheap and fun.

Night tour. We went on a dinner tour of the creek. It was cool and interesting. The little water transport boats zipped between the line of restaurant boats and the boats very colourful.Our tour was very sedate and expensive for what we got.

Really authentic. Really authentic tour and a good way to interact with the locals. This ferry takes you across to the souk village and gold shops where you can buy spices, gold and jeanie shoes! Don't visit this area as part of a tour because they will rush you & if your adventurous you will want to stay....
Must See. Part of Dubai culture, a real must see. It could almost look like Venice, with the boats and people. You can see all the business being made here. :)

Tour Dubai - Dove Cruise. Dinner on Tour Dubai Dove Cruise. The Food was amazing. Staff were very friendly. Different experience overall.
Good Option for Couple as well as family.

Must see especially at night. Lovely, relaxing and at night watch the boats lit up as they go up and down the Creek.
Some of the larger boats have Whirling Dervish dancers on board and other entertainment.
There's also an evening fun fair down near the Intercontinental and Mall.
Hire a Dhow. We hired a dhow boat for around 45 minutes which worked out at £20 and went up and down the creek. Amazing , relaxing and a nice change from the hussle of the big city.

Most authentic place in Dubai. I loved the creek area. The souks were so much fun to walk through. We bought a couple things from the shops, and I'm glad we did. all the other souvenirs we saw we're cheap plastic Burj Khalifas. Ride an Abra across the creek!

A must. To cross the creek in a little boat is so in conflict to Dubai; and that is why its so charming! the paradox! it is also the best way to interact with locals and taste the flavor of the city (from a different aspect)
TRAVEL BACK IN TIME!. For a few pence you can step on to an old boat and travel across the creek to the Gold and spice souk. You just drop the guy a few coins and off you go.

Wonderful boats. We visited the creek during the day and had a walk along to the docks then visited again at night and it totally came to life. All the pretty boats were lit up and went on cruises up and down the creek.

Nice place to Gather .... Family and friends can stay here for 1 full day... BBQ area is there... a lot of activities to be done like biking, riding in the cable car, games with prizes etc
entrance of 5dirhams is very cheap for your quality stay.. Better to come early before 8am to have ample parking and enjoy d rest of the day

I like to stay in hotel rooms which on creek side. I liked to see creek in the morning when I open blinds......................
I disliked to stay in hotel in the nights, because the creek view in night is very good.
creek side food outlet. beautiful food outlet.. good local food with prompt service. very economical cost... staff very courteous ..

Creek with a lot of activities!!!. I still love the way the Creek holds itself up with multiple activities!!! The abras have always excited me!! Most of the Dhow tours start from there!!! Go there in the morning for a walk or even at last night with your Ipod plugged in and it is amazing!!!!
Real Dubai. I love to walk along the creek and see all the hustle and bustle, lots of boats loading and unloading. Gorgeous views across the creek a must see if visiting the area
very nice boat ride.. Dubai creek very nice boat ride. Rates of the boat ride is also very reasonable. Gold souk is also very near to Dubai creek.

evening meal,. while staying in dubai, we booked an evening meal on the boat,bateaux dubai. expensive, but worth every penny, most of the boats ,where self service buffets, this was 5 star gourmet, service, as they say, a unique cruise experience, would reccomend to every one , so romantic,just perfect

little boats. Boats cost £20, last about an Hour.ok.No where to get a cup of tea .
You can go to the souls from here
Beauty. it looks beautiful , natural beauty. Dubai buildings on both sides of the creek, old boats, dinner on them , sounds very good . must try.
good and rustic boats. the trip on the creek was in old fashioned boats and cost of trip was on the cheap side it takes you to the gold souk and shops
The Creek. Where all starts many years ago. It is nice to see how tourists and local workers are living so close. Nice and clean shops of any kind of goods.
perfect family day out. go carts and jumping castles, bird shows and dolphin shows, a gorgeous park to laze around ...its just the perfect weekend spot

Dubai Creek-The life-line opf Dubai. Dubai Creek is the soul of Dubai. It was and is used since ancient times for carrying good in a Dhow to Asmara, other pots in East Africa and the Indian Subcontinent as well as Iran. You can still see dhows in rows on the Deira side of Dubai.

Fascinating!. Two museums close by - the Old fort and the Pearl Divers village. Worth a look, but the Old fort contains the best historical information about Dubai. The most interesting part was getting up close to the dhows moored in The Creek. Many are very old and most are laden with white goods, technical goods, spices and any other things you might care to think of. Once laden they set off into the Indian Ocean bound for Pakistan, and East Africa - how they actually make it to their destinations one can only guess! We found the dhow crews really friendly and keen to be photographed - and not for a fee! Great fun, but very hot and few local amenities for refreshment unless like us you are happy to chance the local cafe!

Historical. Visited the Creek area and it is like taking a step back in time. The boats are all hand loaded with all sorts of cargo lying adjacent to them on the quayside. Incredible in a big modern city. This is a nice area to sit and relax and watch the world go buy. You are near the spice souk as well. Take a trip over to the otherside on a water taxi for next to nothing.

Could be much better. Authorities should consider ships ( so called Dhow) docks. Need to be managed well. Dubai Creek could be much better a tourist spot if preferably could have a walk across the creek with more refreshment outlets.

Vibrant water scene.. Dubai Creek is a busy vibrant place, places to eat, small places to shop, some a bit touristy but good just the same.Taking a boat trip is never a problem, just to cross the creek is good fun.Some boat owners will give you a private trip for an hour we came across Harpreet Singh sitting by the quay, had a chat and he offered us a boat all to ourself for a cost cheaper than the tourist boats.I think it was Sea Pearl boats he was part of.Cross to the gold souk, next to which is an amazing fish market, this is well worth a visit.

A Must Visit in Dubai!. I loved the Dubai Creek. The boat ride is amazing and the breeze feels lovely on a nice hot summer day in Dubai especially in may because it is super hot! The Boat Ride drops you right off in front of the Dubai Gold Souk! Where you are able to purchase many souvenirs and cultural items !
Great Day out!. Boats, heritage centre, fishing trips. Restaurants, nice place to walk in the afternoon when it's cooler.

To repeat. Share a day in the old souk, or going around the unendles shops of gold, silk and coton shops is a marvelous atrction. Unfortunatly tourim does also mark the marked, and a lot of "chinese" cheap products are also overloading the reall souk life.

Relaxing Dhow cruise. Good place to sit and watch the activity on the water away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We went on a Dhow cruise which was very calm and relaxing but there isn't a lot to take in,other than the day to day river activity. Best to jump on an abra boat that croses the creek for a bit of excitement and to do it like the locals do. Very cheap at 1 AHD so you can do it a few times.

Jade coloured creek.. A very memorable experience visiting the souq. You'll be able to see the daily activities of the people working, at the same feel immersed in their culture of mixed nationalities.
Private taxi. Second time in Dubai and taking a private water taxi for me is very relaxing ( if is not so hot) take it a sClose to sundown and enjoy the view .

Excellent Place for Picnic. This was my first place I visited in Dubai. Really good place for weekend relaxation. I wish, if the authorities allow fishing. Nice pplace for Bar-B-Q. Every facilities is in there.

a reminder of old Dubai. it's always nice and relaxing to watch the creek and the continuous move of boats and dhows there. the creek is a reminder of the where Dubai started its successful journey.. always nice to walk by the creek too.

Best part of Dubai.. Using the public boats to traverse the river and travel along it was without doubt the most enjoyable attraction, away from the fabricated 'new city,' The few original parts of the city are easy to access by this method.

A real taste of Dubai. We were really close to the creek (stayed at the Arabian Courtyard Hotel) so walked down to have a look and take some photos. We decided to go on a Dhow and paid 1 dirham which was the equivalent to 18p in April 2015! It was a really good experiance and I'm pleased we didn't book an expensive trip before we left home, there really isn't any need.

Dubai Creek. Start at Park Hyatt for breakfast and get a taxi to take you to Historical part of the creek where you visit the Bastakiya and museums in area. Stroll along the stalls on Creek and have coffee at one of the little restaurants,facing the creek while you check the boats of all shapes and sizes come up and down with great joy and engine noises...such a lovely vibe! Unfortunately this kind of fun you prefer tt do around Oct to April before simmering summer sets in!!

Place for family leisure time. Creek Park: A place to spend leisure time. Favorite place for all for lots of activities. Very big park, you can spend time as much as you want.Entry: 5AEDMust do activities: Cycling, dolphin show, bird showOther activities: Walking around the park, train ride.Dolphin Show: Good for all ages. You will be thrilled by performance of dolphins. You will surely enjoy this. 90 AED is the entry fees for this. Those who have seen this either in USA or Singapore may be disappointed as they will not fine it up to that level.Bird Show: Specially meant of kids. They will enjoy various birds doing host of activities.
cruise around the creek was good. The night cruise around the creek upto palm jumeria was very good and apealing. Only thing is it is too costly for the ride at 100 dhs
Very interesting maze of souks. Full of gold shops and all manner of stalls. Great trip across the water to the other side. This is the Old Dubai and well worth a visit.
Boats were great. The boats dubai creek is great wish it lasted longer cheap ride on boat too a great little ride from mewna bazar to sook market

Walking in Dubai. We were there in May and it got really hot in the afternoon. But going our reasonably early with a breeze off the Creek made it manageable during this walking excursion. We walked from the Hilton Dubai Creek Hotel to the Gold Souk and it was a really interesting walk along the Creek. The shore is lined with different boats and is a hive of activity from sightseeing boats being cleaned to freight transporting boats being loaded. We then got a water taxi for the very cheap 10-minute ride to the Heritage Village across the water which is also worth a visit. It shows old Dubai and explains the history and Dubai’s growth. It is also near the oldest building in Dubai which is now the Dubai museum. After walking around here we caught the excellent Metro to The Mall of the Emirates. Like all of Dubai’s Malls - an experience in itself but the ski slope has to be seen - it is like a scene out of a Father Christmas Movie.

a taste of old Dubai. We did the hop-on/hop-off tour and stopped at the Dubai Creek for lunch. We ate at a little cafe on the waters edge and it was wonderful to watch the dhows sailing up and down the river. The locals were very friendly and there was great shopping to be done as well. A welcome break from the glitz and glamour of the city.

Dolphinarium in Dubai Creek. we went to see much talked about dolphin show in Dubai i was surprised to see that it was one of the entertainment section of Dubai Creek. a must see attraction of Dubai especially with children. another highlight is you tend to see people from different countries gathered here.paid cycle ride for children gives you chance to see different attractions like bright colored flowers , trees water creek , statues spanning vast expanse of dubai creek. you can have ice candies to cool yourself from the heat
intresting. Nice to explore on both sides of the creek .wandering around the Creek and crossing on the Abbra,Highly recommend that you give it a go.
Best value of the trip. We walked around the old town and then caught the ferry across the river, only cost 2 duram, great ride.
Old Dubai - Walk through History. You can spend a day walking through history walking on both sides of the Creek where you will see historical museums, and Silk and Gold Souks.
Nice. Beautiful views, boatrides (there's one where you can cross with your metrocard: way cheaper), souks nearby. There's not much shade, so it gets really hot, maybe try the evening?

Dubai Creek – Crossing Over to the Other Side. I make it a point to experience public transportation on my travels. As part of a Gate 1 Travel trip in March, friends and I had an opportunity to cross the Dubai Creek in an abra. The creek, that bisects the city, is more like a river than a creek and the abra is an ideal way to visit the souks on the other side. While an abra cannot compare to the sleek, driverless Dubai Metro, it is a very inexpensive way to ‘cross over to the other side.’ The covered abras depart as soon as they are filled. Watch your step as you board. Avoid a dunk in the creek at all costs. It will remind you of crossing the canals in Venice, albeit in a less elegant vessel, as you rub elbows with the locals.

Amazing!. The Dubai creek is a location with a great number of different things to do. Along the creek you will find evening dinner cruses, high end luxury hotels and shopping along side more traditional souks such as the gold souk
Ferry Ride!. Hi For 1 durum we got a ferry ride across the "creek" best deal in Dubai. Great at night for pictures.
Boat Trip. We went on Bateaux Dubai boat trip through JAResorts, fantastic experience they were so attentive food out of this world, amazing.

Some fresh air. If you wanna have a break from the heat , it is one of the few places in town where you can get it. Just take a walk in one of the different souks that you find along the end of the creek, or have a drink in ona of the many abrs and restaurants along the waterfront. Very pleasant.

The best club / restaurants in Dubai. I am a member in the club since 2006.I cannot imagine a place more relaxing, luxury and peaceful that this placeYou will be impressed by everything there. You cannot resist going back on regular basis whenever you are in DubaiIt has many restaurants that you will love all when you experience them.Boardwalk is a piece of paradise. food, staff, quality, ambiance and all are super extraordinaryCielo and Casa de Tapas are amazing places to enjoy food, drinks and views of the creekBoardwalk and Lake view offers a stylish and relaxed places to enjoy breakfast, lunch or dinner. Legends offers unique experience with luxury and funI do highly recommend it to everyone. It is a must visit in Dubai
One to tick off on your list!. Thoroughly enjoyed a half day wandering around the Creek and crossing on the Abbra. Very inexpensive and feels like the real Dubai.

Interesting View Into The Tradind Business. We took a one hour cruise on a dhow. It was interesting seeing all the goods that were being placed on many, many boats to be transported to nearby countries. Even though it was a very hot day, it was a fun activity seeing all that goes on up and down the creek.

Good for a walk.... Nice to explore on both sides of the creek. You can easily cross over with one of the ferrys. Just hop on and pay the captain one DH before start. What is impressive is the lots of very old blue wooden boats that are loaded with refrigerators and other stuff that is then shipped to India and Pakistan. Unbelievable, this harbour and the fully loaded outdated ships font fit at all in the glimmering world of dubai. It's showing how different the world's are. The rich and the poor...very close...
Cruise across the creek. The quick cruise across the river to the spice markets gave a different perspective on the city. Highly recommend that you give it a go.

Busy creek. We did both a daytime cruise along the creek & a Dhow dinner cruise - both of which we enjoyed.Our hotel room overlooked the creek & it was a beautiful view.It was also lovely to just wander along the creek both day & night as the experiences were very different.

Nice exploring. Went to the creek and it is located in old Dubai. You will see the difference between old Dubai and new Dubai. If you see anything you like and try to bargain the price with the vendors. Price negotiable is around 20 to 30%. Try it and you never know you might get something you like.
A must visit. Please go across the creek on an Abbra just for the experience ,absorb all the smells and surroundings of this wonderful area,eat in a local restaurant and then visit the gold souk area
THEY ARE SOO MANY GAMES AVAILABLE.... Creek park have much entertainments such as dolphin show, 7D Cinema, children park, and etc..... Its good for the enjoyment...

Bargain for a crossing. Its a nice day experience, you can get the big red bus early in the morning, do half a tour, get dropped off on one side of the creek, bargan with one of the many mini Dhous for a crossing, should be no more than $US2.50 each, about 10 Dhirams, you can haggle for cheaper, buy hey, these guys need to eat too.go through the "old souk" to the creek there are a number of really nice places right on the water, then get back on the bus for the rest of the tour, the busses have very handy stops, the Dubai museum is also well worth a stop off too.

Old Dubai. If you like your places to have an old / historical look to them, this is the place for you. Has small shops to visit and eating places at a resonable cost. Away from the Creek, you will find many shops and eating places, 10 to 15 minutes walk away.

dubai creek and dhow cruise. over hyped as it is included in most of the packages offered by travel companies but nothing extra ordinary there are better things to do in dubai rather going for show cruise..

Great. I preferred this place it is so much What I was looking for, narrow streets, local eating places, had wonderful Arabic food away from tourist, I was the only woman in these eateries, but was treated with respect, also old buildings

RELAXING EXCURSION. What a great way to see the city and sights cruising along on a traditional Abra. We disembarked and went to the Gold Souk and Spice Markets another must visit place. The aromas were delicious and the jewellery stores dazzling.

Nice view of building along the Creek Dhow cruise. All developed in the last few years, a nice ride of 1.5 hrs along with some simple nice homely kind of food which you also get at the desert safari organized by North Tours.
GO ON ONE OF THE MANY BOAT TRIPS. A great way to see old & new Dubai meet, its about a 2 hour boat trip & suggest you go of an evening to see the lights.

Worth seeing whilst in Dubai. I definitely recommend heading to Dubai creek for a look, a taste of old Dubai, it is so beautiful. You can ride one of the boats for less then 5 Dihrams. Be warned though about the shop keepers, they will hassle you to go into their stores to try on many scarves, best just to smile and keep walking.
DUBAI APRIL 2014. water taxi for a pound. Great hustle and bustle. Visit the Downtown Creek restaurant. Superb. Nighttime visit recommended

most wonderful dinner cruise on the jebel all bat eaux Dubai. this boat and the food is superb. lets give the cook a star! we had the most wonderful dinner cruise available in Dubai. very modern and suited for all types of ocassions. can be romantic and fun, the boat is really modern with great views from all the tables. our kids loved the food and ist presentation. it is a bit high in price but worth the food.....great great food and a wonderful service. thanks you bat eaux Dubai

THE CREEK BY DHOW. As part of our hop on hop off bus ticket we were able to take a "free" Creek cruise by Dhow which is a wooden boat built in traditional style. We were lucky with the weather - clear blue skies & a gentle breeze. We cruised for about 30 minutes taking in the skyline & viewing the interesting & varied architecture. Also varied was the huge range of types of boats - from small wooden water taxis to million dollar private yachts. During the cruise hard & soft drinks were offered for sale. This was a very relaxing excursion.

Nice boat trip!. After see the Gold Souk and Spice Souk, my and my family walked to the Dubai creek and we took one of the boats to go to the other side (from Deira to Bur -Dubai). The boats are clean but not luxurious (we don't care about this anyway). The trip was fast, around 10 minutes, and really nice. Lots of local people use this boats as transportation, and some of then were on the same boat that we were. Really nice experience!.

Cruise on the creek. on ideal way to spend time cruising the creek for around 1.5hrs with dinner and a traditional arabian dance performed by an artist for around 10 minutes. good view of the high rise building fully lit up.

abra crossing not to be missed. Abra service across the creek is fast and efficient, great to experience a unique mode of transport used by everyday folk and not just tourists. They can also be hired for a trip up and down the creek Adjacent souks slightly spoiled by tourist-tack but at least it keeps them buzzing.
Picturesque, busy waterway. We stayed in a hotel overlooking this. There are wooden dhows that carry produce to and from Persia and India. There are also lots of restaurant boats and water taxis.
Old Dubai. This was a piece of Old Dubai which is rare to find in such a " nothing ever gets old in Dubai" The Creek was a throw back to how things were before the madness of money and development

Heart of Dubai. This is where it all began and it feels like you could possibly be back in time. Easy walk around all the souks, restaurants, Dubai Museum and Cultural centre. The very best place to find a room as the promenade is much more tourist friendly and easy to navigate than the new hotel areas by the Palm Jumeirah. We took the bus from Abu Dhabi, for 25 AED each, air conditioned, lovely trip and the bus station is just on the other side of the metro station. Our hotel was on the creek. Great, inexpensive way to get around. A day pass for 22 AED gives you 24 hour access to all the lines to all the major tourist attractions and malls.
Creek boat trip. We rented a Dhow to take us on an hour Creek trip and had a wonderful experience viewing the buildings along the Creek.

Nice way to spend an evening. The Dubai creek has a nice promenade, great for walks and to sit and enjoy the breeze. It's quiet, not much traffic passing by there and you can make to the museum and a couple of heritage sites from there. It's nice to take the local 'abra' or boat across to the old part of the city, Deira. Definitely doesn't feel like Dubai being down there, which can be a great thing and it's free! I wouldn't recommend the hour-long boat tours that go up the creek which are really boring as there really is nothing to see except big buildings and you're stuck on a boat with no alcohol.
Tour in Dubai Creek. The Creek must be visited when you in dubai. In order to enjoy it you have to get on dhow cruise to see the landmarks and enjoy the view

The heart of Dubai. Dubai has a long maritime history and the Creek today continues the tradition of shipping all sorts of things in and out of Dubai using traditional wooden dhows. You can see them plying back and forth, or watch the wide assortment of cargoes being unloaded at the key side. The little ferry boats (abras) carry passengers across and along the Creek for a few dirhams and are great fun. Along the Creek are the heritage areas of Bastakiya and Shindagah. Both have trendy cafes and guesthouses. The Bastakiya is gaining a reputation as an arts' centre and where you will find some traditional courtyard houses with wind towers - a kind of natural a/c which funnel cool air into the rooms below. Across the Creek from the Bastakiya are the spice souk and the famous gold souk. Both are well worth a visit. The Creek is the oldest area of one of the most modern and innovative cities in the world. It's easy to forget you are in the Middle East in Dubai - a visit to the Creek puts the new into context and connects the visitor with the city's heritage and its past.

I would go with the short ride and avoid the hour long tour. I booked the hour long tour for 120 AED but got bored after 15 minutes. The guide was not very talkative so it was just a boat ride in silence. I would rather do the 1AED ride from one side to the other (go to Meena bazaar), as it gives all the flavor, but doesn't get boring.

Dubai Creek and Abra service. The Dubai Creek separates Old Dubai from Deira and by using the abra service to cross it is a great and different experience, especially if sharing the creek with one of the much larger dhows. The dhows moor along the creek bank so it's worth a wander to check these out.
The Old Dubai. Its the old Dubai where you can see another face of the Emirate. Immigrants and workers live there. A less fancy area but still worth to visit it.

Old creek. Except for some old eateries, there is not much to see in Dubai creek, If you are taking a cruise, marine side is better than creek side.Yes you can go across the creek for just 1 Diharm !! even today on tradition boats
another interesting site in dubai. gives a feeling for the old part of town, both by car and even more when doing the dhow boat tour . recommended

boat ride was really nice... the.,. creek area is close to the old city. and whole creek area is maintained very nice...only thing some time crowed..,,,in market need to be carefull....but over all good experience..

An hour of real pleasure. I went for a trip on Dubai creek and spent an hour of real pleasure! The boat was so comfortable and so cool with the sea breeze, one can just relax and take in the wonderful views of the creekside. Well worth doing.

Best value boat ride!. The water taxis that take you across to Bur Dubai cost 1 dirham each way. Absolute bargain to see the traditional Dubai and visit the souks on each side! We went about 5pm and the temperature was pleasant.
An experience not to be missed. I thoroughly enjoyed walking throught the markets and riding on the local water taxis. The food in the markets was also awesome. Well recommended..
my favourite place in dubai. awesome place for jogging.good ambience.a bit crowded some days,but still good a good place to enjoy with your family on weekends.
peaceful and relaxing. peaceful and relaxing location, but when the weather allows for it as the city can get rather hot and humid.

a very nice creek, viewed from 2 different sites. We stayed at the Park Hyatt, that is located inside the creek. The view is beautiful, including at night. The hotel is isolated and you don't hear the noise of the highway passing around the creek.We also took a little boat that crossed the creek in the market area. We also went to see the fishing boat harbor. Again, the view and the activities are worth looking at. We enjoyed in particular seeing the traditional boats, which seems so out of date with the rest of Dubai!

Great area to see how Dubai lives.. Really nice and clean area to walk around and experience a little bit of history. Walk along the creek and enjoy a drink to see ships passing by and people walking around. There is also a market with all sorts of scarfs and craftwork and if you are not interested to buy, than clearly show you are not interested and learn to say : Not interested or No thanks in Arabic and Hindi, otherwise you will be harassed every 2 meters which makes the market an annoying place to be. You better can walk through the streets surrounding the market as there you see how the Dubai economy is strongly driving on all workers from India. At certain points you actually feel you are in Delhi, so many Indian shops and restaurant and movies showing Bollywood classics.

Great Bargains. Visited the creek - took the short ride across the creek on a rustic, very authentic middle eastern boat after walking through the souks. Very interesting side of Dubai - away from the glamour and had a more natural feel. Lots of people however good stuff and even better prices. Worth taking the time to visit.
Great at night.. Easy to travel across or up and down the Creek. Choice of oats, restaurants etc.Last transport on little boats 9.30pm was a shame!
Breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking views from the Creek. Next time I'll give the golf course a visit. Try to catch sunset here, it's incredible.

Bur Dubai is awesome. Not all travelers make it to this side of the creek. If you get a chance to visit Bur Dubai, make sure you check out the outdoor market, the Gold Souk, etc.My favorite part of this area is the shipping docks. If you are a photographer, I highly recommend taking the time to photograph the boats, their crew and the loading / unloading process. It's quite a sight.

Beautifull. Well Dubai has bunch of man made masterpiece and this is probabaly the only nature made beautifull pasterpiece.Do visit dubai creek and take yachet for collecting some luxuries and memorable moment of your life.

Interesting day. Enjoyed our time here. Travelled via metro, Used the old dohw boats across the river - quite an experience!. Walked through the old souks and along the waterfront and through the gold souks. A bit hassled in the souks unlike Dubai generally. Really enjoyed the historic quarter where old buildings are now craft shops and coin museums etc, and the Dubai Museum was excellent - very well presented and interesting 'living' scenes/sets of old Dubai - and all for 1 AED!!!

Real life in Dubai. Seeing people moving around Dubai creek helps me feel like a local. I took the water taxi and enjoyed the breeze, walked through the spice and gold souk, It was the real life in old Dubai!

The "new" cheek by jowl with the traditional. Visited this as part of our hop on hop off bus tour. Fascinating to see the glitz and glamour of the new buildings and boats mingled in with the locals, every day boats and traders going about their business.

Old Dubai. Loved travelling to Old Souk, and the Gold Souk on the abras....pay virtually nothing to get the real feel of Dubai as it originally was - a maritime trading centre. From our hotel, the Sheraton, it was a one minute walk each evening to another 'adventure'

Dubai Creek. Visited Dubai Creek Wharfage to take a last look at the remaining dhows as believe they are all being moved to a new area with better facilities for the Sailors. Very few dhows there now, majority were tourist restaurant boats. Sad to see yet another traditional Dubai area being marked for redevelopment. Go see it while you still can!

Not my cup of tea. Travelled by shuttle bus then metro with a change of line to get to the creek area to go to the souks, personally not my cup of tea. You daren't even stop to look at anything without being constantly harassed by males trying to get you to buy something, spent the whole time saying no thank you.

Room with a view. Spent the return leg of our holiday in the Hilton dubai creek.Our room had spectacular views of the creek and the ever changing view of abras and larger ships was very relaxing.The creek area had several souks,shopping areas and was great for people watching.

river cruise with meal. We went on a river cruise which takes about 2 hours. We booked with emiratesbooking.com. it cost 120 aed roundabout £20.00 so well worth the money. You get picked up at your hotel and dropped back off. On board you go up the creek right to the marina. There was a touquan dancer and also a magician. The meal was typical curry and rice with salad and pasta. You couldn't have alcohol on this trip but I think if you go on the more expensive boats you may be able to but there was water cola and lemonade. Well worth doing
Nice view of the Deira and Burdubai ... Good wayt to cross over each way on the creek on abras and connect by Metro - Al Ras /AlGhurair ...Al Fahidi fort and museum ..good eating options

worth the ride. after shopping at textile souk we took the boat across the creek to the other side to spice souk and gold souk. I recommend doing this, authentic boat transportation, cost 1aed, 5 min to cross the creek, great heritage building views.

A wee taste of old Dubai. The metro takes you to the mouth of the Creek, don't go inland to Creek Metro Station like we did, there's nothing there.There were some dubious looking restauants but we took a gamble, the food (lamb and chicken kebabs) was fabulous with lovely fresh clean vegetables. No problem in the end. The small boat rides (for ten pence) across the Creek are not to be missed. A bit wobbly but so much fun.At the other side the saffron souk is amazing.Make sure you allow plenty of time to discover the less obvious little gems of this lovely place.BTW the people are lovely and the place appears to be very safe.

you can't visit Dubai without visiting Dubai Creek!. or you will simply msis 80% of the story behind Dubai: it's roots, where it us coming from, and where it is going to. Gold Souk, Spice Souk, Dubai Museum, Watertaxi, all achievable in 4 hours... time well invested for anyone that wants more than just cocktails at the pool.

Abra ca Dabra. Take an Abra ride, will cost you ~2 dhs only !
Experience old dubai in an abra. If you wish, take a Dhow cruise and enjoy entertainment onboard. Worth experiencing it one time during your visit.

A Hive of Activity. We stayed close by and were able to experience this great area both day and night. Hindu Lane, the souks, the water taxis, the trips on the creek and the restaurants - all worth experiencing.

Back home we call this a river. When I heard this referred to as a "creek" I wondered how boats could traverse it because back home a "creek" is shallow and narrow. This is more like a river: deep and very wide. We went on a two different dinner cruises the week we visited and the number of large boats which could fit on this body of water at one time without running into each other was impressive. We were escorted both times so we didn't get to spend any time at the park near the wharf, which looked like a lovely place to people watch and play games.

A great experience. Take one of the little Ferry boats for 25 cents and your little boat will soon dodge freight carrying dhows, face big boats bearing directly down on you, pass many mosques with the muezzins calling for sprayer from one of the many towers before you finally arrive at the old spice market. A great little trip.

Nice view from the water. Definitely take a water taxi to see the Creek from the water. It is not expensive, we paid 60 dirhams for a 40 minutes trip and we got the boat to ourselves (a family of four), it is a very nice experience !
Lovely Dinner Cruise. Our evening dinner cruise on the Dubai Creek was very enjoyable. The food was good and the scenery provided a romantic and lively evening, especially being on the upper deck.

So traditional~. Such a great place to enjoy! The abras that ferry you across the "creek" are truly a flash from the past and so enjoyable and economic. Then so see the dhows unloading all their merchandise without big cranes or equipment was truly amazing! The evening view with all the lit up tourist boats was a sight to see.

Inside Ski Field.. Brilliant that something can be built in the Desert. If hyou are a keen skier or just want to be cool for sometime, this is the place. The fitting area is bigger the Thredbo in Australia and most likely have as much equipment. Ski lifts, ski chairs, ski down a slope, really this is something that makes you think seriously why.

Very Pleasant!. Though there is nothing specifically great about this place but on the whole it has an air of festivity. Adjacent to Heritage Village, by the sea, it is a very warm and welcoming place. You can just sit and enjoy the breeze. There are food stalls, games, restaurants, shops around over here and a very local kind market at the end that sells souvenirs among other things. Mostly run by Indians and Pakistanis. We had the cheapest and bestesstt Falafel sandwich here, which is a wrap. It was delish. They have abra dock here which takes you across the river for 1dirham! It was a pleasant ride. We really enjoyed our evening here.
An oasis of calm and tranquility!. We visited the creek for the famous Dhow Cruise. Idyllic and blissful setting. Food, music and entertainment makes this visit memorable.
Nice Place to eat. I love going here. Take a Dow taxi ride across the creek and eat and smoke shisha ant the creek side restaurant is a must.

Escape the bling and immerse yourself in the most diverse bit of Dubai. If you go by Metro you'll notice the Emirates obscure this part of Dubai from view. Probably because it's where most of Dubai's non European expat community, who aren't building skyscrapers hang out and work. The Creek itself is a body of water that gives you the opportunity it's to escape the bustle on an Abra £30 for an hour tour per group or 80p per person to cross the Creek. On the Diera side is a plethora of shops that sell everything, get all your pashmina and tatt there as it's about 30% of the tourist trap prices.
