It has a big stretch where tourist can go near waterside to enjoy the authentic cuisines on Dhow Cruise(floating restaurant) for a dinner. It also has garden area where normally people come for a walk and kids have play are to enjoy. You also have the famous souks (market) of Dubai to visit. You can also see the old-styles big wooden boats parked near waterside which are still used for trading between countries through sea. You can also enjoy ride of small wooden boats(abra) which takes people from one side to other of the creek.

Nice place to visit.. Nice walk along the Creek, we also stopped at the Silk Souk, which is close by. A nice thing to do would be to catch the boats that go along the Creek. We didn't do this, but now wished we had.
Cruise. The dinner cruise in the Dubai Creek was a highlight in Dubai. Definitely worth it and you get to see the old Dubai and the new.

Get a bit of culture. Jump on one of the boats to cross the creek with some of the locals. be careful as they do like to cram the boats to capacity. and make sure you have your money ready as they take payment enroute. i would avoid doing this in the midday heat
fby. Walk along the Creek starting at the Sheraton Creek Hotel. The "Dhow Wharfage" is quite fascinating. Watch the Dhows being loaded with merchandise before they set off to their destination.

Good old Dubai. After the granduer of Shaikh Zayed road and the rest of gleaming Dubai, I wanted to see what the old Dubai looked like....Well, it's beautiful in its own way.... With beautiful views of hand made "dhows", and a glimpse of the trade scene, Dubai Creek is a peek into ancient middle eastern culture.A ride on the traditional motorboat is a must (AED 1)The creek is one of those places which would make for a wonderful walk with old friends on a cool evening... For a feel of Traditional markets, and inexpensive souvenirs.... drop by the creek..On the metro, take the Green line and the last stop is the creek.Note for photographers:Sunset and blue hour are really beautiful here.... Get ur tripods for those long exposures of boats on water and some really nice scenes at dusk.
Nice change if peace. This area is frequented by locals so here is one of the few chances to see how real life goes on (apart from the markets you find everywhere) in this town. Interesting

Interesting "traditional" area of Dubai. For a nice tourist experience check out the creek area of Dubai. The Spice and Gold Souks are well worth a visit. To add to the experience take the 1 dirham water taxi that goes between Deira and Bur Dubai.
Authentic Dubai. A walk along the Creek provides a chance to get away from the tourists and see locals enjoying daily life and cargo being loaded, unloaded and transported on the river.

Where it all started. During our stay,new decide to go on a tour and experience something new in Dubai, someone recommended we visit the Dubai creek. We really had a good time to see the old Dubai connected with the new Dubai , really nice place, good to walk around and enjoy the boats sailing in the creek
nice place. its a nice place to spend time.... children will have a good time... the place is neat and clean.... dont miss this place......

Beautiful, old Dubai. Gives you a feel for what Dubai was like, before it is what it is today. It gets very hot, especially if you go when I went July/August so take water and fans! I wouldn't recommend going in the middle of the day.

Beautiful scenery. Times watching the beautiful small sailing vessels, especially at night and find restaurants where ships find good eating
For two hours

saluja cruise speed boat dubai. Definitely not a speed boat! Max speed only 7knots! The boat had difficulty starting and was very old! Up and down the creek only with not much to see! The staff were friendly but spoke only a little English! This trip is very boring and you could see the same and go faster on a one dirahim dhow cruise!! Rubbish, not worth the money! Be aware!
Panoramic View. Dubai Creek visit with my kids on an evening was very pleasurable as the ride on an Abra (Boat) gave us a panoramic view of the connecting between the old and new sides of Dubai.
Crossing the creek. Make sure to catch a water taxi, get alongside the locals and get a sense of the real Dubai. You could catch a train, but being on the creek is great fun

Interesting. My family and I used Rayna tours for a dhow cruise in the Dubai Creek. It was very organized and entertaining. The only downside was that the waitress removed all of the glasses from the tables at 30 minutes before the cruise was over. It is always very hot in Dubai and many people were thirsty and ended up drinking water from tall water bottles. Overall, it was a pleasant experience.
Take a quick trip. Best way to reach the gold and spice markets.Cooler on the water too.......Links the old and new Dubai.
Just watch the world pass by. Great place to sit at one of the cafes and watch the world go by. Water taxis crossing the creek, Dhows up and down. Fascinating.
Trip of a lifetime. Great Experience for very little cost on the Abra's also had meal and a cruise on the larger Dhow - Fab!!!

Part of the real Dubai. You can take a dinner cruise or fancy tour but I suggest you take a stroll on either side of the creek. Textile Souk and Rulers' Court on one side. Spice Souk and dhow docks on the other. Use the water taxi (Abra) service to cross (AED1) back and forth. The creek park is also a pleasant place to relax too. It'll probably be your cheapest day in Dubai! As a residents we never tire of our creek strolls especially in the early morning especially in the summer months before the heat becomes oppressive. You'll be amazed at what a human being can load onto a dhow just using his own body weight. The HSE guys don't complain too much at oversize boxes and safety flip flops.
Perfect place to visit and relax. This is a perfect place to hang around, and relax on evenings with a good view of surrounded buildings and boats.
Dubai Creek. One of my favourite places we visited. A break from the soulless shopping centres and simply walking past the dhow wharfs was an experience. The taxi ride across the creek is a must.

Cruise along the Creek. We Opted to Have a Meal & Cruise Aboard 1 of the Many Boats Lined Up in Dubai Creek ... Tip .. Haggle the Price Down for Diner & Cruise !!! Or do what we did and Pre Book & Use a Groupon Voucher that we Purchased in the Uk Before traveling .. We Worth it .. Deffo Recommend to Everyone ..

Man made creek at its best. Loved sitting and watching the abras go by. There were times when I simply hooped on the abra and went towards Dierra and back for no reason. Made it a point to walk upto the creek everyday and enjoy the beautiful architecture around it.
take abra. taking abra to souq was quiet fun! about souq, gold souq was pretty cool and you can buy gold for really cheap price but spice souq and old souq was terrible I say...
Cruise not so great. The Cruise itself was not so great. The Creek by night is quite dark so there's little to see. My 2 yr old enjoyed the entertainment after dinner.
Dubai Creek. I enjoyed the boat ride down Dubai Creek, it was relaxing and picturesque. It was a great place to stroll beside and enjoy the breeze.

Catch an abra to cross the creek. Don't catch a taxi between the Gold or Spice Souk and the Dubai Museum, just walk the few hundred metres to the Dubai Creek and catch an abra (an open boat used by workers) for a very few dirham across the Creek. They are constantly toing and froing across the creek and so you don't have a wait. From the other side of the creek, it is then no more than a 5-10 minute walk to the Museum, depending on how long you look at shops on the way.

relaxing. lovely place to sit and eat and watch the world go by and have a ride on the abra's. Also lots of places to buy souvenirs if you can put up with being constantly bothered to look, all part of the experience but put me off looking.

Packed with history. I was surprised how clean the creek was. The journey across by abra (for 1 dirham) was easy and fun. The heritage buildings around the area we stayed (near the museum) made for a very interesting stay
Creek trip on an abra to the textile souk. The trip across the creek cost 1 dhs each person. A great experience. Found some fantastic people inn the textile souk.
Dinner on the dhows. We have done a dinner cruise on one of the old dhows. ngod was good and it was amazing to see the skyline by night.

Good Food but not much of a cruise. We spent a pleasant evening on the boat which hardly moved. It made just one trip up and down the creek and we had a glimpse of the skyscrapers on both sides. The food was, however, excellent and the service quite good.
Dubai Creek. A real experience travelling on the abra (wooden boat) across the creek to the old area. There are boats going everywhere and it's worthwhile to visit the souks on the other side.
Dubai Creek. Excellent location for families and tourists. Dhow cruise had a lovely buffet and it was a nice relaxing end to a busy day.

Nice boat ride. I bought a tour and went round the creek in a boat ride; it was fun and enjoyable.There are some pretty good views of the city's skyline. One also gets to see the old port from where Dubai grew.
Creek as may creeks. Not very special, and 'old' is not really old. Seemed to me a mere EuroDisneyPark setting, plus that everything is very commersialized

Dubai Creek boat rides. Dubai creek connects Bur Dubai and Deira areas of Dubai. At Bur Dubai (near Al Ghubaiba metro and the bus stand), at the boat station called the Abra, we can take boat ride to cross over the creek to reach Deira. Deira houses the Gold souk(gold market) and a few other shopping attractions including the Spices market. Also, the government transport agency RTA operates quite a few rides on bigger boats, covering a tourist circuit. The creek is sort of reasonably clean (though at a few areas there are a lot of wastes accumulation-like thrown away water bottles, plastics, marine/water plants etc).

Afternoon on the water. Enjoyed our boat trip on the creek. Only criticism - the narrator giving the commentary was very quiet and we couldnt understand what she was saying. It was very relaxing though - my partner dozed off!!!
Great to walk at night. Most relaxing after a long day of shopping to just take a leisurely walk along the creek. A must do.
smoggy. It was a nice little trip across the creek but at this time of year it is very smoggy and of course very hot.
The real Dubai. Take the abra trip, walk up to the docks, visit the waterfront and watch the life on the dhows. Tourist heaven after the battle in the souk!

Take a Leisurely Trip back in Time. Take a dhow trip along the creek, get off at the souk and experience the Gold Souk, Spice Souk (erm, ok all the souks) and don't forget to do a deal...the locals expect it.

convenient and enchanting. A very convenient way to cross across to Gold Souk area using the local ferry type transportation across the creek. This is a blessing also to access some restaurants across the creek and if you are in the mood for this experience

Use the 1dirham boats to cross the river. Yes at only 20p (1 dirham) you can cross the river to go to the old souk, it is a very interesting experience as it is local and it is the media transportation that was used in Dubai before its expansion. No safety belts make it funnier. Still safe, don't worry.
Good to see once. Went to the creek with family , worth visiting once and having a look , if you are in Dubai .Also the local market is nearby and walkable , if you wish to do some street shopping .
The Creek. Here, for me, was the real Dubai with old houses and markets vibrant with colour and the smell of spices.
Busy place. Great way to travel on water taxi's.....upmarket enclosed ones a little more expensive (6 dirham return).....open boat with the locals (1 dirham each trip).....3 to 4 dirham per AU$

Old Dubai. We liked the busy life of Dubai creek with the Dhow's moored up alongside the harbour walls, the Dhows still sailing between various countries continuing a tradition that's been going on for hundreds of years. Just wondering around looking at the cargo and how the boats are stacked up beggars belief! This old Dubai trade is an interesting contrast to the new Dubai of tourism, banking and high finance. The Heritage Village is also worth a visit.

Great to spend some hours. Dubai has a lot of beautifull places to discover.
Far away from those big busy places, the Dubai Creek is a more relaxing place where you can walk around and relax.

Good to see the city from the water. It was very pleasant to sit on a boat in the shade and see the city from the water with a cool breeze blowing. You get an idea of how the city developed and go nearly to the entrance of the creek to within a few hundred metres of the bridge. I think we saw almost as much from the hour boat trip as we did in our walking and bus trip around the inner city area.

Evening dhow cruise and daytime abra crossing. Both really good , cruise had a lovely buffet and it was a nice relaxing end to a busy day ! Abra boat is a must to do get you to the souks and very cheap 1 dirham each !

The place to wind it all down. The place to take a chill pill after a long day, the 1dirham trip across the creek is almost therapeutic, complete with abit of living history... the dhows from and to Oman make it look like you have gone back into history, 10s of years ago ago.

trading, abras and souks. a great place that we enjoyed, it seems to be the centre for all of the souksd, gold, spices, electronics etc, also a great place to take the real abra ride across the river for only 1 dirham each. a lot of trading going on on the wharfwith all the goods just sitting out in the open, an eyeopener and fun.

Brilliant. Excellent views and lots going on. Great place to go and chill out and people watch. Plenty of places that take you on trips along the creek, as a group or individuals, good value for money.

See the traditional part of Dubai. Very cool & authentic.. Took the waterbus which cost AED1. Very nice authentic Dubai scenery which is very different from the new extravagant Dubai. There's an old textile market which is also cool (although some shops are too targeting to tourist now).

Old Times of Dubai. Along the river , you may see the a lot long tail boat taking passenger across river .. Operating like water taxi....There's a lot boat loading & unload along the river. If you have time.. visit the souk around .. get a feeling for the traditional dubai ...
a lovely cruise. We took a lovely cruise on one of the boats with dinner, it was a cool night hence we enjoyed it very much.

a bit overwhelming. its defi a must to visit but it can get a bit overwhelming with the amount of people and the boats going past.. the markets around are a haggle playground and you will get hassled a lot for buying things from the different competitive stores

An old Arab Town. If you go there use the traditional small boats. Very cool. Costs 1 dirham. Go to the souks stores and buy a black arab costume for women.Go to the traditional old village. It is at the east side of the canal.There are a lot of small stores with cheap souvenirs.Its a bazaar. The seller sell something for 50 dirham and finally you buy it for 30.

take a water taxi and cruise. Lovely way to see a part of Dubai and the workings of the ships and boats that ply their goods. Nice both day and night. We took a closed airconditioned taxi which was a nice option on a hot day

Such good fun. Even if you're not going to ski you can't fail to have fun here. You can play in the snow, take the ski lift and go on various rides. Really amzing place and something quite different from the sun and heat of Dubai.

Nice, lots to do. We crossed the Creek on a small eooden boat whild visiting the souks that are scattered around it. Lovely short boat trip, lots to see once you're on the water. Totally worth the one dirham you'll have to spend on this. After lunch, we decided to rent our own wooden boat to let us float around the Creek for an hour or so. If you have time, you should do this!! It costs 120 dirhams per hour per boat. Since there was four of us, we shared the fee and really enjoyed ourselves! Boat rental is right next to the place where you (dis)embark the "regular" wooden boats.

Lots to see and do.... The creek offers many different sights and experiences for the visitor seeking a way to fill a day. I recommend taking a dhow river cruise for an afternoon, or opting for a dinner cruise later in the day.

Water Taxis. Went to Dubai Creek and used the Water Bus (4 dhs) which allowed us to visit different terminals along the creek. Eventually alighting at The Old Souk Market, which included street markets and at the rear town shopping centres.

Beautiful Cruise Experience - Must Do. HD Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQFV_oJDOI8&list=PLCk8vWTtXgUImXCtrSJr-lvxzOE_gKyrJReally relaxing and pleasurable hour spent in cruise on Dhow in Dubai Creek. Calm, serene, traditional setup with modern skyscrappers forming the backdrop. Interesting to see traditional boats/ships ferrying people and goods in ultra modern Dubai landscape.

A great place to stay in Dubai with some tradition and history.. We arrived and fell in love with this vibrant place ,we used the water taxi to get around and visited the spice souk, the gold souk, the old souk and the Dubai museum using this very cheap water taxi to its best. The atmosphere was great compared to the downtown high roller experience with big towers and flashy food, not saying I don't like this as well. This area needs to be kept up to spec to show people what Dubai was really like less than 50 years a go. A great heritage location to the fast life in Dubai.

a fantastic place to live. just back from dubai first time out there in a few years worked in al ain for a good number of years advice stay near the creek bur dubai to be central and visit al ain the garden city 90mins from dubai and try and visit abu dhabai 60mins from dubai

Water taxi. We took the water taxi called an Abra for 1 dirham across the Creek from close to the Spice market and had our lunch in one of the restaurants. It was like something from hundreds of years ago (except they probably upgraded the engine) and its a lovely way to experience what the original old Dubai was like. Loved it.
Same Old Same Old. Took a boat trip around the creek. It was the same things that Dubai is famed for. More tall buildings of corporate companies and hotels. Did see the trade boats.
FABULOUS PARTICULARLY AT NIGHT. River cruise was fabulous. So much to see. Spice souks, gold shops and water taxis not to be missed. Fort nearby

Awesome ride on a dhow boat. A ride on the Dubai Creek is a must. The narrator on the boat is informative and the ride lasts about 60 minutes. Great photo opportunities for the modern and old Dubai. Very relaxing. You can sit indoors or on the second level. The second level is covered with a canopy with some seating in the direct sun.

See the older side of Dubai. Not as old as some cities we have been to but it seemed to be the "working' side of Dubai. The river taxis, the markets, the smell of the spices etc for sale simply add to the character of the place. A must see if you are to see Dubai in its entirety.
Dhow cruise gives a different perspective. and is the right speed to soak in the Dubai gone by and still co-existing with its glamorous cousin Downtown Dubai
The Creek at Night. We went up the Creek on a dinner cruise, which was fabulous. Although its just building after building, but luckily the food was some of the best we had ever tasted.

Nice for 2 hrs. The old soukh is nice to see. You can have a drink on the terrace on the water and make a little tour in the water in a dow.
The market is not that large, but nice if you like bargaining.

It'll be the best one Dirham you spend. Take a little wooden boat called an Abra to get across the creek - they go back and forth the creek all the time so you don't have to wait long...and it's a great way to get across to the Gold and Spice Souks. Just pay the driver. Best to have the right money. And enjoy the view!

Take a cruise or an Abra, your choice. The creek area is vibrant and exciting and is a must do when in Dubai. An Abra trip across it only costs 1 Dirham and the many cruises are reasonably priced. The creek dissects the old part of the city and holds the location for the spice and gold souks on one side and the silk souks on the other. Many boats constantly use the river and the atmosphere really helps make your day by getting you into the mood of the place.

View the city by water. Cruise Dubai by water viewing beautiful yachts and visualising the growth of Dubai. There were so many apartments for sale and rent and new businesses, It was a pleasure to see the wealth of Dubai.

Don't just experience the culture, LEARN the culture. I stick by this phrase. You can come to Dubai and party and whatnot, but it is so much better to learn about where Dubai started back in the pearling and fishing days. I already reviewed the abra's, which is how you will access the creek instead of just driving by it. Get out on the water, enjoy it! You can pay 100-200 dhs, depending on the driver, to rent the abra out for an hour and just cruise around. Well worth it in my opinion. You'll get to see the old parts of the city, and people watch. Do it!
dubai creek. take water bus cross the creek, 10p, very quick crossing and yuo meet genuine people going by life’s. There is not much old in Dubai but this one of the them.

Way To Go.. A nice scenic view one can have from the "Dubai Creek" of the Deira side of Dubai and as well as the Bur Dubai side of Dubai.In fact both the sides has its beauty and charm and both are equally viewed from the "Dubai Creek".

The heart of old Dubai. Take an Abra across the old Creek for the equivelent of about 50p. Its the heart of old Dubai and was the starting place for the growth that has happened since. There are several companies that offer lunch or dinner cruises that will take you the full length of the creek to see old souks and Mosques with a drink and food.I recommend bateaux dubai if you can splash out a bit. Its the nicest one I saw on the water (and the one we did). It had a violinist and pianist

Must do, so refreshing and authentic. I think I enjoyed a cruise the most during my short stay in Dubai: I liked it more than Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall with its fountain ! Away from the bursting city Dubai creek offers an authentic experience of how the locals do it.

Hustle and bustle of old Dubai. The creek. Where old Dubai meets the new Dubai and where a lot of hustle and bustle happen. It's a nice relaxing stroll at night too with excellent shawarma and other Arabic cuisine nearby.

Back to the 70's. Maybe you find the impressive is too new or modern, Dubai Creek get you back to the old days of what Dubai used to be before the rapid development for the past 15 years.Good to take ferry along the creek and do some shopping at local market.1-2 hours is enough for the whole visit, or you may visit the Dubai Museum afterward which is just right next to the creek.

You have to do this. We used the boats across the Dubai Creek to get to the Gold Souk and even to go to dinner as the access was very near our hotel and the taxis had to go much further to cross a bridge.
Historic. If you get a chance, this historic creek is the reason Dubai became what it is today. Worth a ride on the abras and a stroll in the close by Creek Park.

take the abra. Take the abra to cross from one side to the other and watch Dubai slide by with a breeze through your hair. You will love it. A crossing only costs 1 dirham. Don't worry if you don't know where you're going, distances between abra stations are limited.

Leisurely Cruise. the price of this tour is included in the Hop on hop off Downtown bus. It is well worth taking the time to relax and enjoy it. Do check on the departure times though as the first time I went there was a long delay for the dhow so I went off somewhere elve - the Souq of course, any excuse. The Dhow was very nicely appointed and the woodwork was special. I had to insist that I'd be sick if I stayed downstairs in order to get upstairs. I hung out at the back and watched Dubai pass by. The commentry was easy to follow and understand. This is a great way to fully realise the contrast of Dubai; the old and the new merging so well together. The water taxis swish by - no thought to life jackets or even proper seats, everyone just sits along benches. To see the blue and white working dhows was great. Wanting to savour the whole touristic experience I had my "tattoo" dye done along my ankle, which prompted some others to do it too. I also had a Shawarma - not great but ok. All in all this is an experience not to be missed. Next time I'll take a nightime dinner cruise.

Authentic part of Dubai. If you look for a bit of history in Dubai, you need to see Creek, a natural inland water in old part of Dubai. Most developments around Creek have been in place for over 30 years, so this is a truly authentic experience of old Dubai life.

Loved the Abra Ride. The abra ride on these old boats smelling of diesel was a highlight. They work well and run constantly. 1 Dur is fantastic price. Easy to navigate and get to the souk's.Just note there are 2 stations one each side. On Bur Dubai they are close near the textile souk, but are further apart on the other side. For the gold souq, go to the station furthest from the museum.
Delicious Dubai. So much to look and take in! Take an Abra ride on the creek -very cheap and fascinating . Sit at water's edge table for free viewing of the Dubai life.

Sunset Cruise. We were walking along the creek when we decided to take a boat ride on the creek. A young man with a motorboat charged us 50 AED per person. He took us from one end of the creek to the floating bridge and back to where he picked us up. We went at a very slow pace at sunset and what a memorable experience that was! On our own private boat.

Must visit journey !. Although during my visit i made up to cancel my Dhow cruise dinner but then i went on. Thanks God i experienced it. It was a memorable short cruise dinner. The cruise boats are well decorated & they serve very nice dinner aboard. Dont miss it.
Night time spectacular. Lovely area. We went on the night dinner cruise and loved the lights and atmosphere. By day it is clean and some lovely cafes. Really nice to walk around and enjoy.
Best place in Dubai. Loved the creek view and the numerous abras that keep going back and forth. The place makes for a very good evening stroll with cafetarias serving excellent falafel shawrmas..

An Interesting Place to Walk around, especially at Night.. We walked along the creek, near the gold & spice souks on one side & the heritage village on the other side. We walked around these areas during the daytime & at night. It displays a totally different atmosphere during the day to what it does at night. It is great to take a ride across the creek for 1AED on an 'abra', which run day & night. Don't take a water taxi unless you have to go further along the creek to a specific destination, as this will cost you significantly more. If you just want to go across the creek, take the traditional abra, as it is fun & safe.
Relax and Unwind. Excellent location for families and tourists. You can relax, play with the kids as well as grab a bite to eat.

Ferry trip a must. Hop on one of the small timber ferries to get to the other side of the creek - more of a river actually. It's a good way to mix with the locals and view the city from a different vantage point. It's also relaxing. Ferries run regularly, are cheap and fast.
Walk around the creek area. Great to soak up atmosphere along the creek. We had a sail on it which was included in the bus ticket. Lots to visit nearby.

Old-School Dubai. There is a fascinating walk to be had along the Deira side of Dubai Creek. There are masses of dhows being loaded, often by hand, tasking all manner of goods across the Gulf to Iran and down to the sub-continent and to East Africa. This really gives a feel of trade at the sharp end, and but for the fact that the dhows are all mechanised, could have looked broadly the same over a century ago. Wander back from the Creekside and there are plenty of souks to be found that are worth wandering though and the pressure to buy is fairly relaxed.When you want to cross to the other side there are 3 different abra routes across the Creek, leaving when each abra is full, so basically continuous. And it will cost you the princely fee of 1 dirham: the best bargain in Town.
Into the Past!. Do take an Abra tour - only 1/2 hour long - great way to take your time and see the waterfront up close.
Disappointed. Probably should have gone during the day and also not on Thursday as this is like our Friday and it is very busy. Be prepared to be hassled and pestered.

THE HEART BEAT. THE beat of Dubai if you miss this area you miss Dubai, its a constant comming and going of all kinds of traffic day and night with great cafes along its sides with all country,s flags visable ,we loved it and when you see the old buildings up against the new the old wind towers ,and behind them the gleeming skyscrapers of new DUBAI .

Lovely to have a boat trip, relaxing and looking to both sides of the creek. The boat tour on the Dubai Creek was included in our ticket for the hopp on and hopp off bus. We took the opportunity and sailed up and down the creek. Was beautiful.

Different. You simply have to visit to see the other side to Dubai. Ride the wooden boats for 1AeD ( 20p) - barter with the traders: pick up the inexpensive souvenirs. A welcome couple of hours from the opulence of Dubai Mall

Worst Service you can ever find- Saluja Cruise LLC. To be honest with you, the experience at the Cruise was not a good one. It is not the one you could recommend to anyone; it was just way below average, rather it should be said as one of the worst. • Food was just terrible, nothing could even be remembered- It typically looked that it was stale and did not had any taste. • The person who was allocating the seats was Idiot( no sense of how to be hospitable) and on the top of it, if you try to escalate, they start calling you and being rude with you over phone• There was nothing on the cruise: Tanura show or the DJ musicTypically if you are planning to take Dhow cruise, never book through Saluja LLC, they are cheat and crook.

See a bit of Old Dubai if you are not afraid of being lost !. My cab driver dropped me off on the wrong side of the river so I had a chance to wander Bastikaya at 8:00 a.m., well before it opened ... then I found my way to Dubai Creek, and while trying to figure out which Dhow would take my to the Gold Souk across the creek, I happened upon the Silk Souk - fascinating ! Took the Dhow /ferry (1 dirham - about $ 0.30 US) - great fun, then wandered to the Spice Souk (small but really worth seeing) then made my way to Heritage House and the old school next to it. Street maps are not helpful, there are a few signs pointing in the general direction but mostly you just have to find your way, and ask for directions from passersby. By 10:00 a.m. it was so hot I had to leave - but it was a really nice little excursion in to the old way of life.

A view of old Dubai. It is very nice to sit by the creek and watch the dhows pass by. A view of old Dubai I could pass endless time watching while sipping one the outstanding fresh fruit juices at this place I do not remember the name of... but it has a great terrace on the creek and you can access it form the Bur Dubai souk. It is very popular.

Enjoyable. This gives you a look at how business is conducted on a day-to-day basis. It also gives an insight into how trade would have been conducted years ago. A lot to see on either side of the Creek and the boats that ply, from modern to old, offer good options to get around.
Nice experience. It gives you an idea of the old days, there are still some nice acient houses along the river, and the boats are 'old style'

Gold Souk is the best place for gold shoppers. They have so many shops all over the place. And one day cant cover them all. And has good quality items. Price reasonable too. Good thing is they even buy used gold jewelry and if our item is less than that they pay in cash. Kanz jewellery ( the owners of world's biggest ring) is a good shop there and good service too.

Excellent Place to enjoy evening and Dhow. The place is so cool and worth spending time at. We did not take dhow cruise here. The rates were varying from 125- 250 AED, sometime negotiable but not much. WE took Dhow at Dubai Marina, amidst high rise towers, but far away from Creek. This dhow is costlier 200 AED, but perhaps due to working day and last minute phone call got us at 130 AED. You can see the beauty of each and every tower here with close distance which may not be there at creek.
Creek. Overall a nice , interesting ,memorable and enjoyable visit here .Recommended to all. We would return for another visit.

A great Dubai experience. For a real Dubai experience, pop on a dhow on the museum side of the river and sail across the creek. You get a great view of the city and it's fun being on the water. Jump off at the first stop (on the other side of the river) to take in the spice, gold, and fabric souks.

Ethnic. For the old cultural dubai experience it is a must! leave you LV bags, Chanel dresses at home and come comfortable yet respectfully dressed if you dont want to be undressed with their eyes!!!! crossing the creek on a wooden old school boat for 50 fils to the old trading side of dubai is an experience on its own, the boats are old and not clean but its all part of the fun! once on the other side there is the spice and gold market which is exotic and you can find some serious good jewelry for all shapes and sizes of people! You get to see the old dows that still trade and transport little nik naks all across the ocean to trade once in Dubai... they love onboard the boat so you can get a real feel of what it was like back in the day! A must do, but be open minded!!

Fun day, market experience. We took the small passenger boat across the creek to the suk and had a nice day. The spice and gold suk where interesting and the flower Suk is older and smaller but also nice to see. The creek it’s self is an industrial type area but some of the boats are interesting. There are also party barges and restaurants, we did not do that.

Creek. We visited the Creek as part of a big red bus tour. We took a dow along the creek. Very formative but away from the Dow you could see that the locals were clearly workers with little in the way of personal possessions. The impression that you get is that this is the way old Dubai used to be before the high rise properties came.
A Ride on the Creek.... We took a short ride to the other side of the creek and the other side of Dubai. It was a mellow and relaxing ride.
Dubai Creek. More of a narrow river than a creek. Fun to cross on a small dhow (small boat carrying about 20 passebgers.
Dow boat tour. Went to the creek with family and friends. We went on a tour of the creek on a dow boat, which was an experience and loads of fun.very cheap and a good way to see the Dubai skyline.

Nice views. Sailing on a boat on this lake gives you a very nice view of the city ;Deira, Bur Dubai etc
You can chatter a boat or have lunch or dinner on one of the floating restaurants.
The night views are the best!
Cool boat ride. For only 1 dirham you can have a nice short boat ride to get from one side to the other. Valuable experience! Also easy way to get to Spice and Gold souk.

Relaxed affair !. The cruise along the creek was good but lack of commentary made it boring !
The boat taxis are an interesting way to cross from the Deira to Bur dubai area !

Cross the creek to the souks... It costs just 1 AED (about £0.20p) to cross the creek in a water taxi. This must be the cheapest & best value of anything in Dubai. The souks, spice and gold, are intercut with kitchen-ware street, perfume avenue, nice dress road, and everywhere the offer of fake watches, sunglasses & anything branded. OK for an hour or so.
Fun boat trip. Take a water taxi across the creek it's so cheap and great fun to sit in the middle on a bench watching all the other boats go by. Just turn up they run all day and evening.

clean and clear. So beautiful it is that we can easily pass our time by just sitting over there and seeing the abra's pass by. The water is sparklingly clean. Even more beautiful at night when the lights are on. The Dhow Cruise boats all lined up one after the another fully lighted looks beautiful. Feast to the eyes
Lovely. Creek park offers great views of the Creek and the opportunity to walk along the creek or take a boat trip.

Enjoyable place to spend an evening. Its so much lively with the dhows and the boats floating on the beautiful sea front. A ride on the local boat ABRA is a fun trip to go across or a dinner cruise on one of the many boats which offers music and sumptuous dinner on board. I loved walking along the entire stretch which ended to a souk which sells local stuff and the many open restaurants which offers variety of delicious meals. Do visit particularly in winter months..

A must do in dubai.. Hire a boat. A must do in dubai is travelling down the dubai creek. You can hire a long wooden boat opposite the Spice souk in deira. You pay around AED 100 for 1 hr & you have the boat all to your self.A wonderful experience..

Love the markets. Love the markets, with good shopping and not too many touts, could be dangerous for the wallet in the Gold souq with cash to spend. Canal crossing fun in the boats, recommend a guided tour first then come back to explore at your leisure.
Old Dubai. Busy waterway with lots to look at. Try an Abra,a small boat you sit on a bench with lots of other people, costs 20p. Also An Arab Dhow dinner cruise, interesting evening.
Fun. Cheap way to cross the dubai creek, only 1 dirham, less than 0.30 american dollars. Beautiful view. I went in the evening, visited the spice market on the other side.I recommend it.

A nice outing. Dubai creek is a river which separates the old and the new dubai. There is a lot of ferry which takes us for a couple of hour rides. They offer a good buffet veg & non veg meal and some entertainment shows. Overall a good outing in the evening-night.
Sun Burnt. Got a little sun burnt on the creek if your not carfull, lovely way to see part or Dubai, worth the trip as part of the Big Bus Tour.

Lovely 'old Dubai' at Dubai Creek. This is well worth a visit - the charm of the dhows going up and down the river, the chance to visit the spice souk and gold souk. People charming and friendly and a real antidote to the glitz and glamour of the beach resorts. Dress respectfully, tip appropriately and it will be a rewarding experience.
Nice relaxing getaway. The sheer innovation with which the Emiratis have managed to convert their ancient waterway to a great potential tourist spot, clean hygienic and relaxing is worth lauding.

Great place for independent sightseeing. Criss cross the creek by taxis, very cheap....we did that, and then hired a taxi for the family, £20 for an hour, which we considered very good value, right up and down the creek, very interesting, Gold souk and spice souk very good, Dubai Old Souk- not much unless you want textiles.

Haggle and enjoy. Visiting the Creek and the Souks within is a brilliant way to spend a few hours, be prepared to be approached by sellers almost immediately, but a polite smile and walk on if you are just browsing. if you are seeking leather goods, don't be surprised if you are led away up stairs or a lift into a secret almost seedy looking building, this is normal and you will be treated to some pretty good designer knock offs, and bargain as though your life depends on it, they don't expect you to pay anywhere near the asking price and if all else fails, walk away, if they follow, you'll get a bargain, if not, go on to the next seller. Enjoy the spice souk, its not very big, but its colourful and the aromas and scents are gorgeous...
Good place to spend evening. It is a best place to spet with your family and kids. In one side ofthe creek park you can do gills. Lot of big trees gives fresh air.

Back in time. This was our favourite part of Dubai we did tour as part of big bus tour ,it was good to see all the amazing buildings from a slow pace on the Creek .the cargo and river cruise boats are ancient little river taxis with no side definitely no health and safety here
Great food. A busy place on Friday night for delicious lebanese food and shisha as you watch the cruises go up and down the creek.

A bit of old world charm, in a modern city setting.... Lots of merchant boats, and other water crafts plying the waters of Dubai Creek. It's more than just a creek, kinda looks like a harbour. Lots to see, and all kinds of markets along the way.
Soothing Ride. We had a soothing ride on Captain Jack cruise on our visit to Dubai in March 2013. A must for your Dubai itinerary.

Night trip on a floating restaurant. A good trip with good food but being night it was difficult to see the sights. Make sure you have transport arranged for your return to hotel as you may not find a taxi readily.

Very cozy place to take a boat. There are lots of boarts, birds there (you can bring or buy there white breat & feed them). You can take water bus which is a very cheap & convenient way to travel there.

good heritage in modern Dubai. this is an excellent place to see the other side of Dubai away from the gleaming skyscrapers. It shows old original housing, souks and various boats trading with India. Really interesting
Dubai Creek. We took a dhow cruise in the evening. It was nice, but I'd recommend taking one in the daytime or at sunset.

on board a dhow on the Dubai creek. A taste of the past when you sail along the Dubai creek and admire the old buildings reflecting on the waters of this (artificial!?) canal . The boat is oldish and strikes a contrast with the huge luxurious cruisers that you can see in the bay.

interesting. The Creek is the center of local and original life in Dubai.
The old Dubai has been built around it.
Around the Creek you can visit the souks, Deira and Bastakya.
You can also have a ride on the Abra (little traditional boat).
Great area. Wonderful area--fun to watch the dhows go up and down and really fun to people watch--also near the spice and gold souk.

Great way to drift around. Sailing on a dhow was a unique experience and was a great way to see the buildings towering over the creek. The price of this leisurely 1-hour ride was included in our Big Bus Tour ticket.
Dubai Creek. If you have time you should be visit Dubai Creek take a ride along of the water taxi. It is cheap, and a good way to cross from one side to the other.

Beautiful in the evening. We stayed in the Sheraton Dubai Creek with creek views. Absolutely beautiful in the evenings with the brightly lit boats and floating restaurants. We did the dinner by evening on a floating restaurant and it was lovely. Food basic but edible.
Dubai Creek. A hive of activity. We went on a dinner cruise aboard a traditional Dhow boat. Very pleasant evening. The price included pick up and drop off to your hotel!
Take a leisurely boat ride. Hire one of the local boats for an hour trip up and down, as a group of five cost us less than ten aussie dollars each - tip the boatmen, they deserve it!

Do not miss this. Take time to get away from the beautiful hotels and visit the Creek. It's a great experience and a reality check that is worth seeing. The boats and fishermen are all visible, the souks and the buzz of non mall shopping is just a must in my opinion.

Very nice. I stopped by here just to see it and found it to be a very relaxing place. Very nice place to watch boats go by. You can also take a cruise on the Creek and eat at a few nice places along the way.

Real Dubai. Our second visit to the creek for a spot of shopping at the Gold and Spice Souk on the far side and material and electronics on the other. The Abras are fantastic - for just one dirham (20p) you can cross the creek on these passenger abras - great fun.

Take the Abra for an authentic experience. Dubai creek is as close to seeing "old dubai" as it's possible to. Flanked by the gold and spice souks at Deera it's a nice change from the glamour of central Dubai and Jumeriah. Crossing the Creek on an old Abra costs like 20p and is really good fun. It's a busy little waterway and the museums and heritage village make for a really fun day out.

Plenty to see. When here on several days. Loved the souqs. (Textiles,spice, etc)the gold souq is well worth a visit. Used the water taxi but as a treat we hired one of the abras (flat bottomed, open sided boats) just for the two of us for an hour. Well worth it, great photos. Enjoyed the walk around the Dubai museum and the Heritage and Diving village.

Lots to see. We visited the Heritage Centre, Sheiks palace, souk and museum. You can walk along the creek to see all of these sights, you need to have a map and good guide book. There is lots to see and do.
Beautiful. A beautiful area with awesome views. Plenty of little shops to keep you amused. A lot of places close from 2-4:30pm, so avoid at these times as you will have very little to do.

Most atmospheric part of Dubai. A good place to stay and/or visit if you are looking for something to do other than shopping or the beach. Visit the Dubai Museum, take an abra across to the gold and spice souks or a boat along the Creek, see the wind towers and the heritage areas, enjoy a food and drink sitting outside in the Creek breeze.

Abra boat, cheap and the 'local' way. Take the Abra Boat across the creek to the textile souq/market. Haggle like a local for a pashmina and have some local grub before setting off home. Try and time it for sunset, its only a 5 min journey but incredibly entertaining.

Cruise included. We bought a ticket for the Ho-Ho bus and an hour-long Dhow cruise on Dubai creek was included. The boat is basic and refreshments are for sale. The commentary is in English and is very informative. One nit-pick ... if you go later in the afternoon, there is no bus to meet the cruise and we think we were ripped off with the taxi fare.

Lovely place to walk. There is a lovely promenade to walk along with beautifully laid out gardens. You can also just sit and watch the dhows and water taxis sailing up and down the River. Some of the dhows are floating restaurants although we didn't get a chance to try them
On the water. A must do trip across the Creek on an Abra gives great views of the city and a great feel to Dubai life

Catch an Abra across the creek. Easy and cheap activity. A great experience for the kids. Boat was quick and it was clean. Took it from near the fabric souk and arrived near the spice souk. A really easy way to get from one side of the river to the other and cost AED1 each. Probably the cheapest thing to do in Dubai!
Disappointing. We went on a tour of the creek by boat but felt disappointed by it as it is rather dirty, not much to see or do. Wouldn't bother revisiting.

The buzzing lifeline of Dubai. Dubai Creek buzzes with activity with the constant coming and goings of laden Dhows, the Abras crossing from Deira to Bur Dubai and during one of our walks at midnight there were floating restaurants docked as far as the eye could see along the Bur Dubai waterfront. Even at this time of night there was a lot of energy along the Creek. A definite must see when in Dubai.
Probably the most authentic part of Dubai!. Have a wander around this area! Walk in the direction of the Souk and watch the labourers stack and handle cargo onto the Dhows.
Most Cultural you will find. Visit the Dubai Creek to see some of the older culture of the city. The Abra boat trip is an experience of Old Dubai and worth visiting the Souks on the other side.

A beautiful sightseeing while on water. I like the different tourist and historical spots that we get to passed by as we sailed on water via big water boat, intended for large group of people and visitors. Dubai is so full of life even while on water.

Nice Sunset Walk. The creek itself is situated between Bur Dubai and Diera. There is a nice "boardwalk" on the Bur Dubai side, lined with dinner cruise boats. It's a nice place to walk at sunset, but the drawback is that there are no cafe's or even food/drink stands along the creek. It woud have been nice to have an ice cream or coffee while strolling along the creek. Maybe this will come with time?

water trip. get on a boat, very cheap for almost two hours past the creek skyline, past the daus and the palce, hidden behind walls, you might find yourself unexspectedly in a sandstorm, not very nice when wearing lenses

Beautiful view. The Creek shall also refer as the river. Basically this is a river side journey. The riverside along the Creek includes Dhow Station near Bastakiya area, Bur Dubai, Shindagha area. It is traditional souq and coffee houses along the riverside.You may also want to explorer the Creek on the Deira side. However, I was unable to accomplish the challenges on both sides of the Creek.It is a romantic and joyful getaway from the busy life. I did not take dhow cruise dinner but the river view and Abra ride really make me feel refresh. I like the sea birds flying following the boats.

Favourite part of Dubai. I love the commerical luxury provided by the hotels and restaurants in Dubai, however, the Creek was my favourite part. Sitting on a dhou (wooden boat) is so calming and picturesque.

Excellent view !. Great to watch the dhows sail by especially the floating restaurants at night time with their well-lit display lights. Also, a nice experience to cross the creek on a Dhow. Only costs a dirham each way.

NIGHTMARE. we are extremely disappointed by saluja staff services.we had a guest from america and they got a very bad impression of this type of dhow cruise.if they reduce the price please don’t reduce the quality of serivice , ythey can reduce the quantity of services better.it was a nightmarevery poor seating arrangementsfood was not tasty food was coldservice was very bad.so many reasons not to recommend to any body.

Amidst the busy boulevards of Dubai. We were staying in Deira for New Year's Eve and decided the day after to take a look and perhaps try a water taxi on the creek. Water is always a good way to energize oneself so after crossing a couple busy boulevards, we found ourselves at the correct marina docks to catch a water taxi. They were fairly abundant and the fellows at the ticket booth and cue were fairly helpful. I believe we waited about 15-20 minutes as it was mid day. Once aboard on this ferry filled with a wonderfully internationally mixed crowd, were able to observe other water craft and many of the beautiful examples of architecture in this area of Dubai. Our destination was The Old Souk. The cost of the water taxi was quite affordable and I was glad to spend some time on the water. By the way, the term creek is used lightly I think canal or ever river would be more appropriate!

A nice dhow ride. In the heat and hustle of Dubai, Creek is like going back in time. It sort of splits the city in old and new parts of town. So if you take an abra ride(1drh for a ride), or a dhow cruise, you will get to see both:the little open markets(souks)on one side, and futuristic Dubai skyline on the other. Dhow rides often come included in the price of the city tour, and it is an excellent opportunity to see the Creek, because you don't get a chance to see it from the Metro.If you want a more romantic ride, you can opt for a dinner dhow cruise, and you will see the Creek in all its nightly glory.I do recommend taking a ride on the Creek, even if its just to escape the heat of the city!

Delightful. We traveled down the creek on a dhow boat, and it was worthwhile, and enabled you to see the marina, as well as go into the Arabic sea (on the edge following the beach). On another night we went on the creek in a donut boat and grilled our dinner, spectacular.

Interesting. If you will take the BIG BUS TOUR you will have a free cruise and you can see the old town, the old markets and the old harbor. This is interesting but is not the best place from Dubai. This should be on the list with places to be visited but in the second part of the list.

Dinner Cruise on the creek. Our small group of 7, decided to take a dinner cruise on one of the nights we were in Dubai. There are many companies that offer this service of a 'dinner cruise' around the dubai creek or the dubai marina. We were picked up from our residence and taken on the cruise where we were assigned a table by the window. Because we had young children we couldn't sit at the top/balcony area, which is open. The wooden boat travels down the creek and back as you are having your meal, after which they have some entertainment. All soft drinks and meal are included in the cost of the cruise. It's a nice way to see dubai by night. It took about 4hours.

Take 1 Hour private tour around the Creek. we were invited by my girlfriend (who lives in Dubai) for a Creek Tour.It was a private tour for 1 hour.We were early @approx. 10 AM. So it was not very busy @the pier.She nego. the price, so I did not know how much it was cost!!Anyway, I was nice to take the boat along the creek...to see lotsof interesting building along both sides. Of course I got the best Tour-Guide too.Actully with the private boat tour, you can ask them to stop @Spices Market and Gold Market also. But as I already see them on my previous visit to dubai. So I chosen just the boat drive upto Dubai Golf Club...Try to avoid a Rush-Hours @the Creek. Because it is really busy. You cannot enjoy the drive during Rush-Hours....
Creek. It is very nice to float around on the boats in the creek and watch all the spectacular views...shops,skys krapers etc

Busy waterway. We visited the creek through the hop on hop off package, we were given a boat trip and taxi ride around the creek. The boat trip travels down the creek and back up. It is good to see but it has nothing on Shanghai,Hongkong or Sidney. The government pays to keep the old barges/boats operating so it is very busy around the old docks and interesting to see old wooden boats loaded with TV's washing machines etc to be taken to India and other far off places. There is still a lot of building going on but still worth a visit.

Amazing. Made use of free cruise down the creek with our big bus ticket. Lovely to see all the wooden dhows getting loaded with goods before they set sail against the backdrop of all the modern buildings of Dubai

Dubai... then and now. Its nice to see the old means of water transpo in dubai... Facilities were poor thoug and the "abra" drivers aren't as friendly and accommodating as they should... overall, its an experience...

My favorite place in Dubai!!!!!!. I went to Dubai Creek my last day in Dubai. SO much better then any mall there!!! As much history as you will get from Dubai here.
What fantastic deals you can get here. I came home with tons of spices and OUD. You can haggle prices as well! Make sure you head down while you are there!

Crazy time. This is a crazy place. I guess this is just a crossing point for the locals, but to us visitors it's just fun. We paid the small cost and crossed. The atmosphere and noise is something to experience, We thought about a trip and wondered if it would be easy to do our selves, well when you get there things are so easy. Forget the trips, just travel back and forth. We did about 4 times, each having its own buzz. We walked down to the next staion and crossed back to the start. I guess the locals think us mad and a pain, I wouls say at rush hiur, but I think it's always busy. Jump on and enjoy the trip.

A nice evening stroll. Was a lovely afternoon in the shopping centre and then a nice stroll along the creek. The children loved the camel ride along the creek. Could be a nice romantic place too. People friendly...

Worth a visit, a bit of old Dubai remains. Gives you an idea of what Dubai used to be like, more character and a refreshing break from the modern buildings and bling! Although not as clean as the newer Dubai, there is character and more realism to the area. Great place to watch the boat activity and a must to take one of the many small boat taxis across the creek to visit the Souks on the other side, The watertaxi cost 1 Dhs so a bargin! You can also hire one of the boats for a 1 hour trip up the creek, normal charge is about 100Dhs for the hour but you have the boat to yourself (you can try negotiating the price but probably will not get them down below 70 Dhs.

Dubai Creek - a mix of old and new. You should definitely take the time to walk along the Dubai Creek. You'll see everything from old wooden cargo ships being loaded with all types of goods (from cars to produce) to dinner cruise ships to million dollar boats. You'll see more activity on the side with the Sheraton/Emirates NDB. You definitely need to ride the abra (water taxi) from one side of the creek to the other.
Poor facilities.. Highlight the 'abra' trip. The soukhs very disappointing and a rip off. Then if you have been to Marrakesh and Istanbul no contest really.

Care for a fancy dinner in a cruise!. i am not sure how to book these fancy dinner cruises, but this is something you must try in Dubai. it will take about 2 hours and will turn before it hits the open water, it is truly a great experience through the old Dubai. Its fun and romantic as well, if you manage to get a lovely singer in your cruises like we did.

beauty. yes its a man made creek.. but when you visit there you will find the beauty of it ... from there you will find so many dhow cruises... you can enjoy beautiful dinner on it... also some entertainment programs are there.....

Good impression of ancient Dubai. Around the Creek there are many places to visti sucg as gold souk and verious other old street. Several restaurants are in the area. Advise to make a dinner cruise in the evening on one of the dohws. Moonlicht Sonata dohw i can recommned.

Better than all the usual holiday attractions in Dubai. Just stroll along the Creek and watch what's being unloaded from ports around the world. Both the produce and handlers are as diverse as you could imagine. Most of Dubai side is being constantly modernized, but take an abra across the creek and explore the alleys of Deira and you will find buildings (and a good museum) that have lasted a century. Absolutely fascinating.

Abra. We took a water taxi (Abra) across to the Spice souk (market) A real taste of tradition. Be prepared to be harangued when you enter the markets but also be prepared to haggle for goods. I easily negotiated 50% (for my daughters handbag)
Real. Real life in Dubai far from the malls... Go there if you want to have another impression of the city. And do not miss the crossing of the creek for 1AED on one of the abras.

VIP DINNER. This trip is best at night when the whole creek is lit up with all the dhows decorated with stunning lights. We took a 2 hr cruise with buffet dinner, and then was treated to a magic show. Very relaxing and entertaining. Suggest book on your own for AED 99

My favourite place in Dubai. I love the creek area,watching life on the creek is wonderful love the abra rides and the water taxis,walking along the creek is lovely especially at night when its all lit up,the little cafes just to sit and people watch are great & the fresh fruit juices are delicious

My Abra ride at Dubai Creek. An abra is a small wooden boat that transports passengers over the Creek between Deira and Bur Dubai. The trip takes about ten minutes and is well worth taking - it almost feels like a little getaway from the city while cruising over the water. Crossing the creek on an abra provides a spectacular view of the Dubai skyline, and birds will accompany the boats all the way across. As you come into the Bur Dubai side, you can see the ruler's court standing out proud (the huge white structure - beautiful and hard to miss). The Creek is the reason Dubai exists - it's where the first settlement was built and was the driving force behind the early pearl trade with the outside world. Go onto Deira side, from where the traditional wooden dhows still trade with the sub-continent, Iran, east Africa, and you'll see all kinds of goods being loaded - from canned milk powder to trucks!Then walk into the old spice and gold souks and on around Naif Road, a fascinating old shopping area. Get the abra ferry across to Bur Dubai and visit Shindagah, site of the original settlement, which is being renovated and rebuilt. You'll find museums, Heritage Village, Sheikh Saeed's House and several great open-air restaurants. Certainly an amazing adventure!
Great fun going from one side to the other by boat. The old DUbai around the Creek full of old buildings and Souks. Beware you can get Souked out!! but fun.
great place. Loved watching the boats been loaded and unloaded and the water taxi was cheap and ran often up and down.

A must visit. A must visit not to be missed, Excellent views from both sides of Dubai Creek, it costs you only 100 Dirhams on private boat for one hour journey along the creek, but the views on both sides are very photogenic, if u r interested in photographs, strongly recommended.

Half day tour of the creek. When planning your visit, remember that the souks close between 1 and 4pm.My favourite itinerary is to take a taxi to Rulers Court and walk through Bastakiya on your way to the textile souk. If interested take a small diversion and visit Dubai Museum, which is particularly suitable for children. Stroll through the textile souk and continue past the abra station and along the creek until you reach the Heritage village. Take a look around the displays, watch an Emirati show, or just relax at a table by the creek and have a meal or cold drink. Continue past the Heritage village until you see a pedestrian tunnel which will take you under the creek. Once on the other side, head towards the gold souk, and be amazed by the amount of jewellery on display. Then its on to the spice souk. On the way you should pass the Old School and a merchants house. If you have time, step inside and see what life was like in the 1900's in Dubai. Stock up in the spice souk then head to the water and take an abra for 1dhs back across the creek where you will finish your tour back in the textile souk. Allow at least 4-6 hours, for a shorter tour omit the Heritage village and take abra journey to and from the souks.

Enjoying the Creek Nightlife. This is a lovely district for dinner in the evening, the Bastakiya, the old houses with their wind towers (air conditioning from ancient times), enjoy a refreshing lemon mint drink, a sort of non alcoholic mojito, fresh caught fish in the restaurant, cool breezes, delightful!

Nice for a stroll at night. Plenty of people about lots of little food places and felt very safe even at night. Well lit and good signage to keep you advised of where to get the metro and taxis. Crossing on one of the boats is nice and cheap - and an experience.
Take the water taxis. At AED 1, these are the bargain of Dubai, much like the Star Ferry in Hong Kong. Parking can be challenging, but well worth it. This was one of the nice surprises of the trip.

We had our dinner cruise in Dubai Creek. I like the whole set-up of the creek where you see images of international countries on walls. Clean and there are so much to do and buy for cheap. Restaurants are all over the surrounding creek. Dubai Creek is like any other state fares in the US but Dubai has more perks, activities, organization, tourists and outstanding international food.
Trade on the creek. Most interesting to see all the different cargo being loaded onto these small boats - a hive of activity. Good view over river to modern Dubai.

Dhow Cruise on Dubai Creek was superb. The 3 hours of slow movng dhow cruise with lovely food (we were aazed by the rane of vegetrian food they could serve), music and cool beeze was a very nic experience we had.
Nice place, especially at night!. I've been on boat cruise at night. The creek is very beautiful, because boats are differently illuminated.Creek Cruise was with very delicious dinner :)
A good way to see Dubai. The creek was very interesting with all the traders on the boats. The trip on the boat was very good as you saw the other side of Dubai, thoroughly recommend.
Pleasant afternoon cruise. A lovely way to view some of Dubai s iconic landmarks and buildings along the creek. There is also no charge if taken in conjunction with The Big Bus trip.
Lovely Evening Strool. For old fashion Dhows and sparkling water views - then walking up the promade of Dubai Creek is stunning. Beware of hassly Dhow owners wanting your trade!

Find a cafe to watch life on the creek go by.. A hub of life and activity - catch the water taxi across to the gold souk or just watch life go by on the creek with a myriad of boats travelling up and down.

Abra ride. What a great bustling place, almost like stepping back in time, with the hustle and bustle. 120AED for the hire of an Abra for an hour gets you up and close to the large cargo boats, creaking with the weight of it's cargo. Will definitely go again and take time to visit the souks there. Remember they close on a Friday morning!

Saluja cruise- what a mess!. My friends and I reserved for a table of 5 for the one hour sunset cruise...they should start at 5pm,unfortunately they started at 6pm. When we are seated in the table,they offered us welcome drink,which is a half glass of lemon juice in a styropor cup!, and then the boat started to move along the dubai creek, and then they served us one bottle of mineral water, one glass of softdrinks in a styropor cup and they gave us styropor plate and put a one very small round pizza and one piece of spring vegetable roll..and that's all! It is very disappointing because in the offer it was written that all the food is unlimited!,the voucher cost 39 aed and we bought it from cobone.com and the regular price is 100aed , and the other people bought the offer at 100aed a waste of money!.and take note that the cruise ended early,about 35minutes only! So pls guys, dont ever attempt to book for this kind of cruise, because after all you will be disappointed and annoyed!
Heart warming. A walk down Dubai Creek is a heart warming experience. The views are great and the vibrancy of the city can be quietly experienced from the creek

Getting touristy?. Well, the creek has its charm, the busy abra's, resting dhows and the hundreds of sea gulls...it is a pleasant diversion to what modern Dubai is. One should try the abra ride, you can skip the dhow cruise.It isnt one of the charming waterways of the world, , though at night , it looks more ravishing. The creek isnt a venice or the backwaters of kerala or the waterways of hongkong...The dhow cruise dinner on the creek is an overkill and it isnt romantic nor pleasant and you can get bored of the creek, if you are just going back and forth.

Heritage Village, Spice Souq...Dubai Creek. If you are in Dubai- then you can't escape this... you have to cross it anyways... by car, metro, abra, boat, cruise..whatever be the transportation mode.. unlike JBR, Palm etc-- the water here is dark, muddy..but historic..

Symbolic....creek dividing the new and the old. The creek is in between Bur Dubai and Deira and one has to take the local ferries to cross over to the other side which are rather frequent. One also has the option of taking more luxurious and fancy options for a boat ride in the night which is rather nice and quiet. One can take walks along and it's very cool and beautiful in the evenings or one can just cross over to deira and get a flavour of the old world charm. That's also the way to the old Gold souk.There are nice small parks around where one can often find guys playing soccer and can join in.
Less artificial that the rest of Dubai. Abra rides across the creek are not to be missed (and this is the easiest way to get to the spice souk and gold souk beyond)

Interesing experience. It was just few minutes, but you could have a quick glance of the interesting buildings along side of the creek. And it was a cheap and quick way to travel between the spice market and the Dubai Museum.
lost its charme. We visited it 12 years ago and were now disappointed: the whole shore is build and the creek is touristically exploited. It has lost its charm and originality
Very pleasant walk along picturesque surroundings. Very pleasant walk to take along, even better take a boat and enjoy nice views.. A must if you'd like to get a glimpse at the 'Old Dubai'..
Taste of Old Dubai. Get a feel of the old Dubai by exploring the heritage village at the Creek. Great for photo taking! You can take the dhow cruise or the abra. Be sure to check the prices.

Top tips for visiting Dubai Creek. Tip 1: Look out for the 1 dirham ferry boat ride. It is somewhere along the station. The boat is a little bit rundown then the others but it is still worth going on the boat.Tip 2: Do not go on those fancy boats because they cost more and they use the same route anyway.Tip 3: If i am not wrong, there is a Deira boat station somewhere near the Spice Souk. So aske around or ask your taxi driver and he will be able to help you out.Tip 4: Wear some sunscreen because you will be under the sun for about 15 minutes. Tip 5: Prepare your camera well in advanced because when you go on the boat, you might be too busy to enjoy the view.If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

Relaxing boat ride along the creek. Very few things in Dubai have an actual address, so it took a while for our driver to actually find the correct spot to drop us off for this ride. Once we found the spot however, we had a lovely boat ride along the creek right around sunset time. We spent about an hour on the water and it was great. It's very congested traffic wise so it's not something you can really walk along. If you take a boat ride, you will have to pay for it.

A lovely boat trip on The Creek. We had a lovely trip on a dhow and saw Dubai from a different angle.It was great fun experiencing the hustle and bustle of life on the water.The buildings of Dubai look magnificent in their reflections on the water of The Creek.

the cleanest most hassle free souk in the world?. loved our trip across the creek and through the souk. Bought some gorgeous embriodered wall hangings. Arrived at the creek on the metro which like the city as a whole is spotless and efficient
worth doing. we liked walking through the mini bazar and then took an abra to the other side of the creek. From the gold souk on we walked to the media city centre, a very nice walk along the creek
Busy Waterway. Winding through the heart of "old" Dubai, this arm of the Arabian Gulf has pleasant promenades for walking and a variety of watercraft as well...sit, stroll, eat....
Back in Time. A visit to the creek is like stepping back in time. The buzz of all the boats and people makes it an interesting stop.

Walk the history of Dubai. A great place to walk, visit the museum, cross the river by boat with the locals and visit the Gold, Spice and material Souks. The pressure selling from the stall holders is a bit strong but if you smile and say no politely they leave you alone.

The river of the UAE. Well, I always thought that Dubai is totally a desert and cannot have a river. I was wrong! The Dubai Creek is like a river only.We went along the creek in a Dhow. A Dhow cruise arranged for us by "Lama tours", one of the best tour agents in Dubai (check out my review on them). And we had taken the evening Dhow cruise, so we saw the illuminated Dubai city along the creek, and it was an awesome spectacle. In the daytime, you will be able to appreciate major buildings better in the daylight.A brief description of the Creek Dhow Cruise:- The tour bus drops you off at the Creek.-You board the Dhow boat, where a special table will be waiting with your name on it-At around 8:30 pm, the cruise will start-The boat moves very slowly along the creek, with arabic and instrumental music playing all the while-Food will be kept -Veg, non veg, everything with drinks. You can have whatever you want to your heart's content.-Staff are VERY friendly on board.- At around 11 pm, the boat reaches back to where it started, and the tour agent bus drops you off at your hotel.

Must go on the Abra boats.. If you want to see some of old Dubai then take the Abra boat across the creek, you'll see how all goods ar brought in to Dubai on Dhows. Walk through the back streets of old Dubai and you'll come across markets and the gold & spice souks where it seems you have stepped back in time and you expect to see Sinbad standing on a Dhow. Go and do it.
Up the creek in old Dubai. A must see location in Dubai as this is where it all began from. Great at night as it teams with life and excitement.

Awesome spectacle. The Dubai Creek is an inlet off the Persian Gulf (usually referred to locally as the "Arabian Gulf" because the GGC members don't like to give the Iranians credit for anything). Wooden sailing vessels called dhows have called on the port of Dubai for centuries and to this day there are dhows big-and-small moored along the Dubai Creek wharves loading up for voyages to Iran, Pakistan, India andf elsewhere in the region.A walk along the dhow docks watching the huge old wooden vessels being loaded with everything from used cars to tires and modern electronic goods like refrigerators and air conditioners can be fascinating. The dhows themselves look like they'd be an accommodation horror show for mariners plying their way between regional ports but there appears to be no end of sailors to man these seagoing dhows.Be sure to jump onto an abra (water taxi) to get from one side of the Creek to another for only one Dirham. For 120 Dirhams (about US$35) , you can hire a dhow and "captain" for an hour of cruising up and down the Creek. The spectacle of commerical Dubai with its high-rise buildings alongside these creaky old boats being loaded to their gunnels is a real, and affordable, treat.

Important part of Dubai. Still a main artery of Dubai, it is a very busy place. Old souk, gold souk and spice souk are located on either side of the Creek. You can take a water taxi to get to the other side of the creek or, if you are feeling adventurous- take the Abra- small wooden boat with essentially no sides or railing. You have to jump off the boat which does not get tied down. You can take a Dhow cruise along the creek which are offered daily. The dhow cruise as well as the water taxi crossing is free if you purchase the tickets for the Big Bus.

Where's Sinbad? I need a load of treasures transported.. This is the original settlement of Dubai, traders have been sailing Dhows to here for a millenium. The dock area is interesting to look at, water taxis can be taken to the other side ofhe creek. The souk has old spice sellers and was very interesting with tthe ancient stalls and architecture. Definitely worth a stroll even in summer, it wasnt overbearing heat at 54c and low humidity, just need a hat.

Impressive view!!. After visiting gold souk and spice souk, we took a boat to Dubai Creek.When we got off the boat, there were so many seagulls flying around everywhere.It was an interesting scene. And we found an restaurant just locates in the best spot which we could enjoy the food, drinks while watching the beautiful sunset.

Leisurely ride. This is the one of the best ways to spend your mornings in Dubai. The tickets for the round trip journey for the water taxi is around 3 dirhams and takes about 1hour for the jorney. It fairly covers most of the places of Dubai and does it in a relaxed way.

The authentic Dubai : impressive.. Both sides of the creek are interesting. They are connected by small boats that take you to the other side for a small fee. This is the old Dubai and authentic Dubai. It was strange to see that there weren't many tourists here. If you stay in Dubai you need to see this. We went to see this part of town at sunset and it was perfect. We visited the stamp shop and did some interesting buys. We walked through the gold souk on the other side and were impressed.
Old town Dubai. Bustling, busy, and a glimpse of what this stunning city started from just a few decades ago. Try the water taxis if you need to get across.

Not to be missed when you visit Dubai. Great place to explore the old Dubai, Dubai Creek is between Deira and Bur Dubai. You can take a nice Dhow Cruise during the day or optional with Dinner at night. The local take a water taxi across the creek, only 1 Dirham. You should try this experience, interesting boat ride on the busy Dubai creek. In Deira site you can go to Gold Souk/ Spice Souk the Old Dubai. Recommended!!

hot hot hot. Wear a hat or have a parasol ladies. Also, I recommend covering up any bare skin if you can if you visit the old part or cross the creek on one of the little boats, as a mark of respect for the locals and for your own comfort. We were stared at a lot and I did feel very uncomfortable. A good lesson learnt.
Old Dubai still in tact. To think this was the hub of all commerce up until 41 years ago. It's amazing to think of what has been achieved in such as short space in time.
A glance of real Dubai. Dubai creek is a mut if you go to Dubai, it shoes the origin of Dubai and that todays Dubai is still more than fancy buildings and shopping malls.
Alex's Dubai tour. My partners son who lives in Dubai, took us to the creek, it was great.A trip across the creek cost about 16 pence each, a must do!
Once a view is must of Dubai Creek. It is the place from where Dubai started. Boats are there to go for Dhow cruise. The candle light dinner at Dhow cruise is good. It is sort of floating restaurant.

Hop over! It's only 1 DHM to good souveneir shops.. So this was a really fun ride. To avoid a growing amount of traffic in Dubai, they created this little short detour to cut over to the other side. It costs 1 DHM to sit on the taxi boat ride to the other side of not-so-glamorous Dubai outskirt where you can find souveneirs with shop owners you can haggle with, shoe makers and repairers that can be mean or nice (look for the one in between a clean alley- he's cool his business card has Alladin on it), and find yourself checking out a different side of UAE. The Creek is quite a stretch so if you like a walk, this is a good place,
Great for a stroll. A great place at night with it being all lit up and so much to see the boats are lovely and the stalls sold great stuff
Bustling area. Worth a walk along the docks side. All the hustle and bustle and seeing the cargo ships is a worthwhile experience.

Take an authentic view of Dubai. Most people have only been to the glitzy and glamour side of Dubai but that's just one part of the amazing Dubai Adventure. Take a stroll down Dubai Creek for a modern history view. Breathe in the hustle and bustle of this working class part of the City. Take an abra to cross to the other side, just like they used to several decades ago.
