It'll only cost you about 1dhs per person per station... much cheaper than the sanitized version elsewhere and you get the real experience. Walk through several souqs (Gold,Spice, and Textile) along the way. Stroll through heritage villages (Bastakiya and Shindagha). Eat at one of the creekside restaurants (I'd suggest the one beside the Textile Souq... the ones near the Heritage Village tend to have really bad service). There are several metro stations nearby.
Great ambience. Surprisingly clean and vibrant. Take an hour trip on dowh for £10 pp. Very good value. Interesting to see the boats being loaded with cargo for Europe and Asia.

boat tour for 2 AED. Hey, where else can you get an authentic boat tour of the sites for only 2 dirhams? Super cheap, take the abra across the creek and back and see the sites while sitting with the multiracial "real people" of dubai, which means mostly darker fellows from India & pakistan, with occasional Arab looking fellows. Got to do this one, if nothing else on your visit to Dubai.

Nice, traditional mixed with Modern styles. Nice to see the old traditional boats on the creek, contrasting with modern buildings on the opposite side of the creek. Ran out of time to do a dinner cruise, but there were many options to choose from.

Awesome you certainly need be there. Awesome you certainly need be there The Dubai creek belong to 1001 fairy tales ..it gives you a feeling of being in city in the old time. The souk is marvelous !!!! River crossing about 15p,and then a wander round the market. Just cross the river from to Deheira, where the gold suk is.the souk is amamzing dresses, spices, jewellery and "genuine fake rolex's".It worth however to spend 1 or 2 ours walking in the souk and quickly visit the reconstitution of the old houses.Food was wonderful, lots of traditional meze, but quite expensive, .

Great. The Dubai Creek runs right through the middle of Dubai and in the evening the dhows float up and down carrying tourists who dine on them. There is a taxi service whereby you can cross from one side of the city to the other. Don't go to Dubai without trying this. A vital part of Old Dubai.

Keeps you grounded. If you really want to know how & why Dubai is where it is today (obviously if it interests you) . I would recommend a walk by Dubai Creek side (Deira). I go there for my morning walk/run & everytime I am there I see how products are brought in to Dubai. You see a comfortably co existing contrasts of Modernity, tourism & trading (shipment loads of products). The Park landscaping is beautiful, there are squares where people practice yoga, Tai chi play, there are pretty dhow cruises that look pretty in the night, there are number of pathans (I would be careful of them if you are alone) who have been on ships for days together, you can see the pleasure on their faces to be off the ship for a while.. It wonderful to run/walk or sit across on the bench to people watch.

FLOATING - RESTAURANTS. I have already bought the voucher before reading the comments below and I was almost refunding my vouchers but since it was a long process, i have decided to proceed with my reservation. With all the bad reviews I have read below, I already had a bad impression about the trip, yet I was proven wrong. The experience was really good and we were on a very nice spot watching the fireworks in the creek. Buffet was on different variety, after all, we don't intend to dine out to have the same food we are having everyday, so it was a new taste for all of us which we have enjoyed the most. All was good that I am recommending them to my office in our next company event.. « hide

Feel ancient and modern Dubai!. Creek is the wonderful river connects the ancient and modern Dubai! You can see the old barges and trading over one side and the most modern amenities on the opposite side. Night journey in Dhow Cruise make you feel the dark beauty. Creek part is a very clean and beautiful green park here. We have enjoyed rope way journey and spent one whole day here.

One must Visit Dubai Creek. Whether it is summer or winter, Dubai sopping festival or Dubai summer festival, One must Visit Dubai Creek side. Once upon a time Dubai creek was main trading place & used to connect with many traders by sea route. Still today we can see some trading happenings.Dubai creek is mainly got some of the famous office or places like Ruler’s Court, British embassy, American embassy & mainly some traditional Textile merchants, Temples etc.One can have fantastic views & enjoy dining in cruse & watching the rich & cultured dove cruses , which have enhanced UAE heritage. Dubai Creek stretches from Jadaf to Al Bastakia. Bastakia is mainly named for heritage buildings which belonged to the rulers & well know persons. The traditional ABRA (Boat Service) is fantastic service, which transports thousands of people every day from Bur Dubai to Deira & visa versa, not to forget the Water bus & Wonder bus which travels across the creek. Any people can enjoy by seeing the fireworks during Dubai Shopping festival & kids as well elders can play verity of games, rides etc.Last but not least, where it is alone or with family, this place is wonderful for everyone.

Nice to see but not too long. The Dubai creek gives a feeling of what was the city in the old time. However, as most of the things in Dubai, everything is made up. It worth however to spend 1 or 2 ours walking in the souk and quickly visit the reconstitution of the old houses
the creek. this is the main spiritual arteria of Dubai. visit Abra dock, Ferry station and al Seef street and you will be satisfied!

Dubai creek and dinner on cruise. Dubai creek is really provides a magnificent view. When I reached in even, though it was too hot, I roamed around the place and walked along its bank. Crossed over to the other side with one Durham. Then I had a dinner in the cruise which moves around the creek, A very good experience.
Lovely Place. Lovely place to relax with fresh air from the creek.. Superb atmosphere in winter evenings as the white birds come in quantity.. Amazing..

Different... We were out on a dry night so chose a dry restaurant. Food was wonderful, lots of traditional meze, but quite expensive, and there was far too much that went to waste. Make sure you're hungry.

visting the gold suk. crossed the river from bur dubai to deheira,where the gold suk is.River crosssing about 15p,and then a wander round the market.I have to say the suk on the Dubai side is more interesting,unless your interested in jewellery and "genuine fake rolex's".worth a vist and apart fro the river crossing costs nothing

Nice place to unwind and to cross City to visiting both sides. A visit to Dubai means a visit to Dubai Creek too, a very Nice and relaxing place to stroll by waterside and to watch both sides of the City, specially the old one, the historical, with the fortress and the old narrow streets. Try to cross the river by boat like locals and visit the local souks, the species souk and the gold souk.

pleasant. Arabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was goodArabian dance was good

Really old and beautiful. We were craving culture, not money and towers, so made the long trip via metro to the old city. We crossed the creek in a traditional boat, great fun, and really cheap. We walked the souks, and ate at a really cute restaurant on the sea front. We got a bit lost, but had time so just enjoyed exploring. The walls o the city can still be seen, but no-one there seemed that interested in history , which is a shame.

Anyone can afford 1 AED. The amazing creek, originating from the brackish waters of the Persian Gulf, the creek def transformed Dubai into the commercial hub it is today. You can see how this creek divides Dubai into Bur Dubai and Deira. I def recommend you take a ride down the waters of the creek on a traditional boat named the abra from Bur to Deira. its fun to watch specially after sun set.
walk & boat. Nice place to walk around and see Dubai life. You have to try to cross creek using wooden-motored boat. It's cheap and not to be missed!

The key feature of Dubai. I love staying in hotels in and around the creek and taking the occasional boat trip from the yacht club out into the Persion Gulf. the creek brings a great natural feature into the heart of Dubai and is obviously the inspiration for so many of the new inland man made waterways in Dubai. There is nothing like hanging out at the villa drinking a whiskey and watching the Dubai skyline sitting on the far horizon of the creek at dusk.
Nice cruise. Very relaxing cruise, good food, and plenty of it. The entertainment was different and very funny, Thank you Mr Horse !
A must do. Take a taxi (boat) ride in the Creek and enjoy the views. Including the hustle and bustle of daily life. Reasonable cost and safe.

old dubai. If you are looking for the last bit of old Dubai this is it. Little boats criss cross the creek and its easy to just hop on and off for a paltry sum. The gold souk and spice souk well worth pottering around. Do haggel

Great shopping and bargains galore!. Whatever you do, do not pay full price!! They love to haggle and most items can be had for 50% of what they are asking for them.belly dancing outfits, shisha pipes, scarves and dresses. This is a fun place to talk and have fun with the local salesman. A very safe place, full of tourists and activity. Once it gets dark out, the place is glowing with neon lights, and even some gas lamps. Bring your camera and walking shoes.

Yes go see Dubai creek just for the view. Forget about Beach side gloss. Come and experience Dubai creek. For an authentic taste of Dubai before the skyscrapers took over take an Abra down the Creek river for a holiday highlight. Cheap too at only a few dirhams a ride.

Relaxation in Dubai. Excellent opportunity to discover the Dubai Creek is to rent a river taxi. The cost is around 100 Dirham for 1 hour boat trip. We hired a boat around lunch time. So sitting in the shades on the boat an taking pictures is a lot of fun and gives the tired feed a short break.
back in time. It is very nice and it is the place where you can see old and new Dubai and feel the magic of combining between them.

Very nice and cool. Very characteristic. We had a ride on a Dow and could admire the creek from the waters with its beauties. It sometimes looked like being thrown back in time when spices and textile merchants approached the harbour for their bargain. Very beautiful the constellations of Abras surfing in the late afternoon on the river full of ordinary people that looked at us tourists smiling and waving from the distance. A very nice piece of old Dubai.
A very nice place, clean water. Lovely Dhow boats. The creek has a great atmosphere. It has a lovely view of the lovely buildings around it. However the parking gets crowded at night

Layed back creek cruise. Definitely worth the trip down Dubai creek. However the double decker bus trip around Dubai, definitely NOT worth the 1 hour sitting in traffic as you drive by buildings that really don't show what they are like. You only get to see things as a passenger, unless you stop and get off at one of the shopping malls! Very much a disappointment as I have done Rome and new york on the double decker buses and had an amazing experience. Unfortunately Dubai's bus tour just not worth it.
If you have time for a boat cruise will be Okay. See the old side of dubai. Just get a boat tour along the creek and enjoy the breeze. but don't expect something special there.
Fun trip through Old Dubai. Walk the alleys exploring the spices and trinkets on sale, bargain someone down on the prices of gold. Take a ride on the water ferry, fun trip all round!

No, don't waste your time. Just don't do it-head to the Dubai Marina instead. My hubby kept complaining that this was boooring, that there was nothing spectacular (and it's true!). We rented this traditional wooden boat taxi and had a one-hour trip along the creek-with our driver not saying a word about what we were passing along our way. Probably a more "touristy" experience with lots of other people and a larger boat and a guide would be better (?)-but it was just not to our liking at all, unfortunately.

A cheap view of Old Dubai. Visit The Old Spice Souk (avoid Viagra sellers) and book an Abra (water taxi) for an hours trip up to Creek Golf Club and back to Rulers Court.Should be able to hassle for Dhs 50 but give the guy aDhs 100 ,it's worth it.
Dubai Creek. Lovely cultural area. Cross the Dubai Creek in a local water taxi and shop at the Spice & Gould Souks.

Different to what I imagined. The creek is and old area in a poorer part of Dubai where you can get hassled on the streets by vendors. A trip up the creek on a small boat is a must. It is interesting to see the contrast between this and the affluent Juremiah Beach.

pleasent envirenment. though i didnt take the cruise but went to the creek to enjoy the view and to sit n relax. it looked beautiful in the night and is very near to bur dubai. in winters it looked even more beautiful

Why not riding an "abra" in Dubai Creek?. Dubai Creek is something special. The old port and the "abra" boats connecting the ancient town to the modernity of new Dubai. We took the boat, like a taxi, going from one side to the other, ending up in the Gold Souk, following the beautiful birds fed everyday by emiratis. If you have the time, why not experiencing a boat ride in the Gulf? Enjoy!

Tranquil Waterway. Whether walking along the Dubai Creek at night or taking a dhow dinner cruise, the view of the banks of this waterway is unique. It is an ideal way to experience the ambience of the old city, with its creek side cafes, music & heritage museums. While there, a visit to Shindaqah will introduce visitors to real fishing family living in palm leaf huts. They welcome visitors into their home to see their lifestyle. There are various ethnic entertainment, craftsmen plying their trade, cuisine & souks. You may even be lucky enough to see a palm leaf hut being built. Take a short camel, horse or pony ride.

Nice if the weather is ok. You can walk around the creek, or if you are there at night get a trip on a dinner boat - which is fun and not so expansive - also at night has something like a Mardi Gras in a very small scale, but its worth the visit - mainly at night.

Water taxi's a must. if you go to the creek, have a go on a water taxi - its works out about 20 odd pence to go from one side to the other - this is the land that the loonie health and safety have not discovered yet - Its well worth the experience!
great day out. hire a boat for the 1 hour tour up and down the creek. lots of atmosphere and it gets pretty busy up by the old souk. the gold souk is also on the creek which is worth a vista

Must see. It's a must. See how the Dhows are being loaded by hand. Ultra modern hotels, offices and shops on one side of road and old tradiditional Dhow ships loading by hand, on other side of road. Situated next door to Souk and Gold Market, so obvious place to see whilst there.

Take an Abra. To get a feel of old Dubai, taking a ride in an abra is a great way to do it. We were on a half day sightseeing tour and took the abra to the gold souk area. So different to the modern skyscrapers everywhere.

Dubai Creek- an old street in Dubai,must visit!!!. It was really amazing n great feeling when u enter the boat,(they called it Abra) from gold souq to burj dubai,u can enjoy a very nice river view n building from there.if u ride on an Abra,u get a better understanding of the trade n commercial tradition of the people.All the building r very unique n classic.
one way to see dubai. we went on an arba, took about an hour. lovely and relaxing way to see the sights. reasonably priced.

Wooden dhow cruise. The dhow cruise was included in the Big Bus ticket. It was an interesting cruise where one could see many of the spectacular buildings, also the local taxi boats that take the local people across the creek and the many wooden dhows.

A must see. I went here with some friends who have lived in Dubai for 35 years on and off. I have been to Dubai around 8 times and never visited this until now. It is really beautiful to see the old Dubai and all the boats that come from all over the world. We got a traditional boat over to the other side for the equivalent of about 1p! We went to the gold souk and the spice souk which was a great experience. MAKE SURE TO HAGGLE THEM DOWN!
Great Views. We took an evening Dhow cruise. The buildings along Dubai Creek are very tall, and modern. The views of the buildings and lights were fantastic.

Classic Dubai. This is the cradle of the civilization in the emirate, and I consider it to be one of the classics in this city. It has nothing of the modern Dubai, but if you ride on an abra you get a feeling of blending in with the locals and a better understanding of the trade and commercial tradition of the people. In my vision, this is a must for any first time tourist.

Evening Walk. The Dubai creek bifurcats Dubai into Deira and Burr , the two area distinctly. A walk around the creek is very lively and enchanting. During the DSF, the fireworks and band are an added attraction.The pomenade is a nice place to have long walks on paved surfaces. Many kioska and souk dot the creek. Ferries are available from Burr Dubai to Deira Dubai .Non Ac and AC Abras (Boats) are available for ferry. Creek comes alive in the evenings but is a cool place to have a long walk in the mornings too.

An Exciting Adventure. Dubai Creek was just a short walk from our hotel and there was such a lot to see and do. We enjoyed the Arabian Dhow Cruise which took you along the creek where you could see all the sites and listen to a commentary about them. Enjoy the beautiful architecture of the variety of buildings along the creek, from Arabic style buildings, mosques, and the most modern buildings and skyscrapers. You could then take a walk along the creek on a very good pathway to enjoy the sites at your leisure. The silk souks are a treat for the eyes with all the colours of the rainbow displayed beautifully. Be prepared to be bombarded (in a nice way) by the stall sellers all wanting to be your special friend wanting to sell their wares, anything from silks, imitation rolex watches, bags, clothing, shoes, souvenirs etc. Experiencing a river taxi (abra) for 20 - 50 dirhams is a must and they take you across to the spice, perfume and gold souks which are also very interesting and the beautiful aromas will entice you to discover much more than you would imagine. There are well signposted (English), clean toilets along the way and plenty of shade which is essential.I can't say enough about Dubai Creek - just go there and you'll most certainly enjoy if you love a bit of adventure. I can't think of anything I disliked.

Don't go for the food. The 1-hr sunset dhow cruise by Saluja tours is nothing to write home about. The setting, a short run down the historic Dubai Creek, as the lights of the nearby towers and bridges come on, is quite scenic and relaxing. If you pay by using a cheap online voucher, the sights alone are worth the price of admission. However, don't count on much for food. The Saluza website advertises beverages, pizza and other snacks, but the best part is that there isn't much of it. Service is slow, the pizza is unrecognisable, and, bad as it is, you will still leave hungry.
great!. Definately take and abra accross the river. Its so cheap and its very relaxing and interesting. Its like a mini venitian adventure for 50p!

Probably the best park in Dubai. Equipped with Children city and Dolphinarium this is probably the best destination for kids. The park itself is huge and you need a day to walk through all the routes there. There is basically no food services - so bring your own - picnicking is allowed.
Pleasant. Dhow Cruse included in red bus tour was great. Safe/easy to get around. Wish I had more time than just 2 days.

The true arabian experience.... If You really want to experience the true arabic environment, You need to go for a stroll in the Creek, in the close by souks and, go for a cruise also.... It is a very lively experience for the senses... Very Nice views that give great pictures.We travelled in the winter time which is probably the best season for this atraction. In the summer should be too much hot... We did it at sun set and the light is amazing.We got the cruise ticket with our big bus Dubai hop and hof tour...
Relax. Its nice palce to relax. You can see different kind of boats. In night you can enjoy dinner on big boats made like ships. Its a nice place to be there with family or alone.
a piece of history. If you are short on time then personally i would miss this visit out although lovely boats etc can get rather busy at times.

Nice but few outdoor cafés/ restaurants. If you want a good view with your lunch or dinner go to the third floor in the Twin Tower-bldg. on Deira-side. It´s an Iranian restaurant with a good buffet (as the only option) - 60 dirhams - pick a table on the terrace ofcourse

Dinner Cruise. Two hour long cruise was relaxing. Food served on board was OK.
There were plenty of tourists who were enjoying the cruise in other boats.The atmosphere was great with a closer look at the skyscrapers.
Glamour of the past. Have a night in the traditional restaurant overlooking the Creek... even better, take one of the dinner cruises and enjoy the different skylines of Dubai.

Dubai Creek. If you can tear yourself away from the beach and want to experience the real Dubai, the Creek is a good place to start.
Friday nights come alive with a market and entertainment.

This is the Jewel of Dubai: Old Dubai. This is the Jewel of Dubai: Old Dubai. Where you will walk all around in the souks, in the port, take a water taxi boat, fell the spirit of emirate culture, smell the spices and incenses of the history of the city.
The greenery is stunning. We paid to enter the Creek Park on Dubai Creek. It is stunning to see such well tended grass in UAE. We enjoyed the area and its views.

Away from the skyscrapers, the other face of Dubai. The creek runs between Deira and Bur Dubai, and around here you will experience the older Dubai. Nor flashy neither immaculate but crowded and messy, not a real souq feeling but surely a bit of real trade scene, which will make you aware of the early days of Dubai, the fishermen and merchants village. The gold souq with its wood beamed sheltered alleys has heavily designed jewelry. The spice souq is a mix of actual spice shops and varied utensils and confectionery. Around you will find all sorts of other areas to buy textiles and chinese made stuff, or enjoy the looks of old Dubai at the heritage village. The ferry that shuttles you from one side of the creek to the other for only 1 dirham is a simple and cheap pleasure, unless you have a seagull fobia...
Dubai Creek experience. I really did not enjoy the Dubai Creek in the Traditional wodden boat. The view of the creek was very good but the boats were not that enjoyable

Great way to see Dubai!. Strolling along the creek (either or both sides) is a great way to see the "real" Dubai... at no cost. I think this is the only thing you can do in Dubai that doesn't cost a fortune. The boat traffic is fascinating and the people watching superb. Talk to the crews of the dhows; many are from Iran and transport all kinds of goods from Dubai to that country and others around the Gulf of Aden.

Very Sloooow. I visited the Dubai Creek on the boat tours and it seemed as though I could swim faster than the boat was going. At first, they didn't allow us on the second floor of the vessel so we were forced to stay inside where there was no ventilation and very bad body odor.The tour itself is somewhat informational, but I did not think the information was really worthwhile. I felt trapped for an hour or so!

Its OK. We stayed at the Sheraton which is at the creek. Also did a big bus tour of the creek, its OK. Didn't really find anything spectacular but the history surrounding it and how the former ruler Sheikh Al Maktoum saw its potential and dredged it to allow more people was interesting. The creek comes alive at night with beautifully lit dhows all over with locals and tourists having dinner on the dhow...
old dubai. lovely place to visit ,apart from the street traders ,who hassle you ,must try the abra ,the look round the gold souk n,get out of the comfort zone and its quite grubby
Needs upliftment. Wasnt so impressed since i have seen better sights. Needs attention to so many areas. Was not so refreshing and among the buildings there was nothing interesting to look for....
Beautiful!. Went on the hour long Tour Dubai, gorgeous views of the creek, a must for any visitors to Dubai, nice photo opportunities and get to learn some history about the creek!

Nice way to spend an hour or so. We enjoyed the boat ride, had a half-hour ride up and down the river. Was a fun, nice way to get our bearings on our first, jet-lagged day. Later saw where to get on for the abras, which are a very cheap 1dirham to cross to the other side. The museum, bastikya district etc in this vicinity, so you can make a good half day or so out of it.
dhow rides!!. when at dubai creek area...don't miss a dhow cruise at sunset....u will fall in love all over again when you sit in the beautifully lit up boats.... and glide thru the city...

Great walk to see so much. We walked around the whole area from the Cultural Centre; to the Dubai Museum; The old souls: an abra across the creek and seeing all the ships come into port then to the gold souk and back through the under creel tunnel. The only thing we had to pay for was the museum and the abra across the creek. It was a long walk which we did later in the afternoon, however it was a Saturday and it seemed like everyone else from Dubai was there as well. Don't so this in the summer months or middle of the day as it will just be too hot. I found it hot enough when we did it and the tunnel was very hot and stuffy. By the end of it the kids (6y.o. to 12 y.o.) were exhausted but good in a way as they crash on the bed when you get to your room.We didn't go to the restaurants around the area but some looked nice. The creek cruise is not worth the money. You have to haggle your price at the souks and never accept the first price they give you, a good tip offer only a third of the price they give you and if they don't come down to that then walk away; most of the time you will find them running after you agreeing to that price in the end. It was a sensory overload with the colours and smells down some of the little allyways.The kids favourite part was the museum and we could have spent longer there then what we did.
well worth visiting. Very interesting area. lots to see and experience the culture.Can see the local residents at work and shipping of products.
Great place for a cruise. Beautiful place to visit for a ride in a dhow or on a water taxi. Lots to see and close to Dubai's famous Souks.

Exciting. It was a pot pourri of everything with tiny stalls in the souks to the larger shops around. The atmosphere is busy and take time to sit and watch the world here. Also make sure you take an abra to cross the creek. By night you can use one of the Dinner Dhows to see the skyline and enjoy the warm evening air.

The Souk Creek.... The Souk Creek was the most interesting thing that you must not loose when you go to Dubai. It is an open old market with linen, carpets, spices etc. A place full of colours, smells and flavours.In this place yo can find many amazing things that has to do with a preparaion of food, protection of body or decorating a house and generally many souvenirs. Try to negotiate everything and not to be trapped by different prices and by the clever attitude of some merchants!It is a little bit hard to find if you take just one wrong way. You have to take the main road of Creek that pases front of the Bur Dubai the so-called river and then turn right. It is a place that combines the modern with the old dubai and is the region of all the shops and is full of locals so for the ladies they must be careful of their dressing and appearance and not to go alone there.
old Dubai. "A must visit" to experience old town Dubai, Take a ride on a Dhow boat across the creek and visit the different souks. A great way to enjoy the local culture.

Not an amazing experience. My wife and I decided to take a trip by boat (floating restaurant) at night at Dubai Creek and honestly the whole thing was boring.Food was at best, passable. There is almost nothing to see. However it is nice to experience Dubai creek by walking or on a bicycle as you get to see the old Dubai.

Awesome,awesome,awesome !!!. Dubai Creek...a must see on your next visit to Dubai.On a pleasant wintry morning or a hot summer night,its the ideal get away from the razzle dazzle of Dubai.Any time of the day its a calming experience.Take a dhow cruise with the mild sun beating down on your back in mid morning hours in the winter and you get the breath taking views of the reflection of the water on the glass buildings lining the creek on the Deira side.Or take a dhow dinner cruise in the evening and see all the buildings lit up ,providing a beautiful sight of Dubai by night while chomping on traditional Arabic food complete with Arabic entertainment of Tanura dance or even belly dancing on board if you are lucky!

I visited one of its restaurants.. Expensive bad good food, excellent rates for alcohol but very poor service. We were waiting at the entrance for some minutes before they noticed us, a waitress took the plate of my friend without to ask and ofcourse before she finnished eating.
Well worth a look. The Dubai Creek is the heart and soul of old Dubai and a look around here is well worth your time. Don't forget to catch an abra and ask a local for the best food!
Great staff and complete facilities. The staff guide you from arrival. The greens are smooth and the fairways are well maintained. the entire facility is welcoming and the course is challenging.

Interesting times. it is a very interesting place to visit and just sit down and watch the people come and go. Always busy and worth taking a trip on one of the dhows to see the city from the other side.
Dubai creek. thsi si really lovely to visit; you can relax ont he promenade and watch the abras go by....busy place.
Dhow Cruise. Loved the dinner with a lighted up view of Dubai. the grandness of the buildings around the creek shone in the night lights brilliantly.
The old & new side by side.. A visit is a must. The contrast of the fantastic architecture with the working dhows & abras is unique. It's surley the heartbeat of the city.

Night time dining. Been on two of these night time cruises both been very good. The food is a buffet , well presented with waiter service for your drinks.Depending on which boat you you, the entertainment can be vary from good to ordinary. You may have to sing yourself. but the evening is good value for money and I would say try it once.

Gentle introduction. Such a gentle and fantastic way to get a sence of orientation in Dubai. Almost as the Nile is to Cairo, so the Creek is to Dubai, and it is such a lovely experience to see the reflections of the city in the water. A dinner cruise or a breakfast cruise, your choice, either way it will be a good choice.

Take your camera. The Creek encapsulates what Dubai is all about. Best appreciated from a trip on an Abra or a dhow, the contraast between old and new Dubai is brought into sharp relief.Ancient, patched working dhow are moored beside sleek luxury yachts against the backdrop of the Rolex towers. A one hour tour on a dhow takes you past the spice and gold souks and the Bastakia mosque. Great photos if you avoid the middle of the day and wait until the sun is low and reflecting off the windows of the bank buildings on the north shore.
Culture. I just walked along the crees and saw the dhows, people and activity. It's a nice place to get a glimpse of how life used to be. Something everyone should experience while in Dubai.

Don't bother. We went along to a dinner criuise and meal on the Bateau Dubai. The boat is done up nicely and the service good. However, for us, the whole experience just didn't work. Perhaps we were too tired? The food was generally of a good quality but he wine that was included in the price was ru bush at best. Managed to ge a glass down - my wife had 1 sip and stuck to water. There was a bit of hard sell on photographs but I was able to resist quite firmly. By the time we came to dock we were waiting first I. Line to get off.

A must. If you need to get to somewhere on the other side of the creek, DON'T get a cab straight there. Get a cab to your side of teh creek and get the Abra water taxi across. The best 1 dhiram (about 30 cents aussie) you'll ever spend.
Try the little boats to cross and cruise the creek. Get a glimpse on a somewhat more conservative part of the city, to be seen from refreshingly open and fast water busses.
This takes you across to the Souks.. On a small Dow with the locals, interesting sights.Sort of slows things down and you get a good view of all the cargo Dows losding and unloading their wares.

Fun and bustling. I really enjoyed the creek area. I took a narrated cruise, ate at a waterside cafe and wandered around the various old world shopping areas. I didn't realize that EVERYTHING closes from 2pm-5pm. So you need to plan your visit for either the morning or the evening.

Good for spending a romantic evening. In the evening, the creek is a very pleasant site to spend time. Specially decorated floating restaurants arranging dinner along with shows of dance, magic etc., can be an added attraction. But my suggestion would be to avoid any prior booking through travel agents. It is better to choose the restaurants according to individual taste instead.
Loved the experience of the old and new. The Creek was a fantastic day out and good to see the other side of Dubai with it's history, and ordinary buildings.
Cheap as chips!. We sailed on an Abra across the creek from Deira the cost was around 20p each it was quite an experience and the souks where well worth the visit.
Fascinating way of life. We had a trip across the creek and it was fun - we did it all as part of a Big Bus Tour - we got an hours trip on the Creek and loved it.

Worth every penny. This only cost about £1 per person for the boat ride over to the old town and was a lovely though quite short experience. The shops are much cheaper if you are willing to barter and when we found the battery of our camera had run out a kindly Indian camera shop owner was more than happy to recharge it for us. We left the battery and came back an hour later and it was two thirds charged. We gave him about £1 and he was happy. Fantastic service.

A must for an Authentic Visit. The creek is an absolute must if you are an out of town visitor or if you have friends or family in town. If you can experience one of the Dhows or even pay the couple dirhams to take the water taxi, it's well worth it!

Good to wonder about. It is a good alternative to the shop-shop-shop mentality of Dubai. Just take a camera, your walking shoes and wonder about the souks take the boats (1AED) back and forth across the Creek, mingle with your fellow tourists and the locals who still use this mode of transportation. Getting lost here among all the real people might make you forget how this city feels like a Disney Movie Set, if only for a while...
Boat show. Enjoyed the boat show at dubai creek had some food in the club bar was good and nice atmosphere The place was really busy and yet the food was served quickly and hot

Go in the morning - make sure you take your camera. Only had 24 hrs in Dubai and the Creek was my highlight.The old Dhow boats against the backdrop of modern sky scrapers is amazing and must be caught on camera.The goods being loaded were fascinating. All the guys there are very friendly and couldn't wait to be in the photos!Strongly recommend
Great experience. Great atmosphere, interesting to see another side of Dubai, the old ships in this trading port. The only down side was the amount of time it took to get there, very heavy traffic.

Chaotic glory. This is more like the true arab world (although most people there are from the sub-continent - India. Pakistan etc.). Parts can be touristy and you will be subjected to vendors galore - bargin hard. Wear some good walking shoes, carry a camera, and explore the back streets and stores. Take a water taxi over to the Diera side leads to more wonders and the great Dubai Museum. Only seeing the shiny buildings and malls with the chain stores is a shame; Dubai has more to offer and the creek is a must-see.

Highlight of our trip. This place is awesome and not to be missed. Best souk I have been to. Don't miss the colorful "pirates of the caribbean" Iranian boats at the piers. I couldn't stop taking pictures of them. I can't believe those things are seaworthy!We stopped and ate lunch at an outdoor Indian place right next to where the ferries are, and it was very good.
nothing special. do not spend this money... nothing special to see and the food on the dhow is really average... 2 hours going back and forth in the same channel ...

See where it all started.... We took a dhow trip to take in the old town and the transformation to the new mega-city. It's a must-do part of any trip to Dubai, and the views from the creek are stunning.

A real taste of culture. I'm so pleased I discovered Dubai Creek. Its simply a great way to see how Dubai used to be before all the new technology and high rise buildings. Its a fun place to go shopping, especially for unique foods or branded fashion items at a lower price - you get every opportunity to barter and really enrich your experience of old Dubai. Easily reached by the Dubai Metro and walking distance from the station. A must visit if you are in Dubai.

Nice Place to visit. Dubai Creek is covered by most of the Half Day city tour deals. They take you during the day. You can reach there and have a look across the creek. Take photos, you can also see the Rolex Office across the creek.At night, the same creek is the starting point of the Dhow Cruice, which is a 2 hour slow cruise with dinner and a magic show and traditional dance show. Ideal to visit as a part of Dubai.
Traditional. Its the other side of town the old world charm . make sure you take a ride on one of the dows operating on the creek has a charm of its own

Creek tour. Our creek tour started at 5pm and that includes dinner for the night. you will ride a dhow boat(traditional boats of gulf countries) that was made to a floating restaurant. You will see dubai through the creek, there is also some entertainment during the trip a man that is wearing tons of light attached to his clothes where he will spin around for almost 15mins or so. The food was not that much enticing for our tastebuds and it seems like it was not international dishes that was stated in their website of mytrip dubai.. If you like a night scene of dubai you can try it for yourself and experience the cruise at the creek.

Peace in a crazy city. The Dubai Creek is absolutely beautiful, and a must do for any visitor. Various markets surround the creek, so shopping opportunities abound. Take the water taxi across the creek for AED 1 each way, rather than paying the AED 120 for a personal trip.

Go in the evening by 5 PM and get a 1 hour tour.. There are many boats that you can hire for less than 100AED for an Hour or you could get an Abra which is not really safe with children but much cheaper rates.Its a great experience and highly recommended.There are various evening cruises with food served on board they are usually overpriced and the food in most cases are below standard. I would also recommend the creek park near by.
Dubai creek - great adventure. Excellent place to visit if you like to wonder and explore - very safe & some great bargains to be had, not to mention great cafe's.
Very Interesting!. Allow plenty of time for shopping! Don´t be tempted to take the air conditioned water taxis take the open boats at 1 AED per person with the workers much more fun

Bit of Nostalgia. Booked a Dhow dinner through the hotel, excellent value and well worth it. Food was what you would expect. Starters were excellent very fresh salads, mains could have done with being hotter but ok. Price was approx GBP 35. We had an excellent outside table so great views. If you get a choice make sure you ask for the upper outside deck and for a table on the edge - we were given this but I think that was because our hotel booked the trip. This is the 2nd time I have done a Dhow dinner and would recommend as a pleasant change to eating in the hotel and for getting a feel of "Old" Dubai.

Just a creek. I do not consider the creek a special attraction by any standard. It is just a creek. If you want to buy gold, you may shop at some of the shops by the creek. Yes, you may want to ride the water taxi at the creek, but don't expect too much.

Cheapest entertainment in town. Both sides of the creek have old traditional souks back alleys and barrow men in the street. Ride the water taxi for a dirham (30cents) and eat at the local food outlets.
nothing special. It only takes less than 10 minutes to cross the creek. The view is just ok. The dock itself is pretty easy to follow.

Dinner on the Creek - Fabulous.. The Burj booked us onto the Glass Dhow for Dinner and a cruise on the creek. It was perfect. We took our two daughters who were in their 20's at the time, and we all loved it. The food was delicious and the views on the Creek just wonderful. Nothing was rushed and between courses we went outside to see the sights although, with the Dhow being glass, the viewing was perfect. There were other dhows but the glass one is the best.
Have to go on the creek. If you are in Dubai you must go along the creek over to the Gold Souks. A lovely little boat trip past alot of old boats. Very nice and relaxing and cheap!

Good. good place to walk around, its the best way to see things. Much different from the beaches which is a good contrast. Watching what happens along the river is interesting and boat crossings are great.
Dhowing. We took a dhow across Dubai Creek in early evening and it was fun to see all the other dhows on the creek and the juxtaposition of the old dhows and the modern skyscrapers.

Serves romantic purpose. Depends on which cruise/ or boat you're at, but on the Bateaux, river cruise and dining is exceptional. Here I've made the most important proposition of my life, and as it was some sort of a holiday in Dubai then, when they launched those fireworks that i had on my background, I've received a favorable response. She still got that ring on her finger
Creek. we went on the creek as part of the big red bus tour,it was a really nice way to see Dubia from the water

Well worth a visit.. Had an hours cruise on the Creek as part of the Big Bus Tour. Very interesting. Nice boat with good commentary and tasty refreshments. Very different area compared to around by the malls. Enjoyed paying a visit to the gold and spice souks. A must do if you're going to Dubai.

Original Dubai. This main artery running through the old part of Dubai is an essential experience for tourists, who might otherwise get the impression that the city is nothing but shopping malls and glass skyscrapers. Spend some time on both the southern and northern sides of the creek. The south bank is more picturesque and touristy, with the charming Bastakiya district providing a glimpse of the traditional local architecture, densely set along shady narrow alleys. About five minutes walk downstream is a cloth bazar and a strongly Indian district with tiny shops selling trinkets and flower garlands for use in the Hindu temple. You're right beside the waterfront here, and for a few cents (I think the fare is 1 dirham)you can take one of the little abra ferry boats across to the other side. The northern bank of the creek has a busy waterfront where the cargo is loaded on and off ocean-going dhows. Most of the bazars are also here, a few blocks from the water. The spice bazar, selling mounds of such things as indigo and turmeric, is colourful and fragrant. Dubai has been a trading centre for centuries, but in this area near the mouth of the creek you can get a sense of how things were before trading involved global corporations and stock markets.
Great views od Dubai. This is a lovely area and getting on a boat is a must to experience and see the area and architecture.

MOONLIGHT SONATA CRUISE NOT WORTH IT. We pre-booked this Dubai Creek dinner cruise aboard a traditional dhow before we left New Zealand. The dinner was a below average buffet but what really annoyed us was that there was not a word of commentary during the entire 3 hour cruise. We had no idea where we were or what we were seeing. Going back to our hotel we shared a taxi with an overseas travel agent and she told us that she too was not impressed.
Great Views. Great sightseeing along the Creek!!! Highly recommend a boat trip and taking your camera!! Get some fantastics shots along the way!!!
Abra is great. went across the cree kon an abra and it cost AED1 - that's 20p! Bonkers, but a great experience and the pilot was a bit of a comedian. a must do if in Dubai

A great hotel to stay. Dubai Deira Creek is a great hotel. last vocation i staied there and that i was my best vocation that i ever had in my life. so simply advice all of those who are planning to go to dubai should stay there it will make your dream trip.
Nice stroll. To get some flavours of older Dubai a stroll by creek can give you some idea of how trading used to be done. Can be a tad smelly so do plan too long here
More than a creek. We stayed in a hotel on the Creek side and took a boat across the creek ..very different experince for us. These little boats go back and forth all day long for a small fee.

The Heart of the City. This was my favourite part of Dubai on my first visit. It is vibrant colourful and full of tradition. Hire an abra for an hour it is a great way to see the creek and high rise buildings and close to planes taking off from airport. Get off on other side and visit the gold souk and walk through to bus station and take the No.8 along coast road. Great in heat of day as buses are air-conditioned. Buy a bus/metro ticket and then you can zap around at ease.

Still busy after all these years. From the humble 'Abra' to ocean going yachts, dhows plying the Arabian gulf to exotic places with all manner of cargo, usually stacked up on the decks, first time I ever saw 15 cars / vans piled on the deck of a ship, looks strange. A very busy waterway and a must visit before all else.

An evening to unwind. This was one evening i thank God i had my cam and camera with me. we had nice buffet, my wife and i had some self discovery talks. it was a great evening with on board entertainment. several other families were also around to laugh with and share experiences. hmm! i was glad we made it.....
Traditional Experience!. Took a trip on the Creek on a small boat. Was just us 2 so resally relaxing and the views were great!

Speechless. My hotel was on the side of the creek Sheraton creek which was amazing at night and at day. The cute abra/s cost 1 dirham each and are very much better than taxi boats. The creek sides are very much diffrent from one another one side which is more modern and one side which shows the typical side where most people live I definitely reccomend visiting Dubai creek
Lovely in the evening. If you are visiting Dubai, definitely visit the creek in the evening. Take an abra (little boat) to cross the creek in the evening to have a lovely view over old Dubai.

At 1 dirham a ride, a must for all tourists. Bur Dubai abra dock - Cross the creek by abra for only 1DH each way - A great experience & not costly at all - Would recommend everyone visiting Dubai trys this ....

The old city to discover. The old district of Bastakyia is wonderful and maybe the mind of Dubai, just between the souks and the modern city with the skyline of Dubai, try a trip on a ship along the Creek and go to the dubai museum
worth it. we took the boat and had an one-hour tour (part of the Big Bus Tour package). It's worth to do it, you can see interesting views along the two side of the creek.
nice way to view the city skyline. took amazing pics while doing the boat as part of the tour of the city. It offered fantastic views of the city
Fun.. This is a must do as everything is so modern in Dubai. Being here feels like how it is backed in the days where it feels more real. And take the water taxi for 1 AED. Just a fun ride.
Diner cruise on the Creek. This was a comfortable trip but would have been better in daylight. The food was ok, the staff were really good. Some sort of floor show would have been great.
Creek Cruise. Ideal way to get a feel for Dubai and and new. Most cruises are inexpensive but make up income by loading drinks prices. Choose wisely and have a tipple on the Creek
Peaceful. good place to go for a walk in the evening or for a run... we watched the fireworks during Eid and it was awesome

Where History and Modernity Meet. Souks line the two sides of Dubai Creek, and it is a must-do experience to cross Dubai Creek in an abra, a traditional boat transporting people across the Creek. The two banks of the Creek have retained enough of Dubai's historic past, and transport visitors to a different time, which makes the modernity surrounding it appear even more striking.

great setting. Enjoyed staying on the creek side of Dubai was good see see the odler part of Duabi and the water taxis wre great to use crossing one side to the other of the creek and lots to do they are doing a bit of building and making a new walk at the water egde it will be very nice once its finished beautiful to walk down at sunset
site seeing.. Great place. Lots of nice boats and marina. Very nice. Good food and restuarants. Just a walk through the marina is grand. Malls everywhere.

Really interesting. We took a boat ride on the creek through our ticket for the hop on hop off bus. It was truly amazing. The old side of Dubai and was fun to see the waters taxis and just pure culture. Great time! The markets were amazing...the buildings just great to see.

on a dhow. Food excellent, service great. Views on the evening superb. Well worth giving it a go. Getting there was an experience in a bus!! I would advise you go by taxi or private car. The boats are beautifully decorated and very clean. My cousin and I enjoyed a Magic show on board. Didn't get back til 11.30pm a bit scary.

Get you camera out. You can get some good pictures around here and with a little manipulation make them look quite old. There are lots of floating restaurants and lots of people wanting to take you for a boat ride. It is hot and there is little. Shade so beware.
Interesting. We really enjoyed our walks along the waterfront at night, extremely pleasent and felt very safe at all times

plenty to do, lots to see. If you're looking for cool breezes and to be unhassled by haggling tradesmen then a walk along Dubai Creek is for you. Very close to Al Fahidi metro station (but possibly closer to Creek Metro station!) it's a great place lined with floating restaurants and abras (water taxis) so there are a variety of ways to see this waterway.We did it by foot - and again with in a floating restaurant and both were nice. Most restaurants charge a price for a 2-hour meal and entertainment event. It's wonderful.

Mix of old and new.... Creek surrounded with old historical building and market and along with new high class hotels and lots of Gold shops. Still you can find old time trading ship and luxurious yachts. Dhow rides with dinners are also popular here.
Dubai Creek. Probably the most interesting way to see the Creek is from a dhow. I did both the day and night cruise and would advise both.

A busy waterway with unimaginable cargos. The bustle, the water taxis, the general to'ing and fro'ing make this an enjoyable experience. To see the dhows being laden with just about everything you can think of is quite something (washing machines, old motor cars and vans, you name it - they will transport it)

Taste of Old Dubai. We took a water taxi (Abra) up the creek for an hour tour, passing dhows from all over the world - loading up their goods etc. Also passed the Rulers Court, what a building, obviously no photography there but the rest of the creek tour was enjoyable. From seeing the new buildings to the older dhows was fascinating.

Variety!. No Shortage of activities here!Sea traders from all over the Gulf come here to load goods that have landed at DBX. So there is no shortage of activity. The Al Sabkha Abra stop is also a hive of activity (and a photographers paradise).After dark, make the most of a dinner cruise on something that resembles a Dhow - wouldn't recommend a swim!!
Go in winter !. Dubai creek is a great place to walk and take in the views. The cargo boats are amazing. In the summer it is way too hot to walk along the creek so walk in winter or take a dhow

Up the Creek!. The abras run commuters across the creek to the Diera sectionof the city, but we were able to hire one for an hour for about £20 (120 dirhams). We went right up as far as the pontoon bridge, past a royal summer palace and back again. A lovely way to see the city, but without the benefits of the humorous yarns spun by the London River Cruise pilots!. We then ate in the restaurant near the jetty reached via the market - sorry can't remember the name but it had a terrace on the water only used in the cooler months - like now.A lovely day out.
Beauty personified. The best place to be,, peaceful and calm, clean and the calmness of the water leaves you spell bound!

Real Dubai. Great to see the "real" Dubai. The dhows are fascinating as are the souks. Leave plenty of time to explore. If you are on the big bus tour get off at stop 5, and wonder along the creek side. Rejoin at stop 7.
fun to just wander. Is very interesting and you get a feel for the history and culture. It's great to find a restaurant overlooking the creek and just relax.

Exciting. What a magical sight. This bustling creek is a working river. It is wide, colorful and exciting. If you are staying in a hotel by the Creek you will have a great view,day and night. There is always life on the creek with all types of boats criss crossing. A ride on the creek is a must when you are in Dubai.

This is a Must See. This was an amaxing exerience. The boats of all descriptions were just so good to see and photograph. The busy dhows with the brightly coloured wood work captured the old Dubai. The restaurants were great and you can take a water taxi to the other side so cheaply..well worth the experience

Traditional and modern Dubai. You get to see old Dubai juxtaposed against modern Dubai at Dubai Creek. On one side of the Creek is Deira ( old town ) while on the side is Bur Dubai ( modern ). It is good experience to take a boat trip across the Creek on an abra ( traditional fishing boat ) in the morning and a night cruise to view the night city skyline.
Great Indian food. 42 degrees on the Creek at 10.30pm, but the meal and views were amazing. Excellent evening. All you can eat, good service and memorable sights.
great to view the gold and diamond jewellery. hated the locals trying to ram fake designer bags down my neck!loved viewing and taking pics of the exquisite jewellery
OK. Creek is lovely, if not a little Disneyesque with the little boats going up and down - some nice restaurants down by the water.

A man-made creek!. The Dubai Creek which divides Bur-Dubai and Deira happens to be a man-made waterway made for the convenience of trade ships. Presently, it is a delight to sail along the creek speciall y in the evenings.

dubai creek. Best to go on your own rather than a tour.
The buildings are amazing to see sparkling in the sunlight.
Take a dhouw to go down the creek as they are very cheap

On a very hot afternoon. We went there at the wrong time when it was almost unbearably hot on a small boat. But there are cruizes with air-conditioned boats. The view into the old quarters of Dubai was a nice change. At the east-side of the Creek is the Gold market offering also wonderful choice of jewellery and precious stones such as the emeralds from Columbia, deep-blue sapphires or the purple-blue Tansanites. A delightful way of shopping in contrast to the Malls.
Taxi. A fantastic way to cross over to the gold Souk, only one Diram to cross over and the little boats are very frequent, very old but adds to the beauty of your visit.
different side of Dubai. the older side of Dubai, with plenty of character and many hidden gems to discover. Highly recommend exploring the area during the cooler months of the year.
Best place Relax. Just sat & talking to friends. Very calm, relaxing & beautiful landscape. In the evening nice display of fire works can't believe we are living in the middle of a dessert.

Very good cruise experience. It was ideal for relaxation after a busy day city tour. The sitting arrangement was good.There were lots of options in the food including decent vegetarian dishes. The taste was much better than that of desert safari dinner.A magician also entertained us.A must activity when you are in Dubai.

Bateaux river cruise. We went on this river cruise it was excellent the meal was fantastic there was not too many on the boat and the ambience was great soft music in the background as you floated down the creek taking in the views the service was fantastic it was a memorable night in Dubai a great night for the last evening in a wonderful and safe city
Abra-cadabra and Souk it up!. Must cross the Creek using the abra's (water taxi) - great experience and excellent way to wander in the various souks of Bur Dubai and Deira.
not really worth it..!!. the river smells really terrible and the food on our boat cruise was really nothing at all, cheap and no value meals, we didn't even try to eat..

Nice but nothing great. The cruise dinner is average with food which is below average. It is good time to relax in the cruise over the creek but that kind of similar experience you can get almost anywhere.

Wonderful place to watch all the action. So much seems to go on around the creek it was amazing to watch all the action, jump on a ferry to the other side of the river with all the locals and see what is happening fun place to go

An oasis of old style Dubai. If the ostentatious displays of glitz and glamour get to be too much (I was 'over it' in ten minutes) then you must visit this area. Sure, there are the usual 'tourist' trinket traps and every second person can sell you a cheap Rolex. Once to learn to politely but firmly ignore them you'll find much of interest to explore. Wandering around the plentiful side streets and alleys was very safe and gave an interesting overview of the 'Arabian Experience'. I highly recommend it.
lovely to get a boat. was lovely to get a boat , one of the most enjoyble things i did, nice food and people ... recomendable to have a nice night out.
1 dirham to get you accross. a good experience to feel what it's like to be a local. you get the sun, the breeze and the scenery.

The Creek park. Wonderful family park with the dolphernium where you can see the dolphin show, kids land where the kids learn while playing, bicycle ride and the long Cable car trip. there is also a parbique area and a lot of kids playground and rides.

Nice to see old Dubai. We visited the creek area on our third visit to Dubai, it definitely makes you feel like you are somewhere in the middle east. We wondered through the souks and got an abra across the river. Compared to the skyscrapers and modern buildings in Jumeirah, this is so different and definitely worth doing whilst in Dubai to get a feel for the proper Dubai!

Dhow cruise on River Creek. Recommend taking a night dinner cruise on a Dhow - you pass by all the other Dhows which are lit up and you see and the cruise offers you a good look at the city all lit up.

My favourite place in Dubai. I love the Creek at Deira - full of souks, street food and an eclectic mix of nationalities. Take the Abras back and forth for just 1 dirham. Be aware though that there is a distinct lack of WC's and facilities

Awesome view of Dubai old and new. Do not miss the somptuous boats very uxurious as well as the emir palace.Unfortunately i found that there was lots dirt floating on the water.The old boats carrying cargo from iran are so old and made of wood.An opportunity no t miss
Impressive. Took a slow boat ride and dinner throug the Dubai Creek. This is a good way to see the city and many of its impressive buildings

Rent a Water Taxi For An Hour for about $35US. A nice treat was to rent a Water Taxi for an hour for about $35US. It appears this is for the boat no matter how many passengers as I was the only one. The taxi driver came up to me to solicit the taxi and pointed to a sign from the Transit Authority that is 120 Dirham per hour. Takes about an hour to make a circle around the Creek (more like a small harbor).The buildings are nice. The waterway is a little small. One can watch workers unload ships' freight onto the dock.
Bateaux Dubai. Went for dinner on the bateaux dubai crusise which was good, went all around the creek, would rather of gone around the marina though as more sights to see

WATER WATER WATER <3. I love water sides, water banks, water shores, water bodies, water animals... So I didnt miss the chance to go to the creek. and I loved it.. the boulevard to walk.. the lights to enjoy the water and salty air to feel.. if this doesnt relax u and makes u feel like living there then nothing can.

My favourite place in Dubai!. Why....it satisfies all of the senses. Everything is going on in Dubai Creek, I jumped on a 1Dhs abra and while crossing the creek, coke can in hand, a large cargo dhow was about 1 meter away from us, cruising past, apparently on it's way to Iran.....I wondered where in the world is this not breaching a hundred safety laws? The creek itself is a deep emerald green and it just beckons you....but I'm no mermaid, so I stayed put. The hustle and bustle is worth it.....but it's not for everyone. Don't forget to check out the textile, gold and spice souks too. Be prepared to haggle and get the best price. Know your gold price for the day if you intend to do some serious shopping.
evening dinner on warer. the best thing we done on dubai going at the creek side an getting on the boats an having a evening meal with style it was great
dinner on the creek. had dinner on the dubai bateaux great experience, food excellent service very good, great foe a romantic evening

the awesome view. you should go there once, and sit near the water and try and look at the reflection of beautiful buildings in the creek waters... its an area of peace, calm, tranquility and elegance midst the chaotic city.
Sailing at night. Had a nice time on the Creek during a dinner cruise on a dhow. Nice weather, good food, great service, lovely waters, and beautiful Dubai at night!

Dubai Creek Dinner Cruise. This was a fantastic evening. We enjoyed dinner and drinks while we cruised downd the creek to the open ocean, then back up the creek. There were fireworks being fired off from a boat in the middle of the creek. There were lots of colourfull boat lit up cruising the creek. We would definitly do it again.

The beautiful water and AMAZING Skyline. For someone who also lives in the desert kinda place Dubai creek seemed like an urban oasis.
The water was glistening with lights. The boulevard felt so peaceful and enjoyable. I was very happy here. Would've stayed there all my life.
Souks. Great place to shop and get bargains bought lots of lovely things and nice people, been a few times and would definitely go back.

Great course. Great condition. I played Dubai Creek while on a stopover. I know all the golf courses in Dubai are probably amazing but Dubai Creek was the only one I played. I really enjoyed it (except the 49 C temperature)
Old Meets New. Very nice to see heritage of dubai on this side of the creek. Lovely shops and locals and very relaxing water taxi.
Old old Dubai. If you want to see the real old Dubai it was twenty years ago, just go to Creek. Although not a clean and humongous a new Dubai, the old Dubai is just full of history.

Peaceful. Lovely to walk along and lovely to look at from the apartment windows. A dhow cruise is ideal but make sure you have a decent and reputable company - try getting onto a cruise from the Raddison hotel as they seem to be quite good.
View of the Creek from Hotel. It was a great view of the Dubai Creek. There are, I'm sure, several good hotels to use if one would prefer a view of Dubai Creek to wake up to.

the only recall to Arabic real culture. it is a kind of junction between Asia and Arabic Peninsula. It is nice to walk thrugh souk, or take the boat to cross the river. You have a real fealing of reality...completely different form artificial Dubai...
Wow. use the small shuttle boats to cross the creek, feels very interesting and its a must do in Dubai, the best part is its dame cheep

ok-ish. We had dinner on the bateaux, there is not a huge amount to see along the creek, it was more about having a nice dinner on a boat. We wouldnt do it again just because there is not much to see.
Great place to browse. The little boats shuttle you across the creek and you can tour the various souks on the other side. It is also cooling to be on the river for a while.

BigBus Dubai Creek Tour. The creek is the waterway of Dubai and the views with the amount of dhows are amazing. If you book the BigBus tour please make sure you go on the dhow cruise, well worth investing the hour on the creek.

Old Dubai. There is the Old suk on one side, where you can find cheap souvenirs, don't forget to take the abra (water taxi) to the other side of the creek wher you can walk around and see the spice suk and the gold suk.

Local taste. Crossed the creek on abra (water taxi) from Arabic market in Deira to Indian market. The bay is full of life. Gives a view on the lifestyle of locals and Indians. This is one of the places to see how real Dubai lools like. Mix of luxury, new technologies and poverty. Worth seeing.

The true spirit of Dubai. The creek is a very beautiful place. Try crossing it on al abra. It is very authentic and gives a great view over Deira. See the wrecked old ships that move goods from India and Pakistan...behind the futuristic buildings, mega roads and luxurious lifestyle in the malls there is the real Dubai!
Worth Seeing.. We enjoyed a meal on a dhow.......Nicely done....good variety of food......live music......good way of seeing the sights.....Extremely good value.

Amazing. I have been to Dubai many times and always my first choice was to spend some time at its beautiful creek. Surrounded by the beautiful old yachts for fishing, its a beautiful sight to visit. You can a trip of Dhou Cruise and sit aside by the cafes there. Its a must visit area if you are in Dubai.
1 Dhs. visit. Try to cross the Greek by only 1 Dhs. in the late night & buy a cup of tea from the boarder by 1Dhs to drink while you travel, really very nice trip traditionally.

Pretty average. The creek or river cruise is include in the Big Bus Tour. I thought it was very average, it lasted about an hour, up one side and back the other. We had already seen it all on the bus tour. I would not pay to go on it.
Worthwhile. We had a traditional Arab barbecue on a traditional Dhow boat. A nice experience and very reasonable.

Lots to see. This was a particular visit for the fireworks and celebrations for UAE day which were wonderful. During the day there are many things to do at the Creek from shopping the Gold souk or the other souks on the other side of the Creek. There is a replica of buildings from old Dubai and the Bastikya which is an area on the Creek.

Great little boat trip. We had a great boat trip on Dubai Creek. Along the wharves were vessels from other nearby countries loading/offloading goods. They stayed there a number of days so people were living on board. Regularly the call to prayer came over the loudspeakers, echoing over the creek. I hoped our boat driver would not leave us for the prayer. Very busy place, but relaxing on the water.

The vibe of Dubai. No trip to Dubai would be complete until you take a ride on an Abra across the creek from Deira to Bur Dubai. From the fabric souk to the gold souk, this is the real pulsing heart of Dubai.
it's just a creek. its just a creek. what make it special is just because it was man-made. and those building across the creek is awesome, and yea, they have floating restaurants there.

Take a boat. We were 9 and rented a boat for a 1 hour trip for a total cost of €5 per person. We started at 7pm as this is the best time to avoid high temperatures. We had the chance to see the sunset and it was great. Everybody enjoyed a lot

Great!. Is one of the best attractions in dubai. Enojy a visit to the creek and walk on both the sides.Uses the Abras (public transports) to cross the creek for only one Dirham. Really good experience really worth it.
Good view and good ride. The creek in the center of the city is refreshing with its water body. A ride on the country dhow to go across is a different but good experience.

Old Dubai. We travelled acroos the creek as part of a tour with Arabian advetures to visit the Soukes. The boats were old and very quaint. There is loads to see on the water and a nice change from the large buildings and shopping malls. A good trip to experience the other side of a very rich and growing country.

The other side of Dubai.. It's well worth spending 20 pence to take one of the water taxis across the river before haggling for fake goods, spices or gold! It's not the clean modern Dubai you see in the city though!
Loved it. Get a private boat to go up and down the creek. The creek bus is unbelievably cheap. The taxis are fun. But get a cruiser boat on your own!
Good spot for a late afternoon stroll. I found this to be good spot for a late afternoon stroll. relaxing breeze as you leisurely walk by the water
Dubai Creek Cruise. Brilliant value for money boat trip up and down the creek with free drinks!! Lovely old boats in varnished wood, leisurely pace ideal for photos / filming.

chillaxing. Took the free of charge dhow cruise from the Big Bus Tours, the creek is lively, and relaxing, just sit and watch the world pass by, smell the sea, see the fish, watch the traders load boats, and hear the mosque in the air... really great experience.

Got to do it. This was a great trip ...you just mingle in with the old and very new ...it takes you through some fantastic little places that are so not on the map ...it can be a little overwhelming my advice is to keep yourself dressed modestly as you will feel so much more comfortable when walking amongst the crowds ..a mixture of so many cultures better to feel safe in regards to what you wear not all people are as open minded as some parts of Dubai ...

Great, and you must do the Abra crossings. The creek gives a real insight into the tradings that still take place - all the boats docked and masses of activity. The Abra crossings at 1d. are amazing value, great fun, and give superb views. An absolute MUST DO on any trip to Dubai!
Dubai Creek. Dubai creek is okay. A mixture of modern and traditional boats can be seen. Take a water taxi or charter a boat across the water.
Hot and intimadating. OMG, attack of the fake watch sellers! we even got an assurance that the watches were genuine fakes,,, Abra was ok getting there , but i am not sure its all worth the hassle

A must do in Dubai. Catch an abra, walk along both sides of the creek. Watch the loading and unloading of all sorts of goods from the dhows. Visit the souqs. Visit the Dubai Museum and Bastikiya. The best part of Dubai for seeing the culture.

A Dubai must. The creek is where you'll get an idea of what Dubai was once like. The "old city" has been reduced to a few streets and a virtual amusement park. But, take a boat on the creek - a water taxi or rent a little boat by the hour - and you'll get a sense of how life used to be. On a hot summer night, it's the place to cool down.

Creek itinerary. The Creek is the hearth of old Dubai. Walking on Deira side, I suggest starting from Bastakia, Dubai Museum, Spices market Gold Souk. Note there is a minute ally on side of Dubai Museum Entrance: this is the best kept secret marvel in town.And remember to explore the Creek renting for 100AED an ambra, the local ship.

Dubai Creek. Worth a stroll down the creek to see all the wooden dhows and laden with goods either arriving or leaving (for example for Iran). There is the water taxi to take you across the creek to the other side - cheap too. In the heart of original Dubai so was the hub of activity.

Take the Water Taxi. You can go across the creek taking a taxi or the metro. but you must find the stating for the water taxi and take it over the creek. It is a 15min trip costing 6 drhms (under 2 pounds) for the air conditioned ones, return trip. or 3 drhms for the open,non air-conditioned. It is one of the few things I would recommend. You can find the stations on googlemap and walk your way there if the hotel is close. On the other side, its a huge shoping area for the local ex-pats, don't expect to see local people.
One of the Only Places where Culture is Present. If you want to experience some sort of culture in Dubai you should definitely visit the creek and the souks around.

A taste of tradition. An excellent scenic spot for all ages and interests. I took my Mom and Dad here when they came to visit me in the UAE. After we left the shiny modern skyscrapers behind us my parents finally got a sense of true tradition and culture of Dubai. We took a traditional cruise down the creek on our own abra.... there's also the option of paying 2 dirham and sharing with other tourists. Long ago these wooden boats were used to transport textiles and other goods from one side of the creek to next. It really is a must do when you visit Dubai a taste of the old traditional Dubai. Have a traditional Arabic lunch on one of the restaurants overlooking the creek followed by a stroll around the amusing souq to pick up a few essential souvenirs.

Dubai creek. Had some great walks in this area by the creek.Good at night as well as the day. Great to see all the Dhows being loaded the old way, blood sweat and tears.Felt a little intimidated by the workers in this area as they liked to stare at us and in particular my wife.

It s a good way to see old and new. we hired a speed boat with a driver and had a sunset trip by ourselves up and down the Creek. It was fine but highlighted to us that Dubai is great for shopping and admiring new buildings but the history and culture does not come through

A nice experience. We took the Dhow cruise on Dubai creek, which alsts for about 2-3 hours including cruise, dinner, belly dance...it is almost surreal and you feel you are re-living some arabian tales
Beauty at creek. The best time to go would be during the evening when temperatures fall down. Many parks are situated here too
Feel the heat. If you are in summer you will feel the heat, however the smell of the sea is fantastic, you can see the old boats beside the new ones.

Good place to visit. It is one of the place which you would visit to spend time during the weekend. It is recommended to visit the place during the winter season in Dubai. The view is very relaxing and the fireworks that take place during DSF is just amazing.

If you have time to spare. Do this!. It is amazing. I have been through Dubai airport many times and never knew this was possible until a friend took me. The water taxis are easy to use and very very cheap. You see Dubai from an angle you never saw before, and see boats and dhows the like of which a westerner will not have seen before. Get yourself dropped off at one of the routine stops and have lunch watching the boats. I caught the new metro back to the airport. Incredible.
very nice place for spending an afternoon. it was very nice to see this different side of dubai. take the boat for only 100 dinars and have a very nice time in dubai
feeling arabic culture. At the old gold souk, you finally feel like you are in a Arabic country
Water way travel. Not sure my wife would agree, but for me crossing on one of the many boats which constantly cross the creek was a fun experience
Lovely place. you can spend only 1 aed and get a ride of dhow like 5 to 10 mins is it interesting

RTA Water Taxi & the Boats. RTA Water Taxi & the Boats are a nice additon to the Dubai creek..which gives a splendid view during night time with the lighting...one can go the Old souq..gold souq...bashra..on the traditional boats which are a fun drive wid a nominal cost of just 2 AED...full too paisa wasool jagah :) :)

colours of old Dubai. Dubai creek is termed as lifeline of Dubai. However as a tourist attraction, you do not have much to do than abra ride or sit on one of the banks and see the life go by. However in a hot and humid month of July, when we visited, you donot enjoy it much

A lifestyle view. We loved this area as it gave a wonderful insight on the life and workings of this river. That is by day and by night what a lovely experience to have a dinner cruise on the water. Our hotel had a creek view and it was amazing both day and night.

Evening walks. the burdubai side creek has parks and diera creek is more of a loading station for small vessels,there is a boat station (called Abra) which takes u to and fro in the wooden boat for 1AED. there is also wooden dow boats for evening dinner cruises ,which take you around for couple of hours in the creek waters and serve you with arabic buffet dinner (prices are approx 150-200 Aed) depending on tour operators... overall its a nice view from bur duba side of the diera side in the evenings.the diera side has 2 stations ,one drops you closer to gold souk (gold shopping market) and the other one is closer to diera market area-retail/wholesale markets.

Great fun to see the real Dubai. Lots of markets and nooks and crannies to explore, though sometimes the traders were a little too pushy but nothing too bad (unless Egypt!).Not too much shade so head for tyhe covered gold markets which are an eye opener.

Have a taste of old traditional Dubai. Dubai creek was in the old days the main means of transpoting goods in and out of the emaret. And being a city known in the area for trading, the creek was and still is very busy with boats traveling to and from eastern Asia, mainly Iran and India.Dubai visitors should not miss taking a ride across the creek weather for traveling from one side to the other, or just for siteseing, especially if the ride costs less than a can of soda (more or less).
Bit of the old town. Was great to go and see more of the traditional Dubai other than the flash new modern buildings and malls. Very busy and crazy but enjoyed it!
