see the Old Dubai. Take an abra (traditional boat) to cross to the Spice Souq and Gold Souq. You'll see the creek busy with abras and dhows transporting goods taking you back to the time when Dubai wasn't connected by the numerous bridges they have now.

A commercial destination with touristic value. As been told by our guide, Dubai creek is a salt water creek which divides Dubai in two parts Bur and Deira. Its more of commercial importance with the Chamber of commerce and major banks situated in the location. But has some tourism value too as all the site seeing tourist bus have a stop here and the local guides doesnt forget to speak at length about its importance. The creek serves as a port for ships loading and unloading goods from various parts.

A must see and experience. One of the remaining authentic parts of Dubai is the creek side. You will witness a different side of Dubai life. The working dock, the museum, the abra ride, the old souks...must see and do! Its nice to visit the Bastakiya specially during winter time, very Arabic! There are some lovely cafes serving authentic Arabic food...sometimes camel meat is available. Our favorite is this resto by the creek just right next to the abra station...order a pot of moroccan tea with your food and watch the abras go by.

Take a boat drip across the creek!. I definitely recommend taking a boat trip across the creek and having dinner by the creek. This is a completely different side of Dubai and the old souk has some hidden treasures. I managed to get some old currency from Iraq there not so long ago.

Classy place. We were lucky enough to have been given a seaplane trip which took off from the Dubai Creek and had coffee in the golf club house before our flight again a very popular place and extremely pleasant surroundings.

The best part of Dubai. The biggest attention is always paid to the new parts of town, but Dubai Creek is truly the best part. Very easy to wander around the river, take a boat across, and soak in the Bastika Quarter.
Nice walk. Pleasant walk along both sides of the Creek , as long or as short as you wish. Take a water taxi from one side to the other.
a park to go with kids. Its the greenest part of Dubai. A nice park with playground, bycles, etc.

The most enjoyable cheapest experience in Dubai !. If you want to see the real old Dubai and trading as they have done for hundreds of years go to the Abra station on the Bur Dubai side of the creek, wander around the old souks with their tailors and small shops where you can haggle real bargains , then spend 20p ( 1 dirham) to join the working dubai people on an abra to cross over to the Gold and Spice souks the other side, view those Souks for a while then from the abra station that side negotiate an approx hours trip on a private abra down the creek to the Dubai Yacht club a modernistic "Sails type" building approx £10 (50 dirhams) on a round trip to see life along the creekside and old working dhows, and palace houses and parkland on the right bank, - a lovely way to spend a morning.

Nice place to chill and spend the winter evenings. Serenade watching the Dubai creek in the midst of winter when everything seems to be buzzing and also calm at the same time. The view from QD's of the creek is also spectacular. Next time i would like to jet ski in the creek :-)
borring. personal preference, there is nothing to seebut hotels on both sides of the lagoon, best part is where small ships are loaded and unloaded with goods to trade, cool

Joy ride with full of happiness. I was having fun day with my 4 yrs old daughter as fulfiling her one of the dream to go thorough Dubai Creak with Personnal Boat.Its was excellant joy ride which take you for almost 45 minutes for backwater and then staring point of ocean

Dhow central. A pristine stretch of water with an abundance of floating restaurants and dhow cruises. The walk along the creek to the various souks is wonderful with spectacular views of the ultra modern city behind.
Meet the Locals. Worth a visit just to sit and have a coffee or an ice cream and watch the coming and goings of the Abra's Have a walk around the silk souk it's like going back in time

Ride on the abra. Its free to walk up and down the trading docks and the souks either side but we paid 120AED for a private ride on the abra, there were 3 of us which made it pricey but if you're in a big group you could easily get 10 or so on board (if not more) and that makes it really cost effective. With fewer you have better opportunity to get some good photos and see some of the sky scrapers on the Diera side of the creek. Takes about an hour for the trip and the driver was really friendly and explained what the different buildings along the creek were as well as taking a few photos of the three of us on the boat which was nice.

Worth a visit. Quite an unusual mix of water craft on the creek against the back drop of Old Dubai - mosques and older style buildings. Worth catching an abra or two or maybe a dinner cruise as it has a nice buzzing atmosphere all day and into the evening.
Dinner Cruise. We did a dinner cruise on one of the traditional boats. Very nice evening.

Take a Dhow down the creek and see Dubai from a different perspective. Cath a Dhow (wooden boat) along the Dubai creek and see the Gold Souk, beautiful buildings, old and new boats and experience this city from a new perspective.
Life. Life today in Dubai, wounder what it was like 30 years ago
Not to be missed. Authentic Dubai, pedestrianised (unusually for Dubai) and not to be missed, especially the abra trip across the water. Don't let the cost put you off - about 18 pence.
Great Golf. Fantastic course, it was challenging and the golf bags were slightly lighter in balls by the end of it but we had an amazing time. Staff couldn't be more helpful and friendly.

Best for the sights and sounds of the old Dubai. As a Yorkshire born colleague of mine said when we visit "Eeh, it's right different 'ere ain't it!"
Great place to see the old trading heart of Dubai - old dhows piled up with all sorts of merchandise, smells of spices and other less savory things; abras crossing the Creek for a few dhirams...
gud. creek which divides dubai into two nice to travel in boat for 1dhs :)

Boats, abras, dhows. The development of the creek goes hand in hand with the development of modern Dubai. The Maktoum family relocated to Dubai in the 19th century from Abu Dhabi. Dubai was then a small village beside an inlet. The pearl fishing industry brought money to the port and both sides of the creek prospered.In the 1960s the creek was dredged, oil was found in Abu Dhabi and Dubai's deep water port became essential. Today, on the creek you will see dhows, abras and importantly boats unloading cargo from all over the world, it is still a working port.

Gold, gold, gold. Gold souk is very good. Do you research beforehand and check out a few stores before buying. Negotiate to roughly 50-60% of stores first prize. Shops very helpful and not pushy as in other "markets".Forget about the spice souk. A tourist trap and totally over prized even when negotiating.Textile souk ok, but lots of stores are wholesale.
Watch the sunset. You should plan on being there just before the sunset. The view is amazing and right after the sunset you can watch the city (Dubai) lighting up!
~Take an abra across. ~We enjoyed an abra ride across the Dubai Creek, upon first glance they seem unstable, but they are perfectly safe.

Definitely Recommend. Very traditional place. Do the boat ride and enjoy the sunset. This place gives you a different view of Dubai, compared to the glamorous world you get to see in the swanky hotels.This is really a must place to visit if you are the kind of traveller who is more keen on knowing more about the history, traditions, etc. Very enjoyable and informative.
The Old and New Dubai. How brilliantly done good walkways and modes of transport not overly crowded but still full of life even at 1000pm.
If you miss don't feel bad. If you have visited similar cruises in Europe etc then you won't like this because the experience is mediocre,dinner was bad and overall experience was forgetful.

Roots of the old city. Indeed it is the place to visit when the connection time between two flights exceeds 5-6 hours, or when we stay overnight in Dubai.It takes 45mn to 1 hour to go through airport passport control and reach the creek by taxi, 1-2 hours to walk along the harbour piers, visit the spice souq & gold souq, enjoy a snack, then again 45mn to 1 hour to get back to airport and go through passport control again.It gives a good taste of the middle-east, witness downtown Dubai life and souqs.While walking around the Deira (Al Ras) area, we discovered Heritage Houses, Al Almadiya Heritage School that can be visited (free of charge).If not in the hurry (1-2 more hours), it is worth crossing the creek by boat (Abras) and walk in the "Bur Dubai" area : Al Fahidi fort & museum, Heritage and Diving village are worth the visit.
Abra expererience. Good place to experience however nothing related to the local community. the best part is the Abra passing from one side of the Creek to the other side (gold souk).
Great opportunity to see local life in Dubai. The creek offers good walking opportunities and catching a public boat to the other side is about $1 which beats any organised boat trip.

Wonderful, authentic & interesting.. Loved Bur Dubai & the creek. Took a Dhow cruise, ate in the local restaurants,wandered for hours. Purchased some goodies from the Souks . . all in all a lovely place to visit. Authentic & fascinating. Loved it.

Hustle and Bustle. Metro to the Al Ghubaiba station, walk through the Old Souk for a hassling experience down to the ferry station and for AED 1 have a roller coaster ride up and across the creek on one of the small brown ferries to the other side where the large sea-going dhows load cargo of every description. Just an experience that we did at sunset for a fabulous view in the glowing light.
Interesting. We went to the creek every day it was great, plenty going on, Had a great boat ride, cheap and the people really friendly.

Take a boat trip. The creek is a nice place to be in the late afternoon. You can at a low cost rent a boat and they will take you up the creek for 1/2 or 1 hrs trip. And to take the water taxi from the souk to Basra side is nice and cheap.
I miss the Old days!. It is nice to take the Abarrah from one end to the other... To see the Deira and Bur Dubai side from the waters!!

A Must-See in Dubai. Dubai creek is one of the few natural wonders in the city. No man-made body of water here. It's a beautiful, navigable waterway that affords you some interesting views of the city, you wouldn't otherwise see form land. Best way to see it is on a wooden Abra (boat) as you ply the creek from one side to the other.
afternoon in Dubai. Walked most everywere in Bar Dubai. found the area friendly and people helpfull in local shops when lost..

Interesting in parts. Along Dubai Creek there a few things that you can do. Walking along the creek bank is a nice walk, but not that interesting. It is difficult in parts to walk right beside the water. The best thing to do there is to go for a ride on one of the water taxis. They are a great way of getting from one side of the Dubai Creek to the other side and you can take some good photos. At night the boat ride is average.

Take a boat across the creek. I took one of the local boats across the creek to go from the textile souk in the old part of Dubai to the gold and spice souks in the newer part of town. I went at night and enjoyed it quite a lot. I'll do it again when I have another opportunity.

Free cruise with Big Bus Tour. This tour was free with the Big Bus tour ticket- very relaxing 1 hour cruise along the Dubai creek with food and drinks (small charge). Make sure you don't sit near the loudspeaker!

How on earth. do all the items get put onto the correct boats and arrive in the correct destination, it just looks so un-organised, with lots of flat screen tv's sitting at the dockside in the middle of barrels of cooking oil, fridge freezers, boxes of flip-flops and car tyres just to mention a few ..
Hussle and Bustle. Interesting, lots of working vessels. Souks nearby bustling, lots of fake Rolex etc
nice but nothing to do. you look at stuff and thats about it, just walk along the east side of the creek and goto the souks.

Very Photogenic area for the Photographers out there. Great spot...a lot of action going on... Check for moon phase and rising time for some good shots. Also large fireworks display every night at 8:30 pm sharp.
Where old and new dubai meet. Nice place for a late afternoon walk or just crossing which is just aed1. If want more of it try the dinner cruise.

Interesting but could well give it a miss. You can take a Dhow boat across from one side of the river to the other for about 20 pence. It is interesting to see the boats loaded with everything imaginable loading and unloading. The Gold Souk is worth a stroll as well as the spice market. There are lots of stalls selling pashminas and kaftans. The traders can heckle you a bit and don't like it if you don't buy after haggling. Prices are reasonable though!

Pleasant boat trips on the Creek. One company, operating from just outside the British Embassy, does one hour trips for 45D (10€ £9) you get to see the basic outline, which can be followed up by walking and using the local river taxis (Abras) for about 5D
Dinner on the Boat. Excellent place foir a walk, a must have - dinner on the boat in the Sea. Great sights.

Great place to people watch. We went for a walk several times around the creek and also did a short boat trip as part of the Big Bus Tour. I love to people watch and this is the perfect place. One of the best things was to walk along the whaffage where all the dhows are loaded and unloaded. This might not interest everyone but makes for a pleasant walk.

nice feeling. it 's great cruise in sea ,i tried it 2 times ,once in "beauteax ship" it wasn't good experience because it seems so boring ,so classic and just play of piano and u started to feel bored and tierd of this ,but i tried it another time with a cruise in a arabic ship ,and it was good experience and i enjoyed.

Brilliant area. Spent an afternoon wandering along the creek, it was very nice, you get a great view of the buildings on the other side, and there is some amazing boats, including floating restaurants on old dhow's. Everywhere you see the contrast between the old boats and traditional buildings, but with the huge skyscrapers in the background. The old abra's (water taxis) are a nice sight. We took a ride on a small boat which was great, all the way up and down the creek from the floating bridge down to near the open sea, was only about £20 for the hour for just the two of us. Could spend many days wandering about here taking in the atmosphere.

This is Reallt Dubai!!. So many people that visit Dubai only view the Dubai Creek from the window of their taxi!! I feel you must ask the taxi driver to take you down to the park which runs along the length of the Creek.Do book a Dhow Cruise and you will experience the Creek even more than from afar...Any trip to Dubai is not complete with a least a walk or cruise along the Dubai Creek!!Thomas L. Webber
Golf course. Well worth a visit a drive out of the city but worth it as the facilities, location and customer service are outstanding,
good. it is good for once in your life if you never been in a boat trip in a river creek or ....;
Abra riding is fun and cheap. easy to do and definitely worth going back and forth over the creek, even if you have no clue where you are going.... for 1 dirham they take you back where you came from
Cool to try. Jump on the little boats for next to nothing and take a quick spin across the creek.
Must visit. Take an abra ride across the creek. You can get a private ride for two for 20 aed for the crossing and 50-60 aed for a half hour ride. A glimpse of old Dubai and its souks.....
what a view. you have to go on the abra (water taxi) very cheap and takes you across the river. beautiful buildings to admire
so romantic. I went there and hired a small boat for 40 AED all of it for 1 hour, it's amazing enjoyed my time :)

PLEASANT LOOKING AT THE DHOWS ON THIS CREEK. It's very clean, water is blue and waves are mild to moderate. The dhows are nice, they offer meals on board. I hesitated to ride because I was on a cruise via Brilliance of the Seas so I do not need anymore water ride.
Really pretty. This was cool and serene and a lovely place to have late nite wander

For any budget. Boat trips vary from $15 in a no frills boat for an hour up to $250 per couple with dinner for 2 hours with dinner. there are other ways to experience the creek like water taxis. About $3 to collective small boats for less than a $1
How the other half live. Beautiful to walk along and see the hustle and bustle. Also the lovely parked yachts. Allows one to dream...
Nice view, but honks. Nice walk along the creek, nice atmosphere, lots of boats and stuff, but the creek smells of fish.. realy badly. If they got rid of the smell then it would be better

Beneath Dubai's glitz.... ...is the historic area of the Creek. Take a stroll starting in the renovated historic area to enjoy the atmosphere (and pop into the Basta Art Cafe for a drink if you can), and continue round the waterfront through the souk area. From here you can take an "abra" (the small river ferries) across to the Deira Old Souk, or keep walking round to Sheik Mahmouk's renovated palace and enjoy the exhibition of historic photographs showing how Dubai's changed in just a few decades.
OK place to go. Its OK.....hustle and bustle and sometimes avg. but no where can the it beat the atmosphere of european or mediteranian costal towns.

A precinct that takes you back in time. This is where Dubai started , a hub where the merchants did their trading and still do to this day. Very busy,colourful ,the abra rides are a must and the evening dinner cruises are fabulous. Have visited numerous times as you have the City of Deira on one side and Bur Dubai on the other.

The magic of Arabian life. One can better get in touch with the arabian life by sailing in an abra in Dubai creek, on the reddish waters of the sunset! One can get in touch with the every-day life of the people who use abra as a current means of transportation. In the distance, one can see the new Dubai.

Creek. We stayed overlooking the creek and it was such an interesting place to be. I love seeing all the trading boats especially as you get nearer to the Gold Souk. It was a great place to see as well.
Best attraction for 1 AED!. It is available through out the day and quite an experience! You can feed the birds and they will follow you to the other side.....

The other side of Dubai. THere is a nice textile market on 1 side of the creek. Then take the boat like the locals (2dhs) to cross the creek to the Spice and Gold Souk. Wonderful experience to ride with the locals!

a day trip in itself. It is like you have gone back in time when you go down to Dubai creek, such a different atmosphere and look as apposed to the manufactured side of Dubai.Make sure you find the local abra and pay 1dhs to cross the river, an experience in itself.
not a must. good to have a boat ride in the creek but dont waste time on it, it was better to walk in the creek park and along the creek side, especially that the boats are so slow and old
Great for some quiet time. Hire your own water taxi and sit back and enjoy the river

Soulful excited Life at Dubai Creek. Not to be missed if in Dubai. The oldest, the vintage signature of Dubai. Take away the modern development and still the Dubai Creek will enliven the surprise and leave one bedazzled with complete spirit and sweet memories.
Dubai is complete with Dubai creek, others still fall short by 50 years.
Take Your money and run. The tourist trap - that's my comment. You like Souks? Go to Morocco.
???. Just had a look from outside - did not feel like having to descend the slopes ... as I'm looking forward to do 'real skiing' in the Dolomites soon ... ;-)
lots of Dhow boats. lots of dhow boats.Can take a dhow boat trip from the creek.Totally different from the modern Dubai
Dubai Creek. The Dubai Creek is an excellent place to visit where boats rides are taken at a reasonable price.There are also outdoor eating places available.
see it from the Boardwalk. as the title suggests; its nice to be there and sit at the boardwalk; you can enjoy the dun during winter time and enjoy nice refreshments.
Boat cruise is lovely and slow, but very hot.. Open top boat, average food, but a very nice experience. Would do it again.

Nice change from the city. Lots of space , plenty going on around the creek & the abra rides are easy too . watch out for the miriad of back streets where you can spend hours chatting to the locals & lose track of time .

Happy New Year. We did the New Years Eve cruise via the hotel as they own the boat we got a discount. The food was some of the best I have ever eaten and we sat under the fireworks at midnight you would only get a better view if you were sitting on a rocket
excellent park. Creek park is fab for childreen. Very good facilities our two boys realy enjoyed it.

A must on your first trip to Dubai. You visit Dubai because you've seen the Burj Khalifa and Tom Cruise running all over the top of it and you've heard the wonderful stories of a city of glass and steel rising out of the desert coasts of the UAE.Cruising along Dubai Creek in an Abra at sunset is the perfect remedy for the fatigue that begins to set in when you've spent all your time surrounded by glass and steel and man-made wonders. Soaking up the atmosphere of Old Dubai and enjoying the cruise at a pace from a different time when spices from vessels were loaded and unloaded along the banks of this very creek.Complete this time spa treatment by wandering the streets of the spice and gold souks.Wonderful. A complete treatment for 100 AED.
relax. traditional place to see!!! and especially to have a diner to the "golf creek"...
nice to see something NOT fake. felt good to be in the hustle and bustle. still felt safe though. nice getaway from the 'fakeness' that is dubai
Nice lazy way to see Dubai. The creek is a small river that passes through Dubai from bustling old town to the spice,gold and diamond souqs (markets)
Authentic experience. its a wonderful experience if you would like to see old dubai. Its one of the places worth seeing, gives quite an authentic feel about the city itself..

Beautiful. We stayed at the Radisson Blu which is right on the creek and we loved sitting on the balcony and seeing the boats go by - beautiful in the day and amazing at night all lit up. Well worth a visit and dinner cruise.

Much to see in this area. Where Dubal all started and I am sure some of the large boats have been around for 50 years ! To see all the abras is great, it is cheap to cross and fun. The loading docks look like somthing from hundreds of years ago :) Lots of the Souks around the area as well as Mosques with lovely lighting and the haunting sound of the call to prayer make this a Must do in Dubai
Take a abra. Nice area to explore, take a abra, it doesn't cost much, and it's a wonderfull experience to be transported by these boats.
Christmas Day Lunch. We spent Christmas day dining onboard the Bateaux Dubai at Dubai Creek, the Creek is very impressive with excellent views of Dubai and its amazing buildings.
Dubai Creek. Very quaint, interesting way to see both banks. Reliable - never had to wait.
Dubai Creek. Many nice views, bur dubai has the traditional architecture and diera has the nice larger buildings. Fun contrast to view from the water

Nice trip along the creek. As part of the bus tour that we had arranged, we had a one hour boat trip along the Dubai Creek almost to the mouth and back again. Along the way there was a commentary telling us about the history and what to see.The only negative was that it was quite hot on the bottom deck. The top deck was already full and so we couldn't go up there.

Creek. Night lights, belly dance, food...this was too romantic. If you have already traveled in a cruise this will not interest you, but if you have never traveled in a cruise this is a best option. Choose a good tour operator who would provide you with good facilities on board and you will enjoy this to the most.

Dubai Creek Dinner Cruise - Terrible. We have been on a Dubai Creek Dinner Cruise several times before and have really enjoyed them with good quality of service, food and a couple of drinks to set the atmosphere.This trip was for a Birthday celebration and we booked with ISANGO who we think subsequently booked us with Lama Tours. The bus was 30 minutes late in picking us up, the food was very poor quality, butter chicken bones, there was no alcohol available at all, the entertainment was an Asian Disco, no commentary detailing interesting points and we were the only English on board.The Dubai Dinner Cruise is a must for people who come to Dubai, but please don't book this trip.
The best creek~. I love this part very much, I can see the old building in Dubai and have a good experience to get this ride!

Crossing The Creek by Abra. What an inexpensive experience at AED1/- per crossing AED2/- for a return trip. Nice to see how the population that does not have a car cross the creek on a daily basis. Do it every time I go down there with visitors and include a fresh Avocado drink every time. You can also hire an Abra to take you up the creek for an hour. Be sure to take along a picnic basket and have it while cruising the creek.

Very nice. Very nice, very pretty sight at night with colorful lights. But look unsafe for young traveller like babies. The boats dont have good security such as fence or guardrail. But hey, Venice gondola has same problem. Enjoy the trip!!

The soul of Dubai.... An oasis in the midst of the desert- literally and metaphorically. The creek area is where most of the population of the city live around. It is the place where local eateries, small traders and tiny boats (called aabraa) stand shoulder to shoulder with international fast food joints, big brands and expensive yatchs.... It showcases the real picture of the city of gold- its people, its flavours, its past and future all in one place. A must visit for all tourists!The creek has a row of floating restaurants(which open in the evening) offering many flavours for your taste buds. There is a walkway on both sides of the water, with beautiful parks beside them. Local ferries called aabra (costing as little as 1dh per person) are used to transport people across the creek. You can also book pleasure yatchs for 3-4hrs out in the gulf- relaxing, swimming or fishing in the waters... Whatever the reasons for your travel, the creek is a must visit

This is Dubai for me. The timeless buzz around the creek is Dubai for me and preferable to the modern buildings which dominate Dubai. The a bra trip across the creek is a great way to see Dubai from the water and feel part of the scene.Walking past the Dhows with there varied cargo stacks alongside always raises a smile. The 2 sides of the creek have a different feel and both are worth a visit. I love to eat lunch overlooking the creek.

The Old Dubai. The best part of the creek is the ABRA ride. the wooden boats that act as taxis transporting passengers between Deira and Bur Dubai is a trip that must not be missed.the modern dinner cruises and other new rides also add the excitement. But the older buildings around the creek make the ride very nice. All this at just AED 1 one way, cant get any cheaper than that.

Go there.. Fantastic souk because the traders are so friendly. This is hassle with humour. Great bargins if you persist, especially the pashminas. Staring price is about four times what you need to pay. Eating on the creek is fun too. good service and excellent food.
Ferry Travel!. Just for the hell of it, catch one of the boats that take you across the water. They are cheap and you see life as it is!
A must for a real traveller. A must to see if you go to Dubai - for 20p get yourself on to one of the small boats that cross the creek. A genuine exotic experience.

Dubai Creek. A different side of Dubai to the usual opulence, take a taxi to the
transport exchange and then a water taxi to the other side of the creek. It cost 1 Dirham each. Walk through the markets and have a meal in a curry house, we had a super curry for a few Dirhams each. A lovely day out.
got to go see it. Its like going back in time and the water taxis are somethng else but you have to do it

Check out old Dubai. If you come to Dubai you really should go to the creek as well as the luxury hotels. Don't get too excited about the souqs - there is no lack of gold/ jewellery and spice stores in Dubai but it is definitely worth a wander.

a nice walk. to walk along the creek on the Bur Dubai side is lovely, at the top you have the creek side park, then you have the promonade where all the dhow boats moor up, then you come to Bastika and the spice and textile souks, next is the abra station and mosque. if you continue wlaking you come to a number of museums that are free or small fee, including sheik saleem al maktoum house, and the diving and heritage centre where you can learn about old Dubai and how it has grown, again a nice stoll along the creek in doing so, with plenty of food and drink outlets along the way.

It's a Large Stream. A nice way to spend an hour or two, walking along the embankments, strolling through the nearby souks, taking the water taxi across to the other side, having lunch overlooking the water. It's a working dock so don't be surprised to see teams of men unloading the boats along the waterway. A nice interlude.
Near the souk and boat rides. i was able to take some really good pics from the Dubai Creek to watch travelers and workers take the old wooden boats around the creek...
Good place. Love the markets and the alleys, gold souk and the general feeling. Rolexs are aplenty as well as designer bags. Probably better at Karama for the fakes. But the old city is a must
cruise. good food,enjoy the night & light of dudai.the whole trip takes 2 hours and fully enjoyable.
Old Town. Great for spices and if you want to see a bit of the old Dubai

Great golf. Very nice course with beautiful clubhouse and service. Not easy course but friendly and fair.
The restaurant terrace is really cool, we had a beer and seafood salad which was really good.
Fun evening. The Souk is a fantastic experience. Eat at one of the small restaurants on the creek. Most shops are closed until evening.
Lovely to visit at night. Lovely to walk around in the cool of the evening. Boats lit up look lovely. Take an abra ride for 1DHS from one side to the other.
vibrant. Well worth a cruise on the creek to get an overview of Deira and Bur Dubai and see the amount of traffic on and around the creek.

especially during sun-set hour. we had very good lunch in one of the Creek Golf&Yacht Club restaurants with a great view to the golf-course and the water front. From there we took a cab to go to the gold souk and strolled around there. Afterward we took a water-taxi to cross the creek to take the metro at the other side. It was close to sun-set and the lights were amazing.

Old Dubai. Went there one afternoon, what a difference to the more modern part of Dubai, lots of souks selling fabrics and jewellery. Went on the little boats to the creek, beautiful place though, very quiet.
great boat trip. Loved the boat and we even got to go on it on our own.
Very nice. Nice views, many boats to see, watertaxi by abra and a river cruise. Very good
beautiful. wonderful creek. Its an icon of Dubai and must visited.

Plenty to see. Vast shopping Mall opening out into the Creek Area. Pleasant to walk along with plenty of places to sit out and eat or have coffee.
Water Taxis at hand if need be. Very pleasant.
Nice to see how local people spend their free time. When you have seen everything else visit there. Place is clean and beautiful park middle of the city

The gateway to the old town. When in Dubai why not take an abra across the creek? it costs pence and is something unique to Dubai. It is fast,efficient and a wonderful way to get out on the water if only for five minutes! Dont miss it!
nice meal. we went on the Bateaux cruise for our sons 21st fantastic meal took a couple of hours lovely night

creek strole or evening dhow cruise. The dhow cruise at night is ok to review where you plodded during the day, but its a short trip . After the first 1hr streach ,the the boat doubles back on its route so its no longer very interesting.The creek itself boarders the textile souk full of indian/ kashmire handicraft traders and shops of beaded netting lace. The spice souk is laughable if you have ever sneeezed in a real spice market, The gold souk is average and I never even found the perfume souk. The creek is all you may ever see of the 'older' Dubai, but its been sanitised and redone for tourism so its not very authentic. The abra ride is nice, crossing the creek. spend a morning here or a late afternoon.

Busy, traditional area but not pleasent if you are a white woman travelling alone. The abra (water taxi) across the creek was a lovely, local way to travel on the water and handy to get from a to b (plus cheap). We were on the less touristy side of the creek (Deira) which was busy, with local traders loading huge boats along the creek-side. Unfortunately as a white woman travelling along there were lots of men staring at me (despite being dressed respectfully). The area was less affluent than other areas of Dubai and noticeably so. A mixed experience.
So much to see. A fascinating area to visit. We went on a Dhow cruise and enjoyed seeing all the activity along the creek.
Beautiful view. Can take the small ferry boats cross the river, costed only 1AED per person, and the view along the creek is wonderful.
Old Dubai. See the old dhows loading at the spice market (walk around and savour the aromsa) for trading into Iraq, Iran and gulf countries.
A "must see" in Dubai. Take the "water buss" to travel along the creek, and some of the small boats to crossit at least once - otherwise you missed a geat experience in Dubai

Old and new side by side. Take the small old boat to see the great views of the 2 side of Dubai creek where you can see how the old and new buildings mixed together in great harmony , there is also low cost boat sharing with others to cross only the creek

I would not come here for that, but when you are here anyway .... A trip on one of the small boats on Dubai creek during sunset was the best experience I had in Dubai. Apart from that Dubai has little to offer for me. I am a nature loving person and Dubai has mostly shopping options ... big malls, indoor playgrounds ... for those who love this, I guess it's a paradise.
Lovely creek. I watched it from two sides once from Hyatt hotel garden that was superb with very elegant yachts and once from outside with nice and cozy boats that were restaurants...
go local. I liked exploring the creek in the boats where the locals ferry across. It's cheap and fun.
Lovely lively river. Had a very nice boat trip along the Creek. Best way to see the City and marvelous skyline. River seems very clean and quite busy. A must do thing when visiting.
Nice Don't Miss Alboom Trip. I booked for 2 hours dinner tour in Alboom village for a small ship nigh tour with my wife. Don't miss it.
Dubai Creek. The only place in Dubai which has a bit of history. Awesome view and boats. Recommend Bateaux Dubai tour.

Feeling like a sheik, while dinning and cruising on Dubai Creek. After few experiences with abras (the speedy water taxis from Dubai), we've cruised and taken dinner on an Arab wooden ship - called here "dhow". I can tell about this dinner, that was a precious memorable evening, that everybody can try.At our arrival, some friendly people have received us with arabian coffee and dates.Then we’ve arrived on the deck of the dhow, where we’ve took a romantic dinner at the light of the candles. The buffet was great, with fine international, arabian food, and soft non alcoholic drinks. The ambiental arab or indian music, and a local illusionist, wich has shown his skills, bringing their contribution at the oriental atmosphere. If you add the splendor of a night with full moon, the “show” of the both shores of Dubai Creek, and the other dhows floating on the water, you could believe that you have a very pretty dream.
Gold Souk. Dubai creek is best visited at night for the spice markets and gold souk

Things to do.. After arriving at the creek take the time to have a walk around the gold souq(best at night time)and the spice souq.Take a trip down the creek in one of the water taxis,trip takes about an hour and is very cheap.Only bad point are all the hawkers trying to sell you fake watches and the like,but that is part and parcel of being there.

Nice and traditional. I took a dhow cruise from Dubai Festival City Mall along the creek and had dinner for aed 100. The price is excellent but I guess that if you pay more there would be more variety of food. This one was a buffet with soft drinks included, very reasonable. It lasted an hour but no dancing or singing just background arabic music. It was worth it.

Hot in the City... tonight!. It was a little humid when I went for my walk by the Creek! I had not been here for 3 years, but in fact I recommend visiting this part of town when the Museum, and the souks are open. I was there about 9-10pm.
sights. Cruise up the creek in day light was great way to get a feel for Dudai. Dinner cruise at night was the highlight of our stay

Dinner cruise in the Rusthar. It is a bit overpriced, at least what we paid for it (80€/person booked through EXTREME ADVENTURES). The food is a buffet, and it was quite ok, specially the desserts and the salads. The drinks that you get are juices and water, and for anything else you have to pay extra. The entretainment was ok, with some dancers and some henna tatoos, but of course, for a two hours cruise, the time is limited.What was nice, is that they also had shisa to smoke. Although overpriced, I would still recommend it.

Relaxing. Enjoyable day out with a trip across the creek on a dow. The souq is worth visiting and then have lunch overlooking the creek and watch the dow's and other boats sailing up and down. Very relaxing after a day's shopping.
Anice trip. Iliked the night life of Dubai&dislhked the crowdness of the boat
Busy but clean creek. Cleanly maintained creek and a different view of Dubai from its abras (water taxi). I will definitely try this water bus which can travel by water and land next time.
Amazing. We booked this with a company called Xtreme Adventures through our hotel. The food was not very good starters were better than the main so stick with them but the view at night was amazing.
Worth a trip across. Take the Abras for 1 Dirham to get a great view across the creek.
Nice to for a walk. It was okay, nothing special. You can catch a dinner cruise here.
Great Atmosphere. Really buzzing with great views. Efficient service.

Nice Experience, could have been better. The Dhow Cruise is on a lighted up boat on the Dubai Creek. The view around the creek is average with very few lighted tall buildings. The boat was well decorated but cramped for space. The food was good and had variety for Indian vegetarians as well. Not much to do once you are on the boat. You just have your dinner and go the deck to watch the lighting. The time taken for the ride was pretty long (a bit too long I suppose). If you have seen the "Symphony of Lights" in Hong kong, then this is very pale in comparison. A very nice experience no doubt but could have been better with more entertainment.
Take a Dhow. Lovely way to see the Creek and visit the Souks.

Dinner at Dhow Cruise. It was ok. Food was really good. Weather was not so great. Overall experience was average. It could be better if they could have arranged for some live music or entertainment. But view around the creek was good.
Fabulous. Unforgetable experience so much culture and people so friendly. The place is spotless

A Boat trip that shows the old and the new all in one!. I would recommend a Dhow Boat Trip on The Creek to anyone visiting Dubai for the first time. It's a great way of seeing so many different sides of Dubai, from the old architecture of the historical buildings of old Dubai to the contemporary of the modern glass and mirror buildings, from the traditional water taxis to the ultra modern millionaire's yachts.We took this trip as part of the Hop on Hop off Bus Tour but I would certainly do it again without the bus tour.One valuable piece of information is that you can buy bottles of iced water on board, it is a bit pricey but it does save you having to carry bottles.

Abbra tour. When visiting Dubai it is worth while going to the Abbra station in Bur Dubai. You can get an Abbra to yourself for about 15 AED. to sail up the creek and get a different prospective on Dubai.Romantic evening sail during sunset.

Good cheap way to spend an afternoon. Only 1 AED to ride an abra across the creek.Excellent value and a nice pleasant way to spend an hour or two and a good way to visit the various souks on both sides of the creek

gud for children. I went with my son to creek park in the evening coz our taxi driver said it ll b to hot to go there in d afternoon but because of that we missed d dolphin show . There was lots of things to do there . we hired a bike for 30 min . then my son went on horse riding . after that we went on cable car . There was lots of play area for childern to play . on a nice day you can spend gud 4-5 hours there . worth taking your kids .
Dubai Creek. Get to the nub of Dubai. This is a real reflection of what Dubai is and worht a visit. Also suggest you pay for a 1/2 guided tour of the City which will include the Creek
Nice walk on the creek side or boat ride but nothing more. Nice walk on the creek side or boat ride but nothing more

Take the Abra. For just 1dh you can take an Abra (water taxi) from one side to the other. A great way to see the creek and experience part of the city that hasn't changed in years. Check out the Soukhs in North Deira when you cross.
Fascinating view. A wonderful mix of ancient and modern with the huige skleek yachts and the old Arad Dhows that p;u the creen. Great value on the watwer buses and taxis across the creek.
Quirky place. I love the creek, the Gold souk at the end is a must for diamonds and gold. Take the dow boat across the river, it's fun

Great atmosphere. We highly recommend that you take an abra (small boat) across the creek. It only costs one UAE dirham. You can also have a private 30 minute abra trip up the creek for 50 UAE Dirhams (or 100 for an hour.
Meal on the creek. Another great trip up and down the creek in the evening enjoying a buffet meal on the boat. I nice way to see part of the city at night.
nice walk. There is so much to do and see around this area it is well worth a visit.

Old Dubai's heart and soul..... The old Souks sit either side of the Dubai Creek, textile ones on the south side, spice and gold souks on the north side. These are the inevitable destinations of anyone visiting the Creek area. There's also a nice cheap n cheerful indonesian style restaurant that sits above the water, accessed from the second textile souk, that gives a great view up and down the Creek while you enjoy a pleasant lunch (if a tiresomely long wait for service). If you want to buy something in the souks (in the textile ones I'd go for the traditional man's headscarves) you'll be expected to barter. It's actually fun, and the guys there are not pushy and nasty about it like some in the Far East can be, but you'll be constantly approached to see if you want to but knock-off watches, etc, but just smile & decline. A word of caution though, it's fine to chat and have a bit of banter with them, which they will appreciate, but if you don't want to buy, don't start bartering with them. When they get to their final price with you they'll expect you to buy, and not to would be offensive. I always say I'm not buying today and they're quite happy to chat and show their wares without any pressure. Once you start bartering it gets serious and you should expect to buy.The fun bit is to take an Abra across the Creek from the one side to other, from one of the Abra stations. It costs 1 dirham each way, which you give to the boatman once on board. I'd recommend going up to the second station (the one closesto the ocean end of the souks), which then drops you off at the Abra station right by the spice & gold souks. The other one drops you further down the quayside on the north shore which means a longer walk. Although European Health & Safety officers would have kittens at the Abra arrangements, be brave and put up with the boarding hop on board and the squashing up as you sit on the central shared seat. It's been like this for donkey's years here and you'll get a real flavour of authentic original Dubai life, not the plastic Disney style you get with the electric, cushioned Abras on the waterways of the Madinat Jumeira.Further out along the south shore, towards the sea, you will see the collection of restored original buildings that comprise part of the Heritage Centre. Its a bit of a walk from the textile souks to get there but worth it. There's the old Sheik's palace and a building that now houses the Architecture musem, which is really worth seeing. Again, gives a good sense of what it might have been like here a hundred years or so ago.A visit to this historical area around the Dubai Creek is well worth doing, even if you're only in Dubai for a few days. You realise taht there's more to Dubai than just the sky scrapers and five star hotels....there's a real life side to it too.

See both sides of Dubai in one place!. What can I say - one side has a beautiful palace the other tall futuristic sky scrapers hiding ancient souks.
Take an Abra across the creek or a Dhow ride on the creek to get the full experience of Dubai. Recommended.

Old meets the new..... The Dubai creek is in the heart of dubai, separating Bur Dubai from Deira.The creekside is a fantastic place to ride on an abra, waterbus or just look at the water and relax.You can use the abra to cross the creek for just 1 Dhs. the abra is the conventional way of crossing the creek and residents use to use the abra to cross before there were bridges and tunnels. The arbra has a capacity to accomodate around 15 people; and has longitudnal seating. The abras leave when they fill up, which is every 3 minutes or so during peak timings.The modern way to cross the creek is by the Waterbus, which is like the abra operated by the RTA (Roads & Transport Authority). The waterbus costs 1.80 AED and you can use the NOL multipupose card to pay. The 36 seater waterbus is more comfortable than the abra, with Air condition and proper seats. There is a waterbus every 15 minutes or so. There is also something called the Water Taxi which is a much costlier option, with prices ranging from 60 to 160 AED.The night cruise on the creek with a lavish dinner is a really worth trip. There are many private companies operating dhows. The prices start from AED 100 for a small dhow, reaching upto 500 AED for a luxurious ship with panaromic views.

Dubai Creek Experience!. When I stayed at Riviera Hotel Dubai, it was right in front of Dubai Creek. Its about 1 Dirham one way either to the other side of the Creek or stop to another stop along the creek. The sight during sunset was spectacular when the reflection of the sun on the river with golden colors. Try this!

Try Old Dubai. Two absolutelly different world only few meters distance! You can take dhow (boat) to second bank, very cheap 1 DHS only! Old streets and over creek are modern buldings, banks etc! Sometime great shopping at old market and spice market. Very nice place over sunset.

Heart of Dubai. The Creek is in "old Dubai" and is a million miles away from the glitzy 5 star modern Dubai, and if this is what you want don't waste your time on the Creek.However, to miss the Creek you would be missing out on what Dubai was and in fact is. Dubai is a trading town and trades with it's Asian partners and the Creek is where it all starts. We went to Bastakia and the old quarter which is on the Creek and fascinating, from there we walked to the abra station and for the sum of AED 1 we rode to the other side and visited the original gold souk. This was a priceless experience and on the next day we came back and did it again. My only word of caution is that our visit was mid season, attempting to do this in the Summer months would be difficult because of the heat.

Dinner cruise with entertainment. The dinner cruise was recommended by many and was a classic tourist thing to do. However, there is not much to see out side during the cruise up and down the "Creek". The entertainment was well done. The food was good, but somewhat standard. We used the Palm Oasis Company. Because of the great service I would recommend this company if you want to experience this adventure. They are well organized and everything runs on time.
Hire an abra (water taxi) and see old Dubai. A great way to see the older parts of Dubai and the amazing trading dhows that still ply the Indian Ocean.

Big contrast comparing to the new parts of Dubai. The Dubai Creek and surrounding areas are very different comparing to all the skyscrapers. Here you get to see real life. If you are not afraid of it you will enjoy it :-). Just dip into the narrow streets, get a haircut! Lol. Take the water taxis. Or just walk and listen to sound of the city. One hint - skip gold souk and rather visit the Old one. Here you can shop / eat for fraction of prices paid at the mall or hotel. I personally highly recommend to pay visit here.

BORING AND MESSED UP!!!!. this was the part of dubai that my family and I dint like at all. infact the flaw of the entire trip was this place. Would have preferred to stay back at the hotel and have a relazing time rather.People who are really interested for fishing and have a craving towards going into the seas for a recreation, prepare to shell out a little extra. it is very untimely and messed up. The abras are the only thing that are managed. There is an unclear distinction between the park and the main creek centre which can cause you to lose time and get tired.you need clear cut information from the people at local city to get a better idea and manage your ride properly which unfortunately we couldnt!!!!!

It's cheap and won't hurt you.. It's not your 5 star, air con cruise, but for 1dhr, it's actually not bad.We wanted to go across the river to the textile souk and it got us there in one piece. I loved the boats! It's different, unique and pretty cool. It definately won't work here in Oz cos public liability claims will go off radar! But I loved the hussle of the ports with fishermen and traders going crazy. It's definately worth a look

fun ! not too bad!. For sure there are much more things to do in DUBAI that this Creek can not be compared to them but visiting there when you have not any special plan for your evening would be fun ... there are big boats and DHOWS ... first we took one transport boat to get to other side and then there we took a small DHOW for 1 AED and get back ... those small wooden Dhows are more fun and worth trying! they sell very cheap and spicy Shawerma at Creek side ... although i was worried if they are healthy or not i tried them and it was delicious and I survived !

Boat cruise was a waste of time.... I took this as a part of the city tour where they said the 'creek cruise' was included. After 10mins it was nothing but non-stop history lesson on the creek - how it was deepened etc etc. I wanted to leave, but was forced to spend an hour in the boat taking nonsensical pictures and overpriced beer and cheese sandwich. I was surprised that I didn't fall sick after the sandwich.Oh yeah, the best part was that unless the boat is in motion, you can't use the dingy bathrooms coz the lights were off..

Nothing spesial. I'm not take boat tour, just walking around Dubai creek and honestly did not like the place. Its ok to go there, take pics and go back to civilisation as soon as possible. I totally dont like souks and shops around, cheap quality things and annoying sellers. 2 hours walking, did not see any local face. I had feeling that I was not in arab country, that I was in India...

1 Dirham fare.... priceless experience. How great is it to cross Dubai creek with very few handrails or safety mechanisms?? You actually have to balance yourself and get on the boat (rather quickly.... they are doing this to make money after all) and sit down quickly. It provides five minutes of sights, sounds, and smells ... definitely one of the funnest moments in my entire trip. I even did it twice!I can't see spending 100 Dhm on a tourist boat, really. I mean -- it's more about the experience crammed into a few minutes. An hour seems excessive, from my point of view.

Ride the Abrar. If you stay on Bur Dubai side, take the abrar or water taxi to the Deira side. Best time will be after dark as it is cooler and also the view of the creek will be more spectacular with the lightings and also lighted boat passing through the creek. However beware of safety as there are no life jacket on board.
Nice ride. We have taken a private boat (100AED) for 1 hour.You take the boat at "Abra Dubai'.Interesting, funny.You're close of the Gold souk

The boat trip..awful. Please avoid the evening boat ride arranged by the Tour guides.The food is very bad and the arrangement make you feel like you would have better gone for a walk around the creek. I had a very bad experience.
Nice view at night. It's very nice view, expecially during night. Food serve over there, just average, under expectation.
Nice but could be better. I loved crossing the creek on the abras but the view further down the creek (ie when youre on a cruise/dinner boat) is quite dissapointing.

The authentic Dubai. You can't really claim to have experienced Dubai unless you've visited this part of town. Leave the resort, grab a cab, get out and just walk around. Take the water taxi, eat street food, buy some stuff at the market, and enjoy the weather (if it's not summer).The creek abras are super cheap and efficient and it makes for some great photo opportunities.

1 AED/person for the abra, souks on both sides. It's pretty cool to go from the souk in Bur Dubai to the ones in Deira by hopping on an abra for dirt cheap. It's different and fun.
On a related note, take a dhow dinner cruise offered by one of the many operators.

"Mad" Experience. We jumped on a taxi Dhow with the locals, this was a great experience. You pay on the boat 1 Dhs each and pass it down the boat to the driver - it takes you across the river. You have to be quick they can only allow so many passengers and you've got nothing to hold on to and the water's not far from your feet. We did it on a Worship day so there were lots of locals out, the river was heaving with Dhows.

Relaxing and Soothing. Yup this is one very enjoyable experience, especially when you get a boat for you and your partner, or family, and tell the driver to take you for a very nice ride which eventually ends up on the other side the creek. Just let the driver know how long you want the ride to last and he will oblige.You will pass other boats, some smaller some much larger, the wind is beautiful as hits you on a warm evening and the sights are amazing as you see many of the fantastic architecture of Dubai.You will have a choice of doing a cruise as part of a tour but my wife and i decided that instead of 2 hours on the 'cruise ship' we rather have half hour completely to ourselves (well including the driver who stays very quiet!)Overall this is maybe something you will do a few times as it is one of the ways to get from one side the creek to the other.

Nice experience. The Creek area is a very nice one, you'll find the gold, fish, textiles souks (local markets) and you can cross the creek with the traditional boats (abhra). It's a very cheap and a nice experience. You can tell the boat "driver" to take you wherever you want on the river, which can be very useful, above all when it's too hot!
